3_11.word_by_word: उभौ both, अहम् I, इमाम् this, ससागरवनाम् with seas and forests, विन्ध्यमेरुविभूषिताम् adorned with mountains of Vindhya and Meru, कृत्स्नाम् entire, पृथिवीम् earth, रक्षितुम् to rule, योग्यौ fit, मन्ये I think

3_12.shloka: इमे च धनुषी चित्रे श्लष्णे चित्रानुलेपने।प्रकाशेते यथेन्द्रस्य वज्रे हेमविभूषिते4.3.16।।
3_12.translation: 'Smeared with wonderful unguents, (your) bows look  very attractive. And they glow very much like Indra's golden thunderbolt.
3_12.word_by_word: चित्रे wonderful, श्लक्ष्णे attractive ones, चित्रानुलेपने smeared with wonderful unguents, इमे धनुषी च both these bows too, इन्द्रस्य Indra's, हेमविभूषिते decorated with gold, वज्रे यथा like thunderbolt, प्रकाशेते glow

3_13.shloka: सम्पूर्णा निशितैर्बाणै स्तूणाश्च शुभदर्शनाः4.3.17।।जीवितान्तकरैर्घोरै श्श्वसद्भिरिव पन्नगैः।।
3_13.translation: '(Your) quivers also appear beautiful, for they are  fully  filled with sharp and deadly arrows which look like the hissing of dreadful snakes
3_13.word_by_word: शुभदर्सनाः beautiful to look at, तूणाश्च quivers also, जीवितान्तकरैः those which can put an end to life, घोरैः with terrible, श्श्वसद्भिरिव like hissing, पन्नगैरिव snakes, बाणैः with arrows, सम्पूर्णाश्च  totally filled with

3_14.translation: '(Your) long and broad swords appear very huge in size. Being encrusted with pure gold, they  glitter brilliant like snakes in hyberation.
3_14.word_by_word: महाप्रमाणौ of huge size, विस्तीर्णौ long and broad, तप्तहाटकभूषितौ encrusted with shining pure gold, एतौ these two, खडगौ swords, निर्मुक्ताविव पन्नगौ like the snakes that have shed their sloughs, विराजेते shine

3_15.shloka: एवं मां परिभाषन्तं कस्माद्वै नाभिभाषथः4.3.19।।सुग्रीवो नाम धर्मात्मा कश्चिद्वानरयूथपः।वीरो विनिकृतो भ्रात्रा जगद्भ्रमति दुःखितः4.3.20।।
3_15.translation: 'Why are you silent  while I am talking? (I am here to apprise ) about a great and righteous warrior Sugriva, the chief of the troop of monkeys, sadly wandering all over the land here, banished by his brother
3_15.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, परिभाषन्तम् talking to you, माम् to me, कस्मात् why, नाभिभाषथः  not replying, सुग्रीवो नाम Sugriva by name, वीरः warrior, धर्मात्मा righteous, कश्चित् some one, वानरयूथपः chief of monkeys, भ्रात्रा by brother, विनिकृतः is aggrieved, दुःखितः grieved, जगत् world over, स भ्रमति roaming about

3_16.shloka: प्राप्तोऽहं प्रेषितस्तेन सुग्रीवेण महात्मना।राज्ञा वानरमुख्यानां हनुमान्नाम वानरः4.3.21।।
3_16.translation: 'I am a monkey called Hanuman. I am here sent by great king Sugriva, the best of monkeys.
3_16.word_by_word: महात्मना by the great, वानरमुख्यानाम् best of monkeys, राज्ञा by the king, तेन सुग्रीवेण by such Sugriva, प्रेषितः I am sent, प्राप्तः came here, अहम् I, हनुमान्नाम Hanuman, वानरः monkey

3_17.shloka: युवाभ्यां सह धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवस्सख्यमिच्छति।तस्य मां सचिवं वित्तं वानरं पवनात्मजम्4.3.22।।भिक्षुरूपप्रतिच्छन्नं सुग्रीवप्रियकाम्यया।ऋष्यमूकादिह प्राप्तं कामगं कामरूपिणम्4.3.23।।
3_17.translation: 'The righteous Sugriva wishes to make friendship with both of you. For his wellbeing I came here disguised as a mendicant from  Rishyamuka mountain. I am a monkey, son of the Windgod and minister to Sugriva. I can assume any form at my free will and go anywhere I like'.
3_17.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous , सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, युवाभ्याम् with you both, सख्यम friendship, इच्छति desires, माम् myself, सुग्रीवप्रियकाम्यया for the wellbeing of Sugriva, भिक्षुरूपप्रतिच्छन्नम् disguised like a mendicant, तस्य his, सचिवम् minister, ऋष्यमूकात् from  Rishyamuka, इह here, प्राप्तम् reached, कामगम् can go whereever I desire, कामरूपिणम् can assume whatever form I desire, पवनात्मजम् son of the windgod, वानरम् monkey, वित्तम् you  may know

3_18.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु हनुमांस्तौ वीरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।वाक्यज्ञौ वाक्यकुशलः पुनर्नोवाच किञ्चन4.3.24।।
3_18.translation: The eloquent Hanuman, having spoken thus to both Rama and Lakshmana, good at speaking, said no more.
3_18.word_by_word: वाक्यज्ञौ good at speaking, वाक्यकुशलः eloguent, हनुमान् Hanuman, वीरौ two heroes, तौ both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, पुनः again, किञ्चन anything more, नोवाच did not speak

3_19.translation: Having heard him, the Illustrious Rama cheerfully said to brother Lakshmana standing nearby:
3_19.word_by_word: श्रीमान् Illustrious, रामः Rama, तस्य his, एतत् all that, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, प्रहृष्टवदनः with cheerful face, पार्श्वतः nearby, स्थितम् stood, भ्रातरम् brother, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

3_20.shloka: सचिवोऽयं कपीन्द्रस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।तमेव काङ्क्षमाणस्य ममान्तिकमुपागतः4.3.26।।
3_20.translation: 'Here is minister to Sugriva, the great chief of monkeys whom I wish to see.
3_20.word_by_word: कपीन्द्रस्य of the lord of monkeys, महात्मनः of great self, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, सचिवः minister, अयम् this, तमेव him only, काङ्क्षमाणस्य as I wish to see, मम to me, समीपम् near by, इह here, आगतः has come

3_21.translation: 'O Saumitri, conqueror of enemies this monkey, Sugriva's minister, is skilled in friendly communication. Reply to him in words gentle and sweet.
3_21.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, वाक्यज्ञम् knows how to talk, स्नेहयुक्तम् in a friendly way, अरिन्दमम् conqueror of enemies, सुग्रीवसचिवम् Sugriva's minister, तं कपिम् this monkey, मधुरैः pleasant, वाक्यैः words, अभिभाषस्व  reply well .

3_22.translation: 'Unless wellversed in Rigveda, Yajurveda and Samaveda, for sure, it is not possible for anyone to articulate so well.
3_22.word_by_word: अनृग्वेदविदुषः not trained in Rigveda, एवम् in that way, भाषितुम् to talk, न शक्यम् not possible, अयजुर्वेद्धारिणः  not a scholar in Yajurveda, न not, असामवेदविदुषः  not a scholar in Samaveda, न not

3_23.shloka: नूनं व्याकरणं कृत्स्नमनेन बहुधा श्रुतम्।बहु व्याहरताऽनेन न किञ्चिदपशब्दितम्4.3.29।।
3_23.translation: 'Surely, he seems to have studied well the whole of grammar, for there is not a single mispronunciation in his entire speech.
3_23.word_by_word: नूनम् surely, अनेन by him, कृत्स्नम् entire, व्याकरणम् grammar, बहुधा in many ways, श्रुतम्  studied, बहु much, व्याहरता spoken, अनेन by him, किञ्चित् even a little, अपशब्दितम् wrong pronunciation

3_24.shloka: न मुखे नेत्रयोर्वापि ललाटे च भ्रुवोस्तथा।अन्येष्वपि च गात्रेषु दोषस्संविदितः क्वचित्4.3.30।।
3_24.translation: No fault can be found in his face, eyes, forehead, between the eyebrows or any other part of his body (during his expression).
3_24.word_by_word: मुखे in his face, नेत्रयोर्वापि in the eyes or, ललाटे on the forehead, तथा likewise, भ्रुवो between the eyebrows, अन्येष्वपि च or anywhere, गात्रेषु parts of body, क्वचित् even a little, दोषः fault, न संविदितः not found

3_25.shloka: अविस्तरमसन्दिग्धमविलम्बितमद्रुतम्।उरस्थं कण्ठगं वाक्यं वर्तते मध्यमे स्वरे4.3.31।।
3_25.translation: His sentences are not too elaborate, not ambiguous, not dragging, not fast, raised in the chest or throat, in a medium tone.
3_25.word_by_word: वाक्यम् sentences, अविस्तरम् not too elaborate, असन्दिग्धम् not ambiguous, अविलम्भितम् not dragging, अद्रुतम् not fast, उरस्थम् raised in his chest, कण्ठगम् from the throat, मध्यमे medium, स्वरे tone

3_26.translation: 'His words are auspicious. They are refined. Neither fast nor slow, his utterances captivate the heart.
3_26.word_by_word: संस्कारक्रमसम्पन्नाम् refined, अद्रुताम् not too fast, अविलम्बिताम् not too slow, कल्याणीम् auspicious, हृदयहारिणीम् captivating the heart, वाचम् language, उच्चारयति speaks

3_27.shloka: अनया चित्रया वाचा त्रिस्थानव्यञ्जनस्थया।कस्य नाराध्यते चित्तमुद्यतासेररेरपि4.3.33।।
3_27.translation: 'His colourful words flow from all the three sources: the bottom of his bosom, his throat and his head. Whose mind will not adore them even if one happens to be an enemy holding a sword?
3_27.word_by_word: त्रिस्थानव्यञ्जनस्थया delivered from the bottom of his chest, throat and head, चित्रया with a wonderful, अनया by this, वाचा by words, उद्यतासेः holding a sword, अरेरपि of even an enemy, कस्य whose, चित्तम् mind, नाराध्यते will not be pleased?

3_28.shloka: एवं विधो यस्य दूतो न भवेत्पार्थिवस्य तु।सिद्ध्यन्ति हि कथं तस्य कार्याणां गतियोऽनघ4.3.34।।
3_28.translation: 'O sinless one, how can a king, whoever he be, not accomplish his goal in the past with such an ambassador?
3_28.word_by_word: अनघ sinless, यस्य whosoever, पार्थिवस्य  of a king, दूतः ambassador, एवंविधः in that way, न भवेत् not being, तस्य his, गतयः in the past, कथम् how, सिध्यन्ति would have accomplished

3_29.shloka: एवं गुणगणैर्युक्ता यस्य स्युः कार्यसाधकाः।तस्य सिध्यन्ति सर्वाऽर्था दूतवाक्यप्रचोदिताः4.3.35।।
3_29.translation: Whoever has such great taskmasters of great qualities as their envoys, can have all their goals accomplished, driven by their diplomatic skills.
3_29.word_by_word: यस्य whosoever, एवं गुणगणैः such qualities, युक्ताः are endowed, कार्यसाधकाः who can accomplish tasks, स्युः they may be, तस्य his, सर्वे all, आर्थाः objects, दूतवाक्यप्रचोदिताः guided by the ambassador's skill of speaking, सिध्यन्ति will be achieved.

3_30.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु सौमित्रिस्सुग्रीवसचिवं कपिम्।अभ्यभाषत वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यज्ञं पवनात्मजम्4.3.36।।
3_30.translation: Thus instructed, Saumitri who was equally skilled in speach replied to Sugriva's minister, son of the Windgod
3_30.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been instructed, वाक्यज्ञः skilled in speech, सौमित्रिः Saumitri, वाक्यज्ञम् good at speaking, पवनात्मजम् son of the windgod, सुग्रीवसचिवम् minister of Sugriva, कपिम् monkey, अभ्यभाषत replied

3_31.shloka: विदितौ नौ गुणा विद्वंत्सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।तमेव चाऽवां मार्गावस्सुग्रीवं प्लवगेश्वरम्4.3.37।।
3_31.translation: 'O learned Hanuman having heard about the virtues of  great Sugriva, lord of the monkeys, we eagerly look forward to meeting him
3_31.word_by_word: विद्वन् learned, महात्मनः great, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, गुणाः virtues, नौ for both of us, विदितौ are known, अवाम् both of us, ल्पवगेश्वरम् lord of monkeys, तमेव him only, मार्गावः are looking for

3_32.shloka: यथा ब्रवीषि हनुमान्सुग्रीववचनादिह।तत्तथा हि करिष्यावो वचनात्तव सत्तम4.3.38।।
3_32.translation: 'O virtuous Hanuman we will do whatever you are saying, for it is the message of Sugriva.
3_32.word_by_word: सत्तम O virtuous one, हनुमन् Hanuman, इह here, सुग्रीववचनात् by Sugriva's words, यथा those, ब्रवीषि you speak, तत् that, तव your, वचनात् words, तथा so also, करिष्यावः we will do

3_33.shloka: तत्तस्य वाक्यं निपुणं निशम्यप्रहृष्टरूपः पवनात्मजः कपिः।मनस्समाधाय जयोपपत्तौसख्यं तदा कर्तुमियेष ताभ्याम्4.3.39।।
3_33.translation: Pleased with Lakshmana's words spoken in a skilful manner, Hanuman, the monkey son of the Windgod, resolved to make friendship with them.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे तृतीयस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the third sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
3_33.word_by_word: पवनात्मजः Hanuman, कपिः monkey, तस्य his, निपुणम् skilful, तत् वाक्यम् those words, निशम्य  listening, प्रहृष्टरूपः pleased countenance, जयोपपत्तौ on the success, मनः mind, समाधाय  fixed, तदा then, ताभ्याम् with both of them, सख्यम् friendship, कर्तुम् to make, इयेष wishes

4_1.shloka: [Lakshmana speaks to Hanuman the purpose of their arrival at Rishyamuka -- Hanuman takes Rama and Lakshmana on his shoulders to Sugriva]ततः प्रहृष्टौ हनुमान्कृत्यवानिति तद्वचः।श्रुत्वा मधुरसम्भाषं  सुग्रीवं मनसा गतः4.4.1।।
4_1.translation: After listening to the sweet words of Lakshmana, Hanuman, having done what he had to do felt happy and thought of Sugriva.
4_1.word_by_word: ततः then, कृत्यवान्  who has done his duty, हनुमान् Hanuman, इति thus, तद्वचः his words, श्रुत्वा having heard, मधुरसम्भाषं च and sweet talk, प्रहृष्टः glad, मनसा at heart, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, गतः about

4_2.shloka: भव्यो राज्यागमस्तस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।यदयं कृत्यवान्प्राप्तः कृत्यं चैतदुपागतम्4.4.2।।
4_2.translation: The great Sugriva, thinks Hanuman, who had done his duty is likely to acquire his kingdom, because great Rama who would help in the work of Sugriva has also come.'
4_2.word_by_word: महात्मनः great self, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य that Sugriva's, राज्यागमः acquisition of kingdom, भव्यः is likely to happen, यत् since, कृत्यवान्  one who has done his duty, अयम् this, प्राप्तः got, एतत् this, कृतं च and has work, उपागतम् has come

4_3.shloka: ततः परमसंहृष्टो हनुमान् प्लवगर्षभः।प्रत्युवाच ततो वाक्यं रामं वाक्यविशारदः4.4.3।।
4_3.translation: Hanuman, the best of the monkeys, learned in conversation, felt extremely happy and enquired from Rama:
4_3.word_by_word: ततः then, परमसंहृष्टः extremely happy, प्लवगोत्तमः best of monkeys, हनुमान् Hanuman, ततः then,वाक्यविशारदम् learned in converasation, रामम् Rama's, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच  enquired

4_4.shloka: किमिर्थं त्वं वनं घोरं पम्पाकाननमण्डितम्।आगतस्सानुजो दुर्गं नानाव्याळमृगायुतम्4.4.4।।
4_4.translation: 'Why have you come with your brother to this dreadful, inaccessible forest surrounding Pampa, full of different varieties of serpents and wild animals?'
4_4.word_by_word: सानुजः accompanied by your brother, पम्पाकाननमण्डितम् woods surrounding Pampa, दुर्गम् inaccessible, नानाव्यालमृगायुतम् full of different kinds of serpents and wild animals, घोरम् dreadful, वनम् forest, किमर्थम् why, आगतः came here?

4_5.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणो रामचोदितः।आचचक्षे महात्मानं रामं दशरथात्मजम्4.4.5।।
4_5.translation: Having listened to Hanuman, and urged by Rama, Lakshmana told him about the great Rama, son of Dasaratha.
4_5.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तस्य his, तत् those, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, रामचोदितः urged by Rama, महात्मानम् great soul, दशरथात्मजम् son of Dasaratha, रामम् Rama, आचचक्षे narrated

4_6.shloka: राजा दशरथो नाम द्युतिमान्धर्मवत्सलः।चातुर्वर्ण्यं स्वधर्मेण नित्यमेवाभ्यपालयत्4.4.6।।
4_6.word_by_word: द्युतिमान् brilliant, धर्मवत्सलः lover of dharma, चातुर्वर्ण्यम् four classes, नित्यमेव always, स्वधर्मेण  his duty, अभ्यपालयत् ruled, दशरथो नाम named Dasaratha, राजा king

4_7.shloka: न द्वेष्टा विद्यते तस्य न च स द्वेष्टि कञ्चन।स च सर्वेषु भूतेषु पितामह इवापरः4.4.7।।अग्निष्टोमादिभिर्यज्ञैरिष्टवानाप्तदक्षिणैः।
4_7.translation: 'He never hated any one nor did any one ever hate him. To all his subjects, he was like another father, the Creator Brahma. And he was generous in giving gifts while performing yajnas (rituals with fire) like Agnistoma.
4_7.word_by_word: तस्य his, द्वेष्टा enemy, न विद्यते never existed, सः he, कञ्चन any one indeed, न द्वेष्टि not hated, सः he, सर्वेषु at all, भूतेषु beings, अपरः another, पितामहः इव like the father, आप्तदक्षिणैः with generous gifts, अग्निष्टोमादिभिः with fire sacrifices and others, यज्ञैः with yajnas, इष्टवान् performed.

4_8.shloka: तस्यायं पूर्वजः पुत्रो रामो नाम जनैः श्रुतः।।4.4.8।।शरण्यस्सर्वभूतानां पितुर्निर्देशपारगः।
4_8.translation: 'Here is his eldest son, popularly known as Rama. He is the protector of all beings and never failed his father's instructions.
4_8.word_by_word: अयम् this is, तस्य his, पूर्वजः elder, पुत्रः son, रामो नाम by name Rama, जनैः by people, श्रुतः popular, सर्वभूतानाम् at all beings, शरण्यः protector, पितुः father's, निर्देशपारगः one who  never fails to follow instructions.

4_9.shloka: वीरो दशरथस्यायं पुत्राणां गुणवत्तमः।।4.4.9।।राजलक्षणसम्पन्नस्सम्युक्तो राजसम्पदा।राज्याद्भ्रष्टो वने वस्तुं मया सार्धमिहागतः4.4.10।।
4_9.word_by_word: दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, पुत्राणाम् among sons, वीरः warrior, गुणवत्तमः most virtuous, राजलक्षणसंयुक्तः endowed with royal traits, राज्यसम्पदा with royal wealth, संयुक्तः he isendowed with, अयम् this one, राज्यात् from kingdom, भ्रष्टः is sent away, वने in the forest, वस्तुम् to reside, मया सार्धम् along with me, इह here, आगतः has come

4_10.shloka: भार्यया च महातेजास्सीतयाऽनुगतो वशी।दिनक्षये महातेजाः प्रभयेव दिवाकरः4.4.11।।
4_10.translation: 'This glorious Rama was followed by his wife, Sita, like the rays of the effulgent Sun follow him to the end of the day.
4_10.word_by_word: महातेजाः glorious one, वशी selfcontrolled, दिनक्षये at the end of the day, दिवाकरः Sun, प्रभयेव with radiance, भार्यया  with wife, सीतया with Sita, अनुगतः followed

4_11.shloka: अहमस्यावरो भ्राता गुणैर्दास्यमुपागतः।कृतज्ञस्य बहुज्ञस्य लक्ष्मणो नाम नामतः4.4.12।।
4_11.translation: 'I am his younger brother, called Lakshmana. I have accepted the service of this learned, virtuous and grateful man.
4_11.word_by_word: अहम् I am, कृतज्ञस्य of the grateful man, बहुज्ञस्य of a wellversed man, अस्य his, गुणैः by virtues, दास्यम् servitude, उपागतः has accepted, अवरः younger, भ्राता brother, नामतः  name, लक्ष्मणो नाम called Lakshmana

4_12.shloka: सुखार्हस्य महार्हस्य सर्वभूतहितात्मनः।ऐश्वर्येण च हीनस्य वनवासाश्रितस्य च4.4.13।।रक्षसाऽपहृता भार्या रहिते कामरूपिणा।तच्च न ज्ञायते रक्षः पत्नी येनास्य सा हृता4.4.14।।
4_12.translation: 'This man who should have lived in comfort and in reverence, one who was worthy of all the wellwishers lost his wealth and was banished into the forest. He is now deprived of his wife kidnapped by an unknown demon who could assume any form at will.
4_12.word_by_word: सुखार्हस्य  deserved comforts, महार्हस्य worthy  of reverence, सर्वभूतहितात्मनः wellwisher of all beings, ऐश्वर्येण by wealth, विहीनस्य deprived, वनवासे dwelling in the forest, रतस्य of a man engaged, भार्या wife, रहिते when we were not present2 2सा she, कामरूपिणा who can assume any form at will, रक्षसा by a demon, अपहृता kidnapped, येन वा or by whomsoever,  अस्य his, भार्या wife, हृता has been stolen, तत् that, रक्षः rakshasa, न ज्ञायते is not known

4_13.shloka: दनुर्नाम दितेः पुत्रश्शापाद्राक्षसतां गतः।आख्यातस्तेन सुग्रीवस्समर्थो वानरर्षभः4.4.15।।
4_13.translation: 'Diti's son called Danu who had been cursed to live the life of a demon had said that Sugriva, the best among monkeys, would be able to locate her.
4_13.word_by_word: दितेः Diti's, पुत्रः a son, शापात् by curse, राक्षसताम् as a demon, गतः became, दनुः नाम called Danu, तेन by him, वानरर्षभः the bull among monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, समर्थः capable, आख्यातः had said

4_14.shloka: स ज्ञास्यति महावीर्यस्तव भार्यापहारिणम्।एवमुक्त्वा दनुस्स्वर्गं भ्राजमानो गतस्सुखम्4.4.16।।
4_14.translation: 'That Valiant Sugriva can spot the demon who has abducted your wife', said Danu and disappeared happily into heaven shining in brilliance.
4_14.word_by_word: महावीर्यः valiant one, सः he, तव your, भार्यापहारिणम्  who has stolen your wife, ज्ञास्यति will know, दनुः Danu, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, भ्राजमानः glowing away, स्वर्गम् heaven, सुखम् happily, गतः went

4_15.shloka: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथा तथ्येन पृच्छतः।अहं चैव हि रामश्च सुग्रीवं शरणं गतौ4.4.17।।
4_15.translation: 'I have given a factual account of everything, since you asked me. Now Rama and I have arrived seeking Sugriva's shelter.
4_15.word_by_word: पृच्छतः since you asked, ते you, एतत् that, सर्वम् every event, यथा तथ्येन  in fact, आख्यातम् said, अहं चैव and I also, रामश्च Rama too, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva's, शरणम् refuge, गतौ both arrived

4_16.shloka: एष दत्त्वा च वित्तानि प्राप्य चानुत्तमं यशः।लोकनाथः पुरा भूत्वा सुग्रीवं नाथमिच्छति4.4.18।।
4_16.translation: 'Having earned supreme fame through his munificence in the past, this lord of the world now craves Sugriva's indulgence.
4_16.word_by_word: एषः this person, वित्तानि wealth, दत्त्वा च and gifting , अनुत्तमम् excellence ,यशः fame, प्राप्य च having obtained, पुरा earlier, लोकनाथः lord of the world, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, नाथम् king, इच्छति wishes

4_17.shloka: पिता यस्य पुरा ह्यासीच्छरण्यो धर्मवत्सलः।तस्य पुत्रश्शरण्यश्च सुग्रीवं शरणं गतः4.4.19।।
4_17.translation: 'One whose father was once a protector of dharma, a refuge to all now seeks Sugriva's shelter.
4_17.word_by_word: पुरा earlier, यस्य whose, धर्मवत्सलः lover of dharma, पिता father, शरण्यः refuge to others, आसीत् he was, शरण्यश्च refuge of, तस्य his, पुत्रः son, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, शरणं गतः seeks protection

4_18.shloka: सर्वलोकस्य धर्मात्मा शरण्यश्शरणं पुरा।गुरुर्मे राघवस्सोऽयं सुग्रीवं शरणं गतः4.4.20।।
4_18.translation: 'This righteous Rama who used to lend in the past protection to the whole world and, indeed, a refuge to all, venerable sir, now seeks Sugriva's shelter.
4_18.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, शरण्यः  protector, पुरा earlier, सर्वलोकस्य for the whole world, to all (his) people शरणम् protector, गुरुः respectable, सः he, अयम् this person, राघवः Rama, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva's, शरणं गतः sought protection

4_19.shloka: यस्य प्रसादे सततं प्रसीदेयुरिमाः प्रजाः।स रामो वानरेन्द्रस्य प्रसादमभिकाङ्क्षते। 4.4.21।।
4_19.translation: 'This Rama for whose grace the subjects were ever bobolden to him now seeks the favour of the Chief of monkeys.
4_19.word_by_word: यस्य whose, प्रसादे grace, इमाः these, प्रजाः people, सततम् always, प्रसीदेयुः they will be pleased, सः रामः that Rama, वानरेन्द्रस्य chief of monkeys', प्रसादम् favour, अभिकाङ्क्षते is desiring

4_20.shloka: येन सर्वगुणोपेताः पृथिव्यां सर्वपार्थिवाः।मानितास्सततं राज्ञा सदा दशरथेन वै4.4.22तस्यायं पूर्वजः पुत्रस्त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः।सुग्रीवं वानरेन्द्रं तु रामश्शरणमागतः4.4.23।।
4_20.translation: 'Famous in all the three worlds, this Rama, who was the firshborn of Dasaratha, endowed with all virtues and ever respected by all the kings of this earth, now seeks shelter of Sugriva, Chief of monkeys.
4_20.word_by_word: राज्ञा by the king, येन by whom, दशरथेन by Dasaratha, पृथिव्याम् on this earth, सर्वगुणोपेताः endowed with all virtues, सर्वपार्थिवाः all kings, सदा always, सततम् ever, मानिताः honoured, तस्य his, पूर्वजः eldest, पुत्रः son, त्रिषु लोकेषु in the three worlds, विश्रुतः very famous, अयं रामः such Rama,  वानरेन्द्रम् lord of monkeys, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, शरणमागतः sought refuge

4_21.shloka: शोकाभिभूते रामे तु शोकार्ते शरणं गते।कर्तुमर्हति सुग्रीवः प्रसादं हरियूधपः4.4.24।।
4_21.translation: 'Sugriva, lord of monkeys, ought to help Rama who tormented by, and overwhelmed with, grief seeks his favour.'
4_21.word_by_word: हरियूधप: lord of monkeys, शोकाभिभूते one who is overcome by grief, शोकार्ते one who is pained  by sorrow, शरणं गते when he sought refuge, रामे to Rama, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रसादम्  favour कर्तुम् to render, अर्हति deserves

4_22.shloka: एवं ब्रुवाणं सौमित्रिं करुणं साश्रुलोचनम्।हनुमान्प्रत्युवाचेदं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः4.4.25।।
4_22.translation: To Saumitri who was speaking thus in a piteous tone, his eyes filled with tears the eloquent Hanuman replied:
4_22.word_by_word: करुणम् piteously, साश्रुलोचनम् eyes filled with tears, एवम् that way, ब्रुवाणम् while speaking, सौमित्रिम् to Saumithri, वाक्यविशारदः an erudite speaker, हनुमान् Hanuman, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied back

4_23.shloka: ईदृशा बुद्धिसम्पन्ना जितक्रोधा जितेन्द्रियाः।द्रष्टव्या वानरेन्द्रेण दिष्ट्या दर्शनमागताः4.4.26।।
4_23.translation: 'It is a matter of great fortune that you who have intelligence, control over your senses and conquered anger have come to see the lord of monkeys who needs instead, to approach you.
4_23.word_by_word: बुद्धिसम्पन्नाः highly intelligent, जितक्रोधाः who have conquered anger, जितेन्द्रियाः who have 2 2conquered senses, दिष्ट्या luckily, दर्शनम् to see, आगताः came here, ईदृशाः such men, वानरेन्द्रेण by king of vanaras, द्रष्टव्या deserve to be approached

4_24.shloka: स हि राज्यात्परिभ्रष्टः कृतवैरश्च वालिना।हृतदारो वने त्यक्तो भ्रात्रा विनिकृतो भृशम्4.4.27।।
4_24.translation: '(In fact) seriously offended by his brother Vali who treated him like his enemy and expelled him from the kingdom. He is now abandoned in the forest, his wife hijacked.
4_24.word_by_word: वालिना by Vali, कृतवैरः developed enmity, भ्रात्रा by his brother, हृतदारः deprived of his wife, भृशम् strongly, विनिकृतः is offended, राज्यात् from the kingdom, विभ्रष्टः thrown out, सः he, त्यक्त: is abandoned, वने in the forest

4_25.shloka: करिष्यति स साहाय्यं युवयोर्भास्करात्मजः।सुग्रीवस्सह चास्माभि स्सीतायाः परिमार्गणे4.4.28।।
4_25.translation: 'Sugriva, son of the Sungod, along with us will extend all help to you, in your search for Sita.'
4_25.word_by_word: भास्करात्मजः son of the Sungod, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अस्माभिः सह along with us, सीतायाः Sita's, परिमार्गणे in search of, युवयोः for both of you, साहाय्यम् help, करिष्यति he will do

4_26.shloka: इत्येवमुक्त्वा हनुमान् श्लक्ष्णं मधुरया गिरा।बभाषे सोऽभिगच्छेम सुग्रीवमिति राघवम्4.4.29।।
4_26.translation: Hanuman, having spoken with sweet, gentle words said to the Raghavas, 'We will now go to Sugriva'.
4_26.word_by_word: हनुमान् Hanuman, मधुरया sweetly, गिरा with words, इत्येवम् like that, श्लक्ष्णम् gently, उक्त्वा having said, साधु well done, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, अभिगच्छेम we will go, इति thus, राघवम् Raghava, बभाषे spoke

4_27.shloka: एवं ब्रुवाणं धर्मात्मा हनुमन्तं स लक्ष्मणः।प्रतिपूज्य यथान्यायमिदं प्रोवाच राघवम्4.4.30।।
4_27.translation: Having offered reverential salutations to Hanuman as per tradition, righteous Lakshmana now spoke to Rama:
4_27.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, सः लक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, ब्रुवाणम् as he spoke, हनुमन्तम् to Hanuman, यथान्यायम् as per tradition, प्रतिपूज्य  offered salutation, राघवम् Raghava, इदम् this, प्रोवाच spoke

4_28.shloka: कपिः कथयते हृष्टो यथाऽयं मारुतात्मजः।कृत्यवांत्सोऽपि सम्प्राप्तः कृतकृत्योऽसि राघव4.4.31।।
4_28.translation: 'O Raghava this monkey, son of the Windgod appears pleased as evident from his words. As he is a man of action, take your work as accomplished now.
4_28.word_by_word: राघव Rama, मारुतात्मजः son of the windgod, अयं कपिः this monkey, हृष्टः a pleased one, यथा as, कथयते he is telling, सोऽपि he also, कृत्यवान् a person of action, सम्प्राप्तः has come, कृतकृत्यः  accomplished, असि you are

4_29.shloka: प्रसन्नमुखवर्णश्च व्यक्तं हृष्टश्च भाषते।नानृतं वक्ष्यते वीरो हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः4.4.32।।
4_29.translation: 'It is evident from his words  and from his cheerful face that Hanuman is pleased. (I know that) this heroic son of the Windgod will never tell a lie'.
4_29.word_by_word: व्यक्तम् it is evident, प्रसन्नमुखवर्णश्च he has a cheerful face, हृष्टश्च he is pleased, भाषते  words, मारुतात्मजः son of the windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, अनृतम् lie, न वक्ष्यते will not tell

4_30.shloka: ततस्स तु महाप्राज्ञो हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।जगामादाय तौ वीरौ हरिराजाय राघवौ4.4.33।।
4_30.translation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod, endowed with great wisdom carried both the Raghava warriors to the king of monkeys.
4_30.word_by_word: ततः then, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, मारुतात्मजः son of the windgod, सः हनुमान् that Hanuman, वीरौ   warrior heroes, तौ राघवौ both Raghavas, हरिराजाय to the king of monkeys, आदायled them, जगाम went

4_31.shloka: भिक्षुरूपं परित्यज्य वानरं रूपमास्थितः।पृष्ठमारोप्य तौ वीरौ जगाम कपिकुञ्जरः4.4.34।।
4_31.translation: Hanuman, who was an elephant among monkeys, gave up the guise of a mendicant, and assuming the form of the monkeys, lifted both the heroes  on to his back and proceeded.
4_31.word_by_word: कपिकुञ्जरः elephantlike monkey, भिक्षुरूपम् form of a mendicant, परित्यज्य  gave up, वानरम् monkeys, रूपम् form, आस्थितः assumed, तौ both, वीरौ heroes, पृष्ठम् on the back, आरोप्य lifted, जगाम proceeded.

4_32.shloka: स तु विपुलयशाः कपिप्रवीरःपवनसुतः कृतकृत्यवत्प्रहृष्टः।गिरिवरमुरुविक्रमः प्रयातस्स शुभमतिस्सह रामलक्ष्मणाभ्याम्4.4.35।।
4_32.translation: The son of the Windgod, the most valiant, the supremely heroic monkey and the one welladmired, having performed his task, felt immensely happy.And with an auspicious feeling, departed for the great mountain (Rishyamuka) along with Rama and Lakshmana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किंधाकाण्डे चतुर्थस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fourth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
4_32.word_by_word: विपुलयशाः highly renowned, कपिप्रवीरः most heroic monkey, सः पवनसुतः son of the windgod, कृतकृत्यवत् having done his duty, प्रहृष्टः gladly, शुभमतिः with auspicious feeling, उरुविक्रमः renowned for his valiance, सः he, रामलक्ष्मणाभ्यां सह with Rama and Lakshmana, गिरिवरम् to the great mountain, प्रयातः departed.

5_1.shloka: [Rama and Lakshmana meet Sugriva -- Rama makes friendship with him -- Sugriva reveals the injustice done to him by Vali -- Rama assures him help -- Sugriva promises to send his troops to find Sita.]ऋश्यमूकात्तु हनुमान्गत्वा तु मलयं गिरिम्।आचचक्षे तदा वीरौ कपिराजाय राघवौ4.5.1।।
5_1.translation: Leaving Rishyamuka, Hanuman reached the Malaya mountain. Seeing the chief of monkeys there, he announced the arrival of  the heroic Raghavas.
5_1.word_by_word: हनुमान् Hanuman, ऋष्यमूकात् from Rishyamuka, मलयं Malaya, गिरिम् mountain, गत्वा on going, कपिराजाय to the lord of the monkeys, तदा then, वीरौ the two heroes, राघवौ Raghavas, आचचक्षे  seeing announced (the arrival)

5_2.shloka: अयं रामो महाप्राज्ञ स्सम्प्राप्तो दृढविक्रमः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा रामोऽयं सत्यविक्रमः4.5.2।।
5_2.translation: 'This Rama of greatwisdom and valour, endowed with the power of truth has arrived here along with his brother Lakshmana.
5_2.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञः very wise, दृढविक्रम: unfailing in valour, अयं रामः this Rama, भ्रात्रा with brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, सम्प्राप्तः has arrived, अयं रामः this Rama, सत्यविक्रमः  endowed with the power of truth

5_3.shloka: इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातो रामो दशरथात्मजः।धर्मे निगदितश्चैव पितुर्निर्देशपारगः4.5.3।।
5_3.translation: 'Born in the Ikshvaku race Rama Dasaratha's son, distinguished for his righteousness is here to carry out the orders of his father.
5_3.word_by_word: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of Ikshvakus, कुले in the race, जातः he is born, दशरथात्मजः Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama, धर्मे in righteousness, निगदितश्चैव is noteworthy, पितुः father's, निर्देशपारगः

5_4.shloka: तस्यास्य वसतोऽरण्ये नियतस्य महात्मनः।रावणेन हृता भार्या स त्वां शरणमागतः4.5.4।।
5_4.translation: 'While the great Rama armed with selfrestraint was living in the forest, his wife was abducted by Ravana. So he has come to you seeing refuge.
5_4.word_by_word: अरण्ये in the forest, वसतः  living , नियतस्य  self controlled , तस्य his, अस्य this man, महात्मनः great man's, भार्या wife, रावणेन by Ravana, हृता is abducted, सः he, त्वाम् to you, शरणम् आगतः has come to you to seek refuge

5_5.shloka: राजसूयाश्वमेधैश्च वह्निर्येनाभितर्पितः।दक्षिणाश्च तथोत्सृष्टा गावश्शतसहस्रशः4.5.5।।तपसा सत्यवाक्येन वसुधा येन पालिता।स्त्री हेतोस्तस्य पुत्रोऽयं रामस्त्वां शरणं गतः4.5.6।।
5_5.translation: 'This Rama, son of a king who had gratified the firegod through many yajnas like  Rajasuya and Aswamedha, gifted hundreds of thousands of cows and ruled this earth with truth and austerity, has come seeking help for a woman.'
5_5.word_by_word: येन by whom, राजसूयाश्वमेधैश्च by Rajasuya and Aswamedha yajnas, वह्निः god of fire, अभितर्पितः is gratified, तथा so also, शतसहस्रशः in hundreds and thousands, गावः cows, दक्षिणाः sacrificial gifts, उत्सृष्टाः येन by whom given, तपसा by practising religious austerity, सत्यवाक्येन  justly, वसुधा earth, पालिता is ruled, तस्य his, पुत्रः son, अयं रामः this is Rama, स्त्री हेतोः on account of a woman, शरणम् refuge, समागतः came here

5_6.shloka: भवता सख्यकामौ तौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।प्रतिगृह्यार्चयस्वैतौ पूजनीयतमावुभौ4.5.7।।
5_6.translation: 'Both the brothers, Rama and Lakshmana seek friendship with you. As both of them are worthiest of worship, welcome them with due reverence.'
5_6.word_by_word: भ्रातरौ  brothers, तौ  both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, भवता by you, सख्यकामौ for friendship, पूजनीयतमौ are worthiest of worship, एतौ both of them, उभौ both, प्रतिगृह्य  may receive, अर्चयस्व  welcome with all reverence

5_7.shloka: श्रुत्वा हनुमतो वाक्यं सुग्रीवो हृष्टमानसः।भयं चराघवाद्घोरं प्रजहौ विगतज्वरः।।4.5.8।।सकृत्वा मानुषं रूपं सुग्रीवः प्लवगर्षभः।दर्शनीयतमो भूत्वा प्रीत्या प्रोवाच राघवम्4.5.9।।
5_7.translation: Hanuman's words took away Sugriva's great fear for Rama and filled him with cheer. This bull among monkeys gave up his natural appearance and and assuming an attractive human form spoke to Rama lovingly:
5_7.word_by_word: हृष्टमानसः delighted at heart, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, हनुमतः Hanuman's, वाक्यम् word, श्रुत्वा having heard, भयं च and fear, राघवा Raghava, घोरं  terrible, प्रजहौ abandoned, विगतज्वरः devoid of fear, प्रीत्या lovingly, दर्शनीयतमः most attractive, सकृत्वा having taken, मानुषं रूपं human form, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्लवगर्षभः best among monkeys, भूत्वा having given up, राघवम् of  Raghava,  (प्र)उवाच said,

5_8.shloka: भवान्धर्मविनीतश्च विक्रान्तस्सर्ववत्सलः।आख्याता वायुपुत्रेण तत्त्वतो मे भवद्गुणाः4.5.10।।
5_8.translation: 'You are a great hero, affectionate to all and wellversed in all dharmas. The son of theWindgod has, in fact, apprised me  of your virtues
5_8.word_by_word: भवान् you, धर्मविनीतश्च educated in all dharmas, विक्रान्तः a great hero, सर्ववत्सलः kind to all beings, भवद्गुणाः your virtues, वायुपुत्रेण by the son of the windgod, तत्त्वतः truly, मे to me, आख्याताः apprised

5_9.shloka: तन्ममैवैष सत्कारो लाभश्चैवोत्तमः प्रभो।यत्त्वमिच्छसि सौहार्दं वानरेण मया सह4.5.11।।
5_9.translation: 'O Lord that you are eager to have friendship with me, who is a monkey is a great honour and is extremely beneficial to me.
5_9.word_by_word: प्रभो O Lord, तत् that, त्वम् you, वानरेण by a monkey, मया सह with me, सौहार्दम् friendship, इच्छसि (इति) यत् that you are wishing, एषः that way, ममैव for myself, सत्कारः an honour, उत्तमः best, लाभश्च benefit

5_10.shloka: रोचते यदि वा सख्यं बाहुरेष प्रसारितः।गृह्यतां पाणिना पाणिर्मर्यादा बध्यतां ध्रुवा4.5.12।।
5_10.translation: 'If you are desirous of my friendship, here is my arm (palm) stretched out to you. With due regard, establish our bond firmly, holding my palm in yours.'
5_10.word_by_word: वा if , सख्यम् friendship, रोचते यदि is desired, एषः this is, बाहुः my arm, प्रसारितः stretched, पाणिना on my hand, पाणिः your hand, गृह्यताम् may be received, ध्रुवा firm, मर्यादा  with due2 2regard, बध्यताम् may be bound

5_11.shloka: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवेण सुभाषितम्।सम्प्रहृष्टमना हस्तं पीडयामास पाणिना4.5.13।।हृद्यं सौहृदमालम्ब्यपर्यष्वजत पीडितम्।
5_11.translation: Rama became very happy to hear Sugriva's warm words and pressed his hand with his. Delighted, he went close  to Sugriva and hugged him tightly and  affectionately.
5_11.word_by_word: सुग्रीवेण(सुग्रीवस्य) Sugriva's, सुभाषितम् wellsaid,एतत् this,वचनम् word,श्रुत्वा having heard, सम्प्रहृष्टमनाः became very happy, पाणिना with the hand, हस्तम् hand, पीडयामास pressed, सौहृदम् affectionately, आलम्ब्य maintaining, हृद्यं delighted , पीडितम्  getting close, पर्यष्वजत firmly hugged

5_12.shloka: ततो हनूमान्सन्त्यज्य भिक्षुरूपमरिन्दमः।।4.5.14।।काष्ठयोस्स्वेन रूपेण जनयामास पावकम्।दीप्यमानं ततो वह्निं ह्निं पुष्पैरभ्यर्च्य सत्कृतम्4.5.15।।तयोर्मध्येऽथ सुप्रीतो निदधे सुसमाहितः।
5_12.translation: Then, Hanuman vanquisher of enemies, gave up his guise of a mendicant, assumed his natural form and generated fire by rubbing two pieces of wood. Wellpleased at heart, he made an offering of flowers to the flaming fire and placed it between them.
5_12.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, अरिन्दमः vanquisher of enemies, हनुमान् Hanuman, भिक्षुरूपम् mendicant form, सन्त्यज्य giving up, स्वेन by his real, रूपेण form, काष्ठयोः two pieces of wood, पावकम् fire, जनयामास generated, ततः then, दीप्यमानम् glowing, सत्कृतम् a spot of worship, वह्निम्  into fire, पुष्पैः of flowers, अभ्यर्च्य made an offering, सुसमाहितः vigilant, सुप्रीतः a pleased one, तयोः of them, मध्ये in between, निदधे placed

5_13.shloka: ततोऽग्निं दीप्यमानं तौ चक्रतुश्च प्रदक्षिणम्।।4.5.16।।सुग्रीवो राघवश्चैव वयस्यत्वमुपागतौ।
5_13.translation: They both circumambulated the blazing fire and solemnized their friendship.
5_13.word_by_word: ततः then, तौ both of them, दीप्यमानम् blazing, अग्निम् fire, प्रदक्षिणं चक्रतुः went round, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राघवश्चैव and Raghava also, वयस्यत्वम् friendship, उपागतौ  both established

5_14.translation: Rama and the monkey contented at heart, yet not fully content, continued looking at each other.
5_14.word_by_word: ततः then, सुप्रीतमनसौ both delighted at heart, तौ both, हरिराघवौ Sugriva and Rama, उभौboth, अन्योन्यम् each other, अभिवीक्षन्तौ looking at each other, तृप्तिम् contented, न अभिजग्मतुः  yet not fully content

5_15.shloka: त्वं वयस्योऽसि मे हृद्यो ह्येकं दुःखं सुखं च नौ4.5.18।।सुग्रीवो राघवं वाक्यमित्युवाच प्रहृष्टवत्।
5_15.translation: 'You are a dear friend to me. Your sorrow is my sorrow, your pleasure is my  pleasure. We are one and the same' said Sugriva to Rama, his heart overflowing with happiness.
5_15.word_by_word: त्वम् you, मे to me, हृद्यः dear, वयस्यः friend, असि you are, नौ for both of us, सुखम् pleasure, दुःखं च and sorrow, ह्येकम् are one and the same, इति thus, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रहृष्टवत् happy, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.

5_16.shloka: ततस्सुपर्णबहुलां छित्वा शाखां सुपुष्पिताम्4.5.19।।सालस्यास्तीर्य सुग्रीवो निषसाद सराघवः।
5_16.translation: Then Sugriva cut the branch of a sala tree with luxuriant leaves and flowers, spread it on the ground and sat down along with Raghava.
5_16.word_by_word: ततः then, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, सालस्य of a Sala tree, सुपर्णबहुलाम् with luxuriant leaves, सुपुष्पिताम् wellblossomed, शाखाम् branch, छित्वा cut, आस्तीर्य spread, सराघवः along with Rama, निषसाद sat down.

5_17.shloka: लक्ष्मणायाथ संहृष्टो हनूमान् प्लवगर्षभः4.5.20।।शाखां चन्दनवृक्षस्य ददौ परमपुष्पिताम्।
5_17.translation: Then Hanuman, the bull among monkeys, felt very happy, cut the branch of a sandalwood tree full of flowers and gave it to Lakshmana.
5_17.word_by_word: अथ then, संहृष्टः very happy, प्लवगर्षभः bull among monkeys, हनुमान् Hanuman, चन्दनवृक्षस्य sandal tree, परमपुष्पिताम् full of flowers, शाखाम् branch, लक्ष्मणाय to Lakshmana, ददौ gave.

5_18.shloka: ततः प्रहृष्टस्सुग्रीवः श्लक्ष्णं मधुरया गिरा4.5.21।।प्रत्युवाच तदा रामं हर्षव्याकुललोचनः।
5_18.translation: Then Sugriva, eyes sparkling with joy, replied to Rama in a sweet, gentle voice.
5_18.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रहृष्टः overwhelmed with joy, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, हर्षव्याकुललोचनः eyes sparkling with joy, तदा then, रामम् Rama, मधुरया in sweet, गिरा with words, श्लक्ष्णम् gently, प्रत्युवाच replied.

5_19.shloka: अहं विनिकृतो राम चरामीह भयार्दितः4.5.22।।हृतभार्यो वने त्रस्तो दुर्गमेतदुपाश्रितः।
5_19.translation: 'O Rama, I have been insulted deeply and my wife hijacked. Stricken with fear I have taken refuge in this inaccessible forest.
5_19.word_by_word: राम Rama, अहम् I, विनिकृतः badly insulted, हृतभार्यः wife hijacked, भयार्दितः stricken with fear, इह here, वने in the forest, चरामि I am moving, त्रस्तः frightened, दुर्गम् in accessible, एतत् this, उपाश्रितः taken refuge.

5_20.shloka: सोऽहं त्रस्तो वने भीतो वसाम्युद्भ्रान्तचेतनः4.5.23।।वालिना निकृतो भ्रात्रा कृतवैरश्च राघव।
5_20.translation: 'O Rama humiliated by my brother Vali, I have developed enmity with him. Terribly distraught and disturbed I live in this forest in great fear.
5_20.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, भ्रात्रा by my brother, वालिना Vali, निकृतः humiliated, कृतवैरश्च developed enmity, सः अहम् such a person, त्रस्तः frightened, उद्भ्रान्तचेतनः with unsteady mind, वने in the forest, भीतः fearing, वसामि I am living.

5_21.shloka: वालिनो मे महाभाग भयार्तस्याभयं कुरु4.5.24।।कर्तुमर्हसि काकुत्स्थ भयं मे न भवेद्यथा।
5_21.translation: 'O reverend Kakutstha, I feel helpless with fear from Vali. Save me. You should release me free from fear.'
5_21.word_by_word: महाभाग reverend, वालिनः from Vali, भयार्तस्य feeling helpless with fear, मे to me, अभयम् security, कुरु give me, काकुत्स्थ Kakusta, मे यथा as I, भयम् fear, न भवेत् may not be, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि you ought to.

5_22.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु तेजस्वी धर्मज्ञो धर्मवत्सलः4.5.25।।प्रत्यभाषत काकुत्स्थ: सुग्रीवं प्रहसन्निव।
5_22.translation: The righteous and glorious Rama to whom dharma is very dear said to Sugriva with a gentle smile on his face, when he was entreated thus:
5_22.word_by_word: एवम् that way, उक्तः having addressed, तेजस्वी glorious, धर्मज्ञः righteous man, धर्मवत्सलः   lover of dharma, काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha, प्रहसन्निव with gentle smile on the face, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, प्रत्यभाषत replied.

5_23.shloka: उपकारफलं मित्रं विदितं मे महाकपे4.5.26।।वालिनं तं वधिष्यामि तव भार्यापहारिणम्।
5_23.translation: 'O great monkey I know friendship is the fruit of a beneficial deed. I will kill that Vali who has usurped your wife.
5_23.word_by_word: महाकपे O great monkey, मित्रम् a friend, उपकारफलम् result of doing a good deed, मे to me, विदितम् is known, तव your, भार्यापहारिणम् one who has stolen your wife, तं वालिनम् that Valin, वधिष्यामि I will kill.

5_24.shloka: अमोघास्सूर्यसङ्काशा ममैते निशिताश्शराः4.5.27।।तस्मिन्वालिनि दुर्वृत्ते निपतिष्यन्ति वेगिताः।कङ्कपत्रप्रतिच्छन्ना महेन्द्राशनिसन्निभाः4.5.28।।तीक्ष्णाग्रा ऋजुपर्वाणस्सरोषा भुजगा इव।
5_24.translation: 'These arrows covered with kanka feathers, sharp and straight at the tip, comparable to great Indra's thunderbolt are (burning bright) like the sun. Looking like angry serpents, they will unfailingly strike at the miscreant Vali soon.
5_24.word_by_word: अमोघाः unfailing, सूर्यसङ्कशाः comparable to Sun, निशिताः sharp, कङ्कपत्रप्रतिच्छन्नाः covered with the feathers of a kanka bird, महेन्द्राशनिसन्निभाः equal to great India's thunderbolt, तीक्ष्णाग्राः with a sharp tip, ऋजुपर्वाणः straight, सरोषाः angry, भुजगाः इव like serpents, इमे these, मम शराः my arrows, वेगिताः soon, दुर्वृत्ते at the miscreant, तस्मिन् at him, वालिनि at Vali, निपतिष्यन्ति they will strike.

5_25.shloka: तमद्य वालिनं पश्य तीक्ष्णैराशीविषोपमैः4.5.29।।शरैर्विनिहतं भूमौ विकीर्णमिव पर्वतम्।
5_25.translation: 'With these sharp, serpentlike arrows Vali will be killed. He will fall down on the ground like a mountain shattered.You will see it now'.
5_25.word_by_word: अद्य now, आशीविषोपमैः comparable to serpents, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, शरैः arrows, विनिहतम् killed, भूमौ on the ground, प्रकीर्णम् will fall shattered, पर्वतमिव like a mountain, वालिनम् Vali, पश्य see.

5_26.shloka: स तु तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवस्यात्मनो हितम्4.5.30।।सुग्रीवः परमप्रीतस्सुमहद्वाक्यमब्रवीत्।
5_26.translation: Sugriva, very much pleased with the words of Rama, spoke highly (of him).
5_26.word_by_word: सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, आत्मनः for himself, हितम् welfare, राघवस्य Rama's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, परमप्रीतः very much pleased, सुमहान् very great, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

5_27.shloka: तव प्रसादेन नृसिंह राघवप्रियां च राज्यं च समाप्नुयामहम्।तथा कुरु त्वं नरदेव वैरिणंयथा निहंस्यद्य रिपुंममाग्रजम्4.5.31।।
5_27.translation: 'O Rama, by your grace I will get my wife and kingdom back. O king accomplish this so that I can destroy my, elder brother, my enemy, O lion among men
5_27.word_by_word: नृसिंह lion among men, तव your, प्रसादेन by your grace, अहम् I am, प्रियां च wife and, राज्यं च kingdom, समाप्नुयाम् will attain, नरदेव king, सः he, पुनः again, यथा as, निहंस्यद्य will destroy, तथा thus, त्वम् you, वैरिणम् enemy, मम अग्रजम् my elder brother, कुरु do.

5_28.translation: While Sugriva was making a friendly alliance with Rama, Sita's left eye, like lotus, Vali's left eye glittering like gold and Ravana's left eye blazing (like fire) twitched at the same time for a moment (Twitching of left eye is considered auspicious to a woman and ominous to a man).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fifth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
5_28.word_by_word: सुग्रीवरामप्रणयप्रसङ्गे while Sugriva and Rama were making a friendly alliance, सीताकपीन्द्रक्षणदाचराणाम् Sita's, Vali's and also Ravana's, राजीवहेमज्वलनोपमानि lotuslike and blazing like gold, वामानिनेत्राणि left eyes, समम् equally, स्फुरन्ति throbbed.

6_1.shloka: [Sugriva speaks about the abduction of Sita by Ravana -- shows to Rama the veil and ornament dropped down by Sita -- Rama eager to killl Ravana, seeks further details of the enemy from Sugriva]पुनरेवाब्रवीत्प्रीतो राघवं रघुनन्दनम्।अयमाख्याति मे राम सचिवो मन्त्रिसत्तमः4.6.1।।हनुमान्यन्निमित्तं त्वं निर्जनं वनमागतः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वसतश्च वने तव4.6.2।।रक्षसाऽपहृता भार्या मैथिली जनकात्मजा।त्वया वियुक्ता रुदती लक्ष्मणेन च धीमता4.6.3।।अन्तरप्रेप्सुना तेन हत्वा गृध्रं जटायुषम्4.6.4।।
6_1.translation: Sugriva was pleased to say to Rama, delight of the Raghu race once again, 'O Rama, Hanuman, jewel among Ministers, has told me the cause of your coming to this desolate forest. While you were residing in the forest, a demon who was looking for an opportunity carried off your wife, the princess from Mithila, daughter of Janaka, finding her alone. While she was crying (piteously) he killed Jatayu. (the vulture who pretested).
6_1.word_by_word: प्रीतः pleased, रघुनन्दनम् delight of the Raghu dynasty, राघवम् to Rama, पुनरेव again, अब्रवीत् said, राम Rama, त्वम् you, भ्रात्रा your brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana यन्निमित्तं the reason, निर्जनम् desolate, वनम् forest, आगतः has come, मे my, सचिव: counsellor, मन्त्रिसत्तमः jewel among ministers, अयम् this, हनुमान् Hanuman, आख्याति has told, वने in the forest, वसतः residing, तव your, भार्या wife, त्वया by you, धीमता a wise person, लक्ष्मणेन च and by Lakshmana, वियुक्ता alone, रुदती crying, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, मैथिली Maithili, रक्षसा by the demon, अपहृता was carried off, अन्तरप्रेप्सुना seeking a chance, तेन by him, जटायुषम् Jatayu, गृध्रम् vulture, हत्वा having killed

6_2.shloka: भार्यावियोगजं दुःखं न चिरात्त्वं विमोक्ष्यसे।अहं तामानयिष्यामि नष्टां वेदश्रुतीमिव।।4.6.5।।
6_2.translation: 'Very soon you will be relieved of the grief caused by the separation from your wife. Just as Visnu retrieved the Vedas (carried away by the demons, Madhu and Kaitabha) I will deliver her to you.
6_2.word_by_word: त्वम् you, न चिरात् very soon, भार्यावियोगजम्  due to separation from wife, दुःखम् grief, विमोक्ष्यसे will be relieved, नष्टाम् lost, वेदश्रुतीमिव like the Vedas, ताम् her, आनयिष्यामि I will get her

6_3.shloka: रसातले वा वर्तन्तीं वर्तन्ती वा नभस्थलेअहमानीय दास्यामि तव भार्यामरिन्दम।।।4.6.6।।
6_3.translation: 'O subduer of enemies I will restore her to you even if she is kept in the bowels of the earth or in the vaults of heaven.
6_3.word_by_word: अरिन्दम subduer of enemies, रसातले in the underworld, वर्तन्तीम् staying, वा or, नभस्तले in the sky, वर्तन्तीम् staying, वा or, तव भार्याम् your wife, आनीया after restoring, (अहं) दास्यामि (I) will give you

6_4.shloka: इदं तथ्यं मम वचस्त्वमवेहि च राघव।न शक्या सा जरयितुं सेन्द्रैरपि स्सुरासुरैः4.6.7।।तव भार्या महाबाहो भक्ष्यं विषकृतं यथा।त्यज शोकं महाबाहो तां कान्तामानयामि ते4.6.8।।
6_4.translation: 'O longarmed Rama, take these words of mine as true. Your consort cannot be absorbed with impunity even by the denizens of heaven including Indra or the ogres on earth any more than food cooked with poison.Give up grief.
6_4.word_by_word: राघव Rama, मम my, इदम् these, वच: तथ्यम् words will come true, त्वम् you, अवेहि may know, महाबाहो O longarmed one, तव your, भार्या consort, सा she, विषकृतम् mixed with poison, भक्ष्यं यथा like the food, सेन्द्रैः inclusive of Indra, सुरासुरैरपि by  gods or demons, जरयितुम् to absorb, न शक्या not possible, महाबाहो O longarmed, शोकम् grief, त्यज give up,ते to you, कान्ताम्  lady, ताम् her, आनयामि I will get

6_5.shloka: अनुमानात्तु जानामि मैथिली सा न संशयः।ह्रियमाणा मया दृष्टा रक्षसा क्रूरकर्मणा4.6.9।।क्रोशन्ती राम रामेति लक्ष्मणेति च विस्वरम्।स्फुरन्ती रावणस्याङ्के पन्नगेन्द्रवधूर्यथा4.6.10।।
6_5.translation: 'Yes, I remember. I had observed a lady being carried away by a wicked demon. She was crying loudly 'Oh, Rama Oh Rama Oh Lakshmana' in a husky voice. It was Maithili. She was wriggling on the lap of Ravana like a female serpent.
6_5.word_by_word: क्रूरकर्मणा of terrible deeds, रक्षसा by the demon, ह्रियमाणा being carried away, राम रामेति saying Rama, Rama, लक्ष्मणेति also Lakshmana, विस्वरम् husky voice, क्रोशन्ती (विलपन्ती)  crying, पन्नगेन्द्रवधूर्यथा like the queen of serpents, रावणस्य Ravana's, अङ्के on the lap, स्फुरन्ती while she was wriggling, मया by myself, दृष्टा was seen, सा she, मैथिली Maithili, अनुमानात् no doubt, जानामि I know, संशयः doubt, न not

6_6.shloka: आत्मना पञ्चमं मां हि दृष्ट्वा शैलतटे स्थितम्।उत्तरीयं तया त्यक्तं शुभान्याभरणानि च4.6.11।।
6_6.translation: 'Seeing me as the fifth member seated on a mountain  she dropped down the auspicious ornaments (bundled) in her veil
6_6.word_by_word: शैलतटे on the mountain, स्थितम् seated, आत्मना by myself, पञ्चमम् a fifth one, माम् me, दृष्टवा after seeing, तया by her, उत्तरीयम् veil, त्यक्तम् is dropped, शुभानि auspicious, आभरणानि च ornaments also

6_7.shloka: तान्यस्माभिगृहीतानि निहितानि च राघव।आनयिष्याम्यहं तानि प्रत्यभिज्ञातुमर्हसि4.6.12।।
6_7.translation: 'Rama, we have kept  them safely. I will fetch them so that you should be able to identify them.'
6_7.word_by_word: राघव Rama, तानि those, अस्माभिः by us, गृहीतानि collected, निहितानि च and kept safely, अहम् I, तानि them, आनयिष्यामि will get, प्रत्यभिज्ञातुम् recognise them, अर्हसि you ought to

6_8.shloka: तमब्रवीत्ततो रामस्सुग्रीवं प्रियवादिनम्।आनयस्व सखे शीघ्रं किमर्थं प्रविलम्बसे4.6.13।।
6_8.translation: Rama then said to Sugriva, one who used pleasing words, 'O my friend why delay? Get them here immediately'.
6_8.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama, प्रियवादिनम् a man of pleasant word, तं सुग्रीवम् that Sugriva, अब्रवीत् said, सखे O friend, शीघ्रम् quickly, आनयस्व you may get, किमर्थम् why do you, प्रविलम्बसे delay

6_9.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवश्शैलस्य गहनां गुहाम्।प्रविवेश ततशशीघ्रं राघवप्रियकाम्यया4.6.14।।
6_9.translation: On hearing this, Sugriva at once entered into the deep cave of the mountain (to get the ornaments and veil) in order to please Rama.
6_9.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, उक्तः having asked, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, ततः then, राघवप्रियकाम्यया to make Rama happy, शैलस्य mountain's, गहनाम् deep, गुहाम् cave, शीघ्रम् at once, प्रविवेश entered

6_10.shloka: उत्तरीयं गृहीत्वा तु शुभान्याभरणानि च।इदं पश्येति रामाय दर्शयामास वानरः4.6.15।।
6_10.translation: That monkey brought out the veil and auspicios ornaments, showed them to Rama and said, 'Please, see.'
6_10.word_by_word: (सः) वानरः that monkey, उत्तरीयम् veil, तानि those, आभरणानि च and ornaments, गृहीत्वा after taking, इदम् this, पश्य see, इति thus, रामाय to Rama, दर्शयामास showed

6_11.shloka: ततो गृहीत्वा वासस्तु श्शुभान्याभरणानि च।अभवद्बाष्पसंरुद्धो नीहारेणेव चन्द्रमाः4.6.16।।
6_11.translation: Holding the raiment  as well as the ornaments,  Rama's  eyes were filled with tears.He appeared like the Moon covered with dews.
6_11.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, वासः raiment, शुभानि auspicious, आभरणानि च ornaments, गृहीत्वा holding, नीहारेण with dew, चन्द्रमाः इव like the Moon, बाष्पसंरुद्धः filled with tears, अब्रवीत् spoke.

6_12.shloka: सीतास्नेहप्रवृत्तेन स तु बाष्पेण दूषितः।हा प्रियेति रुदन्धैर्यमुत्सृज्य न्यपतत्क्षितौ4.6.17।।
6_12.translation: On account of his deep attachment for Sita, he shed profuse tears. Unable to maintain his natural composure, he sank down to the ground, saying 'O my darling Sita' and cried inconsolably
6_12.word_by_word: सः he, तु too, सीतास्नेहप्रवृत्तेन  on account of his deep love for Sita, बाष्पेण with tears, दूषितः affllicted, धैर्यम् patience, उत्सृज्य  failed to maintain, हा प्रियेति Oh darling, रुदन्  crying, क्षितौ on the ground, न्यपतत् fell

6_13.shloka: हृदि कृत्वा तु बहुशस्तमलङ्कारमुत्तमम्।निशश्वास भृशं सर्पो बिलस्थ इव रोषितः।।4.6.18।।
6_13.translation: Pressing the excellent ornaments to his bosom again and again Rama hissed like a cobra provoked in its anthill.
6_13.word_by_word: सः he, उत्तमम् excellent, तम् अलङ्कारम् her ornaments, बहुशः again and again, हृदि on his chest, कृत्वा held, रोषितः in anger (sorrow), बिलस्थः in the hole, सर्पः इव like a snake, भृशम् intensely, निशश्वास sighed

6_14.shloka: अविच्छिन्नाश्रुवेगस्तु सौमित्रिं वीक्ष्य पार्श्वतः।परिदेवयितुं दीनं रामस्समुपचक्रमे4.6.19।।
6_14.translation: Rama began to wail piteously while tears streamed down his eyes incessantly. He looked at Saumitri standing by his side and said:
6_14.word_by_word: रामः Rama, अविच्छिन्नाश्रुवेगः tears streamed incessantly, पार्श्वतः by his side, सौमित्रिम् at Saumitri, विक्ष्य  looking, दीनम् piteously, परिदेवयितुम् to wail, समुपचक्रमे started

6_15.shloka: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेह्या सन्त्यक्तं ह्रियमाणया।उत्तरीयमिदं भूमौ शरीराद्भूषणानि च4.6.20।।
6_15.translation: 'O Lakshmana, behold the veil and the ornaments dropped on the ground by Vaidehi while she was being abducted.
6_15.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, ह्रियमाणया while being abducted, वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, शरीरात् from her body, भूमौ on the ground, सन्त्यक्तम् thrown down, इदम् these, उत्तरीयम् veil, भूषणानि च and ornaments, पश्य see

6_16.shloka: शाद्वलिन्यां ध्रुवं भूमौ सीतया ह्रियमाणया।उत्सृष्टं भूषणमिदं तथारूपं हि दृश्यते4.6.21।।
6_16.translation: 'Sita, for sure, dropped these ornaments on the grassy ground. They are in good shape (without any damage).
6_16.word_by_word: ह्रियमाणया while being carried away, सीतया by Sita, इदम् these, भूषणम् ornaments, शाद्वलिन्याम् on the grassy land, भूमौ on the ground, उत्सृष्टम् dropped down, ध्रुवम् surely, तथारूपम् as before, दृश्यते हि It appears like that

6_17.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।नाहं जानामि केयूरे नाहं जानामि कुण्डले4.6.22।।नूपुरे त्वभिजानामि नित्यं पादाभिवन्दनात्।
6_17.translation: Thus addressed by Rama, Lakshmana replied, 'I recognise neither the armlets nor the earrings. I only recognise the anklets as I used to bow at her feet daily.'
6_17.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having addressed, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, अहम् I am, केयूरे armlets, न जानामि I do not know, कुण्डले earrings, न not, नित्यम् daily, पादाभिवन्दनात् by bowing at her feet, नूपुरे तु only the anklets, अभिजानामि I recognise

6_18.shloka: ततस्तु राघवो वाक्यं सुग्रीवमिदमब्रवीत्4.6.23।।ब्रूहि सुग्रीव कं देशं ह्रियन्ती लक्षिता त्वया।रक्षसा रौद्ररूपेण मम प्राणैः प्रिया प्रिया4.6.24।।
6_18.translation: Then Rama said to Sugriva,.'Tell me, O Sugriva, to which region that fiercelooking demon has carried away my Sita, who is dearer than my life.
6_18.word_by_word: ततः then, राघवः Rama, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, सुग्रीव O Sugriva, मम my, प्राणैः life, प्रिया प्रिया dear one, रौद्ररूपेण by the fiercelooking one, रक्षसा by the demon, कम् which,देशम् place, ह्रियन्ती taken, त्वया by you, लक्षिता is seen, ब्रूहि tell me

6_19.shloka: क्व वा वसति तद्रक्षो महद्व्यसनदं मम।यन्निमित्तमहं सर्वान्नाशयिष्यामि राक्षसान्4.6.25।।
6_19.translation: 'Let me know where dwells that huge  ogre who has caused this agony to me. I will exterminate all the demons
6_19.word_by_word: अहम् I am, यन्निमित्तम् on whose account, सर्वान् all, राक्षसान् demons, नाशयिष्यामि I will exterminate, तत् that, मम my, व्यसनदम् brought agony to me, महत् रक्षः huge demon, क्व वा where does, वसति he lives?

6_20.shloka: हरता मैथिलीं येन मां च रोषयता भृशम्।आत्मनो जीवितान्ताय मृत्युद्वारमपावृतम्4.6.26।।
6_20.translation: 'By abducting Maithili he has stirred my fierce anger and has opened the door of his death.
6_20.word_by_word: मैथिलीम् Maithili, हरता being kidnapped, माम् me, रोषयता च by causing anger, येन by whom, भृशम् profusly, आत्मनः to his self, जीवितान्ताय for his death, मृत्युद्वारम् door of death, अपावृतम् opened

6_21.shloka: मम दयिततरा हृता वनान्ताद्रजनिचरेण विमथ्य येन सा।कथय मम रिपुं तमद्य वैप्लवगपते यमसादनं नयामि4.6.27।।
6_21.translation: 'O lord of monkeys tell me the whereabouts of that nightranger who has carried off my darling from the heart of the forest and has harassed her. I will send him now to the abode of Death.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षष्ठस्सर्गःThus ends the sixth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana,  the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.
6_21.word_by_word: प्लवगपते O lord of monkeys, येन by whom, रजनिचरेण by the mightrangers, मम my, दयिततरा most beloved, सा she, विमथ्य troubled her, वनान्तात् from the forest, हृता stolen, मम my, रिपुम् enemy, तम् him, कथय अद्य tell me now, यमसदनम् abode of lord of death, नयामि carry him

7_1.shloka: [Sugriva promises to kill Ravana and bring Sita back -- he consoles Rama -- Rama promises to kill Vali.]एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो रामेणार्तेन वानरः।अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं सबाष्पं बाष्पगद्गदः।।4.7.1।।
7_1.translation: On hearing the words of Rama in deep distress, the monkey replied to him with folded hands, his throat choked with tears:
7_1.word_by_word: आर्तेन  by the distressed, रामेण by Rama, एवम् that way, उक्तः spoke, वानरः monkey, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, बाष्पगद्गदः voice choked, सबाष्पम् with sears, वाक्यम्  words, अब्रवीत् said

7_2.shloka: न जाने निलयं तस्य सर्वथा पापरक्षसः।सामर्थ्यं विक्रमं वापि दौष्कुलेयस्य वा कुलम्4.7.2।।
7_2.translation: 'I do not have any knowledge of this sinful demon's dwelling , his capability, his valour or his clan or his despicable lineage.
7_2.word_by_word: दौष्कुलेयस्य born in despicable clan, तस्य his, पापरक्षसः of the sinful demon, निलयम् residence, सामर्थ्यम् capacity, विक्रमं वापि or his valour, कुलं वा or even the clan, सर्वथा all that, न जाने not known to me

7_3.shloka: सत्यं ते प्रतिजानामि त्यज शोकमरिन्दम।करिष्यामि तथा यत्नं यथा प्राप्स्यसि मैथिलीम्4.7.3।।
7_3.translation: 'O subduer of enemies, give up sorrow. I promise I will make necessary effort so that you will obtain the princess from Mithila.
7_3.word_by_word: अरिन्दम O subduer of enemies, सत्यम् truth, प्रतिजानामि I promise you, शोकम् sorrow, त्यज give up, मैथिलीम् Maithili, यथा as, प्राप्स्यसि will obtain, तथा that way, यत्नम् effort, करिष्यामि I will make

7_4.shloka: रावणं सगणं हत्वा परितोष्यात्मपौरुषम्।तथाऽस्मि कर्ता न चिराद्यथा प्रीतो भविष्यसि4.7.4।।
7_4.translation: 'With all my capability I will kill Ravana and his clan. Thus I will be able to satisfy you soon with my efforts.
7_4.word_by_word: सगणम् including clan, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after killing, आत्मपौरुषम् my prowess, परितोष्य satisfy, यथा as, प्रीतः pleased, भविष्यसि you will be, तथा that way, न चिरात् very soon, कर्तास्मि I will do

7_5.shloka: अलं वैक्लब्यमालम्ब्य धैर्यमात्मगतं स्मर।त्वद्विधानां न सदृशमीदृशं बुद्धिलाघवम्।।4.7.5।।
7_5.translation: 'Give up despair. It is enough. Be patient. Maintain your natural disposition.It is unworthy of men like you to entertain such frivolus thoughts?
7_5.word_by_word: वैक्लब्यम् despair, आलम्ब्य resorting to, अलम् it is enough, आत्मगतम् your natural disposition, धैर्यम् patience, स्मर pick up, त्वद्विधानाम् for men like you, ईदृशम् such, बुद्धिलाघवम् frivolous thought, न सदृशम् is not worthy

7_6.shloka: मयाऽपि व्यसनं प्राप्तं भार्याविरहजं महत्।नाहमेवं हि शोचामि न च धैर्यं परित्यजे4.7.6।।
7_6.translation: 'Separated from my wife, I, too, am afflicted with deep grief. But I do not brood, I donot lose patience.
7_6.word_by_word: मयापि I am also, भार्याविरहजम् due to separation from my wife, महत् great, व्यसनम् sorrow, प्राप्तम् shared, अहम् I am, एवम् in that way, न not शोचामि I am not brooding, धैर्यं च patience also, न परित्यजे  not given up

7_7.shloka: नाहं तामनुशोचामि प्राकृतो वानरोऽपि सन्।महात्मा च विनीतश्च किं पुनर्धृतिमान्भवान्4.7.7।।
7_7.translation: 'I am an ordinary monkey born. Even then, I do not brood over my wife. You are highsouled, humble and patient. Why do you grieve?
7_7.word_by_word: अहम् I am, प्राकृतः ordinary, वानरोऽपि सन् although a monkey, ताम् her (wife), न अनुशोचामि I do not brood, महात्मा च you are highsouled, विनीतश्च  humble, धृतिमान् endowed with patience, भवान् you, किं पुनः why (grieve) again.

7_8.shloka: बाष्पमापतितं धैर्यान्निग्रहीतुं त्वमर्हसि।मर्यादां सत्त्वयुक्तानां धृतिं नोत्स्रष्टुमर्हसि4.7.8।।
7_8.translation: 'Restrain the flow of your tears. Be  patient. Men (like you) endowed with  equilibrium and dignity and patience ought not to leave their composure.
7_8.word_by_word: त्वम् you, आपतितम् streaming down, बाष्पम् tears, धैर्यात् with patience, निग्रहीतुम् to  restrain,  अर्हसि you ought to, सत्त्वयुक्तानाम् men endowed with equilibrium, मर्यादाम् mark, धृतिम् steadfastness, उत्स्रष्टुम् to deviate from, नार्हसि ought  not

7_9.shloka: व्यसने वाऽर्थकृच्छ्रे वा भये वा जीवितान्तके।विमृशन्वै स्वया बुद्ध्या धृतिमान्नावसीदति4.7.9।।
7_9.translation: 'In times of grief or loss of wealth or at the hour of death, one who is patient does not abandon his wisdom, he does not despair.
7_9.word_by_word: व्यसने वा in grief or, अर्थकृच्छ्रे वा or even over loss of wealth, जीवितान्तके at the hour of death, भये वा or in fear?, धृतिमान् one who is patient, स्वया बुद्ध्या by his own wisdom, विमृशन्  leaving, नावसीदति will not despair

7_10.shloka: बालिशस्तु नरो नित्यं वैक्लब्यं योऽनुवर्तते।स मज्जत्यवशश्शोके भाराक्रान्तेव नौर्जले4.7.10।।
7_10.translation: A man who is unwise and distraught only gets sunk in grief like a heavily loaded boat (sinks) in water.
7_10.word_by_word: यः नरः which man, बालिशः foolish, नित्यम् always, वैक्लब्यम् despair, अनुवर्तते gives in for, सः he, अवशं he loses selfcontrol, भाराक्रान्ता burdened, नौः boat, जले इव as in the water, शोके in grief, मज्जति gets sunk

7_11.shloka: एषोऽञ्जलिर्मया बद्धः प्रणयात्त्वां प्रसादये।पौरुषं श्रय शोकस्य नान्तरं दातुमर्हसि4.7.11।।
7_11.translation: 'I implore you with folded palms on account of our friendship to show manliness. You should not give in to grief.
7_11.word_by_word: मया by me, एषः this, अञ्जलिः folded palms, बद्धः is held, प्रणयात् out of friendship, त्वाम् you, प्रसादये be pleased, पौरुषम् manliness, श्रय you may take resort to, शोकस्य sorrow's, अन्तरम् a chance, दातुम् to give in, नार्हसि you ought not.

7_12.shloka: ये शोकमनुवर्तन्ते न तेषां विद्यते सुखम्।तेजश्च क्षीयते तेषां न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि4.7.12।।
7_12.translation: 'There is no happiness for those who give way to sorrow. Their brilliance is dimmed. Therefore, you ought not grieve.
7_12.word_by_word: ये those, शोकम् grief, अनुवर्तन्ते whoever give way, तेषाम् for them, सुखम् pleasure, न विद्यते is not there, तेषाम् for them, तेजश्च brilliance, क्षीयते is reduced, त्वम् you, शोचितुम् to grieve, नार्हसि ought not

7_13.shloka: शोकेनाभिप्रपन्नस्य जीविते चापि संशयः।स शोकं त्यज राजेन्द्र धैर्यमाश्रय केवलम्4.7.13।।
7_13.translation: 'Even the chances of survival are doubtful for a man who is overpowered by sorrow. Give up sorrow and have patience, O king
7_13.word_by_word: शोकेन by grief, अभिप्रपन्नस्य who is overpowered, जीविते चापि even in life, संशयः doubt, राजेन्द्र O king, सः he, शोकम् sorrow, त्यज give up, केवलम् only, धैर्यम् patience, आश्रय seek shelter

7_14.shloka: हितं वयस्यभावेन ब्रूमि नोपदिशामि ते।वयस्यतां पूजयन्मे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि4.7.14।।
7_14.translation: 'Out of friendly concern I offer my opinion in your interest. I am not competent to advise you. Respecting my friendship, you should never yield to grief.'
7_14.word_by_word: वयस्यतां friendly concern, पूजयन्मे offering you, हितम् ब्रूमि I am speaking, ते to you, नोपदिशामि I do not advise, मे my, वयस्यताम् friendship, पूजयन् honouring, त्वम् you, शोचितुम् to grieve, न अर्हसि you ought not to

7_15.shloka: मधुरं सान्त्वित स्तेन सुग्रीवेण स राघवः।मुखमश्रुपरिक्लिन्नं वस्त्रान्तेन प्रमार्जयत्4.7.15।।
7_15.translation: Consoled by the sweet words of Sugriva, Rama wiped his face filled with tears by the hem of his upper cloth.
7_15.word_by_word: तेन सुग्रीवेण by  Sugriva, मधुरम् sweet, सान्त्वितः comforted, सः राघवः that Rama, अश्रुपरिक्लिन्नम् wet with tears, मुखम् face, वस्त्रान्तेन with the hem of his upper cloth, प्रमार्जयत् wiped

7_16.translation: When lord Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha race was comforted by these words of Sugriva, he came to his senses, and clasping him said:
7_16.word_by_word: प्रभुः Lord , काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha, सुग्रीववचनात् by the words of Sugriva, प्रकृतिस्थः he becamecomposed, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, सम्परिष्वज्य after embracing, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् he spoke

7_17.shloka: कर्तव्यं यद्वयस्येन स्निग्धेन च हितेन च।अनुरूपं च युक्तं च कृतं सुग्रीव तत्त्वया4.7.17।।
7_17.translation: 'O Sugriva you have done what a friend should have done in a befitting manner with your sweet words and good wishes.
7_17.word_by_word: सुग्रीव O Sugriva, स्निग्धेन by a loving, हितेन च and by a wellwisher, वयस्येन by a friend, यत् whatever, कर्तव्यं duty, अनुरूपं suitable, युक्तम् proper, तत् that, त्वया by you, कृतम् done

7_18.shloka: एष च प्रकृतिस्थोऽहमनुनीतस्त्वया सखे।दुर्लभो हीदृशो बन्धुरस्मिन्काले विशेषतः4.7.18।।
7_18.translation: 'O friend you have guided me back to my senses thus. It is difficult to find a friend like you specially at this time.
7_18.word_by_word: सखे O friend, त्वया by you, अनुनीतः counselled by you, एषः अहम् that way I am, प्रकृतिस्थः come back to the senses, ईदृशः such, बन्धुः friend, दुर्लभः हि is difficult to find, अस्मिन् काले this time, विशेषतः specially

7_19.shloka: किं तु यत्नस्त्वया कार्यो मैथिल्याः परिमार्गणे।राक्षसस्य च रौद्रस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः4.7.19।।
7_19.translation: 'Indeed, you must make effort to trace the princess from Mithila and the evilminded,fierce  demon Ravana.
7_19.word_by_word: किं तु but, त्वया by you, मैथिल्याः Maithili's, दुरात्मनः of the evilminded, राक्षसस्य demon's, रौद्रस्य of the fierce, रावणस्य Ravana's, परिमार्गणे in tracing, यत्नः effort, कार्यः do

7_20.shloka: मया च यदनुष्ठेयं विस्रब्धेन तदुच्यताम्।वर्षास्विव च सुक्षेत्रे सर्वं सम्पद्यते तव4.7.20।।
7_20.translation: 'Now tell me about my duty without any hesitation. I assure you that your desire will be fulfilled, just as seeds sown in a fertile land with timely rains bear fruit.
7_20.word_by_word: मया by me, यत् that, अनुष्ठेयम् to be done, तत् that, विस्रब्धेन without any hesitation, उच्यताम् it may be, तव your, सर्वम् everything, वर्षासु in the rainy season, सुक्षेत्रे इव in a fertile land, सम्पद्यते it will produce good results.

7_21.shloka: मया च यदिदं वाक्यमभिमानात्समीरितम्।तत्त्वया हरिशार्दूल तत्त्वमित्युपधार्यताम्4.7.21।।
7_21.translation: 'O tiger amongst monkeys accept my words uttered out of injured honour in their true sense.
7_21.word_by_word: हरिशार्दूल O tiger among monkeys, मया by me too, अभिमानात् out of injured honour, यत् those words, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, समीरितुम् have been uttered, तत् that, त्वया by you, तत्त्वम् इति appropriately, उपधार्यताम् it may be treated so

7_22.shloka: अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे न च वक्ष्ये कदाचन।एतत्ते प्रतिजानामि सत्येनैव च ते शपाम्यहमं।।4.7.22।।
7_22.translation: 'I have never uttered a false word earlier nor will I do it in future. This is my promise. I swear by truth alone.'
7_22.word_by_word: मे by me, अनृतम् lies, न उक्तपूर्वम् never said earlier, कदाचन at any time, न वक्ष्ये च I will not tell also, एतत् this, ते to you, प्रतिजानामि I promise, अहम् I am, सत्येनैव by truth alone, च and, ते शपामि I swear

7_23.shloka: ततः प्रहृष्टस्सुग्रीवो वानरैस्सचिवैस्सह।राघवस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा प्रतिज्ञातं विशेषतः4.7.23।।
7_23.translation: Sugriva and his counsellors felt glad on hearing Rama's words, particularly  the assurance given by him.
7_23.word_by_word: ततः then, सचिवैः with his counsellers, वानरैः सह with monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राघवस्य Raghava's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, विशेषतः specially, प्रतिज्ञातम् his own promise, प्रहृष्टः felt glad

7_24.translation: Man and monkey then met privately and shared the weal and woe of one another.
7_24.word_by_word: ततः then, एवम् that way, एकान्तसम्पृक्तौ meeting in private, तौ both, नरवानरौ a man and a monkey (Rama and Sugriva), उभौ both, अन्योन्यसदृशम् in a mutually befitting manner, सुखदुःखम् joy and sorrow, अभाषताम् spoke to each other

7_25.shloka: महानुभावस्य वचो निशम्यहरिर्नृपाणामृषभस्य तस्य।कृतं स मेने हरिवीरमुख्यस्तदा स्वकार्यं हृदयेन विद्वान्4.7.25।।
7_25.translation: Wise Sugriva, chief of monkeys, heard the words of the magnanimous Rama, a bullamong men. He felt glad at heart thinking that his task has been achieved.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventh sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.
7_25.word_by_word: विद्वान् wise man, सः he, हरिवीरमुख्यः chief of monkeys, हरिः monkey, महानुभावस्य of the magnanimous, तस्य his, नृपाणाम् of kings, रुषभस्य of the bull among men, वचः words, निशम्य after listening, तदा then, कार्यम् task, कृतम् achieved, हृदयेन at heart, मेने he thought

8_1.shloka: [Sugriva feels happy about his friendship with Rama -- solicits Vali's death -- relates to Rama about Vali's hostile attitude and his enmity with him.]परितुष्टस्तु सुग्रीवस्तेन वाक्येन वानरः।लक्ष्मणस्याग्रतो राममिदं वचनमब्रवीत्4.8.1।।
8_1.translation: Sugriva, the monkey was very pleased with Rama's words and said to him in front of Lakshmana:
8_1.word_by_word: वानरः monkey, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तेन वाक्येन by the words, परितुष्टः very pleased, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, अग्रतः in front, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् he spoke.

8_2.shloka: सर्वथाऽहमनुग्राह्यो देवतानां न संशयः।उपपन्न गुणोपेतस्सखा यस्य भवान्मम4.8.2।।
8_2.translation: 'Since one like you endowed with all virtues has become my friend I am (now) worthy of grace of the gods in all respects. There is no doubt.
8_2.word_by_word: उपपन्नः come, गुणोपेतः endowed with all virtues, भवान् yourself, यस्य मम you to me, सखा friend, अहम् I am, सर्वथा in all respects, देवतानाम्  of gods, अनुग्राह्यः worthy of favour, संशयः doubt, न no.

8_3.shloka: शक्यं खलु भवेद्राम सहायेन त्वयाऽनघ।सुरराज्यमपि प्राप्तुं स्वराज्यं किं पनः प्रभो 4.8.3।।
8_3.translation: 'O Rama, my sinless Lord, it is possible to attain even the kingdom of the gods with your help, what  to speak of my own kingdom?
8_3.word_by_word: अनघ sinless, प्रभो O Lord, राम Rama, त्वया by you, सहायेन with help, सुरराज्यमपि even the kingdom of the gods, प्राप्तुम् to attain, शक्यम् possible, स्वराज्यम् my own kingdom, किं पुनः what to speak

8_4.shloka: सोऽहं सभाज्यो बन्धूनां सुहृदां चैव राघव।यस्याग्निसाक्षिकं मित्रं लब्धं राघववंशजम्4.8.4।।
8_4.translation: 'O Rama, since you, born in Raghava dynasty, have become my friend with fire as witness, I have become equally honourable among my relatives and friends.
8_4.word_by_word: राघव Rama, यस्य whose, राघववंशजम् born in Raghava dynasty, मित्रम् friend, अग्निसाक्षिकम्  fire as witness, लब्धम् got, सः अहम् that I, बन्धूनाम्  among relatives, सुहृदां चैव also among friends, सभाज्यः became equally honourable.

8_5.shloka: अहमप्यनुरूपस्ते वयस्यो ज्ञास्यसे शनैः।न तु वक्तुं समर्थोऽहं स्वयमात्मगतान्गुणान्4.8.5।।
8_5.translation: 'You will come to know slowly that I am also a friend worthy of you.It is not proper for me to speak of my qualities( flatter myself).
8_5.word_by_word: अहमपि I am also, ते to you, अनुरूपः worthy, वयस्यः friend, शनैः slowly, ज्ञास्यसे you will know, अहम् I am, इमान् those, आत्मगुणान् my own qualities, स्वयम् myself, वक्तुम् to speak of, समर्थः proper, न not

8_6.shloka: महात्मनां तु भूयिष्ठं त्वद्विधानां कृतात्मनाम्।निश्चला भवति प्रीतिर्धैर्यमात्मवतामिव4.8.6।।
8_6.translation: 'The affection of exalted souls is exceedingly stable like the patience of  selfcontrolled and wellcomposed men like you.
8_6.word_by_word: आत्मवताम् wellcomposed, कृतात्मनाम्  selfcontrolled, त्वद्विधानाम् of men like you, महात्मनाम् of the exalted souls, प्रीतिः affection, भूयिष्ठम् exceedingly, निश्चला stable, भवति will be, धैर्यम् patience.

8_7.shloka: रजतं वा सुवर्णं वा वस्त्राण्याभरणानि च।अविभक्तानि साधूनामवगच्छन्ति साधवः4.8.7।।
8_7.translation: 'Good friends consider(valuables such as) silver or gold, clothes or ornaments of worldly wealth indivisible.
8_7.word_by_word: साधूनाम्  good friends, रजतं वा silver or, सुवर्णं वा gold, वस्त्राणि clothes, आभरणानि च and ornaments, अविभक्तानि not divisible, साधवः men who go in one's way, अवगच्छन्ति will consider.

8_8.shloka: आढ्यो वापि दरिद्रो वा दुःखितस्सुखितोऽपि वा।निर्दोषो वा सदोषो वा वयस्यः परमा गतिः4.8.8।।
8_8.translation: 'Whether rich or poor, afflicted or happy, flawless or guilty, a friend is the ultimate refuge to a friend.
8_8.word_by_word: आढ्यो वापि whether a rich man, दरिद्रो वा or poor, दुःखितः or sad one, सुखितोऽपि वा or a happy man, निर्दोषो flawless one, सदोषः guilty, वयस्यः a friend, परमा ultimate, गतिः refuge.

8_9.shloka: धनत्यागस्सुखत्यागो देहत्यागोऽपि वा पुनः।वयस्यार्थे प्रवर्तन्ते स्नेहं दृष्टवा तथाविधम्4.8.9।।
8_9.translation: 'One will not hesitate to sacrifice wealth or happiness or even life for the sake of a friend like you.'
8_9.word_by_word: स्नेहम् friendship, तथाविधम् that kind, दृष्ट्वा after finding, वयस्यार्थे for the sake of a friend, धनत्यागः to sacrifice wealth, सुखत्यागः to sacrifice happiness, देहत्यागोऽपि वा or sacrifice even life, प्रवर्तन्ते undertake

8_10.translation: As wise Lakshmana, brilliant like Indra stood witness, Rama said, 'it is true as you say' to Sugriva who spoke pleasing words.
8_10.word_by_word: रामः Rama, वासवस्य इव like Indra, धीमतः wise, लक्ष्म्या by signs, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, अग्रतः in the presence of, प्रियवादिनम् pleasant speaker, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, तत् that, तथा it is true, इति thus, अब्रवीत् he spoke.

8_11.shloka: ततो रामं स्थितं दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।सुग्रीवस्सर्वतश्चक्षुर्वने लोलमपातयत्4.8.11।।
8_11.translation: With mighty Rama and Lakshmana standing by, Sugriva cast his eyes eagerly all round the forest.
8_11.word_by_word: ततः then, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, स्थितम् standing, रामम् Rama, महाबलम् strong, लक्ष्मणं च Lakshmana also, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, लोलम् moving unsteadily, चक्षुः his eyes, वने in the forest, सर्वतः all sides, अपातयत् cast.

8_12.translation: Then the chief of monkeys saw a sala tree looking lovely with tender leaves and flowers graced by bees.
8_12.word_by_word: ततः then, सः हरीश्वरः chief of monkeys, अविदूरे not very far, सुपुष्पम् having flowers, ईषत्पत्राढ्यम् with a few leaves, भ्रमरैः by bees, उपशोभितम् looking graceful, सालम् sala tree, ददर्श saw.

8_13.shloka: तस्यैकां पर्णबहुलां भङ्क्त्वा शाखां सुपुष्पिताम्।सालस्यास्तीर्य सुग्रीवो निषसाद सराघवः4.8.13।।
8_13.translation: Sugriva cut a branch of the beautifully blossomed sala tree with plenty of leaves,   spread it (on the ground) and squatted along with Rama.
8_13.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तस्य its, पर्णबहुलाम्  with plenty of leaves, सुशोभिताम् beautifully  blossomed, एकां शाखाम् one branch, भङ्क्त्वा broke, रामस्य for Rama, आस्तीर्य spread, स राघवः with Rama, निषसाद sat.

8_14.shloka: तावासीनौ ततो दृष्ट्वा हनूमानपि लक्ष्मणम्।सालशाखां समुत्पाट्य विनीतमुपवेशयत्4.8.14।।
8_14.translation: Thereafter Hanuman also broke a branch of the sala tree and seated Lakshmana on it.
8_14.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, हनूमानपि Hanuman also, आसीनौ seated, तौ both Rama and Sugriva, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, सालशाखाम् a branch of sala tree, समुत्पाट्य  broke, विनीतम् obedient, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, उपवेशयत् made him sit.

8_15.shloka: सुखोपविष्टं रामं तु प्रसन्नमुदधिं यथा।फलपुष्पसमाकीर्णे तस्मिन् गिरिवरोत्तमे4.8.15।।ततः प्रहृष्टस्सुग्रीवश्लक्ष्णं मधुरया गिरा।उवाच प्रणयाद्रामं हर्षव्याकुलिताक्षरम्4.8.16।।
8_15.translation: Now Rama, seated comfortably on the best of mountains overgrown with trees full of flowers and fruits, appeared tranguil like an ocean. Extremely delighted and excited, Sugriva spoke to Rama words that got mixed up with softness and sweetness out of love:
8_15.word_by_word: ततः then, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, फलपुष्पमाकीर्णे in a place filled with flowers and fruits, तस्मिन् in that, गिरिवरोत्तमे on the best of mountains, सुखोपविष्टम् seated comfortably, प्रसन्नम् peaceful, उदधिं यथा like an ocean, रामम् Rama, श्लक्ष्णम् softly, मधुरया sweetly, गिरा words, हर्षव्याकुलिताक्षरम् mixing up words due to extreme joy and excitement, प्रणयात् out of love, उवाच said.

8_16.shloka: अहं विनिकृतो भ्रात्रा चराम्येष भयार्दितः।ऋष्यमूकं गिरिवरं हृतभार्यस्सुदुःखितः4.8.17।।
8_16.translation: 'I am sadly roaming here in the great Rishyamuka mountain, my wife stolen, offended by my brother and frightened.
8_16.word_by_word: भ्रात्रा  brother, विनिकृतः offended, एषः here I am, अहम् I, भयार्दितः frightened, हृतभार्यः wife stolen, सुदुःखितः very sad, गिरिवरम् great mountain, ऋश्यमूकम् Rishyamuka, चरामि I am roaming .

8_17.shloka: सोऽहं त्रस्तो भये मग्नो वसाम्युद्भ्रान्तचेतनः।वालिना निकृतो भ्रात्रा कृतवैरश्च राघव4.8.18।।
8_17.translation: 'O Rama my brother is my enemy. Deceived and threatened by him, I live in the forest stricken with fear and utterly confused.
8_17.word_by_word: राघव Rama, भ्रात्रा brother, वालिना by Vali, निकृतः deceived, कृतवैरश्च developed enmity, सः अहम् that I am, त्रस्तः terrified, सम्भ्रान्तचेतनः utterly confused, वने in the forest, भये with fear, मग्नः stricken.

8_18.shloka: वालिनो मे भयार्तस्य सर्वलोकाभयङ्कर।ममापि त्वमनाथस्य प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि4.8.19।।
8_18.translation: 'O great warrior who can frighten all the worlds scared of Vali, I feel  helpless like an orphan to whom you ought to extend your grace.'
8_18.word_by_word: सर्वलोकाभयङ्कर O warrior who can threaten people of all worlds, मे to me, वालिनः from Vali, भयार्तस्य of one scared and helpless, अनाथस्य of an orphan, ममापि for me, त्वम् you, प्रसादम् grace, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि ought to.

8_19.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु तेजस्वी धर्मज्ञो धर्मवत्सलः।प्रत्युवाच स काकुत्स्थस्सुग्रीवं प्रहसन्निव4.8.20।।
8_19.translation: Thus spoken to, the glorious Rama, lover of righteousness who knew his duty, replied to Sugriva with a smile on his face:
8_19.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, उक्तः having spoken, तेजस्वी glorious, धर्मज्ञः knower of duty , धर्मवत्सलः a lover of dharma, सः काकुत्स्थः that Kakustha, प्रहसन्निव gentle smile on his face, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, प्रत्युवाच replied

8_20.shloka: उपकारफलं मित्रमपकारोऽरिलक्षणम्।अद्यैव तं हनिष्यामि तव भार्यापहारिणम्4.8.21।।
8_20.translation: 'While a friend is known for his help, an enemy is known for his offensiveness. I will this very day kill the one who wrested your wife.
8_20.word_by_word: मित्रम्ज्ञ a friend, उपकारफलम् carries the fruit of help, अपकारः harm, अरिलक्षणम् an enemy's characteristic feature, तव your, भार्यापहारिणम् wrested your wife, तम् him, अद्यैव this very day, वधिष्यामि I will kill.

8_21.shloka: इमे हि मे महावेगा पत्रिणस्तिग्मतेजसः।कार्तिकेयवनोद्भूताश्शरा हेमविभूषिताः4.8.22।।कङ्कपत्रपरिच्छन्ना महेन्द्राशनिसन्निभाः।सुपर्वाणस्सुतीक्ष्णाग्रास्सरोषा भुजगा इव4.8.23।।
8_21.translation: 'Here are my highspeed, winged arrows glowing like fierce fire, born out of Kartikeya's bed of reeds.They are smooth and welljointed, decked with gold, comparable in strength to great Indra's thunderbolt, very sharp with pointed tips looking like angry serpents.
8_21.word_by_word: महावेगाः of high speed, मे my, पत्रिणः winged ones, इमे these , शराःarrows, तिग्मतेजसः glowing like fierce fire, कार्तिकेयवनोद्भताः born out of Kartikeya's bed of reeds, हेमविभूषिताः decked with gold, कङ्कपत्रपरिच्छन्नाः covered with kanka feathers, महेन्द्राशनिसन्निभाः  comparable to great Indra's thunderbolt, सुपर्वाणः those with smooth joints, सुतीक्ष्णाग्राः  with very sharp and pointed tips, सरोषाः angry, भुजगाः serpents, इव like.

8_22.shloka: भ्रातृसंज्ञममित्रं ते वालिनं कृतकिल्बिषम्।शरैर्विनिहतं पश्य विकीर्णमिव पर्वतम्4.8.24।।
8_22.translation: 'Vali who calls himself your brother is your enemy and a doer of wrong deeds. You will see him crushed, like a mountain shattered, by my arrows.'
8_22.word_by_word: ते your, वालिनम् at Vali, कृतकिल्बिषम् doer of wrong deeds, वालिसंज्ञम् calls Vali's brother, अमित्रम् enemy, शरैः by arrows, विनिहतम् being killed, विकीर्णम् shattered, पर्वतम् इव crushed like a mountain, पश्य you may see.

8_23.shloka: राघवस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवो वाहिनीपतिः।प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे साधु साध्विति चाब्रवीत्4.8.25।।
8_23.translation: On hearing Rama's words, Sugriva, chief of the army of monkeys experienced immeasurable happiness and exclaimed, 'you're great, you're great.'
8_23.word_by_word: वाहिनीपतिः chief of the army (of monkeys), सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राघवस्य Rama's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अतुलम् immeasurable, प्रहर्षम् happiness, लेभे attained, साधु साधु इति good good thus, अब्रवीत् said.

8_24.shloka: राम शोकाभिभूतोऽहं शोकार्तानां भवान्गतिः।वयस्य इति कृत्वा हि त्वय्यहं परिदेवये4.8.26।।
8_24.translation: 'Rama I am overwhelmed with sorrow. You are the refuge of the distressed. As you are a friend I ventilate all my grief to you.
8_24.word_by_word: राम  Rama, अहम् I am, शोकाभिभूतः overcome with sorrow, शोकार्तानाम् for those in sorrow, भवान् you are, गतिः refuge, वयस्यः friend, इति कृत्वा treating you like this, अहम् I am, त्वयि to you, परिदेवये express.

8_25.shloka: त्वं हि पाणिप्रदानेन वयस्यो मेऽग्निसाक्षिकम्।कृतः प्राणैर्बहुमतस्सत्येनापि शपामि ते4.8.27।।
8_25.translation: 'I value your hand of friendship extended to me, with fire as witness more than my very life. I, on my own, offer my pledge of friendship.
