8_25.word_by_word: त्वम् you, पाणिप्रदानेन by offering your hand in friendship, अग्निसाक्षिकम् with fire as witness, कृतः did, प्राणैः more than life, बहुमतः very great, मे वयस्यः हि being my friend, अहम् I am, सत्येन truly, शपामि  vow, ते to you.

8_26.shloka: वयस्य इति कृत्वा च विस्रब्धः प्रवदाम्यहम्।दुःखमन्तर्गतं यन्मे मनो हरति नित्यशः4.8.28।।
8_26.word_by_word: वयस्यः इति कृत्वा च also considering you as a friend, अहम् I am, विस्रब्धः  relaxed , प्रवदामि I am speaking, मे अन्तर्गतम् my feelings, दुःखम् sorrow, नित्यशः always, मनः mind, हरति is tormenting me.

8_27.shloka: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं बाष्पदूषितलोचनः।बाष्पोपहतया वाचा नोच्चैश्शक्नोति भाषितुम्4.8.29।।
8_27.translation: His vision blurred, words choked with tears he was unable to speak further.
8_27.word_by_word: एतावत् till that, वचनम् words, उक्त्वा spoken, बाष्पदूषितलोचनः vision blurred by tears, बाष्पदूषितया choked with tears, वाचा with words, उच्चैः loudly, भाषितुम् to speak further, न शक्नोति was not able to do.

8_28.shloka: बाष्पवेगं तु सहसा नदीवेगमिवागतम्।धारयामास धैर्येण सुग्रीवो रामसन्निधौ4.8.30।।
8_28.translation: Quickly Sugriva controlled his tears streaming fast like the rushing river, with patience, Rama seated in front.
8_28.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, रामसन्निधौ in front of Rama, नदीवेगमिव like a rushing river, सहसा instantaneously, आगतम् flowing, बाष्पवेगम् fast flowing tears, धैर्येण with patience, धारयामास checked

8_29.shloka: सन्निगृह्य तु तं बाष्पं प्रमृज्य नयने शुभे।विनिश्श्वस्य च तेजस्वी राघवं वाक्यमब्रवीत्4.8.31।।
8_29.translation: Effulgent Sugriva controlled his tears, wiped his bright eyes, took deep breath and said to Rama:
8_29.word_by_word: तेजस्वी  brilliant, सः he, तं बाष्पम् his tears, निगृह्य  controlled, शुभे auspicious, नयने eyes, प्रमृज्य wiped, विनिःश्वस्य took deep breath, राघवम् to Rama, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said

8_30.shloka: पुराऽहं वालिना राम राज्यात्स्वादवरोपितः।परुषाणि च संश्राव्य निर्धूतोऽस्मि बलीयसा4.8.32।।
8_30.translation: 'O Rama I was subjected to the harsh words of powerful Vali in the past when he uprooted me from  the kingdom and threw me out.
8_30.word_by_word: राम O Rama, पुरा in the past, अहम् I, बलीयसा powerful, वालिना by Vali, स्वात् from my  own, राज्यात् from the kingdom, अवरोपितः was uprooted, परुषाणि harsh (words), संश्राव्य making me listen, निर्धूतः thrown out, अस्मि I am.

8_31.shloka: हृता भार्या च मे तेन प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसी।सुहृदश्च मदीया ये संयता बन्धनेषु ते4.8.33।।
8_31.translation: 'I was robbed of my wife who is dearer than my own life. All my friends were rounded up and imprisoned.
8_31.word_by_word: तेन by him, प्राणेभ्योऽपि than my own life, गरीयसी dearer, मे भार्या my wife, हृता robbed, मदीयाः my, ये whoever, सुहृदः friends, ते they, बन्धनेषु under arrest, संयताः imprisoned.

8_32.shloka: यत्नवांश्च सुदुष्टात्मा मद्विनाशाय राघव।बहुशस्तत्प्रयुक्ताश्च वानरा निहता मया4.8.34।।
8_32.translation: 'O Rama this evilminded one made several attempts to kill me. The monkeys he sent to kill me were themselves killed.
8_32.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, दुष्टात्मा evilminded, सः he was, मद्विनाशाय to kill me, यत्नवांश्च made effort, बहुशः in many ways, तत्प्रयुक्ताः  sent by him, वानराः monkeys, मया by myself, निहताः were killed.

8_33.shloka: शङ्कया त्वेतया चेह दृष्ट्वा त्वामपि राघव।नोपसर्पाम्यहं भीतो भये सर्वे हि बिभ्यति4.8.35।।
8_33.translation: 'It is because of suspicion that I did not approach you. Every one is scared when there is ample reason to fear.
8_33.word_by_word: राघव Rama, अहं च I also, एतया by that, शङ्कया with doubt, त्वाम् अपि you also, इह here, दृष्ट्वा seeing, भीतः scared, नोपसर्पामि I did not come near, भये out of fear, सर्वे all, बिभ्यति हि one is scared.

8_34.shloka: केवलं हि सहाया मे हनुमत्प्रमुखास्त्विमे।अतोऽहं धारयाम्यद्य प्राणान् कृच्छ्रगतोऽपि सन्4.8.36।।
8_34.translation: 'Only Hanuman and other chiefs are helping me. Therefore, I am surviving in spite of all difficulties.
8_34.word_by_word: केवलम् only, इमे these, हनुमत्प्रमुखाः Hanuman and other chiefs, मे to me, सहायाः helpfulones, अतः therefore, अहम् I, कृच्छ्रगतोऽपि सन् in spite of all difficulties, अद्य now, प्राणान् life, धारयामि I am surviving.

8_35.shloka: एते हि कपयस्स्निग्धा मां रक्षन्ति समन्ततः।सह गच्छन्ति गन्तव्ये नित्यं तिष्ठन्ति च स्थिते4.8.37।।
8_35.translation: 'These monkeys out of love for me keep me protected from all sides. They go out with me when it is necessary and stay back whenever I stop (in order to guard me).
8_35.word_by_word: स्निग्धाः affectionate, एते these, कपयः monkeys, माम् me, समन्ततः on all sides, रक्षन्ति protecting, गन्तव्ये  have to go, सह with any one, गच्छन्ति they go, स्थितौ stay when I stay, तिष्ठन्ति च stop.

8_36.shloka: सङ्क्षेपस्त्वेष मे राम किमुक्त्वा विस्तरं हि ते।स मे ज्येष्ठो रिपुर्भ्राता वाली विश्रुतपौरुषः4.8.38।।
8_36.translation: 'O Rama I tell you (my story) briefly. It is not necessary to go into details. My elder brother Vali, who is known for his prowess, is my enemy.
8_36.word_by_word: राम O Rama, एषः this, मे my, सङ्क्षेपः in brief, ते to you, विस्तरम् in detail, उक्त्वा telling, किम् why, मे my, भ्राता brother, विश्रुतपौरुषः a man of wellknown prowess, सः वाली that Vali, रिपुः enemy.

8_37.shloka: तद्विनाशाद्धि मे दुःखं प्रणष्टं स्यादनन्तरम्।सुखं मे जीवितं चैव तद्विनाशनिबन्धनम्4.8.39।।
8_37.translation: 'My sorrow will go only with his death. My happiness and my life are also subject to his destruction.
8_37.word_by_word: तद्विनाशाद्धि only after he is killed, अनन्तरम् thereafter, मे my, दुःखम् sorrow, प्रणष्टम् can vanish, स्यात् will be, मे my, सुखम् happiness, जीवितं चैव and life also, तद्विनाशनिबन्धनम् is subject to his destruction.

8_38.shloka: एष मे राम शोकान्तश्शोकार्तेन निवेदितः।दुःखितस्सुखितो वापि सख्युर्नित्यं सखा गतिः4.8.40।।
8_38.translation: 'This what I had to tell you out of sorrow. This is how my sorrow will end. In joy and in sorrow your friend is your refuge.
8_38.word_by_word: राम Rama, शोकार्तेन out of sorrow, मे my, एषः this, शोकान्तः end the sorrow, निवेदितः  explained to you, सख्युः for a friend, दुःखितः unhappy, सुखितो वापि or happy, सखा a friend, गतिः is the only refuge.

8_39.translation: After hearing  Sugriva, Rama said 'I wish to know the actual cause of this enmity.
8_39.word_by_word: रामः Rama, एतत् these, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् he spoke, किं निमित्तम् for what reason, वैरम् enmity, अभूत् was caused, तत्त्वतः truly, श्रोतुम् to hear, इच्छामि I wish

8_40.shloka: सुखं हि कारणं श्रुत्वा वैरस्य तव वानर।अनन्तरं विधास्यामि सम्प्रधार्य बलाबलम्4.8.42।।
8_40.translation: 'On hearing the cause of your enmity and considering your strength and weakness, I will take steps to make you happy.
8_40.word_by_word: वानर O monkey, तव your, वैरस्य enmity's, कारणम् cause, श्रुत्वा after hearing, बलाबलम् strength or weakness, सम्प्रधार्य after measuring, आनन्तर्यात् thereafter, सुखम् विधास्यामि I will take action to make you happy.

8_41.shloka: बलवान् हि ममामर्षश्श्रुत्वा त्वामवमानितम्।वर्तते हृदयोत्कम्पी प्रावृड्वेग इवाम्भसः4.8.43।।
8_41.translation: 'On hearing about your humiliation I feel highly agitated at heart. I feel very much angry and restless like the water in rainy season.
8_41.word_by_word: त्वाम् your, अवमानितम् insulted, श्रुत्वा after hearing, मम my, हृदयोत्कम्पी heart is agitated, बलवान् strong, आमर्षः restless, अम्भसः rain water, प्रापृड्वेग इव  enraged , वर्तते feels

8_42.shloka: हृष्टः कथय विस्रब्धो यावदारोप्यते धनुः।सृष्टश्च हि मया बाणो निरस्तश्च रिपुस्तव4.8.44।।
8_42.translation: 'Tell me freely and cheerfully before I string the bow. Your enemy will be destroyed as soon as I release my arrow.'
8_42.word_by_word: मया by me, धनुः bow, यावत् until, आरोप्यते is strung, बाणः arrow, सृष्टश्च on the release, तव your, रिपुः enemy, निरस्तश्च will be destroyed, हृष्टः happily, विस्रब्धः freely, कथय speak.

8_43.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवः काकुत्स्थेन महात्मना।प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे चतुर्भिस्सह वानरैः4.8.45।।
8_43.translation: When the great Rama said this, Sugriva with all the four monkeys felt immeasurably glad.
8_43.word_by_word: महात्मना by the great, काकुत्स्थेन by Rama, एवम् that way, उक्तः having been told, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, चतुर्भिः with all the four, वानरैः सह with monkeys, अतुलम् immeasurable, प्रहर्षम् joy, लेभे felt.

8_44.translation: With a smile on his face, Sugriva started narrating to Lakshmana's elder brother the facts about the cause of his enmity (with Vali).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टमस्सर्गःThus ends the eighth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
8_44.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रहृष्टवदनः  smiling face, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, वैरस्य on account of enmity, कारणम् cause, तत्त्वम् facts, लक्ष्मणाग्रजे to the elder brother of Lakshmana, आख्यातुम् to tell, उपचक्रमे started.

9_1.shloka: [Episode of Vali's fight with Mayavi -- installation of Sugriva as king of Kishkinda -- return of Vali to Kishkinda.]वाली नाम मम भ्राता ज्येष्ठश्शत्रुनिषूदनः।पितुर्बहुमतो नित्यं ममापि च तथा पुरा4.9.1।।
9_1.translation: 'My elder brother called Vali, capable of exterminating enemies was always highly regarded by my father and me.
9_1.word_by_word: शत्रुनिषूदनः an exterminater of enemies, वाली नाम called Vali , मम my, ज्येष्ठः भ्राता elder brother, नित्यम् always, पितुः father, बहुमतः very highly regarded, पुरा earlier, मम चापि even me also, तथा that way.

9_2.shloka: पितर्युपरतेऽस्माकं ज्येष्ठोऽयमिति मन्त्रिभिः।कपीनामीश्वरो राज्ये कृतः परमसम्मतः4.9.2।।
9_2.word_by_word: तस्मिन् he, पितरि my father, उपरते demise, अयम् this, ज्येष्ठः इति being  elder, राज्ये in the kingdom, परमसम्मतः with the acceptance of all, कपीनाम् ईश्वरः king of monkeys, मन्त्रिभिः including ministers, कृतः made.

9_3.shloka: राज्यं प्रशासतस्तस्य पितृपैतामहं महत्।अहं सर्वेषु कालेषु प्रणतः प्रेष्यवत् स्थितः4.9.3।।
9_3.translation: 'I served him obediently like a servant while he ruled over the great  ancestral kingdom inherited by him.
9_3.word_by_word: अहम् I, महत् great, पितृपैतामहम् inherited from ancestors, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रशासतः while he was ruling, तस्य his, सर्वेषु कालेषु at all times, प्रेष्यवत् like a servant, प्रणतः an obedient one, स्थितः remained.

9_4.shloka: मायावी नाम तेजस्वी पूर्वजो दुन्दुभेः सुतः।तेन तस्य महद्वैरं स्त्रीकृतं विश्श्रुतं पुरा4.9.4।।
9_4.translation: 'Dundubhi's eldest son Mayabi was a mighty demon. He developed bitter enmity with Vali for the sake of a woman.
9_4.word_by_word: दुन्दभेः Dundubhi's, पूर्वजः elder, सुतः son, मायावी Mayavi, तेजस्वी a  mighty one, पुरा in the past, तस्य विश्श्रुतं wellknown about him, तेन by him, स्त्रीकृतम् for the sake of a woman, महत् bitter, वैरम् enmity.

9_5.shloka: स तु सुप्तजने रात्रौ किष्किन्धाद्वारमागतः।नर्दति स्म सुसंरब्धो वालिनं चाह्वयद्रणे4.9.5।।
9_5.translation: 'One midnight when all were asleep, he (Mayabi) came to the entrance of Kishkinda screaming angrily and bellowing at Vali, challenging him to a duel.
9_5.word_by_word: रात्रौ at night, जने people, सुप्ते were asleep, सः he, किष्किन्धाद्वारम् entrance of Kishkindha, आगतः came, सुसंरब्धः an agitated one, नर्दति स्म bellowing, वालिनम् Vali, रणे for war, आह्वयत् challenging.

9_6.shloka: प्रसुप्तस्तु मम भ्राता नर्दितं भैरवस्वनम्।श्रुत्वा न ममृषे वाली निष्पपात जवात्तदा4.9.6।।
9_6.translation: ' My brother Vali, who was asleep could not tolerate the frightful sound and jumpedout of bed hastily.
9_6.word_by_word: तदा  then, प्रसुप्त was sleeping, मम भ्राता my brother, वाली Vali, नर्दतः shouting, भैरवस्वनम् frightful sound, श्रुत्वा after hearing, न ममृषे  did not tolerate, जवात् hastily, निष्पपात jumped out.

9_7.shloka: स तु वै निस्सृतः क्रोधात्तं हन्तुमसुरोत्तमम्।वार्यमाणस्तत स्त्रीभिर्मया च प्रणतात्मना4.9.7।।
9_7.translation: 'Enraged, he came out to kill the powerful demon even though I with the womenfolk (of the harem) tried to prevent him.
9_7.word_by_word: ततः then, सः he, स्त्रीभिः by women, प्रणतात्मना by an obedient one, मया च and by me too, निवार्यमाणः  was prevented, तम् him, असुरोत्तमम् powerful demon, हन्तुम् to kill, क्रोधात् angrily, निःसृतः came out.

9_8.shloka: स तु निर्धूय ताः सर्वा निर्जगाम महाबलः।ततोऽहमपि सौहार्दान्निस्सृतो वालिना सह4.9.8।।
9_8.translation: 'That mighty warrior(Vali) came out, pushing aside all the womenfolk. I too followed  him due to my affection towards him.
9_8.word_by_word: महाबलः powerful, स तु he too, ताः सर्वाः all the women, निर्धूय pushing aside, निर्जगाम went, ततः then, अहमपि I too, सौहार्दात् out of love, वालिना सह accompanied Vali, निःसृतः came out (to support him).

9_9.shloka: स तु मे भ्रातरं दृष्ट्वा मां च दूरादवस्थितम्।असुरो जातसन्त्रासः प्रदुद्राव ततो भृशम्4.9.9।।
9_9.translation: 'On seeing my brother and me from a distance, the demon took to his heels scared.
9_9.word_by_word: सः he, असुरः तु demon also, मे भ्रातरम् my brother, दूरात् from a distance, अवस्थितम् took my stand, मां च and us, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तदा then, भृशम् very much, जातसन्त्रासः felt scared, प्रदुद्राव ran

9_10.shloka: तस्मिन् द्रवति सन्त्रस्ते ह्यावां द्रुततरं गतौ।प्रकाशश्च कृतो मार्गश्चन्द्रेणोद्गच्छता तदा4.9.10।।
9_10.translation: 'Frightened, he ran. We too chased him running faster. As the Moon was rising the path was welllit.
9_10.word_by_word: सन्त्रस्ते when frightened, तस्मिन् him, द्रवति while running, आवाम् we also, द्रुततरम् faster, गतौ both went, तदा then, उद्गच्छता while rising, चन्द्रेण by the Moon, मार्गः the path, प्रकाशश्च was welllit, कृतः made.

9_11.shloka: स तृणैरावृतं दुर्गं धरण्या विवरं महत्।प्रविवेशासुरो वेगादावामासाद्य विष्ठितौ4.9.11।।
9_11.translation: 'The demon entered into a hole (cave) covered with a heap of grass, difficult, therefore, of access. Both of us reached there and took position.
9_11.word_by_word: सः असुरः that demon, धरण्याः on earth, दुर्गम् difficult passage, तृणैः by heaps of grass, आवृतम् covered, महत् great, विवरम् a hole, प्रविवेश entered, आवाम् both of us, आसाद्य reaching, विष्ठितौ we took position

9_12.shloka: तं प्रविष्टं रिपुं दृष्ट्वा बिलं रोषवशं गतः।मामुवाच तदा वाली वचनं क्षुभितेन्द्रियः4.9.12।।
9_12.translation: 'Seeing the enemy entering the cave, Vali became wrathful and his senses were terribly disturbed.He said to me:
9_12.word_by_word: तदा then, बिलम् hole, प्रविष्टम् entered, तं रिपुम् that enemy, दृष्ट्वा seeing, वाली Vali, रोषवशम् angry, गतः went, क्षुभितेन्द्रियः senses stirred, माम् to me, उवाच said.

9_13.shloka: इह त्वं तिष्ठ सुग्रीव बिलद्वारि समाहितः।यावत्तत्र प्रविश्याहं निहन्मि सहसा रिपुम्4.9.13।।
9_13.translation: 'O Sugriva wait here at the entrance of the cave and be on your alert until I enter this hole and kill the enemy'.
9_13.word_by_word: सुग्रीव O Sugriva, अहम् I, तत्र there, प्रविश्य after entering, सहसा at once, रिपुम् the enemy, यावत् निहन्मि till I kill, समाहितः being alert, अद्य now, इह here, बिलद्वारि at the hole, तिष्ठ you wait, त्वम् yourself.

9_14.shloka: मया त्वेतद्वचश्श्रुत्वा याचितस्स परन्तपः।शापयित्वा तु मां पद्भ्यां प्रविवेश बिलं महत्4.9.14।।
9_14.translation: 'On hearing him, I begged the scorcher of enemies (Vali) that I would follow him, but he made me swear on his feet and entered the cave.
9_14.word_by_word: एतत् this, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, मया me, याचितः begged, परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, सः he, माम् me, पद्भ्याम् on his feet, शापयित्वा made me swear, महत् great, बिलम् cave, प्रविवेश entered.

9_15.shloka: तस्य प्रविष्टस्य बिलं साग्रस्संवत्सरो गतः।स्थितस्य मम बिलद्वारि स कालो व्यत्यवर्तत4.9.15।।
9_15.word_by_word: बिलम् cave, प्रविष्टस्य  him who entered, तस्य for him, साग्रः well over, संवत्सरज्ञ a year, गतः had passed, बिलद्वारि at the entrance of the cave, स्थितस्य was waiting, सः कालः all that year, व्यत्यवर्तत passed by.

9_16.shloka: अहं तु नष्टं ज्ञात्वा तं स्नेहादागतसम्भ्रमः।भ्रातरं न च पश्यामि पापाशङ्कि च मे मनः4.9.16।।
9_16.translation: 'Thinking him dead, I became agitated because of my love for him. My mind began to apprehend his death since I had not seen my brother for long.
9_16.word_by_word: अहं तु I also, तम् him, नष्टम् dead, ज्ञात्वा after knowing, स्नेहात् due to love, आगत संभ्रमःbecame agitated, भ्रातरम् brother, न पश्यामि I have not seen, मे my, मनः mind, पापाशङ्कि च suspected.

9_17.shloka: अथ दीर्घस्य कालस्य बिलात्तस्माद्विनिस्सृतम्।सफेनं रुधिरं रक्तमहं दृष्ट्वा सुदुःखितः।।4.9.17।।
9_17.word_by_word: अथ then, दीर्घस्य कालस्य after a long time, तस्मात् from that, बिलात् from the cave, विनिःसृतम् flowing down, सफेनम् along with foam, रुधिरम् blood, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, ततः then, अहम् I, भृशदुःखितः became very sad.

9_18.shloka: नर्दतामसुराणां च ध्वनिर्मे श्रोत्रमागतः।निरस्तस्य च सङ्ग्रामे क्रोशतोनिस्स्वनो गुरोः4.9.18।।
9_18.translation: 'I heard the roaring voices of the demons and not the yelling of my brother engaged in the duel.
9_18.word_by_word: नर्दताम्  roaring voices, असुराणाम् of the demon, ध्वनिः sound, मे to me, श्रोत्रम् to the ear, आगतः came to, सङ्ग्रामे in war, रतस्त engaged, क्रोशतो वापि or not of a shouting, गुरोः of my brother, निस्स्वनः voice.

9_19.shloka: अहं त्ववगतो बुद्ध्या चिह्नैस्तैर्भ्रातरं हतम्।पिधाय च बिलद्वारं शिलया गिरिमात्रया4.9.19।।शोकार्तश्चोदकं कृत्वा किष्किन्धामागतस्सखे।गूहमानस्य मे तत्त्वं यत्नतो मन्त्रिभिश्श्रुतम्4.9.20।।
9_19.translation: 'O friend by those signs I understood that my brother was killed and concluding that way I blocked the entrance of the cave with a rock of the size of a mountain and offered oblations to my brother and came to Kishkinda. I intended to hide the fact of Vali's death. But the ministers came to know the truth with their efforts.
9_19.word_by_word: सखे O friend, अहं तु I also, तैः by those, चिह्नैः by the signs, भ्रातरम् my brother, हतम्  killed, बुद्ध्या with my understanding, अवगतः  came to know, गिरिमात्रया of the size of a mountain, शिलया with a rock, बिलद्वारम् the entrance of the mountain, पिधाय blocking, च and, शोकार्तः immersed in sorrow, उदकं कृत्वा offering oblations, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkindha, आगतः came, मे  me, गूहमानस्य intending to hide the fact, मन्त्रिभिः by the ministers, तत्त्वम् truth, यत्नतः  efforts, श्रुतम् heard.

9_20.shloka: ततोऽहं तैस्समागम्य सम्मतैरभिषेचितः।राज्यं प्रशासतस्तस्य न्यायतो मम राघव4.9.21।।आजगाम रिपुं हत्वा वाली तमसुरोत्तमम्।।
9_20.translation: 'Then all the ministers assembled together and consecrated me. While I was ruling the kingdom lawfully, Vali, the monkey came back after killing the enemy demon.
9_20.word_by_word: ततः then, समेतैः by those coming together, तैः by them, समागम्य having assembled, अहम् I, अभिषेचितः I was consecrated, राघव O Rama, तस्य मम to me (in such a condition), राज्यम् kingdom, न्यायतः lawfully, प्रशासतः while I was ruling, सः वानरः that monkey, रिपुम् enemy, दानवम् demon, हत्वा after killing, आजगाम came back.

9_21.shloka: अभिषिक्तं तु मां दृष्ट्वा वाली संरक्तलोचनः।मदीयान्मन्त्रिणो बद्ध्वा परुषं वाक्यमब्रवीत्4.9.22।।
9_21.translation: 'Seeing me on the throne, Vali became angry and his eyes turned red. He imprisonedmy ministers and spoke to me harshly.
9_21.word_by_word: अभिषिक्तम् consecrated, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, कोपात् angrily, संरक्तलोचनः with his eyes turned red, मदीयान् those belonging to me, मन्त्रिणः at the ministers, बद्ध्वा after imprisoning, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

9_22.shloka: निग्रहेऽपि समर्थस्य तं पापं प्रति राघव।न प्रावर्तत मे बुद्धिर्भ्रातुर्गौरवयन्त्रिता4.9.23।।
9_22.translation: 'O Rama even though I was capable of restraining the sinner, my intellect did not let me do so out of respect for my brother.
9_22.word_by_word: राघव Rama, निग्रहे in resistance, अपि also, समर्थस्य of a capable one, मे my, बुद्धि: intellect, भ्रातृगौरवयन्त्रिता controlled by my respect for my brother, तं पापं प्रति towards that sinner, न प्रावर्तत did not advance.

9_23.shloka: हत्वा शत्रुं स मे भ्राता प्रविवेश पुरं तदा4.9.24।।मानयंस्तं महात्मानं यथावच्चाभ्यवादयम्।उक्ताश्च नाशिषस्तेन सन्तुष्टेनान्तरात्मना4.9.25।।
9_23.translation: 'When my brother came back to the town after killing the enemy, I offered as usual my salutations to him. But he did not bless me wholeheartedly.
9_23.word_by_word: मे भ्राता my brother, सः he, शत्रुम् enemy, हत्वा after killing, तदा then, पुरम् town, प्रविवेश he entered, महात्मानम् great man, तम् him, मानयन् while I respected, यथावत् as usual, अभ्यवादयम् I offered salutations, तेन by him, सन्तुष्टेन  gladly, अन्तरात्मना wholeheartedly, आशिषः blessings, नोक्ताः were not pronounced.

9_24.shloka: नत्वा पादावहं तस्य मकुटेनास्पृशं प्रभोअपि वाली मम क्रोधान्न प्रसादं चकार सः4.9.26।।
9_24.translation: 'O lord I bowed at his feet with my crown in total submission. Even then Vali was not pleased a bit.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे नवमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
9_24.word_by_word: प्रभो O Lord, अहम् I, नत्वा bowing, तस्य पादौ at his feet, मकुटेन with my crown, अस्पृशम् I touched, अपि even then, सः वाली that Vali, क्रोधात् angrily, मम my, प्रसादम् pleasure, न चकार not accepted.

10_1.shloka: [Sugriva narrates to Rama the reasons for his hostility with Vali and banishment from the kingdom.]ततः क्रोधसमाविष्टं सम्रब्धं तमुपागतम्।अहं प्रसादयाञ्चक्रे भ्रातरं प्रियकाम्यया4.10.1
10_1.translation: 'I sought to appease my brother who arrived in an agitated state overpowered with anger.
10_1.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, क्रोधसमाविष्टम्  overpowered with anger, सम्रब्धम् agitated, उपागतम्  arrived, तं भ्रातरम् brother, प्रियकाम्यया to pacify, प्रसादयाञ्चक्रे I appeased.

10_2.shloka: दिष्ट्यासि कुशली प्राप्तो निहतश्च त्वया रिपुः।अनाथस्य हि मे नाथस्त्वमेकोऽनाथनन्दनः4.10.2।।
10_2.translation: 'By providence you have come back safe and the enemy has been killed. You are the only protector to an orphan which I am.
10_2.word_by_word: अनाथनन्दन  compassionate to orphans, दिष्ट्या providence, त्वया by you, रिपुः enemy, निहतः is killed, कुशली safely, प्राप्तः असि have returned, अनाथस्य  to the orphan, मे  me, त्वम् you, एकः alone, नाथः are the saviour.

10_3.shloka: इदं बहुशलाकं ते पूर्णचन्द्रमिवोदितम्।छत्रं सवालव्यजनं प्रतीच्छस्व मया धृतम्4.10.3।।
10_3.translation: 'Here is the manyribbed parasol shining like the full Moon above the horizon and the yak's tailfan held by me.Pray accept it.
10_3.word_by_word: ते to you, मया by me, धृतम् held, बहुशलाकम् having many ribs, उदितम् risen above, पूर्णचन्द्रमिव like the full Moon, सवालव्यजनम् Yak tailfans, इदम् this, छत्रम् parasol, प्रतीच्छस्व pray accept.

10_4.shloka: आर्तश्चाथ बिलद्वारि स्थितस्संवत्सरं नृप।दृष्ट्वाऽहं शोणितं द्वारि बिलाच्चापि समुत्थितम्4.10.4।।शोकसंविग्नहृदयो भृशं व्याकुलितेन्द्रियः।अपिधाय बिलद्वारं शैलशृङ्गेण तत्तथा4.10.5।।तस्माद्देशादपाक्रम्य किष्किन्धां प्राविशं पुनः।
10_4.translation: 'O king I waited at the entrance of the cave for a year. As you did not come out, I felt distressed and my heart sank in great sorrow seeing blood flowing out of the cave. With my senses fused I returned to Kishkinda, closing the entrance with a rock(lest the demon should come out).
10_4.word_by_word: नृप O king, आर्तः distressed, संवत्सरम् one year, बिलद्वारि at the entrance of the cave, स्थितः waited, अथ and then, बिलात् from the cave, समुत्थितम् flowing out, शोणितम् blood, द्वारि at the entrance, दृष्ट्वा च and seeing, शोकसंविग्नह्रुदयः with a sunken heart, भृशम् greatly, व्याकुलितेन्द्रियः senses fused, तदा then, तत् that, बिलद्वारम् entrance of the cave, शैलशृङ्गेण with a rock, अपिधाय closed, तस्मात् from  that place, देशात् kingdom, अपक्रम्य retreated, पुनः again, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkinda, प्राविशम् entered.

10_5.shloka: विषादात्विह मां दृष्ट्वा पौरैर्मन्त्रिभिरेव च4.10.6।।अभिषिक्तो न कामेन तन्मेत्वं क्षन्तुमर्हसि।
10_5.translation: 'Here I was consecrated by the people and ministers who saw me immersed in grief. It was not my desire to be coronated. Therefore, I may be forgiven.
10_5.word_by_word: विषादात् due to grief, इह here, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, पौरैः by the people, मन्त्रिभिरेव च and by the ministers also, अभिषिक्तः  consecrated, कामेन by desire, न not, त्वम् you, मे my, तत् that, क्षन्तुम् to excuse, अर्हसि ought to.

10_6.shloka: त्वमेव राजा मानार्हस्सदा चाहं यथा पुरम्4.10.7।।राजभावनियोगोऽयं मम त्वद्विरहात्कृतः।सामात्यपौरनगरं स्थितं निहतकण्टकम्4.10.8।।
10_6.translation: 'You alone are the king and worthy of reverence.I will be the same old brother carrying out my work as earlier. I held the responsibility of the state in your absence forced by the citizens and ministers. The kingdom has been kept stable with the enemies destroyed.
10_6.word_by_word: मानार्हः worthy of reverence, राजा the king, त्वमेव you alone are, अहं च I also, पुरा यथा like  in earlier times, मम to me, अयम् this, राजभावे held the state, नियोगः an assignment, त्वद्विरहात् due to your absence, कृतः held, सामात्यपौरनगरम् with ministers, citizens and towns, निहतकण्टकम् with the enemies destroyed, स्थितम् is stable.

10_7.shloka: न्यासभूतमिदं राज्यं तव निर्यातयाम्यहम्।मा च रोषं कृथास्सौम्य मयि शत्रुनिबर्हण4.10.9।।
10_7.translation: 'I am handing over this kingdom which was in trust. O slayer of enemies, O good natured one, give up your anger against me.
10_7.word_by_word: न्यासभूतम् was in trust, इदं राज्यम् this kingdom, अहम् I am, तव to you, निर्यातयामि I am returning, शत्रुनिबर्हण a slayer of enemies, सौम्य goodnatured, मम at me, रोषम् anger, मा कृथाः to give up

10_8.shloka: याचे त्वां शिरसा राजन्मया बद्धोऽयमञ्जलिः।बलादस्मिन् समागम्य मन्त्रिभिः पुरवासिभिः4.10.10।।राजभावे नियुक्तोऽहं शून्यदेशजिगीषया।
10_8.translation: 'O king I bow my head and beg you with folded hands. The ministers and citizens assembled and forced me to take charge, as the kingdom without a ruler was vulnerable to attack.'
10_8.word_by_word: राजन् O king, शिरसा head bent, त्वाम् you, याचे I beg you, मया by myself, अयम् this, अञ्जलिः folded palms, बद्धः bound, मन्त्रिभिः by ministers, पुरवासिभिः by citizens, समागम्य havingassembled, अहम् I, शून्यदेशजिगीषया kingdom without a king can be conquered, अस्मिन् in this, राजभावे as king, बलात् with pressure, नियुक्तः assigned.

10_9.shloka: स्निग्धमेवं ब्रुवाणं मां स तु निर्भर्त्स्य वानरः4.10.11।।धिक्त्वामिति च मा मुक्त्वा बहु तत्तदुवाच ह।
10_9.translation: 'Even tnough I spoke to him with affection, Vali abused me in many words, saying, 'Fie on you'.
10_9.word_by_word: सः वानरः that monkey, एवम् thus, स्निग्धम् affectionately, ब्रुवाणम् speaking, माम् me, निर्भर्त्स्य having abused, त्वाम् you are, धिक् reproached, इति च this way, उक्त्वा after saying, तत्तत् in various ways, बहु many (words), उवाच ह spoke

10_10.shloka: प्रकृतीश्च समानीय मुन्त्रिणश्चैव सम्मतान्4.10.12।।मामाह सुहृदां मध्ये वाक्यं परमगर्हितम्।
10_10.translation: 'Having invited ordinary people and favourite ministers he condemned me in the presence of friends.
10_10.word_by_word: प्रकृतीश्चैव ordinary people, सम्मतान् whom he liked, मन्त्रिण श्चैव and ministers, समानीय having invited, सुहृदाम् of friends, मध्ये in the midst, माम् me, परमगर्हितम् contemptuous, वाक्यम् words, आह he spoke

10_11.shloka: विदितं वो यथा रात्रौ मायावी स महासुरः4.10.13।।मां समाह्वयत क्रूरो युद्धाकाङ्क्षी सुदुर्मतिः।
10_11.translation: 'You know very well how that wicked demon, Mayabi, that night challenged me angrily to a duel.
10_11.word_by_word: सुदुर्मतिः wickedminded one, महासुरः great demon, मायावी Mayavi, क्रुद्धः angry one, युद्धाकाङ्क्षी wishing to tight, यथा as, रात्रौ In that night, माम् me, समाह्वयत challenged, वः toyou, विदितं is known.

10_12.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा निस्सृतोऽहं नृपालयात्4.10.14।।अनुयातश्च मां तूर्णमयं भ्राता सुदारुणः।
10_12.translation: 'On hearing his words I came out of the royal abode quickly, followed by this wicked brother.
10_12.word_by_word: तस्य his, तत् that, वचनम् words , श्रुत्वा after hearing, अहम् I, नृपालयात् from the royal abode, निःसृतः I came out, सुदारुणः terrific, अयम् this, भ्राता brother, तूर्णम् quickly, माम् me, अनुयातः followed.

10_13.shloka: स तु दृष्ट्वैव मां रात्रौ सद्वितीयं महाबलः4.10.15।।प्राद्रवद्भयसन्त्रस्तो वीक्ष्यावां समुपागतौ।अनुद्रुतश्च वेगेन प्रविवेश महाबिलम्4.10.16।।
10_13.translation: 'The powerful demon that night saw me followed by another advancing towards him and fled out of fear. When we chased him, he entered this huge cave in great speed.
10_13.word_by_word: महाबलः powerful, सः he, रात्रौ that night, सद्वितीयम् followed by a second person, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा एव soon after seeing that, प्राद्रवत् he ran, समुपागतौ both advancing towards him, आवाम् both of us, वीक्ष्य after seeing, भयसन्त्रस्तः shaken with fear, वेगेन speedily, प्रविवेश entered, सः he, महाबिलम् huge cave, अनुद्रुत was chased.

10_14.shloka: तं प्रविष्टं विदित्वा सुघोरं सुमहद्बिलम्।अयमुक्तोऽथ मे भ्राता मया तु क्रूरदर्शनः4.10.17।।
10_14.translation: 'When I saw the dreadful demon entering the great cave, I instructed this cruel brother of mine:
10_14.word_by_word: सुघोरम् dreadful, तम् him, सुमहत् great, बिलम् hole, प्रविष्टम् entering, विदित्वा knowing, अथthereafter, क्रूरदर्शनः with cruel looks, अयम् this, मम भ्राता my brother, मया by me, उक्तः has been told.

10_15.shloka: अहत्वा नास्ति मे शक्तिः प्रतिगन्तुमितः पुरीम्।बिलद्वारि प्रतीक्ष त्वं यावदेनं निहन्म्यहम्4.10.18।।
10_15.translation: 'I cannot return from here without killing him. Wait at the entrance of the cave until I kill him. Look forward to my return.
10_15.word_by_word: अहत्वा without killing him, इतः from this place, पुरीम् town, प्रतिगन्तुम् to return, मे to me, शक्तिः energy, नास्ति is not, अहम् I, एनम् him, यावत् till that time, हन्मि I kill and return, त्वम् you, बिलद्वारि at the entrance, प्रतीक्ष you may wait.

10_16.shloka: स्थितोऽयमिति मत्वा तु प्रविष्टोऽहं दुरासदम्।तं च मे मार्गमाणस्य गतस्संवत्सरस्तदा4.10.19।।
10_16.translation: 'Presuming that Sugriva was waiting there, I entered the formidable cave. While I was searching for the demon there, one year passed.
10_16.word_by_word: अयम् this, स्थितः इति waiting there, मत्वा तु thinking like that, अहम् I, दुरासदम् formidable, प्रविष्टः entered, तदा then, तत्र there, तम् him, मार्गमाणस्य in the process of searching, मे for me, संवत्सरः गतः one year was over.

10_17.shloka: स तु दृष्टो मया शत्रुरनिर्वेदाद्भयावहः।निहतश्च मया तत्र सोऽसुरो बन्धुभिस्सह।।4.10.20।।
10_17.translation: 'I could find that fearful enemy there and killed him along with his relatives without any difficulty.
10_17.word_by_word: भयावहः fearful one, सः he, शत्रुः enemy, मया by me, अनिर्वेदात् without any difficulty, दृष्टः was seen, बन्धुभिः सह along with his relatives, तत्र there, मया by me, निहतः killed, च असुरः that demon.

10_18.shloka: तस्यास्यात्तु प्रवृत्तेन रुधिरौघेण तद्बिलम्।पूर्णमासीद्दुराक्रामं स्तनतस्तस्य भूतले4.10.21।।
10_18.word_by_word: भूतले on the ground, स्तनतः was roaring, तस्य his, आस्यात् from his mouth, प्रवृत्तेन due to emergence, रुधिरौघेण by the flow of blood, तत् बिलम् that cavern, पूर्णम् full, दुराक्रामम् आसीत् difficult to stay.

10_19.shloka: सूदयित्वा तु तं शत्रुं विक्रान्तं दुन्दुभेस्सुतम्।निष्क्रामन्नेव पश्यामि बिलस्य पिहितं मुखम्4.10.22।।
10_19.word_by_word: दुन्दुभेः Dundubhi's, सुतम् son, विक्रान्तम् valiant, तं शत्रुम् that enemy, सूदयित्वा after vanquishing, इह here, निष्क्रामम् as I returned, पश्यामि I could find, बिलस्य cavern, मुखम् entrance, पिहितम् was closed.

10_20.shloka: विक्रोशमानस्य तु मे सुग्रीवेति पुनः पुनः।यदा प्रतिवचो नास्ति ततोऽहं भृशदुःखितः4.10.23।।
10_20.translation: 'When there was no response from Sugriva to my repeated call in distress I was verysad.
10_20.word_by_word: सुग्रीवेति saying O Sugriva , पुनः पुनः again and again, विक्रोशमानस्य  shouting in distress, मे for me, यदा when, प्रतिवचः response, नास्ति was not heard, ततः then, अहम् I, भृशदुःखितः  very sad.

10_21.shloka: पादप्रहारैस्तु मया बहुभिस्तद्विदारितम्।ततोऽहं तेन निष्क्रम्य यथा पुरमुपागतः4.10.24।।
10_21.translation: 'I kicked the boulder again and again till it yielded. I came out that way and arrived at the city.
10_21.word_by_word: मया by me, बहुभिः by many, पादप्रहारैः kicks, विदारितम् broken, ततः then, अहम् I, तेन by that, यथा as, निष्क्रम्य after coming out, पुरः to city, उपागतः arrived.

10_22.shloka: अत्रानेनास्मि संरुद्धो राज्यं प्रार्थयताऽत्मनः।सुग्रीवेण नृशंसेन विस्मृत्य भ्रातृसौहृदम्।।4.10.25।।
10_22.translation: 'I was obstructed by wicked Sugriva who forgot his brotherly love and was desiring  the kingdom, which belongs to me.'
10_22.word_by_word: आत्मनः my own, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रार्थयता by desiring, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, नृशंसेन by the wicked one, अनेन by him, भ्रातृसौहृदम् brotherly love, विस्मृत्य forgetting, अहम् I, तत्र there, अस्मि I am, संरुध्दः I was obstructed

10_23.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु मां तत्र वस्त्रेणैकेन वानरः।निर्वासयामास तदा वाली विगतसाध्वसः4.10.26।।
10_23.translation: 'When Vali, the monkey, spoke that way I remained unperturbed. He banished me  with the only cloth I was wearing.
10_23.word_by_word: वानरः monkey, वाली Vali, तत्र there, माम् me, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having spoken, विगतसाध्वसः unperturbed, तदा then, एकेन with a single, वस्त्रेण cloth, निर्वासयामास   banished me.

10_24.shloka: तेनाहमपविद्धश्च हृतदारश्च राघव।तद्भयाच्छ महीकृत्स्ना क्रान्तेयं सवनार्णवा4.10.27।।
10_24.translation: 'O Rama my wife has been usurped. There is the fear of his attack. So I am roaming this entire earth, covered with forests and oceans.
10_24.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, तेन on account of that, अपविद्धः attacked, हृतदारश्च stolen of my wife, अहम् I am, तद्भयात् by that fear, सवनार्णवा the entire forest and oceans, कृत्स्ना completely, इयं मही this earth, क्रान्ता is covered.

10_25.shloka: ऋष्यमूकं गिरिवरं भार्याहरणदुःखितः।प्रविष्टोऽस्मि दुराधर्षं वालिनः कारणान्तरे4.10.28।।
10_25.translation: 'Tormented by the abduction of my wife by Vali, I came to the great Rishyamuka mountain  inaccessible to Vali for some other reason.
10_25.word_by_word: भार्याहरणदुःखितः tormented by the abduction of my wife, कारणान्तरे for some other reason, वालिनः for Vali, दुराधर्षम् inaccessible, गिरिवरम् great mountain, ऋष्यमूकम् Rishyamuka, प्रविष्टः अस्मि I have come.

10_26.shloka: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं वैरानुकथनं महत्।अनागसा मया प्राप्तं व्यसनं पश्य राघव4.10.29।।
10_26.translation: 'O Rama I have given you this long, full account of the cause of our enmity. For no fault of mine I am suffering.
10_26.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, एतत् this, महत् long, वैरानुकथनम् an account of the cause of our enmity, सर्वम् entirely, ते to you, आख्यातम् said, अनागसा for no fault, मया by me, प्रप्तम् befallen, व्यसनम् sorrow, पश्य see.

10_27.shloka: वालिनस्तु भयार्तस्य सर्वलोकभयङ्कर।कर्तुमर्हसि मे वीर प्रसादं तस्य निग्रहात्4.10.30।।
10_27.translation: 'O great warrior you are one who can frighten the entire world Due to the fear of Vali I seek your grace.You may resist Vali and provide me security.'
10_27.word_by_word: सर्वलोकभयङ्कर वीर warrior, who can frighten the entire world, वीर hero, वालिनः Vali, भयार्तस्य of the frightened, मे for me, प्रसादम् grace, तस्य his, निग्रहात् by resisting, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि you may.

10_28.shloka: एवमुक्तस्स तेजस्वी धर्मज्ञो धर्मसंहितम्।वचनं वक्तुमारेभे सुग्रीवं प्रहसन्निव4.10.31।।
10_28.translation: Having thus addressed by Sugriva the righteous and glorious Rama with a gentle smile  consistent with righteousness, started speaking:
10_28.word_by_word: एवम् that way, उक्तः spoken, धर्मज्ञः one who knows dharms, तेजस्वी glorious one, सः he, प्रहसन्निव as if joking with him, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, धर्मसंहितम् consistent with righteousness, वचनम् words, वक्तुम् to speak, आरेभे he started.

10_29.shloka: अमोघास्सूर्यसङ्काशा ममैते निशिता श्शराः।तस्मिन्वालिनि दुर्वृत्ते निपतिष्यन्ति वेगिताः4.10.32।।
10_29.translation: 'These my sharp, unfailing arrows, bright as the Sun, released by me out of anger will descend on the evildoer, Vali.
10_29.word_by_word: अमोघाः unfailing, सूर्यसङ्काशाः (bright) as the Sun, (रुषा अन्विता accompanied by anger), ममैते released by me, निशिताः sharp, मे शराः my arrows, दुर्वृत्ते on the evil doer, तस्मिन् वालिनि on that Vali, पतिष्यन्ति will descend.

10_30.shloka: यावत्तं नाभिपश्यामि तव भार्यापहारिणम्।तावत्स जीवेत्पापात्मा वाली चारित्रदूषकः4.10.33।।
10_30.translation: 'That sinful Vali who has abducted your wife and violated the moral code will live only as long I do not see him.
10_30.word_by_word: तव your, भार्यापहारिणम् abducter of your wife, तम् him, यावत् until, न not, अभिपश्यामि I do not see, तावत् till that time, पापात्मा sinner, चारित्रदूषकः violater of the moral code, सः वाली that Vali, जीवेत्  live.

10_31.shloka: आत्मानुमानात्पश्यामि मग्नं त्वां शोकसागरे।त्वामहं तारयिष्यामि कामं प्राप्स्यसि पुष्कलम्4.10.34।।
10_31.translation: 'Inferring from my own experience, I see that you are immersed in an ocean of sorrow.I will help you cross over and fulfil your desire.'
10_31.word_by_word: त्वाम् you, शोकसागरे in an ocean of sorrow, मग्नः immersed, आत्मानुमानात् due to my own sorrow, पश्यामि I see, त्वाम् you, अहम् I, तारयिष्यामि I will help you cross over, पुष्कलम् completely, कामम् desire, प्राप्स्यसि you will fulfil.

10_32.translation: On hearing his words that boosted his joy and vigour, Sugriva was immensely pleased and said these warm words.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गःThus ends the tenth sarga of Kishkindhakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
10_32.word_by_word: तस्य his, हर्षपौरुषवर्धनम् boosting his joy and vigour, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, परमप्रीतः very pleased, सुमहत् great, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

11_1.shloka: [Sugriva expatiates about the prowess of Vali -- narrates Dundubhi's challenge -- sage Matanga's curse on Vali -- Rama demonstrates his strength.]रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा हर्षपौरुषवर्धनम्।सुग्रीवः पूजयाञ्चक्रे राघवं प्रशशंस च4.11.1।।
11_1.translation: The words of Rama boosted Sugriva's joy and manliness. He offered him prayers and praise:
11_1.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, रामस्य Rama's, हर्षपौरुषवर्धनम्  joy and manliness increased, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा heard, राघवम् to Rama, पूजयाञ्चक्रे offered prayers, प्रशशंस च and praised.

11_2.shloka: असंशयं प्रज्वलितैस्तीक्ष्णैर्मर्मातिगैश्शरैः।त्वं दहेः कुपितो लोकान्युगान्त इव भास्करः4.11.2।।
11_2.translation: 'There is no doubt that your sharp, blazing arrows will pierce through the vital parts of the body once you are angry, just as the Sungod burns all worlds at the end of the Yuga.
11_2.word_by_word: प्रज्वलितैः by blazing, तीक्ष्णैः by the sharp, मर्मातिगैः  go through vital parts, शरैः with arrows, कुपितः outraged one, त्वम् you, युगान्ते at the end of the Yuga, भास्करः इव like the Sun, लोकान् worlds, दहेः you many burn, असंशयम् no doubt.

11_3.shloka: वालिनः पौरुषं यत्तद्यच्च वीर्यं धृतिश्च या।तन्ममैकमनाश्श्रुत्वा विधत्स्व यदनन्तरम्4.11.3।।
11_3.word_by_word: वालिनः Vali's, यत् such, पौरुषम् manliness, तत् that, यत् वीर्यम् such valour, तत् that, या धृतिश्च courage, मम my, एकमनाः concentrate, श्रुत्वा on hearing, यत् which, अनन्तरम् after that, विधत्स्व  do what is to be done.

11_4.shloka: समुद्रात्पश्चिमात्पूर्वं दक्षिणादपि चोत्तरम्।क्रामत्यनुदिते सूर्ये वाली व्यपगतक्लमः4.11.4।।
11_4.translation: 'In the early hours before Sunrise Vali crosses over the oceans from the west to the east and moving from south to north (performing sandhya) without getting fatigued.
11_4.word_by_word: वाली Vali, व्यपगतक्लमः without getting tired, सूर्ये when the Sun, अनुदिते has not yet risen, पश्चिमात् from the west, समुद्रात् from the ocean, पूर्वम् east, दक्षिणात् from the south, उत्तरम् north, क्रामति crosses over.

11_5.shloka: अग्राण्यारुह्य शैलानां शिखराणि महान्त्यपि।ऊर्ध्वमुत्क्षिप्य तरसा प्रतिगृह्णाति वीर्यवान्4.11.5।।
11_5.translation: 'Climbing up speedily, valiant Vali would catch the huge mountain peaks.
11_5.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् valiant , शैलानाम् of the mountains, आग्राणि tops, आरुह्य ascending, महान्ति huge, शिखराणि peaks, तरसा speedily, ऊर्ध्वम् upward, उत्क्षिप्य climbing, प्रतिगृह्णाति catches.

11_6.shloka: बहवस्सारवन्तश्च वनेषु विविधा द्रुमाः।वालिना तरसा भग्ना बलं प्रथयताऽत्मनः4.11.6।।
11_6.translation: 'Vali would break several sturdy trees in the forest with his vigour and speed, exhibiting his strength.
11_6.word_by_word: आत्मनः his, बलम् strength, प्रथयता exihibiting, वालिना by Vali, वनेषु in the forests, सारवन्तः sturdy, विविधाः several, बहवः many, द्रुमाः trees, तरसा with vigour, भग्नाः break

11_7.shloka: महिषो दुन्दुभिर्नाम कैलासशिखरप्रभः।बलं नागसहस्रस्य धारयामास वीर्यवान्4.11.7।।
11_7.translation: 'Massive like the shining peak of mount Kailas and valiant like the mightybuffalo in form, Dundubhi possessed the strength of a thousand elephants.
11_7.word_by_word: कैलासशिखरप्रभः shining like the peak of mount Kailas, वीर्यवान् valiant one, महिषः mighty buffalo, दुन्दुभिः नाम by name Dundubhi, नागसहस्रस्य of a thousand elephants, बलम् strength, धारयामास possessed.

11_8.shloka: वीर्योत्सेकेन दुष्टात्मा वरदानाच्च मोहितः।जगाम सुमहाकाय स्समुद्रं सरितां पतिम्।।4.11.8।।
11_8.translation: 'Wicked Dundubhi of huge body was proud of his valour and deluded by virtue of the boons, went to the ocean, the lord of rivers.
11_8.word_by_word: वीर्योत्सेकेन proud of valour, वरदानात् by virtue of boons, मोहितः deluded, दुष्टात्मा wickedself, महाकायः of huge body, सः he (Dundubhi), सरितां पतिम् lord of rivers, समुद्रम् to ocean, जगाम went.

11_9.shloka: ऊर्मिमन्तमभिक्रम्य सागरं रत्नसञ्चयम्।मह्यं युद्धं प्रयच्छेति तमुवाच महार्णवम्4.11.9।।
11_9.translation: 'Reaching the mighty ocean, he implored the sea with (high) waves and hoards of gems for a fight.
11_9.word_by_word: ऊर्मिमन्तम् with waves, रत्नसञ्चयम् a hoarder of gems, सागरम् ocean, अभिक्रम्य after reaching, मह्यं to me, युद्धम् war, प्रयच्छ give, इति thus, तम् him, महार्णवम् mighty ocean, उवाच said.

11_10.shloka: ततस्समुद्रो धर्मात्मा समुत्थाय महाबलः।अब्रवीद्वचनं राजन्नसुरं कालचोदितम्4.11.10।।
11_10.translation: 'O king, then the powerful and righteous king of the ocean came out and spoke to the demon (Dundubhi) who was driven to death by fate.'
11_10.word_by_word: राजन् O king, ततः then, धर्मात्मा righteous self, महाबलः  powerful समुद्रः ocean, समुत्थाय  rising, कालचोदितम् driven to death by fate, असुरम् demon, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

11_11.shloka: समर्थो नास्मि ते दातुं युद्धं युद्धविशारद।श्रूयतां चाभिधास्यामि यस्ते युद्धं प्रदास्यति4.11.11।।
11_11.translation: 'You are proficient in warfare. I am not competent enough to challenge you to a duel. But  I will name the one who can.
11_11.word_by_word: युद्धविशारद O warrior proficient in war, ते to you, युद्धम् war, दातुम् to offer (challenge), समर्थः not capable, नास्मि I am not, यः he who, ते to you, युद्धम् war, प्रदास्यति will give, अभिधास्यामि I can name him, श्रूयताम् listen.

11_12.shloka: शैलराजो महारण्ये तपस्विशरणं परम्।शङ्करश्वशुरो नाम्ना हिमवानिति विश्रुतः4.11.12।।गुहाप्रस्रवणोपेतो बहुकन्दरनिर्दरः।स समर्थस्तव प्रीतिमतुलां कर्तुमाहवे4.11.13।।
11_12.translation: 'Himavan, the supreme abode of ascetics is the fatherinlaw of Lord Siva. He is wellknown as king of mountains, who has, waterfalls, caves, caverns and greatforests.He is competent to match your incomparable love for war.
11_12.word_by_word: परम् supreme, तपस्विशरणम् abode of ascetics, शङ्करश्वशुरः fatherinlaw of lord Siva, हिमवानिति Himavan, नाम्ना by name, विश्रुतः wellknown, महाप्रस्रवणोपेतः great waterfalls, बहुकन्दरनिर्दरः many caves and caverns, शैलराजः king of mountains, महारण्ये in the great forest, सः he, समर्थः is competent, तव to you, अतुलाम् incomparable, प्रीतिम् love, कर्तुम् to do, आहवे in the war.

11_13.shloka: तं भीत इति विज्ञाय समुद्रमसुरोत्तमः।हिमवद्वनमागच्छच्छरश्चापादिव च्युतः4.11.14।।ततस्तस्य गिरेश्श्वेता गजेन्द्रविप्रलाश्शिलाः।चिक्षेप बहुधा भूमौ दुन्दुभिर्विननाद च4.11.15।।
11_13.translation: 'Dundubhi, the most powerful of demons, aware that the ocean is frightened of him went swiftly to Himavan like an arrow released from a bow. He raised many huge white cliffs of the size of great elephants to the ground and roared.
11_13.word_by_word: असुरोत्तमः best of demons, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, तम् him, समुद्रम् ocean, भीतः frightened, इति thus, विज्ञाय  knowing, चापात् from the bow, च्युतः released, शर इव arrowlike, हिमवद्वनम् forest of Himavan, आगम्य  reached, ततः then, तस्य गिरेः of that mountain, श्वेताः white, गजेन्द्र (like) elephants, विप्रला huge, शिलाः rocks, बहुधा several, भूमौ on the earth, चिक्षेप threw, विननाद roared, च also.

11_14.shloka: ततश्श्वेताम्बुदाकारः सौम्यः प्रीतिकराकृतिः।हिमवानब्रवीद्वाक्यं स्वे एव शिखरे स्थितः4.11.16।।
11_14.translation: 'Then the gentle Himavan of pleasing appearance stood in the form of a white cloud on the peak and spoke:
11_14.word_by_word: ततः then, श्वेताम्बुदाकारः in a white cloudlike form, सौम्यः a gentle one, प्रीतिकराकृतिः one who has a pleasing appearance, हिमवान् Himavan, स्वे on his own,  शिखरे एव on the peak, स्थितः he stood, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

11_15.shloka: क्लेष्टुमर्हसि मां न त्वं दुन्दुभे धर्मवत्सल।रणकर्मस्वकुशलस्तपस्विशरणं ह्यहम्4.11.17।।
11_15.translation: 'Dundubhi, it is not proper for you to trouble me, for I am devoted to righteousness. I am the resort of ascetics and not adept in warfare'.
11_15.word_by_word: धर्मवत्सल devoted to dharma, दुन्दुभे Dundubhi, त्वम् you, माम् me, क्लेष्टुम् to trouble, नार्हसि it is not proper, तपस्विशरणम्  the resort of ascetics, अहम् I am, रणकर्मसु to wage war, अकुशलः हि not adept

11_16.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा गिरिराजस्य धीमतः।उवाच दुन्दुभिर्वाक्यं क्रोधात्संरक्तलोचनः4.11.18।।
11_16.translation: "At these words of Himavan, the wise king of mountains, Dundubhi whose eyes turned red in anger replied:
11_16.word_by_word: दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, धीमतः of the wise one, तस्य गिरिराजस्य of that king of mountains, तत् that, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा after hearing, क्रोधात् angrily, संरक्तलोचनः with eyes turned red, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच said.

11_17.shloka: यदि युद्धेऽसमर्थस्त्वं मद्भयाद्वा निरुद्यमः।समाचक्ष्व प्रदद्यान्मे योऽद्य युद्धं युयुत्सतः4.11.19।।
11_17.translation: 'If you are unable or unwilling to fight me out of fear, tell me who wants to challenge me to a duel.
11_17.word_by_word: त्वम् you, युद्धे in a duel, असमर्थः यदि if in capable, वा or else, मद्भयात् due to fear of me, निरुद्यमः unwilling, यः whosoever, युयुत्सतः wants to fight, मे with me, युद्धम् duel, प्रदद्यात् give me a challenge, समाचक्ष्व tell me.

11_18.translation: 'On hearing such words, which no one had spoken earlier, righteous Himavan, skilful in conversation, flew into a rage and said to Dundubhi,the best of demons:
11_18.word_by_word: वाक्यविशारदः skilful in conversation, धर्मात्मा righteous, हिमवान् Himavan, श्रुत्वा on hearing, तम् him, असुरोत्तमम् best of demon, क्रोधात् in anger, अनुक्तपूर्वम् had not spoken earlier,वाक्यम् such words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

11_19.shloka: वाली नाम महाप्राज्ञश्शक्रतुल्य पराक्रमः।अध्यास्ते वानरश्श्रीमान् किष्किन्धामतुलप्रभाम्4.11.21।।
11_19.translation: 'Vali, son of Indra, is a wise, powerful and prosperous monkey. He resides at Kishkinda, a city of incomparable glory.
11_19.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञः wise one, शक्रपुत्रः son of Indra, प्रतापवान् powerful, श्रीमान् prosperous one,   वाली नाम Vali by name, वानरः monkey, अतुलप्रभाम् of incomparable glory, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkindha, अध्यास्ते residing.

11_20.shloka: स समर्थो महाप्राज्ञस्तव युद्धविशारदः।द्वन्द्वयुद्धं महद्दातुं नमुचेरिव वासवः4.11.22।।
11_20.translation: 'Vali is profoundly wise, an expert in warfare. He is capable of challenging you to a duel like Indra to Namuchi.
11_20.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञः wise, युद्धविशारदः expert in warfare, सः he, वासवः Indra, नमुचेरिव like Namuchi, तव to you, महत् great, द्वन्द्वयुद्धम् duel, दातुम् to give (challenge), समर्थः competent.

11_21.shloka: तं शीघ्रमभिगच्छ त्वं यदि युद्धमिहेच्छसि।स हि दुर्धर्षणो नित्यं शूरस्समरकर्मणि4.11.23।।
11_21.translation: 'If you wish to fight, go to him quickly.He is ever heroic and difficult to combat.
11_21.word_by_word: इह now, युद्धम् fight, इच्छसि यदि if you want to fight, त्वम् you, शीघ्रम् quickly, तम् him, अभिगच्छ  go now, शूरः heroic, सः he, नित्यम् ever, समरकर्मणि in warfare, दुर्धर्षणः हि difficult to combat.

11_22.shloka: श्रुत्वा हिमवतो वाक्यं कोधाविष्टस्स दुन्दुभिः।जगाम तां पुरीं तस्य किष्किन्धां वालिनस्तदा4.11.24।।
11_22.translation: 'Having heard Himavan, Dundubhi, seized with anger, went to Kishkindha,  the city of Vali.
11_22.word_by_word: तदा then, सः दुन्दुभिः that Dundubhi, हिमवतः Himavan's, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, कोपाविष्टः seized with anger, तस्य his वालिनः Vali's, पुरीम् city, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, जगाम went.

11_23.shloka: धारयन्माहिषं रूपं तीक्ष्णशृङ्गो भयावहः।प्रावृषीव महामेघस्तोयपूर्णो नभस्स्थले4.11.25।।ततस्तु द्वारमागम्य किष्किन्धाया महाबलः।ननर्द कम्पयन्भूमिं दुन्दुभिर्दुन्दुभिर्यथा4.11.26।।
11_23.translation: 'Mighty Dundubhi assuming the form of a frightening buffalo with pointed horns looking like a huge, dark raincloud in the sky in monsoon marched to the entrance of Kishkinda and roared like a wardrum as if shaking the earth.
11_23.word_by_word: महाबलः mighty, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, माहिषम् buffalo, रूपम् form, धारयन् assuming, तीक्ष्णशृङ्गः  pointed horns, भयावहः frightening, प्रावृषि in rainy season, नभस्तले in the sky, तोयपूर्णः laden with water, महामेघ इव like a huge cloud, किष्किन्धायाः Kishkinda's, द्वारम् entrance, आगम्य reached, भूमिम् earth, कम्पयन् shaking, दुन्दुभिर्यथा like Dundubhi a wardrum, ननर्द roared.

11_24.translation: 'Dundubhi felled the trees nearby, rent the earth with its hoofs, scratched the entrance gate of the city as an elephant would do with its horns in arrogance.
11_24.word_by_word: समीपस्थान् nearby, द्रुमान् trees, भञ्जन् felling, वसुधाम् earth, खुरैः with hoofs, दारयन् breaking, दर्पात् arrogantly, विषाणेन by the horn, तद्वारम् that entrance, द्विरदो यथा like anelephant, उल्लिखन् digging.

11_25.shloka: अन्तःपुरगतो वाली श्रुत्वा शब्दममर्षणः।निष्पपात सह स्त्रीभिस्ताराभिरिव चन्द्रमाः4.11.28।।
11_25.translation: 'Unable to tolerate the sound, Vali jumped out of the harem along with the women like the Moon with stars.
11_25.word_by_word: अन्तःपुरगतः in the harem, वाली Vali, शब्दम् sound, श्रुत्वा  hearing, अमर्षणः intolereable, ताराभिः stars also, चन्द्रमाः Moon, स्त्रीभिः with women, निष्पपात jumped out.

11_26.shloka: मितं व्यक्ताक्षरपदं तमुवाचाथ दुन्दुभिम्।हरीणामीश्वरो वाली सर्वेषां वनचारिणाम्4.11.29।।
11_26.translation: 'Vali, king of the monkeys who roam the forest, saw Dundubhi and addressed, but briefly:
11_26.word_by_word: वनचारिणाम् forestrangers, सर्वेषाम् for all, हरीणाम् of monkeys, ईश्वरः king, (सः वाली that Vali), दुन्दुभिम् to Dundubhi, व्यक्ताक्षरपदम् a brief statement, मितम् in limited words, उवाच said.

11_27.shloka: किमर्थं नगरद्वारमिदं रुध्द्वा विनर्दसि।दुन्दुभे विदितो मेऽसि रक्षप्राणान्महाबल4.11.30।।
11_27.translation: 'O Dundubhi why are you roaring, blocking the entrance of the city? I know you arepowerful. Go and save your life.'
11_27.word_by_word: दुन्दुभे O Dundubhi, इदम् this, नगरद्वारम् entrance of the city, रुध्द्वा  blocking, किमर्थम् for what reason, विनर्दसि are you roaring, मे to me, विदितः known, असि you are,महाबल O powerful one, प्राणान् life, रक्ष you may protect.

11_28.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वानरेन्द्रस्य धीमतः।उवाच दुन्दुभिर्वाक्यं रोषात्संरक्तलोचनः4.11.31।।
11_28.translation: 'Dundubhi whose eyes turned red in anger when he heard the words of Vali ,the wise king of the monkeys, said:
11_28.word_by_word: धीमतः wise, तस्य his, वानरेन्द्रस्य of the king of monkeys, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा  hearing, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, रोषात् angrily, संरक्तलोचनः eyes turned red, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said

11_29.shloka: न त्वं स्त्रीसन्निधौ वीर वचनं वक्तुमर्हसि।मम युद्धं प्रयच्छाद्य ततो ज्ञास्यामि ते बलम्4.11.32।।
11_29.translation: 'O hero speaking such words in the presence of women is not proper. Come to me for a combat and I will let you know your strength.
11_29.word_by_word: वीर hero, त्वम् you, स्त्रीसन्निधौ in the presence of women, वचनम् words, वक्तुम् to speak, नार्हसि not proper for you, अद्य to day, मम to me, युद्धम् war, प्रयच्छ you may give, ततः then, ते your, बलम् strength, ज्ञास्यामि I will let you know.

11_30.shloka: अथवा धारयिष्यामि क्रोधमद्य निशामिमाम्।गृह्यतामुदयस्स्वैरं कामभोगेषु वानर4.11.33।।
11_30.translation: 'O monkey I will restrain my anger tonight and give you time for your indulgence in sensual pleasures till morning.
11_30.word_by_word: वानर O monkey, अथवा or else, अद्य now, इमाम् this, निशाम् night, क्रोधम् anger, धारयिष्यामि I will control,  स्वैरम् freedom, कामभोगेषु for your sensual pleasures, उदयः morning, गृह्यताम् I will give you time.

11_31.shloka: दीयतां सम्प्रदानं च परिष्वज्य च वानरान्।सर्वशाखामृगेन्द्र स्त्वं संसादय सुहृज्जनान्4.11.34।।
11_31.translation: 'O king of monkeys, hug them and give them any gift you want. Spend the night with your dear ones.
11_31.word_by_word: वानरान् of monkeys, परिष्वज्य embracing, सम्प्रदानम् a gift, दीयताम् may give, सर्वशाखामृगेन्द्रः king of all monkeys, त्वम् you, सुहृज्जनम् with dear friends, संसादय spend

11_32.shloka: सुदृष्टां कुरु किष्किन्धां कुरुष्वात्मसमं पुरे।क्रीडस्व च सह स्त्रीभिरहं ते दर्पनाशनः4.11.35।।
11_32.translation: 'Have a good look a Kishkinda. Assign some one like you kingship. Sport freely  with women and come, I shall destroy your arrogance.
11_32.word_by_word: किष्किन्धाम् Kishkindha, सुदृष्टाम् give a good look, पुरे the city, आत्मसमम् some one equal to you, कुरुष्व assign kingship, स्त्रीभिः with women, सह along with, क्रीडस्व च and sport, अहम्  am, ते to you, दर्पनाशनः a destroyer of arrogance.

11_33.shloka: यो हि मत्तं प्रमत्तं वा सुप्तं वा रहितं भृशम्।हन्यात्स भ्रूणहा लोके त्वद्विधं मदमोहितम्4.11.36।।
11_33.translation: 'Whoever kills a person, who is drunk or is heedless or is asleep or without weapons or stupified by lust in this world, is equal to a killer of a foetus in the womb.'
11_33.word_by_word: यः whoever, मत्तम् drunk, प्रमत्तं वा or heedless, सुप्तं वा or sleeping, रहितम् or without weapons, भृशम् greatly, मदमोहितम् stupified by lust, हन्यात् if killed, सः he, लोके in the world, भ्रूणहा हि is a killer of foetus in the womb.

11_34.translation: 'Then, Vali sent away Tara and all other women slowly and replied angrily to the foolish demon with a mischievous smile:
11_34.word_by_word: तदा then, सः he, प्रहस्य laughing, ताराप्रभृतिकाः Tara and others, ताः those, सर्वाः all, स्त्रियः women, विसृज्य having sent away, मन्दम् slowly, तम् him, असुरोत्तमम् best of demons, क्रोधात् angrily, अब्रवीत् said.

11_35.shloka: मत्तोऽयमिति मा मंस्था यद्यभीतोऽसि संयुगे।मदोऽयं सम्प्रहारेऽस्मिन्वीरपानं समर्थ्यताम्4.11.38।।
11_35.translation: 'Do not consider me drunken. This drink will serve as a warrior's drink in the combat. Be ready, if you are not afraid of a combat.'
11_35.word_by_word: अयम् this, मत्तः a drunken person, इति thus, मा मंस्थाः do not think, संयुगे in the combat, अभीतः not afraid, असि यदि if you are, अयम् this, मदः drunkeness, अस्मिन्  सम्प्रहारे in striking you, वीरपानम् warrior's drink (sharpening a warrior's skill), समर्थ्यताम् consider.

11_36.shloka: तमेवमुक्त्वा सङ्कृद्धो मालामुत्क्षिप्य काञ्चनीम्।पित्रा दत्तां महेन्द्रेण युद्धाय व्यवतिष्ठत4.11.39।।
11_36.translation: 'Having addressed thus in a rage, Vali removed the golden garland gifted by Indra, his father, and stood ready for the combat.
11_36.word_by_word: तम् him, एवम् that way, उक्त्वा having spoken, सङ्कृद्धः angry, पित्रा by his father, महेन्द्रेण by Indra, दत्ताम् gifted, काञ्चनीम् golden, मालाम् garland, उत्क्षिप्य removed, युद्धाय for the combat, व्यवतिष्ठत stood ready

11_37.shloka: विषाणयोर्गृहीत्वा तं दुन्दुभिं गिरिसन्निभम्।आविध्यत तदा वाली विनदन्कपिकुञ्जरः4.11.40।।
11_37.translation: 'Vali, the elephantlike monkey then held the mountainlike Dundubhi by the horns and struck him down, roaring loudly.
11_37.word_by_word: तदा then, कपिकुञ्जरः elephantlike monkey, वाली Vali, गिरिसन्निभम् resembling a mountain, तम् him, दुन्दुभिम् Dundubhi, विषाणयोः by horns, गृहीत्वा  held, विनदन् roaring loudly, आविध्यत struck down.

11_38.shloka: वाली व्यापातयाञ्चक्रे ननर्द च महास्वनम्।श्रोत्राभ्यामथ रक्तं तु तस्य सुस्राव पात्यतः4.11.41।।
11_38.translation: 'Vali whirled him round and round and threw him downroaring. Blood flowed from Dundubhi's ears.
11_38.word_by_word: वाली Vali, व्यापादयाञ्चक्रे whirled round, महास्वनम् great sound, ननर्द च roared, अथ then, पात्यतः  down, तस्य his, श्रोत्राभ्याम् from the ears, रक्तम् blood, सुस्राव flowed.

11_39.translation: 'Each one of them was highly agitated and angry trying to win over the other. A terrific fight took place between Dundubhi and Vali.
11_39.word_by_word: क्रोधसंरम्भात् highly agitated in anger, परस्परजयैषिणोः of both trying to win over the other, तयोः of both, दुन्दुभेः for Dundubhi, वानरस्य च and of the monkey, घोरम् terrific, युद्धम् combat, समभवत् took place.

11_40.shloka: अयुद्ध्यत तदा वाली शक्रतुल्यपराक्रमः।मुष्टिभिर्जानुभिश्चैव शिलाभिः पादपैस्तथा4.11.43।।
11_40.translation: 'Then Vali who was equal to Indra in prowess fought, hitting him with fists, knees, rocks and trees.
11_40.word_by_word: तदा then, शक्रतुल्यपराक्रमः equal to Indra in prowess, वाली Vali, मुष्टिभिः with fists, जानुभिः with knees, च एव also, शिलाभिः with rocks, तथा so also, पादपैः with trees, अयुध्यत fought.

11_41.shloka: परस्परं घ्नतो स्तत्र वानरासुरयोस्तदा।आसीदसुरो युद्धे शक्रसूनुर्व्यवर्धत4.11.44।।
11_41.translation: 'Then as the monkey and demon fought pouncing on each other, the prowess of Dundubhi got diminished and that of Vali, the son of Indra, increased.
11_41.word_by_word: तदा then, तत्र there, वानरासुरयोः of monkey and demon, परस्परम् one to one, घ्नतोः pouncing on the other, युद्धे in fight, असुरः demon, हीनः reduced, आसीद become, शक्रसूनुः son of Indra, व्यवर्धत grew (in strength and spirit).

11_42.shloka: व्यापारवीर्यधैर्यैश्च परिक्षीणं पराक्रमैः।तं तु दुन्दुभिमुद्यम्य धरण्यामभ्यपातयत्।।4.11.45।।युद्धे प्राणहरे तस्मिन्निष्पिष्टो दुन्दुभिस्तदा।पपात च महाकायः क्षितौ पञ्चत्वमागतः4.11.46।।
11_42.translation: In the fight, Dundubhi fell down, with his strength, courage and prowess dwindled. Vali lifted his huge body and dashed it down on the ground. The body of Dundubhi dissolved into the five elements.
11_42.word_by_word: व्यापारवीर्यधैर्यै in effort, strength and courage, पराक्रमैः in prowess as well, परिक्षीणं deterioration, तम् Vali, दुन्दुभिम् Dundubhi, उद्यम्य having lifted, धरण्याम् on the ground, अभ्यपातयत् hit down, तदा then, प्राणहरे in the deadly, तस्मिन् in that, युद्धे fight, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, निष्पिष्ट: crushed, पातयतः thrown down, तस्य his, महाकायः of huge body, पञ्चत्वम् resolved into the five elements (dead), आगतः go, क्षितौ on the ground, पपात fell down.

11_43.shloka: तं तोलयित्वा बाहुभ्यां गतसत्त्वमचेतनम्।चिक्षेप बलवान्वाली वेगेनैकेन योजनम्4.11.47।।
11_43.translation: 'Mighty Vali lifted on both shoulders the insensate body drained of life and hurled it speedily to a distance of a yojana.
11_43.word_by_word: बलवान् powerful, वाली Vali, गतसत्त्वम् life drained, अचेतनम् lost consciousness, तम् him, बाहुभ्याम् with both shoulders, तोलयित्वा after lifting, एकेन in one piece, वेगेन with speed, योजनम् distance of a yojana (eight miles), चिक्षेप hurled.

11_44.translation: 'Scattered by the wind, drops of blood fell at the hermitage of Matanga from the mouth of the deadbody flung.
11_44.word_by_word: वेगप्रविद्धस्य flung, तस्य his, वक्त्रात् from the mouth, क्षतजबिन्दवः drops of blood, मारुतोत्क्षिप्ताः scattered by the wind, मतङ्गस्य Matanga's, आश्रमं प्रति at the hermitage of, प्रपेतुः fell.

11_45.translation: 'The venerable sage became furious to see drops of blood fallen there. He started thinking who could he be?
11_45.word_by_word: महाभागः venerable one, मुनिः sage, तत्र there, पतितान् fallen, शोणितविप्रुषः drops of blood, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तस्य his, क्रुद्धः became angry, अयम् this, को नु who can  he be, चिन्तयामास started thinking.

11_46.shloka: येनाहं सहसा स्पृष्टश्शोणितेन दुरात्मना।कोऽयं दुरात्मा दुर्भुदि्घरकृतात्मा च बालिशः4.11.50।।
11_46.translation: 'Who is that petty, wicked, evil minded one who caused the drops of blood to touch (fall on) me suddenly?
11_46.word_by_word: दुरात्मना wicked self, येन by whom, अहम् I, सहसा instantly, शोणितेन with blood, स्पृष्टःtouched, दुरात्मा a villain, दुर्भुद्धि: evilminded, अयम् he, बालिशः a petty man, कः who?

11_47.shloka: इत्युक्त्वाऽथ विनिष्क्रम्य ददर्श मुनिसत्तमः।महिषं पर्वताकारं गतासुं पतितं भुवि4.11.51।।
11_47.translation: 'The venerable sage came out of the hermitage and saw a mountaneous buffalo fallen dead on the floor.
11_47.word_by_word: सः he, मुनिसत्तमः venerable sage, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, विनिष्क्रम्य having come out, गतासुम् a dead one, भुवि on the floor, पतितम् fallen, पर्वताकारम् with a mountaneous form, महिषम् buffalo, ददृशे saw.

11_48.shloka: स तु विज्ञाय तपसा वानरेण कृतं हि तत्।उत्ससर्ज महाशापं क्षेप्तारं वालिनं प्रति4.11.52।।
11_48.translation: 'Having known through his ascetic vision that it was the act of a monkey, he pronounced a curse on Vali who had hurled (the body):
11_48.word_by_word: सः he, तत् that, वानरेण by the monkey, कृतम् done, तपसा by ascetic vision, विज्ञाय having known, क्षेप्तारम् who hurled, वालिनं प्रति at that Vali, महाशापम् great curse, उत्ससर्ज pronounced.

11_49.shloka: इह तेनाप्रवेष्टव्यं प्रविष्टस्य वधो भवेत्।वनं मत्संश्रयं येन दूषितं रुधिरस्रवैः4.11.53।।
11_49.translation: 'Whoever has desecrated this forest, protected by me, with drops of blood is forbidden to enter this place. Once he does it, he will die.
11_49.word_by_word: मत्संश्रयम् under my protection, वनम् forest, येन by whom, रुधिरस्रवैः with drops of blood, दूषितम् is violated, तेन by him, इह here, न प्रवेष्टव्यम्  should not enter, प्रविष्टस्य of him who enters, वधः death, भवेत् will take place.

11_50.shloka: सम्भग्नाः पादपाश्चैमेक्षिपतेहासुरीं तनुम्।समन्तादाद्योजनं पूर्णमाश्रमं मामकं यदि4.11.54।।आगमिष्यति दुर्बुद्धिर्व्यक्तं स न भविष्यति।
11_50.translation: 'Whoever has broken the trees all over this forest and has thrown the demon's body will not survive if he enters within a radius of one yojana  of my hermitage.
11_50.word_by_word: आसुरीम् demon's, तनुम् body, क्षिपता  hurled, इमे those, पादपाश्च trees also, सम्भग्नाः are broken, समन्तात् all over, पूर्णम् entire, योजनम् yojana, मामकम् mine, आश्रमम् hermitage, आगमिष्यति if he comes, दुर्बुद्धिः wicked  one, सः he, न भविष्यति will not survive.

11_51.shloka: ये चापि सचिवाः स्तस्य संश्रिता मामकं वनम्4.11.55।।न च तैरिह वस्तव्यं श्रुत्वा यान्तु यथासुखम्।
11_51.translation: 'Indeed his counsellors who are here must leave this forest. Let them depart safely.
11_51.word_by_word: मामकम् my, वनम् forest, संश्रिताः taking refuge, ये (केचित्) indeed, अस्य सचिवाः his counsellors, तैः च by them also, इह here, न वस्तव्यम् should not stay, श्रुत्वा on hearing, यथासुखम् safely, यान्तु depart.

11_52.shloka: यदि तेऽपी ह तिष्ठन्ति शपिष्ये तानपि ध्रुवम्4.11.56।।वनेऽस्मिन्मामके नित्यं पुत्रवत्परिरक्षिते।पत्राङ्कुरविनाशाय फलमूलाभवाय च4.11.57।।
11_52.translation: 'If the monkeys stay back to destroy the leaves and shoots and plunder the fruits and roots of this forest which I have protected just like my son will also certainly invite my curse.
11_52.word_by_word: नित्यम् always, पुत्रवत् like a son, परिरक्षिते protected, मामके my, अस्मिन् वने in this forest, तेऽपि they also, पत्राङ्कुरविनाशाय for destroying shoots, फलमूलाभवाय च and for the loss of fruits and roots etc, तिष्ठन्ति यदि if they stay back, तानपि them also, ध्रुवम् certainly, शपिष्ये Iwill curse.

11_53.shloka: दिवसश्चास्य मर्यादा यं द्रष्टा श्वोऽस्मि वानरम्।बहुवर्षसहस्राणि स वै शैलो भविष्यति4.11.58।।
11_53.translation: 'I give one day's time for the monkeys (to leave). Whomsoever, I see tomorrow will get transformed into a mountain for many thousands of years'
11_53.word_by_word: अस्य for him, दिवसः one day, मर्यादा time limit, श्वः tomorrow, यम् whosoever, वानरम् monkey, द्रष्टास्मि I will see, सः he, बहुवर्षसहस्राणि for many thousands of years, शैलः mountain, भविष्यति will become.

11_54.translation: 'The monkeys fled on hearing the words spoken by the sage. Said Vali:
11_54.word_by_word: ततः then, ते those, वानराः monkeys, मुनिसमीरिताम् spoken by the sage, गिरम् word, श्रुत्वा after hearing, तस्मात् वनात् from that forest, निश्चक्रमुः went away, तान् the, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, वालिः Vali, अब्रवीत् said.

11_55.shloka: किं भवन्तस्समस्ताश्च मतङ्गवनवासिनः।मत्समीपमनुप्राप्ता अपि स्वस्ति वनौकसाम्4.11.60।।
11_55.translation: 'Why have you, residents of the groves of Matanga, come to me? Hope all are safe'
11_55.word_by_word: मतङ्गवनवासिनः residents of the groves of Matanga, भवन्तः you, समस्ताः all, किम् why, मत्समीपम् to me, अनुप्राप्ताः came here, वनौकसाम् for all the monkeys, अपि स्वस्ति hope all are safe.

11_56.shloka: ततस्ते कारणं सर्वं तदा शापं च वालिनः।शशंसुर्वानरास्सर्वे वालिने हेममालिने4.11.61।।
11_56.translation: 'Then all the monkeys collected together and narrated everything about the curse given to Vali , adorned with a golden chain(on his neck).
11_56.word_by_word: ततः then, सर्वे all, ते वानराः those monkeys, सर्वम् everything, कारणम् reason, तदा then, वालिनः of Vali, शापं च curse also, हेममालिने to him wearing golden necklace, वालिने to Vali, शशंसुः narrated.

11_57.shloka: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तदा वाली वचनं वानरेरितम्।स महर्षिंतदाऽसाद्य याचते स्म कृताञ्जलिः4.11.62।।
11_57.translation: 'On hearing the monkeys, Vali went to the sage and begged forgiveness with folded hands.
11_57.word_by_word: तदा then, सः वाली that Vali, वानरेरितम् spoken by monkeys, एतत् all that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, कृताञ्जलिः with folded hands, महर्षिम् to the sage, (सम्) आसाद्य having approached, याचते स्म begged.

11_58.shloka: महर्षिस्तमनादृत्य प्रविवेशाश्रमं तदा।शापधारणभीतस्तु वाली विह्वलतां गतः4.11.63।।
11_58.translation: 'The sage went into the hermitage without obliging Vali who became apprehensive of the curse of the sage.
11_58.word_by_word: महर्षिः great sage, तम् him, अनादृत्य without obliging, आश्रमं to the hermitage, तदा then, प्रविवेश entered, वाली Vali, शापधारणभीतः with the fear of hearing the curse, विह्वलताम् agrieved, गतः became.

11_59.shloka: ततश्शापभयाद्भीत ऋश्यमूकं महागिरिम्।प्रवेष्टुं नेच्छति हरिर्द्रष्टुं वापि नरेश्वर4.11.64।।
11_59.translation: 'O Lord Rama because of the fear of the curse, Vali will not enter the great Rishyamuka mountain nor will he like to see it.
11_59.word_by_word: नरेश्वर O Lord Rama, ततः then onwards, हरिः monkeys, शापभयात् for fear of the curse, भीतः frightened, महागिरिम् great mountain, ऋष्यमूकम् Rishyamuka, प्रवेष्टुम् to enter, द्रष्टुं वापि even to see, नेच्छति does not like.

11_60.shloka: तस्याप्रवेशं ज्ञात्वाऽहमिदं राम महावनम्।विचरामि सहामात्यो विषादेन विवर्जितः4.11.65।।
11_60.translation: 'O Rama aware of the prohibition of Vali from entering the place, I roam about this great forest  accompanied by my ministers without any apprehension.
11_60.word_by_word: राम O Rama, अहम् I, तस्य his, अप्रवेशम् entry prohibited, ज्ञात्वा after knowing, विषादेन apprehension, विवर्जितः without, सहामात्यः accompanied by ministers, इदम् this, महावनम् great forest, विचरामि I am roaming about.

11_61.translation: 'Hurled with the pride of his(Vali's) prowess is this heap of bones of Dundubhi here, which shines like a huge mountain peak.
11_61.word_by_word: वीर्योत्सेकात् with pride of prowess, निरस्तस्य thrown away, तस्य दुन्दुभेः Dundubhi's, गिरिकूटोपमो as the mountain peak, महान् huge, एषः this, अस्थिनिचयः heap of bones, सम्प्रकाशते is shining

11_62.shloka: इमे च विपुलास्सालास्सप्त शाखावलम्बिनः।यत्रैकं घटते वाली निष्पत्रयितुमोजसा4.11.67।।
11_62.translation: 'Look at these seven sturdy Sala trees with branches  of one overlapping the other.  Vali was able to remove all the leaves of one Sala tree with just one arrow.
11_62.word_by_word: शाखावलम्बिनः  branches overlapping one another, इमे these, सप्त seven, विपुलाः sturdy, सालाः Sala trees, यत्र there, एकम् one, वाली Vali, ओजसा his own, निष्पत्रयितुम् to remove its leaves, घटते he is competent.

11_63.shloka: एतदस्यासमं वीर्यं मया राम प्रकीर्तितम्।कथं तं वालिनं हन्तुं समरे शक्ष्यसे नृप4.11.68।।
11_63.translation: 'O Rama Vali's strength and fame related by me is unequalled. O king how is it possible for you to kill him in a combat?'
11_63.word_by_word: राम O Rama, अस्य his, असमम् unequalled, एतत् this, वीर्यम् strength, प्रकीर्तितम् is narrated, नृप king, समरे in a combat, तं वालिनम् that Vali's, हन्तुम् to kill, कथम् how is it, शक्ष्यसे it is possible for you?

11_64.shloka: तथा ब्रुवाणं सुग्रीवं प्रहसन् लक्ष्मणोऽब्रवीत्।कस्मिन्कर्मणि निर्वृत्ते श्रद्दध्या वालिनो वधम्4.11.69।।
11_64.translation: Smiling, Lakshmana asked Sugriva, 'By what action will you trust?. By the fulfilment of which task (by Rama) will you have faith?'
11_64.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तथा that way, ब्रुवाणम् while he spoke, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, प्रहसन् with a smile, अब्रवीत् said, कस्मिन् in which, कर्मणि in action, निवृत्ते when carried out, वालिनः Vali's, वधम् killing, श्रद्दध्याः trust

11_65.shloka: तमुवाचाथ सुग्रीवस्सप्त सालानिमान्पुरा।एवमेकैकशो वाली विव्याथाथ स चासकृत्। 4.11.70।।
11_65.translation: Then Sugriva told Lakshmana that earlier Vali had split through these seven Sala trees one after the other, several times.
11_65.word_by_word: अथ then, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तम् him, उवाच said, पुरा earlier, सः वाली that Vali, इमान् these, सप्तसालान् seven sala trees, एवम् in this way, एकैकशः one after the other, अथ then, असकृत् several times, विव्याध struck.

11_66.shloka: रामोऽपिदारयेदेषां बाणेनैकेन च द्रुमम्।वालिनं निहतं मन्ये दृष्ट्वा रामस्य विक्रमम्4.11.71।।
11_66.translation: 'If I see Rama splitting these trees with one arrow, I will believe he can kill Vali with his prowess.
11_66.word_by_word: रामः Rama, अपि also, एषाम् these, द्रुमम् trees, एकेन with one, बाणेन with arrow, दारयेत् pierce through(split), रामस्य Rama's, विक्रमम् prowess, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, वालिनम् Vali, निहतम् killing, मन्ये I think, अपि also.

11_67.shloka: हतस्य महिषस्यास्थि पादेनैकेन लक्ष्मण।उद्यम्याथ प्रक्षिपेच्चेत्तरसा द्वे धनुश्शते4.11.72।।
11_67.translation: 'O Lakshmana and if Rama can also lift the dead buffalo's (Dundubhi's) skeleton and hurl it to a distance  of two hundred bows with one of his feet.
11_67.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण  Lakshmana, हतस्य of the dead, महिषस्य buffalo's, अस्थि skeleton, एकेन by one, पादेन by the foot, उद्यम्य lifted, तरसा with his strength, द्वेधनुः शते a distance of eight hundred hands (distance of two hundred bows), प्रक्षिपेच्चापि if he can also hurl.

11_68.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु सुग्रीवो रामं रक्तान्तलोचनम्।ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तं काकुत्स्थं पुनरेव वचोऽब्रवीत्4.11.73।।
11_68.translation: Having said this and thinking for a moment, Sugriva again said to the heroic Rama whose eyes had turned red.
11_68.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, रक्तान्तलोचनम् with reddened eyes, रामम् Rama, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा havingspoken, मुहूर्तम् for a moment after, ध्यात्वा thinking, काकुत्स्थम् Rama, पुनरेव again, वचः these words, अब्रवीत् said.

11_69.shloka: शूरश्च शूरघाती च प्रख्यातबलपौरुषः।बलवान्वानरो वाली संयुगेष्वपराजितः4.11.74।।
11_69.translation: 'Powerful Vali is valiant and has killed brave fighters. He is wellknown for his prowess and valour. He has not faced defeat in war.
11_69.word_by_word: शूरश्च hero, शूरघाती च killer of heroes, प्रख्यातबलपौरुषः wellknown for prowess and valour, बलवान् powerful, वानरः वाली monkey Vali, संयुगेषु in combat, अपराजितः unconquered.

11_70.shloka: दृश्यन्ते चास्य कर्माणि दुष्कराणि सुरैरपि।यानि सञ्चिन्त्य भीतोऽहमृश्यमूकं समाश्रितः4.11.75।।
11_70.translation: 'Even gods cannot do what he has done. Thinking of all this and being afraid of him, I have taken refuge at Rishyamuka.
11_70.word_by_word: सुरैरपि even by gods, दुष्कराणि difficult, तस्य his, कर्माणि tasks, दृश्यन्ते are seen(all over), यानि all those, सञ्चिन्त्य thinking of, भीतः fear, अहम् I, ऋष्यमूकम् at Rishyamuka, उपाश्रितः I have taken refuge.

11_71.translation: 'Thinking that this indignant, invincible lord of the monkeys, cannot be overpowered, I have not stepped out of Rishyamuka.
11_71.word_by_word: तम् him, वानरेन्द्रम् lord of monkeys, अजय्यम् invincible, अधृष्यम् one who can not be overpowered, अमर्षणम् indignant, विचिन्तयन् while thinking over, अहम् I, ऋष्यमूकम् Rishyamuka, न मुञ्चामि I have not left, इयम this.

11_72.word_by_word: (अहम् I), उद्विग्नः agitated, शङ्कितः frightened, अनुरक्तैः who are devoted to me, वरैः excellent, हनुमत्प्रमुखैः by Hanuman and others, अमात्यैः with ministers, सह along with, महावने in this great forest, विचरामि I am roaming.

11_73.shloka: उपलब्धं च मे श्लाघ्यं सन्मित्रं मित्रवत्सल।त्वामहं पुरुषव्याघ्र हिमवन्तमिवाश्रितः4.11.78।।
11_73.translation: 'I have discovered in you a faithful friend. O tiger among men, O venerable one, you are to me like the Himalayas.
11_73.word_by_word: श्लाघ्यम् praiseworthy, सन्मित्रम् a good friend, मे to me, उपलब्धम् Is obtained, मित्रवत्सल O loyal to friends, पुरुषव्याघ्र tiger among men, अहम् I am, हिमवन्तमिव like the Himalaya, त्वाम् you, आश्रितः seek your protection.

11_74.shloka: किं तु तस्य बलज्ञोऽहं दुर्भ्रातुर्बलशालिनः।अप्रत्यक्षं तु मे वीर्यं समरे तव राघव4.11.79।।
11_74.translation: 'What to do? I know the strength of my mighty bad brother. But so far I have not seen your power in a battle.
11_74.word_by_word: किं तु but, अहम् I, बलशालिनः  mighty, दुर्भ्रातुः bad brother's, तस्य his, बलज्ञः know his strength, राघव Rama, समरे in war, तव your, वीर्यं तु power also, मे I, अप्रत्यक्षम् not see.

11_75.shloka: न खल्वहं त्वां तुलये नावमन्ये न भीषये।कर्मभिस्तस्य भीमैस्तु कातर्यं जनितं मम4.11.80।।
11_75.translation: 'The dreadful acts of Vali have made me feel timid. This is not to compare you with him or your strength with his or insult you and scare you.
11_75.word_by_word: अहम् I am, त्वाम् your, न खलु तुलये indeed do not compare, नावमन्ये I do not insult you, न भीषये  not to scare , तस्य his, भीमैः by dreadful, कर्मभिः by his actions, मम  in me, कातर्यम् cowardice, जनितम् is created.

11_76.shloka: कामं राघव ते वाणी प्रमाणं धैर्यमाकृतिः।सूचयन्ति परं तेजो भस्मच्छन्नमिवानलम्4.11.81।।
11_76.translation: 'Rama  your word and your courage indicate your supreme strength which is like fire covered with ashes.'
11_76.word_by_word: राघव Rama, ते you, वाणी word, प्रमाणम् evidence, धैर्यम् courage, आकृतिः appearance, भस्मच्छन्नम् covered with ashes, आनलम् इव like fire, परम् supreme, तेजः strength, सूचयन्ति indicate, कामम् no doubt.

11_77.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।स्मितपूर्वमथो रामः प्रत्युवाच हरिं प्रभुः4.11.82।।
11_77.translation: Having heard the great Sugriva, Rama replied with a gentle smile:
11_77.word_by_word: रामः Rama, महात्मनः great soul, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य that Sugriva's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अथ then, हरिं प्रति seeing Sugriva, स्मितपूर्वम् smiling gently, प्रत्युवाच  replied.

11_78.shloka: यदि न प्रत्ययोऽस्मासु विक्रमे तव वानर।प्रत्ययं समरे श्लाघ्यमहमुत्पादयामि ते4.11.83।।
11_78.translation: 'If you have no confidence in my strength in fight, O monkey, I will create it in you so much so that you will admire it.'
11_78.word_by_word: वानर monkey, विक्रमे in valour, अस्मासु in us, तव to you, प्रत्ययः faith, न यदि if not, अहम् I, समरे in combat, श्लाघ्यम् praiseworthy, प्रत्ययम् confidence, ते to you, उत्पादयामि create.

11_79.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु सुग्रीवं सान्त्वं लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः।राघवो दुन्दुभेः कायं पादाङ्गुष्ठेन लीलया4.11.84।।तोलयित्वा महाबाहुश्चिक्षेप दशयोजनम्।असुरस्य तनुं शुष्कं पादाङ्गुष्ठेन वीर्यवान्4.11.85।।
11_79.translation: Rama,the mighty elder brother of Lakshmana, having said so to Sugriva in a pleasing manner, lifted the dried body of Dundubhi easily with his toe, shook it and flung it with ease to a distance of ten yojanas.
11_79.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणाग्रजः Lakshmana's elder brother, महाबाहुः longarmed one, वीर्यवान् mighty, राघवः Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, सान्त्वं In a pleasing way, दुन्दुभेः Dundubhi's, कायम् body, लीलया easily, पादाङ्गुष्ठेन with the toe, तोलयित्वा lifting, असुरस्य demon's, शुष्काम् dried, तनुम् body, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, चिक्षेप flung

11_80.shloka: क्षिप्तं दृष्ट्वा ततः कायं सुग्रीवः पुनरब्रवीत्।लक्ष्मणस्याग्रतो राममिदं वचनमर्थवत्4.11.86।।
11_80.translation: Having seen Rama flinging the body, Sugriva said to him again in the presence of Lakshmanameaningfully:
11_80.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, क्षिप्तम् the thrown, कायम् body, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, ततः then, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said, अर्थवत्  meaningful, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, अग्रतः In the presence.

11_81.shloka: आर्द्रस्समांसः प्रत्यग्रः क्षिप्तः कायः पुरा सखे4.11.87।।लघुस्सम्प्रति निर्मांस स्तृणभूतश्च राघव।परिश्रान्तेन मत्तेन भ्रात्रा मे वालिना तदा4.11.88।।क्षिप्तमेवं प्रहर्षेण भवता रघुनन्दन।
11_81.translation: 'O friend, when Vali my brother flung the body, he was tired and intoxicated and the body was fresh with flesh (meaning heavy), but now, O Delight of the Raghu race, it is fleshless and light like a bunch of (dry) grass (for) which you could throw it playfully.
11_81.word_by_word: सखे friend, तदा that time, परिश्रान्तेन by the tired, मत्तेन by the intoxicated, मे भ्रात्रा  by my brother, वालिना by Vali, पुरा earlier, आर्द्रः wet, समांसः with flesh, प्रत्यग्रः fresh, कायः body, क्षिप्तः flung, रघुनन्दन O delight of the Raghu race, राघव Raghava, सम्प्रति now, लघुः light, निर्मांसः without flesh, तृणभूतश्च like a bunch of grass, प्रहर्षेण playfully, भवता by you, एवम् this, क्षिप्तम् flung.

11_82.shloka: नात्र शक्यं बलं ज्ञातुं तव वा तस्य वाऽधिकम्।आर्द्रं शुष्कमिति ह्येतत्सुमहद्राघवान्तरम्4.11.89।।
11_82.translation: 'I was unable to gauge whether your strength is more  than his (Vali's) since there is a great difference between a dry body and a wet one.
11_82.word_by_word: अत्र here (in this case), तव your, बलम् strength, अधिकं वा is more  or, तस्य वा or his, ज्ञातुम् to know, न शक्यम् not able, राघव Rama, आर्द्रम् wet, शुष्कमिति dried, एतत् this, सुमहत् great, अन्तरं हि difference.

11_83.shloka: स एव संशयस्तात तव तस्य च यद्बले4.11.90।।सालमेकं तु निर्भिद्या भवेद्व्यक्तिर्बलाबले।
11_83.translation: 'O Dear, therefore, I have my doubt about your relative strength. If you can split a sala tree with a single arrow then can your strength or weakness be demonstrated.
11_83.word_by_word: तात O dear, तव your, तस्य च and his, यत् such, बले strength, स एव that alone, संशयः  doubt, एकम् one, सालम् Sala tree, निर्भिद्य after splitling through, व्यक्तिः demonstrated, भवेत् will be known, बलाबले strength or otherwise.

11_84.shloka: कृत्वेदं कार्मुकं सज्यं हस्तिहस्त मिवाततम्4.11.91।।आकर्णपूर्णमायम्य विसृजस्व महाशरम्।
11_84.translation: 'Now string your bow, draw it like the trunk of an elephant up to your ear and release the great arrow.
11_84.word_by_word: आततम् stretched, हस्तिहस्तमिव like the elephant's trunk, एतत् that, कार्मुकम् bow, सज्यम् strung(tie it with string), कृत्वा after doing, आकर्णपूर्णम् drawing it (the string) to the ear, आयम्य after stretching, महाशरम् great arrow, विसृजस्व release.

11_85.shloka: इमं हि सालं सहित स्त्वया शरोन संशयोऽत्रास्ति विदारयिष्यति।अलं विमर्शेन मम प्रियं ध्रुवंकुरुष्व राजात्मज शापितो मया4.11.92।।
11_85.translation: 'It will be enough and my doubt will be cleared. If you can pierce the sala tree with your arrow it will be my pleasure and not a test of your strength.
11_85.word_by_word: राजन् king, त्वया your, प्रहितः good, शरः arrow, इमं सालम् this sala tree, विदारयिष्यति will pierce through, अत्र then, संशयः doubt, नास्ति will not be there, विमर्शेन clear, अलम् enough, ध्रुवम् certainly, मम to me, प्रियम् gladden, कुरुष्व do, मया my, प्रतिशापितः not to test you.

11_86.shloka: यथा हि तेजस्सु वरस्सदा रविर्यथा हि शैलो हिमवान्महाद्रिषु।यथा चतुष्पात्सु च केसरी वरस्तथा नरणामसि विक्रमे वरः4.11.93।।
11_86.translation: 'Just as the Sun is the best among the brilliant, the Himalayas among the great mountains, the lion among the quadrupeds, so also you are the best among men of valour.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends  the eleventh sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.
11_86.word_by_word: तेजस्सु among the brilliant, रविः Sun, यथा as, वरः best, महाद्रिषु among the great mountains, हिमवान् शैलः Himalaya mountain, यथा as, चतुष्पात्सु among the quadrupeds, केसरी lion, यथा as, वरः best, तथा similarly, नराणाम् among men, विक्रमे in valour, वरः best, असि you are.
