12_1.shloka: [Rama demonstrates his prowess in shooting -- Sugriva fails in the first combat with Vali -- Rama explains the difficulty in identifying Vali -- advises Sugriva to wear Gajapushpi creeper to help him identify -- once again Sugriva proceeds to encounter Vali ]एतच्च वचनं श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवेण सुभाषितम्।प्रत्ययार्थं महातेजा रामो जग्राह कार्मुकम्4.12.1।।
12_1.translation: Having heard Sugriva's pleasing words, the brilliant Rama took up the bow in order to inspire confidence in Sugriva.
12_1.word_by_word: महातेजाः effulgent, रामः Rama, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, सुभाषितम् good words, एतत् this, श्रुत्वा on hearing, प्रत्ययार्थम्  to create faith, कार्मुकम् bow, जग्राह took up.

12_2.shloka: स गृहीत्वा धनुर्घोरं शरमेकं च मानदः।सालमुद्दिश्य चिक्षेप ज्यास्वनैः पूरयन्दिशः। 4.12.2।।
12_2.translation: Rama, subduer of the enemy's pride, strung his terrific bow, produced the twang that filled all directions, and discharged a single arrow aimed at the sala tree.
12_2.word_by_word: मानदः subduer of enemy's pride, सः he, घोरम् terrific, धनुः bow, पूरयन् filled, दिशः directions, ज्यास्वनैः by the twang, सालम् sala tree, उद्दिश्य aiming, एकम् single, शरम् arrow, चिक्षेप discharged

12_3.shloka: स विसृष्टो बलवता बाणस्स्वर्णपरिष्कृतः।भित्त्वा सालान् गिरिप्रस्थं सप्त भूमिं विवेश ह4.12.3।।
12_3.translation: Released with great force, Rama's arrow embellished with gold pierced through the seven sala trees and splitting the mountain terrain entered the earth.
12_3.word_by_word: बलवता forcefully, विसृष्टः released, स्वर्णपरिष्कृतः decorated with gold, सः बाणः that arrow, सप्त seven, सालान् sala trees, गिरिप्रस्थम् pierced through the mountain terrain, भित्त्वा onsplitting, भूमिम् into the earth, विवेश ह entered.

12_4.shloka: प्रविष्टश्च मुहूर्तेन धरां भित्त्वा महाजवः।निष्पत्य च पुनस्तूर्णं स्वतूणीं प्रविवेश ह4.12.4।।
12_4.translation: In a moment the arrow emerged from the earth which it pierced and reentered the quiver with great speed.
12_4.word_by_word: महाजवः of great speed, सायकस्तु the arrow, मुहूर्तेन in a moment, सालान् sala trees, भित्त्वा  split, निष्पत्य emerging forth, तम् its, स्वतूणीमेव from his quiver, पुनः again, प्रविवेश ह returned

12_5.shloka: तान्दृष्ट्वा सप्त निर्भिन्नान्सालान्वानरपुङ्गवः।रामस्य शरवेगेन विस्मयं परमं गतः4.12.5।।
12_5.translation: The chief of the monkeys was struck with wonder seeing Rama's arrow piercing through  the seven sala trees so swiftly.
12_5.word_by_word: वानरपुङ्गवः chief of monkeys, निर्भिन्नान् split through, तान् those, सप्त seven, सालान् sala trees, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, रामस्य Rama's, शरवेगेन by the speed of his arrow, परमम् highly, विस्मयम् wonderstruck, गतः became.

12_6.shloka: स मूर्ध्ना न्यपतदभ्मौ प्रलम्बीकृतभूषणः।सुग्रीवः परमप्रीतो राघवाय कृताञ्जलिः4.12.6।।
12_6.translation: Sugriva was immensely happy and offered obeisance to Rama with folded hands and bowed down and prostrated while his ornaments touched the ground.
12_6.word_by_word: परमप्रीतः highly pleased, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, राघवाय to Rama, कृताञ्जलिः offered obeisance with folded hands, प्रलम्बीकृतभूषणः ornaments hanging down, मूर्ध्ना forehead, भूमौ on the ground, न्यपतत् prostrated.

12_7.shloka: इदं चोवाच धर्मज्ञं कर्मणा तेन हर्षितः।रामं सर्वास्त्रविदुषां श्रेष्ठं शूरमवस्थितम्4.12.7।।
12_7.translation: Sugriva who stood by, elated to watch the deed of Rama, best among the valiant, proficient in the use of arms of all kinds and knower of dharma, said:
12_7.word_by_word: तेन by that, कर्मणा by the deed, हर्षितः he felt glad, धर्मज्ञम् the knower of dharma, सर्वास्त्रविदुषाम् among the proficient in the use of arms, श्रेष्ठं the best one, शूरम् valiant, अवस्थितम् who stood there, रामम् at Rama, इदम् this, उवाच च and spoke.

12_8.shloka: सेन्द्रानपि सुरान्सर्वांस्त्वं बाणैः पुरुषर्षभ।समर्थस्समरे हन्तुं किं पुन र्वालिनं प्रभो 4.12.8।।
12_8.translation: 'O bull among men, O lord, you are capable of killing with your arrows even the gods including Indra in the battle, what to speak of Vali.
12_8.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ O best among men, प्रभो O lord, त्वम् you, समरे in war, सेन्द्रान् including Indra, सर्वान् all, सुरान् अपि even gods, हन्तुम् to kill, समर्थः are capable, वालिनम् Vali, किं पुनः what to speak of again.

12_9.shloka: येन सप्तमहासाला गिरिर्भूमिश्च दारिताः।बाणेनैकेन काकुत्स्थ स्थाता ते को रणाग्रतः4.12.9।।
12_9.translation: 'O Rama who can in a battle confront you, capable of splitting seven huge sala trees, the mountain and the earth with a single arrow?
12_9.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, येन by such a person, एकेन बाणेन with a single arrow, सप्त seven, महासालाः great sala trees, गिरिः mountain, भूमिश्च even earth, दारिताः pierced, ते to  you, रणाग्रतः in the forefront of the battle, कः who, स्थाता can stand.

12_10.shloka: अद्य मे विगतश्शोकः प्रीतिरद्य परा मम।सुहृदं त्वां समासाद्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमम्4.12.10।।
12_10.translation: 'Having found a friend in you comparable to Indra and Varuna, my grief is gone and I am so happy now.
12_10.word_by_word: अद्य now, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमम् comparable to Indra and Varuna, त्वाम् you, सुहृदम् friend, समासाद्य after getting, मे to me, शोकः sorrow, विगतः is gone, अद्य now, मम my, परा supreme, प्रीतिः pleasure.

12_11.shloka: तमद्यैव प्रियार्थं मे वैरिणं भ्रातृरूपिणम्।वालिनं जहि काकुत्स्थ मया बद्धोऽयमञ्जलिः4.12.11।।
12_11.translation: 'O Rama, for my pleasure kill Vali who is, to me, an enemy in the guise of a brother. I fold my hands to you.
12_11.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, मे my, भ्रातृरूपिणम् in the form of a brother, वैरिणम् enemy, तं वालिनम्  that Vali, अद्यैव now itself, प्रियार्थम् for my pleasure, जहि you may kill, मया by me, अयम् this, अञ्जलि: reverential obeisance, बद्धः offered.

12_12.shloka: ततो रामः परिष्वज्य सुग्रीवं प्रियदर्शनम्।प्रत्युवाच महाप्राज्ञो लक्ष्मणानुगतं वचः4.12.12।।
12_12.translation: Then wise Rama embraced handsome Sugriva and replied in these words which were agreeable to Lakshmana:
12_12.word_by_word: ततः then, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, रामः Rama, प्रियदर्शनम् handsome, लक्ष्मणानुगतम् following Lakshmana, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, परिष्वज्य having embraced, वचः these words, प्रत्युवाच said in reply.

12_13.shloka: अस्माद्गच्छेम किष्किन्धां क्षिप्रं गच्छ त्वमग्रतः।गत्वा चाह्वय सुग्रीव वालिनं भ्रातृगन्धिनम्4.12.13।।
12_13.translation: 'O Sugriva, get ready at once. We will promptly proceed to Kishkinda from here. Go ahead and challenge Vali, your brother only in name, to a combat.'
12_13.word_by_word: सुग्रीव Sugriva, क्षिप्रम् at once, अस्मात् from here, किष्किन्थाम् to Kishkinda, गच्छेम will go, त्वम् you, क्षिप्रम् at once, अग्रतः forward, गच्छ go, गत्वा on going, भ्रातृगन्धिनम् a brother for name's sake, वालिनम् Vali, आह्वय invite.

12_14.shloka: सर्वे ते त्वरितं गत्वा किष्किन्धां वालिनः पुरीम्।वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य व्यतिष्ठन्गहने वने4.12.14।।
12_14.translation: Thay all rushed to Kishkinda, the capital of Vali and waited in the thick forest behind the trees.
12_14.word_by_word: ते सर्वे they all, वालिनः Vali's, पुरीम् capital, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, त्वरितम् quickly, गत्वा went, गहने dense, वने forest, वृक्षैः with trees, आत्मानम् themselves, अवृ़त्य after covering, अतिष्ठन् stayed.

12_15.translation: Sugriva tightened up his waist cloth hurriedly and roared terrifically as though piercing the sky. And screamed  for Vali.
12_15.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, गाढं tightly, परिहितः tightened the cloth around waist, वेगात् with speed, नादैः by roaring, अम्बरम् sky, भिन्दन्निव as if piercing the sky, वालिनः Vali's, ह्वानकारणात् to call out, घोरम् terrific, व्यनदत् screamed.

12_16.shloka: तं श्रुत्वा निनदं भ्रातुः क्रुद्धो वाली महाबलः।निश्चक्राम सुसंरब्धो भास्करोऽस्ततटादिव4.12.16।।
12_16.translation: On hearing his brother roaring, powerful Vali was enraged and rushed like the Sun from behind the western shore of the ocean (this simile suggests the downfall of Vali).
12_16.word_by_word: महाबलः powerful, वाली Vali, भ्रातुः brother's, तं निनदम्  roaring, श्रुत्वा  hearing, क्रुद्धः enraged, सुसंरब्धः overwhelmed, अस्ततटात् from behind the western bank of the ocean, भास्करः Sun, यथा like, निष्पपात came out.

12_17.translation: Then a tumultuous combat took place between Vali and Sugriva who looked like the planets Mercury and Mars.
12_17.word_by_word: ततः then, वालिसुग्रीवयोः for Vali and Sugriva, बुधाङ्गारकयोः between Budha                (Mercury) and Angaraka (Mars), ग्रहयोरिव like the planets, सुतुमुलम् tumultous, युद्धम् war, अभूत् took place.

12_18.translation: The brothers, insensate with fury, struck each other like thunder with their palms, soles  and fists in the combat.
12_18.word_by_word: क्रोधमूर्छितौ senseless with fury, भ्रातरौ brothers, अशनिकल्पैः like thunder, तलैः with palms soles, वज्रकल्पैः like thunderbolts, मुष्टिभिः with fists, समरे in the combat, अन्योन्यम् each other, जघ्नतुः struck.

12_19.shloka: ततो रामो धनुष्पाणिस्तावुभौ समुदीक्ष्यतु।अन्योन्यसदृशौ वीरावुभौ देवाविवाश्विनौ4.12.19।।
12_19.translation: Bow in hand, Rama watched both the heroes who resembled the twin Aswini Kumaras.
12_19.word_by_word: ततः then, धनुष्पाणिः wielder of bow, रामः Rama, देवौ two deities, अश्विनौ इव like the twin Aswini Kumaras, अन्योन्यसदृशौ both of them similar in looks, तौ they, उभौ both, वीरौ the two heroes, समुदीक्ष्यतु  watched

12_20.shloka: यन्नावगच्छत्सुग्रीवं वालिनं वापि राघवः।ततो न कृतवान्बुद्धिं मोक्तुमन्तकरं शरम्4.12.20।।
12_20.translation: Since Rama was not able to distinguish between Vali and Sugriva, he could not decide whether he should discharge his deadly arrow .
12_20.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, वालिनं वापि or Vali, यत् such and such, नावगच्छत् not able to distinguish, ततः then, अन्तकरम् deadly, शरम् arrow, मोक्तुम् to discharge, बुद्धिम् intellect, न कृतवान्  not made.

12_21.translation: Discomfited  by Vali, and not seeing Rama around, Sugriva ran towards Rishyamuka mountain.
12_21.word_by_word: एतस्मिन् अन्तरे in the mean while, तेन वालिना by Vali, भग्नः discomfited, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, नाथम्  lord, राघवम् Rama, अपश्यन् not finding, ऋश्यमूकम् to Rishyamuka, प्रदुद्रुवे ran.

12_22.translation: Exhausted, disfigured and body mauled and drenched in blood all over, Sugriva, chased by the infuriated Vali, entered the region of  great sage Matanga.
12_22.word_by_word: वालिना by Vali, क्रोधात् angry, अभिद्रुतः chased, क्लान्तः exhausted, रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गः body drenched in blood, प्रहारैः with strokes, जर्झरीकृतः mauled, महावनम् great grove (of Matanga), प्रविवेश entered.

12_23.shloka: तं प्रविष्टं वनं दृष्ट्वा वाली शापभयार्दितः।मुक्तो ह्यसि त्वमित्युक्त्वा स निवृत्तो महाद्युतिः4.12.23।।
12_23.translation: Effulgent Vali saw Sugriva entering the (prohibited) grove and turned back due to the fear of the curse (of sage Matanga) saying, 'You have escaped'.
12_23.word_by_word: वनम् grove, प्रविष्टम् entered, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, महाद्युतिः effulgent, वाली Vali, त्वम् you, मुक्तः असि हि you have escaped, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, शापभयात् by the fear of the curse, ततः then, निवृत्तः returned.

12_24.shloka: राघवोऽसि सह भ्रात्रा सह चैव हनूमता।तदेव वनमागच्छत्सुग्रीवो यत्र वानरः4.12.24।।
12_24.translation: Rama together with Lakshmana and Hanuman also arrived at the same gave where  Sugriva was.
12_24.word_by_word: राघवोऽपि Rama too, भ्रात्रा सह along with brother, हनूमता च सह also with Hanuman, वानरः Vanara, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, यत्र where, तत् that, वनमेव to the grove, आगच्छत् arrived.

12_25.translation: At the sight of Rama accompanied by Lakshmana, Sugriva felt ashmed and aggrieved, and looking down on the ground, said:
12_25.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, आगतम् coming in, सहलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, तं रामम् that Rama, दृष्ट्वा seeing, ह्रीमान् ashamed, वसुधाम् ground, अवलोकयन् looking down , दीनम्  piteously, इदम् this, उवाच spoke.

12_26.shloka: आह्वयस्वेति मामुक्त्वा दर्शयित्वा च विक्रमम्।वैरिणा घातयित्वा च किमिदानीं त्वया कृतम्4.12.26।।
12_26.translation: 'You demonstrated your prowess and directed me to challenge Vali and then why did you make the enemy hit me thus?
12_26.word_by_word: आह्वयस्व asked me to declare, इति thus, माम् me, उक्त्वा after telling, विक्रमम् prowess, दर्शयित्वा having demonstrated, वैरिणा by the enemy, घातयित्वा  had hit me, त्वया  by you, इदानीम् this way, किं कृतम् why did you do?

12_27.shloka: तामेन वेलां वक्तव्यं त्वया राघव तत्त्वतः।वालिनं न निहन्मीति ततो नाहमितो व्रजे4.12.27।।
12_27.translation: 'Had you, in fact, told me that you were not going to kill Vali, I would not have budged from this place.'
12_27.word_by_word: राघव Rama, तां वेलामेव at that time, त्वया by you, वालिनम् Vali, न निहन्मि I will not kill, इति thus, तत्त्वतः truly, वक्तव्यम् should have been said, ततः then, अहम् I, इतः from this place, न व्रजे would not have gone.

12_28.shloka: तस्य चैवं ब्रुवाणस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।करुणं दीनया वाचा राघवः पुनरब्रवीत्4.12.28।।
12_28.translation: On hearing the great Sugriva's miserable and moving words, Rama again said:
12_28.word_by_word: महात्मनः great soul, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, दीनया a piteous, वाचा by word, करुणम् compasionately, एवम् in that manner, ब्रुवाणस्य while he spoke, राघवः Rama, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said.

12_29.shloka: सुग्रीव श्रूयातां तात क्रोधश्च व्यपनीयताम्।कारणं येन बाणोऽयं न मया स विसर्जितः4.12.29।।
12_29.translation: 'O dear Sugriva dispel your anger and listen to me why I had not released the arrow.
12_29.word_by_word: तात O dear, सुग्रीव Sugriva, येन why, सः अयम् this, बाणः arrow, मया by me, न विसर्जितः not released, कारणम् reason, श्रूयताम् listen to me, क्रोधः anger, व्यपनीयतां च dispel.

12_30.shloka: अलङ्कारेण वेषेण प्रमाणेन गतेन च।त्वं च सुग्रीव वाली च सदृशौ स्थः परस्परम्4.12.30।।
12_30.translation: 'O Sugriva in form, ornaments and movements there is perfect resemblance between you and Vali.
12_30.word_by_word: सुग्रीव Sugriva, अलङ्कारेण in personal embelishment, वेषेण in form, प्रमाणेन in appearance, गतेन च in your movements, त्वं च your, वाली च and Vali, परस्परम् to each other, सदृशौ both similar, स्थः are.

12_31.shloka: स्वरेण वर्चसा चैव प्रेक्षितेन च वानर।विक्रमेण च वाक्यैश्च व्यक्तिं वां नोपलक्षये4.12.31।।
12_31.translation: 'O monkey in your voice, in brightness, in looks, in valour or in words I have marked no difference between you.
12_31.word_by_word: वानर monkey, स्वरेण in voice, वर्चसा चैव or in splendour, प्रेक्षितेन in looks, विक्रमेण च in valour, वाक्यैश्च in talk, वाम् between the two, व्यक्तिम् difference, नोपलक्षये I have not seen.

12_32.shloka: ततोऽहं रूपसादृश्यान्मोहितो वानरोत्तम।नोत्सृजामि महावेगं शरं शत्रुनिबर्हणम्4.12.32।।
12_32.translation: 'O distinguished monkey you both are so similar in form that I was puzzled and did not release my swift arrow that could have destroyed the enemy.
12_32.word_by_word: वानरोत्तम distinguished monkey, ततः then, रूपसादृश्यात् similar appearance, मोहितः bewildered, अहम् I was, महावेगम् swift, शत्रुनिबर्हणम् that which can destroy enemy, शरम्arrow, नोत्सृजामि I have not let loose.

12_33.shloka: जीवितान्तकरं घोरं सादृश्यात्तु विशङ्कितः।मूलघातो न नौ स्याद्धि द्वयोरपि कृतो मया4.12.33।।
12_33.translation: 'I was doubtful because of your similar appearance. I thought that I should not strike at the very root of the interests of both of us. Therefore, I did not release the terrific and deadly  arrow.
12_33.word_by_word: सादृश्यात् due to similar appearance, विशङ्कितः I doubted, जीवितान्तकरम् deadly arrow, घोरम् terrific, नौ of us, द्वयोः of both, मूलघातः strike at the root, स्याद्धि may be indeed, मया by myself, न कृतः was not done.

12_34.shloka: त्वयि वीरे विपन्ने हि अज्ञानाल्लाघवान्मया।मौढ्यं च मम बाल्यं च ख्यापितं स्यात्कपीश्वर4.12.34।।
12_34.translation: 'O lord of monkeys I would have betrayed my foolishness and childishness had I exposed you to danger by my ignorance and thoughtlessness.
12_34.word_by_word: वीरे warrior, कपीश्वर O lord of monkeys, अज्ञानात् by ignorance, लाघवात् due to thoughtlessness, त्वयि विपन्ने in your danger, मया by me, मम my, मौढ्यं च folly, बाल्यं च childishness, ख्यापितम् revealed, स्यात् will be.

12_35.shloka: दत्ताभयवधो नाम पातकं महदुच्यते।अहं च लक्ष्मणश्चैव सीता च वरवर्णिनी4.12.35।।त्वदधीना वयं सर्वे वनेऽस्मिन् शरणं भवान्।
12_35.translation: 'It is said that killing a person to whom protection is promised is highly sinful. Lakshmana, darling Sita and me, are under your care and you are our refuge.
12_35.word_by_word: दत्ताभयवधो नाम killing a person after promising protection, महत् great, पातकम् sin, उच्यते itis said to be, अहं च I also, लक्ष्मणश्चैव even Lakshmana, वरवर्णिनी darling, सीता च Sita also, वयं सर्वे all of us, त्वदधीनाः under your care, अस्मिन् in this regard, भवान् you, शरणम् refuge.

12_36.shloka: तस्माद्युध्यस्व भूयस्त्वं मा मा शङ्केश्च वानर4.12.36।।एतन्मुहूर्ते सुग्रीव पश्य वालिनमाहवे।निरस्तमिषुणैकेन वेष्टमानं महीतले4.12.37।।
12_36.translation: 'Therefore, O monkey, go and engage yourself in fight again. Do not suspect me. With this single arrow of mine, in one moment you will see Vali thrown down and rolling on the ground in this combat.
12_36.word_by_word: वानर monkey, तस्मात् therefore, त्वम् you, भूयः again go, युध्यस्व fight, मा मा do not do not, शङ्केश्च you may doubt me, एतन्मुहूर्ते  in one moment, मया by me, आहवे in war, एकेन by a single, बाणेन by arrow, निरस्तम् thrown down, महीतले on the ground, वेष्टमानम्  rolling, वालिनम् Vali, पश्य see.

12_37.shloka: अभिज्ञानं कुरुष्व त्वमात्मनो वानरेश्वर।येन त्वामभिजानीयां द्वन्द्वयुद्धमुपागतम्4.12.38।।
12_37.translation: 'O lord of monkeys while you both are engaged in a duel wear some identification mark by which I can recognise you.
12_37.word_by_word: वानरेश्वर lord of monkeys, द्वन्द्वयुद्धम् duel, उपागतम् has come, त्वाम् you, येन by which,  अभिजानीयाम् I may recognise you, अभिज्ञानम् an identification, आत्मनः you, कुरुष्व may put on.

12_38.shloka: गजपुष्पीमिमां फुल्लामुत्पाट्य शुभलक्षणाम्।कुरु लक्ष्मण कण्ठेऽस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।।4.12.39।।
12_38.translation: 'O Lakshmana this Gajapushpi  in bloom is auspicious. Pluck and fasten it on great Sugriva's neck.'
12_38.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, इमाम् these, फुल्लाम् flowers blossomed, शुभलक्षणाम् auspicious, गजपुष्पीम् Gajapushpi, उत्पाट्य plucking, महात्मनः of the great, अस्य सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, कण्ठे in the neck, कुरु put on.

12_39.shloka: ततो गिरितटे जातामुत्पाट्य कुसुमाकुलाम्।लक्ष्मणो गजपुष्पीं तां तस्य कण्ठे व्यसर्जयत्4.12.40।।
12_39.translation: Then Lakshmana went to the mountain slope, plucked the (creeper with) gajapuspi blossoms and fastened it on the neck of Sugriva.
12_39.word_by_word: ततः then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, गिरितटे on the slope of the mountain, जाताम् growing, कुसुमायुताम् flowering, तां गजपुष्पीम् those gajapushpi blossoms, उत्पाट्य  plucked, तस्य his, कण्ठे on the neck, व्यसर्जयत्  fastened on.

12_40.shloka: स तया शुशुभे श्रीमान् लतया कण्ठसक्तया।मालयेव बलाकानां ससन्ध्य इव तोयदः4.12.41।।
12_40.translation: With the creeper round the neck, Sugriva looked like the raincloud at twilight, adorned by a row of cranes like a garland.
12_40.word_by_word: श्रीमान् lucky, सः Sugriva, कण्ठसक्तया by that on the neck, तया लतय by that creeper, ससन्ध्यः at twilight, तोयदः rain cloud, बलाकानाम् of cranes, मालयेव  like a garland, शुशुभे   glowed.

12_41.shloka: विभ्राजमानो वपुषा रामवाक्यसमाहितः।जगाम सह रामेण किष्किन्थां वालिपालिताम्4.12.42।।
12_41.translation: Radiant Sugriva intent on carrying out Rama's words again went to Kishkinda ruled by Vali.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
12_41.word_by_word: वपुषा with his body, विभ्राजमानः radiant, सः he, रामवाक्यसमाहितः intent on carrying out Rama's instruction, रामेण सह with Rama, जगाम went, पुनः again, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkinda,वालि पालिताम् ruled by Vali.

13_1.shloka: [Nature on the way to Kishkinda -- Sugriva describes the hermitage of the seven sages and the power of their penance]ऋष्यमूकात्स धर्मात्मा किष्किन्धां लक्ष्मणाग्रजः।जगाम सहसुग्रीवो वालिविक्रमपालिताम्4.13.1।।
13_1.translation: Lakshmana's righteous elder brother left Rishyamuka with Sugriva for Kishkinda protected by Vali's valour.
13_1.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, सः he, लक्ष्मणाग्रजः Lakshmana's elder brother, सहसुग्रीवः along with Sugriva, ऋष्यमूकात् Rishyamuka, वालिविक्रमपालिताम् ruled by Vali's valour, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, जगाम went.

13_2.translation: Getting ready to go, Rama took up his great bow and arrows adorned with gold and potent in war looking (dazzling) like the Sun.
13_2.word_by_word: रामः Rama, काञ्चनभूषितम् adorned with gold, महत् great, चापम् bow, समुद्यम्य  getting ready, आदित्यसङ्कशान् radiant as the Sun, रणसाधकान् potent in war, शरान् arrows, गृहीत्वा taking up.

13_3.shloka: अग्रतस्तु ययौ तस्य राघवस्य महात्मनः।सुग्रीवः संहतग्रीवो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः4.13.3।।
13_3.translation: The strongnecked Sugriva and mighty Lakshmana walked in front of the highsouled Rama.
13_3.word_by_word: महात्मनः greatsoul, तस्य राघवस्य that Rama's, अग्रतः in front, संहतग्रीवः strongnecked, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, महाबलः powerful, लक्ष्मणश्च and Lakshmana, ययौ went.

13_4.shloka: पृष्ठतो हनुमान्वीरो नलो नीलश्च वानरः।तारश्चैव महातेजा हरियूथपयूथपः4.13.4।।
13_4.translation: Brave and brilliant Hanuman, Nala, Nila, and Tara among the leaders of the monkeys  walked behind.
13_4.word_by_word: पृष्ठतः behind them, वीरः courageous, हनुमान् Hanuman, नलः Nala, वानरः monkey, नीलश्च and Nila, महातेजाः brilliant, हरियूथपयूथपः the head of monkey leaders, तारश्चैव and  Tara.

13_5.translation: They saw (on the way) trees bent down with the load of flowers, and rivers with pure water flowing into the sea.
13_5.word_by_word: ते they, वीक्षमाणा enjoying the view, पुष्पभारावलम्बिनः bending down due to the weight of the flowers, वृक्षांश्च trees, प्रसन्नाम्बुवहाः carrying pure waters, सागरंगमाः flowing into the sea, सरितः rivers.

13_6.shloka: कन्दराणि च शैलांश्च निर्दराणि गुहास्तथा।शिखराणि च मुख्यानि दरीश्च प्रियदर्शनाः4.13.6।।
13_6.translation: (They saw) beautiful valleys, mountains, caves, prominent peaks with deep caverns.
13_6.word_by_word: कन्दराणि valleys, शैलांश्च mountains, निर्दराणि caverns, तथा similarly, गुहाः caves, मुख्यानि prominent, शिखराणि peaks, प्रियदर्शनाः pleasing to look at, दरीश्च  deep caves.

13_7.translation: Observing on the way delightful lotus buds with leaves like Vaidurya, clear water and full tanks (They moved on).
13_7.word_by_word: मार्गे on the way, पर्णै with leaves, वैदूर्यविमलैः clear like Vaidurya, अकोशकुडमलैः buds, पद्मैश्च and lotuses, शोभितान् beautiful, सजलान् with water, तटाकान् tanks, अवलोकयन् observing

13_8.translation: Ducks, cranes, swans, vanjulas, waterfowls, chakravakas and other birds warbling melodiously.
13_8.word_by_word: कारण्डैः with karandas (ducks), सारसैः with cranes, हंसैः with swans, वञ्जुलैः with vanjulas, जलकुक्कुटैः with water fowls, चक्रवाकैः with chakravakas, तथा similarly, अन्यैः with others, शकुनैः with birds, रुपनादितान् warbling melodiously

13_9.translation: They observed deer feeding on tender grass on the ground around without fear, some standing and some roaming the forest
13_9.word_by_word: मृदुशष्पाङ्कुराहारान् feeding on tender grass, निर्भयान् without fear, वनगोचरान् roaming the forest, स्थलीषु on the ground, सर्वतः all around, चरतः roaming, स्थितान् standing, हरिणान् deer, अपश्यन् saw.

13_10.translation: Observing terrific elephants adorned with white tusks wandering alone destroying the tanks, shattering the banks.
13_10.word_by_word: तटाकवैरिणः destroyers of tanks, शुक्लदन्तविभूषितान् adorned with white tusks, घोरान् terrific, एकचरान् wandering alone, कूलघातिनः destroyers of the banks, द्विरदान् elephants (those that have two tusks).

13_11.translation: (Observing) intoxicated elephants knocking the edges of mountain slopes, elephants resembling (dark) rainbearing clouds, elephants like moving mountains, elephants with dust covered all over the body.
13_11.word_by_word: मत्तान् intoxicated, गिरितटोत्कृष्टान् that were knocking the edges of mountain slopes, जङ्गमान् moving, पर्वतानिव mountainlike, वारिदप्रख्यान् resembling (dark) rainbearing clouds, महीरेणुसमुक्षितान् covered with dust of the earth, वारणान् elephants.

13_12.translation: Following Sugriva faithfully, they proceeded swiftly, observing animals of the forest and birds flying in the sky.
13_12.word_by_word: सुग्रीववशवर्तिनः faithful to Sugriva, वने in the forest, अन्यान् other, वनचरांश्च wild animals, खेचरान् those flying in the sky, विहङ्गमांश्च and birds, पश्यन्तः seeing, त्वरिताः fast, जग्मुः went.

13_13.shloka: तेषां तु गच्छतां तत्र त्वरितं रघुनन्दनः।द्रुमषण्डं वनं दृष्ट्वा रामस्सुग्रीवमब्रवीत्4.13.13।।
13_13.translation: While walking fast, looking at the forest full of trees Rama, the delight of the Raghus said to Sugriva:
13_13.word_by_word: तेषाम् while they, त्वरितम् swiftly, गच्छताम् were going, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghufamily, रामः Rama, तत्र there, द्रुमषण्डवनम्  dense forest dense with trees, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, अब्रवीत् said.

13_14.shloka: एष मेघ इवाकाशे वृक्षषण्डः प्रकाशते।मेघसङ्घातविपुलः पर्यन्तकदलीवृतः4.13.14।।
13_14.translation: 'This cluster of trees surrounded by plantain groves look splendid like a vast collection of clouds in the sky.
13_14.word_by_word: मेघसङ्घातविपुलः vast like a collection of clouds, पर्यन्तकदलीवृतः surrounded by banana plants all over, एषः that, वृक्षषण्डः cluster of trees, आकाशे in the sky, मेघः cloud, इव like, प्रकाशते splendid.

13_15.shloka: किमेतत् ज्ञातुमिच्छामि सखे कौतूहलं हि मे।कौतूहलापनयनं कर्तुमिच्छाम्यहं त्वया4.13.15।।
13_15.translation: 'O friend I wish to know what this is? Could you answer my curiosity?'
13_15.word_by_word: सखे O friend, एतत् this, किम् what, ज्ञातुम् to know, इच्छामि wish, मम mine, कौतूहलम् curiosity, त्वया by you, कौतूहलापनयनम् clear to my curiosity, कर्तुम् do, इच्चामि I wish to.

13_16.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवस्य महात्मनः।गच्छन्नेवाचचक्षेऽथ सुग्रीवस्तन्महद्वनम्4.13.16।।
13_16.translation: On hearing great Rama's words while walking in the extensive forest,  Sugriva startednarrating:
13_16.word_by_word: महात्मनः great soul, तस्य राघवस्य that Raghava's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा hearing, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अथ then, गच्छन्नेव walking, तत् that, महत्  extensive, वनम् forest, आचचक्षे started narrating.

13_17.translation: 'O Raghava this is a hermitage, enchanting with vast gardens and trees bearing sweet fruits, full of tasty roots and water that relieves tiresomeness (of travellers).
13_17.word_by_word: राघव Raghava, उद्यानवनसम्पन्नम् beautiful gardens, स्वादुमूलफलोदकम् tasty roots fruits and water, विस्तीर्णम् vast, एतत् all this, श्रमनाशनम् relieves tiresomeness of wearied people, आश्रमम् hermitage.

13_18.shloka: अत्र सप्तजना नाम मुनय स्संश्रितव्रताः।सप्तैवासन्नधशशीर्षा नियतं जलशायिनः4.13.18।।
13_18.word_by_word: अत्र here, संश्रितव्रताः strict followers of austere practices, नियतम्  highly disciplined, अधःशीर्षाः with head down, जलशायिनः immersed in water, सप्तजनाः नाम called seven ascetics (Saptajana), सप्तैव all the seven, मुनयः ascetics, आसन् were residing.

13_19.translation: 'These seven sages used to live on air and that too once in seven nights. They lived for seven hundred years performing penance with motionlessness and attained heaven along with their bodies.
13_19.word_by_word: सप्तरात्रे on the seventh night, वायुना with air, कृताहाराः as food, अचलवासिनः without motion, सप्तभिः  seven, वर्षशतैः hundred years, सकलेबराः with their bodies, दिवम् heaven, याताः attained.

13_20.translation: 'By virtue of the power of their penance, this hermitage surrounded by a row of trees is impenetrable even for demons and gods including Indra.
13_20.word_by_word: द्रुमप्राकारसंवृतम् surrounded by a row of trees, एवं in this way, आश्रम् hermitage, तेषाम् their, प्रभावानां by virtue of their power of penance, सेन्द्रैः by those including Indra, सुरासुरैरपि gods and demons, सुदुराधर्षम् very difficult to enter.

13_21.shloka: पक्षिणो वर्जयन्त्येतत्तथाऽन्ये वनचारिणः।विशन्ति मोहाद्येऽप्यत्र निवर्तन्ते न ते पुनः4.13.21।।
13_21.translation: 'Birds and wild animals avoid the hermitage and whoever enters there out of ignorance never returns.
13_21.word_by_word: पक्षिणः birds, तथा so also, अन्ये other, वनचारिणः wild animals, एतत् this place, वर्जयन्ति avoid, ये whoever, मोहात् by ignorance, अत्र there, विशन्ति enter, ते they, पुनः again, न निवर्तन्ति do not return.

13_22.shloka: विभूषणरवास्तत्र श्रूयन्ते सकलाक्षराः।तूर्यगीतस्वनाश्चात्र गन्धो दिव्यश्च राघव4.13.22।।
13_22.translation: 'O Rama, one can hear pleasant sounds of jingling ornaments (of nymphs), of songs and windinstruments here. One can inhale divine fragrance, too.
13_22.word_by_word: राघव Rama, अत्र here, सकलाक्षराः all words, विभूषणरवाश्च jingling of ornaments, तूर्यगीतस्वराश्चात्र sounds of songs and windinstruments (instruments that make a sound when wind passes through), श्रूयन्ते heard, दिव्यः divine, गन्धश्च fragrance also.

13_23.shloka: त्रेताग्नयोऽपि दीप्यन्ते दूमो ह्यत्र प्रकाशते।वेष्टयन्निव वृक्षाग्रान्कपोताङ्गारुणो घनः4.13.23।।
13_23.translation: 'The three sacred fires keep burning and the thick smoke they emit resembles the red feet of  pigeons. It shines forth as if enveloping the treetops.
13_23.word_by_word: त्रेताग्नयोऽपि three sacred fires (Dakshinagni, Ahavaniya, Garhapatya fires), दीप्यन्ते shining, वृक्षाग्रान् treetops, वेष्टयन्निव as if enveloping, कपोताङ्गारुणः red like the pigeon's feet, घनः thick,दूमो smoke, एषः this, प्रकाशते हि glows.

13_24.shloka: एते वृक्षाः प्रकाशन्ते धूमसंसक्तमस्तकाः।मेघजालप्रतिच्छन्ना वैढूर्यगिरयो यथा4.13.24।।
13_24.translation: 'These treetops covered with thick smoke glow like mountains of Vaidurya concealed by a cluster of clouds.
13_24.word_by_word: धूमसंसक्तमस्तकाः treetops covered with thick smoke, वृक्षाः trees, मेघजालप्रतिच्छन्नाः concealed by clouds, यथा as, प्रकाशन्ते glowing, वैढूर्य Vaidurya, गिरियः a mountain, एते   appears.

13_25.shloka: कुरु प्रणामं धर्मात्मंस्तेषामुद्दिश्य राघव।लक्ष्मणेव सह भ्रात्रा प्रयन्तस्सयताञ्जलिः4.13.25।।
13_25.translation: 'O rigteous Rama you and your brother Lakshmana humbly offer obeisance to them(sacred hermitage and sages Saptajana) with folded hands and meditate on them.
13_25.word_by_word: धर्मात्मन् O righteous one, राघव Rama, तेषाम् उद्दिश्य contemplating about them, भ्रात्रा  brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, प्रयतः humbly, सयताञ्जलिः with folded hands, प्रणामम् offer obeisance, कुरु do, ताम् them.

13_26.shloka: प्रणमन्ति हि ये तेषां मुनीनां भावितात्मनाम्।न तेषामशुभं किञ्चिच्छरीरे राम दृश्यते4.13.26।।
13_26.translation: 'O Rama, nothing inauspicious happens to them who offer obeisance to those highly spiritual sacred sages.'
13_26.word_by_word: राम Rama, भावितात्मनाम्  sacred souls, तेषाम् मुनीनाम् to those sages, ये whoever, प्रणमन्ति offer obeisance, तेषाम् to them, शरीरे in body, किञ्चित् not even a little, अशुभम् inauspicious, न दृश्यते will not be seen.

13_27.shloka: ततो रामस्सह भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणेन कृताञ्जलिः।समुद्दिश्य महात्मानस्तानृषीनभ्यवादयत्4.13.27।।
13_27.translation: Rama and Lakshmana  offered salutations with folded hands in memory of those great sages, great souls.
13_27.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama, भ्रात्रा with brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, कृताञ्जलिः with folded hands offered obeisance, महात्मानः great souls, तान् them, ऋषीन् समुद्दिश्य thinking of the seers, अभ्यवादयत् saluted.

13_28.shloka: अभिवाद्य तु धर्मात्मा रामो भ्राता च लक्ष्मणः।सुग्रीवो वानराश्चैव जग्मुसंहृष्टमानसाः4.13.28।।
13_28.translation: Righteous Rama, Lakshmana, Sugriva and all the monkeys offered obeisance and proceeded delighted at heart.
13_28.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, रामः Rama, भ्राता brother, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, वानराश्चैव and monkeys, अभिवाद्य  offered obeisance, संहृष्टमानसाः  delighted at heart, जग्मुः went.

13_29.shloka: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं तस्मात्सप्तजनाश्रमात्।ददृशुस्तां दुराधर्षां किष्किन्धां वालिपालिताम्4.13.29।।
13_29.translation: Walking a long distance from the hermitage of the seven seers, they beheld the unassailable Kishkinda ruled by Vali.
13_29.word_by_word: ते they, तस्मात् from there, सप्तजनाश्रमात् the hermitage of seven seers, दूरम् long distance, अध्वानम् path, गत्वा on going, वालिपालिताम् ruled by Vali, दुराधर्षाम् unassailable, तां किष्किन्धाम् that Kishkinda, ददृशुः  beheld

13_30.shloka: ततस्तु रामानुजरामवानराःप्रगृह्य शस्त्राण्युदिताग्र्यतेजसः।पुरीं सुरेशात्मजवीर्यपालितांवधाय शत्रोः पुनरागतास्सह4.13.30।।
13_30.translation: Rama and Lakshmana of fierce lustre, and the monkeys took hold of the weapons to kill the enemy and reached the capital ruled by the valour of Vali, son of Indra.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
13_30.word_by_word: ततः then, उदितोग्रतेजसः possessed of fierce lustre, रामानुजरामवानराः Lakshmana, Rama and the monkeys, शस्त्राणि weapons, प्रगृह्य took, शत्रोः enemy, वधाय to kill, सुरेशात्मजवीर्यपालिताम् ruled by the valour of the son of Indra, पुरीम् capital, पुनः again, इह there, आगताः reached.

14_1.shloka: [Sugriva roars at Vali -- Rama encourages him to challenge Vali, himself hiding behind the tree.]सर्वे ते त्वरितं गत्वा किष्किन्धां वालि पालिताम्।वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य व्यतिष्ठन् गहने वने4.14.1।।
14_1.translation: They all at once went to Kishkinda ruled by Vali and there waited hiding behind the trees in the dense forest.
14_1.word_by_word: सर्वे ते all of them, त्वरितं at once, गत्वा went वालि पालिताम् ruled by Vali, किष्किन्धां Kishkinda, वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य hiding behind the trees, गहने वने in the dense forest, व्यतिष्ठन् waited

14_2.shloka: विचार्य सर्वतो दृष्टिं कानने काननप्रियः।सुग्रीवो विपुलग्रीवः क्रोधमाहारयद्भृशम्4.14.2।।
14_2.translation: Broadnecked Sugriva, a lover of the forest, looked around and flew into a rage.
14_2.word_by_word: काननप्रियः a lover of forest, विपुलग्रीवः broadnecked, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, कानने in the forest, सर्वतः all over, दृष्टिम् sight, विचार्य  extending, भृशम् very, क्रोधम् anger, आहारयत् became.

14_3.shloka: ततस्स निनदं घोरं कृत्वा युद्धाय चाह्वयत्।परिवारैः परिवृतो नादैर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम्4.14.3।।गर्जन्निव महामेघो वायुवेगपुरस्सरः।
14_3.translation: Sugriva, surrounded by his companions, raised his voice as if piercing the sky, roaring like a huge thundering cloud, challenging Vali to a duel.
14_3.word_by_word: परिवारैः with companions, परिवृतः surrounded, ततः then, नादैः with sounds, अम्बरम् sky, भिन्दन्निव as if piercing through, वायुवेगपुरःसरः moving with the speed of wind, गर्जन् while roaring, महामेघ इव like a huge cloud, घोरम् terrific, निनदम् sound, कृत्वा having produced,युद्धाय for the combat, अह्वयत् challenged.

14_4.shloka: अथ बालार्कसदृशो दृप्तसिंहगतिस्तदा4.14.4।।दृष्ट्वा रामं क्रियादक्षं सुग्रीवो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।
14_4.translation: Sugriva, proficient in the performance of any task, one who appeared like the rising Sun and moved like a proud lion, said to Rama:
14_4.word_by_word: अथ then, बालार्कसदृश looking like the rising Sun, दृप्तसिंहगतिः moving like a proud lion, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, क्रियादक्षम् proficient in any task, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तदा then, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

14_5.shloka: हरिवागुरया व्याप्तां तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणाम्।प्राप्ताः स्म ध्वजयन्त्राढ्यां किष्किन्धां वालिनः पुरीम्।।4.14.5।।
14_5.translation: 'We have arrived at Kishkinda, the capital of Vali, decorated with flags and having a glittering golden archway that can be opened mechanically. Teeming with monkeys, it looks like a snare to catch the enemy.
14_5.word_by_word: हरिवागुरया  like a net to catch animals, व्याप्ताम् filled, तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणाम् having a glittering golden archway, ध्वजयन्त्राढ्याम् decorated with the flagstaff operated mechanically, वालिनः Vali's, पुरीम् capital city, किष्किन्धाम् of Kishkinda, प्राप्ताः स्म reached

14_6.shloka: प्रतिज्ञा या त्वया वीर कृता वालिवधे पुरा।सफलां कुरु तां क्षिप्रं लतां काल इवागतः4.14.6।।
14_6.translation: 'O heroic Rama fulfil quickly the vow taken by you earlier to kill Vali in the same way  a creeper bears fruit when the time comes.'
14_6.word_by_word: वीर hero, त्वया by  you, वालिवधे to kill Vali, पुरा earlier, या such, प्रतिज्ञा vow, कृता has been taken, ताम् that one, आगतः came, कालः time, लताम् इव like creeper, क्षिप्रम् at once, सफलाम् successful, कुरु make it.

14_7.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवेण स राघवः।तमेवोवाच वचनं सुग्रीवं शत्रुसूदनः4.14.7।।
14_7.translation: Requested thus by Sugriva, righteous Rama, the destroyer of enemies, replied:.
14_7.word_by_word: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, एवम् that way, उक्तः spoken, धर्मात्मा righteous one, शत्रुसूदनः destroyer of enemies, सः राघवः that Rama, तम् to him, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, वचनम् these words, उवाच spoke.

14_8.shloka: कृताभिज्ञानचिह्नस्त्व मनया गजसाह्वया।लक्ष्मणेन समुत्पाट्य यैषा कण्ठे कृता तव4.14.8।।
14_8.translation: 'Lakshmana has uprooted a creeper of  gaja, and fastened it on your neck by which you can be easily identified.
14_8.word_by_word: या that, एषा this, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, समुत्पाट्य having uprooted, तव your, कण्ठे in the neck, कृता done, अनया by that, गजसाह्वया with the help of Gaja creeper, त्वम् you, कृताभिज्ञानचिह्नः can be easily recognised.

14_9.shloka: शोभसेऽह्यधिकं वीर लतया कण्ठसक्तया।विपरीत इवाकाशे सूर्यो नक्षत्रमालया4.14.9।।
14_9.translation: 'O hero, you are shining with the creeper fastened to your neck , just as the fullmoon adorned with a cluster of stars shines in the sky.
14_9.word_by_word: वीर hero, कण्ठसक्तया  fastened to your neck, लतया by the creeper, आकाशे in the sky, नक्षत्रमालया by the cluster of stars, विपरीतः opposite, सूर्यः इव like the Sun, अधिकम् excessive, शोभसे shining.

14_10.shloka: अद्य वालिसमुत्थं ते भयं वैरं च वानर।एकेनाहं प्रमोक्ष्यामि बाणमोक्षेण संयुगे4.14.10।।
14_10.translation: 'O monkey, with the release of a single arrow in the combat, I shall dispel your fear and enmity (hatred) for Vali.
14_10.word_by_word: वानर O monkey, अद्य now, अहम् I, संयुगे in combat, एकेन by a single, बाणमोक्षेण by the release of an arrow, ते to you, वालिसमुत्थम् caused by Vali, भयम् fear, वैरं च and enmity, प्रमोक्ष्यामि I will dispel

14_11.shloka: मम दर्शय सुग्रीव वैरिणं भ्रातृरूपिणम्।वाली विनिहतो यावद्वने पांसुषु वेष्टते4.14.11।।
14_11.translation: 'O Sugriva show me your enemy,who is in the guise of your brother.He will be killed. He will roll down in the dust of the forest.
14_11.word_by_word: सुग्रीव  O Sugriva, भ्रातृरूपिणम् in the form of brother, वैरिणम् an enemy, मम to me, दर्शय वाली show Vali, विविहतः killed, वने in the forest, पांसुषु in the dust, यावत् चेष्टते before he rolls down.

14_12.shloka: यदि दृष्टिपथं प्राप्तो जीवन्स विनिवर्तते।ततो दोषेण मा गच्छेत्सद्यो गर्हेच्च मा भवान्4.14.12।।
14_12.translation: 'If Vali appears before me I will not let him go with life.Then you will not blame me and find fault with me.
14_12.word_by_word: दृष्टिपथम् sight, प्राप्तः comes, सः he, जीवन् with life, विनिवर्तते यदि if he will return, ततः then, भवान् you, सद्यः now, मा my, दोषेण blame, गच्छेत् may go, माम् me, गर्हेच्च will blame.

14_13.shloka: प्रत्यक्षं सप्त ते साला मया बाणेन दारिताः।तेनावेहि बलेनाद्य वालिनं निहतं मया4.14.13।।
14_13.translation: 'You have seen how I have pierced through seven sala trees with a single arrow. You will know how with the same strength I will kill Vali.'
14_13.word_by_word: ते to you, प्रत्यक्षम् in your presence, मया by me, बाणेन by an arrow, सप्त seven, सालाः sala trees, दारिताः are torn, ततः then, अद्य now, मया by me, वालिनम् Vali, बलेन by strength, निहतम् killed, वेहि you may know.

14_14.shloka: अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे वीर कृच्छ्रेऽपि तिष्टता।धर्मलोभपरीतेन न च वक्ष्ये कथञ्चन4.14.14।।
14_14.translation: 'O Sugriva, I have uttered no falsehood before for fear of deviation from righteousness although I was in distress, nor shall I utter any falsehood in any circumstances hereafter.
14_14.word_by_word: वीर hero, कृच्छ्रे in distress, तिष्ठतापि although subjected, धर्मलोभपरीतेन with the fear of deviating from righteousness, मे from me, अनृतम् a lie, उक्तपूर्वम् earlier, कथञ्चन in any way, न वक्ष्ये I will not speak.

14_15.shloka: सफलां च करिष्यामि प्रतिज्ञां जहि सम्भ्रमम्।प्रसूतं कलमं क्षेत्रे वर्षेणेव शतक्रतुः4.14.15।।
14_15.translation: 'I shall fulfil my promise just as Indra (who performed a hundred sacrifices) helps production in the cornfield through timely rain. Give up your apprehension.
14_15.word_by_word: शतक्रतुः Indra who performed a hundred sacrifices, वर्षेण by rain, प्रसूतम् production, कलमं क्षेत्रम् इव like the cornfield, प्रतिज्ञाम् my promise, सफलाम् will make it fruitful, करिष्यामि I will fulfil, सभ्रमम् apprehension, जहि give up.

14_16.shloka: तदाह्वाननिमित्तं त्वं वालिनो हेममालिनः।सुग्रीव कुरु तं शब्दं निष्पतेद्येन वानरः4.14.16।।
14_16.translation: 'O Sugriva give a warcry so that Vali adorned with a golden garland will come out.
14_16.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तत् that, हेममालिनः adorned with a golden garland, वालिनः Vali, आह्वाननिमित्तं च to invite him, तम् such, शब्दम् sound, कुरु make, येन by which, वानरः monkey, निष्पतेत् will come out.

14_17.shloka: जितकाशी बलश्लाघी त्वया चाधर्षितः पुरा।निष्पतिष्यत्यसङ्गेन वाली स प्रियसंयुगः4.14.17।।
14_17.translation: 'Vali, who is proud of  his valour,  is strong, fearless and fond of combat, will rush out of the city in response to your challenge.
14_17.word_by_word: जितकाशी proud of valour, बलश्लाघी one who praises strength, त्वया by you, अधर्षितः challenged, प्रियसंयुगः fond of battle, सः वाली that Vali, असङ्गेन without any fear, पुरात् from the city, निष्पतिष्यति will rush forward.

14_18.shloka: रिपूणां धर्षिण शूरा मर्षयन्ति न संयुगे।जानन्तस्तु स्वकं वीर्यं स्त्रीसमक्षं विशेषतः4.14.18।।
14_18.translation: 'Proud of their own prowess, heroes will not brook the challenge of foes in battle, specially in the presence of women.'
14_18.word_by_word: स्वकम् their own, वीर्यम् prowess, जानन्तः proud, संयुगे in battle, रिपूणाम् foe's, धर्षितम् roar of challenge, श्रुत्वा on hearing, न मर्षयन्ति not brook, स्त्री समक्षम् in front of women, विशेषतः specially.

14_19.shloka: स तु रामवचश्श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवो हेमपिङ्गलः।ननर्द क्रूरनादेन विनिर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम्4.14.19।।
14_19.translation: On hearing Rama's words, the goldenhued Sugriva roared in a fierce voice as if it would piece  the sky.
14_19.word_by_word: हेमपिङ्गलः goldenhued, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, रामवचः Rama's words, श्रुत्वा on hearing,अम्बरम् sky, विनिर्भिन्दन्निव as if splitting, क्रूरनादेन in fierceful voice, ननर्द roared.

14_20.shloka: तस्य शब्देन वित्रस्ता गावो यान्ति हतप्रभाः।राजदोषपरामृष्टाः कुलस्त्रिय इवाकुलाः4.14.20।।
14_20.translation: Alarmed at the yelling of Sugriva, the cows began to run in all directions, like the  women of noble pedigree who, with their brightness lost, run perplexed for failure of the king to protect their chastity.
14_20.word_by_word: तत्र thereafter, गावः cows, शब्देन by the yelling, वित्रस्ताः were alarmed, हतप्रभाः lost their brightness, राजदोषपरामृष्टाः by the failure of the king, कुलस्त्रियः यथा like the chaste women, आकुलाः much perplexed, यान्ति become.

14_21.shloka: द्रवन्ति च मृगाश्शीघ्रं भग्ना इव रणे हयाः।पतन्ति च खगा भूमौ क्षीणपुण्या इव ग्रहाः4.14.21।।
14_21.translation: The deer were unable to run like wounded horses in a battle. Birds fell down on the ground like planets fall when their merit is exhausted.
14_21.word_by_word: रणे in battle, भग्नाः wounded हयाः इव like the horses, मृगाः deer, शीघ्रम् speedily, द्रवन्ति च unable to run, खगाः birds, क्षीणपुण्याः their merit exhausted, ग्रहाः इव like planets, भूमौ on the ground, पतन्ति च fall.

14_22.translation: Then Sugriva, son of the Sungod, with his lustre enhanced by his valour moved swiftly. His roar resembled the rumbling of a cluster of thundering clouds. He gave a warcry the tone of which resembled the sounds of waves lashed by high velocity winds in the sea.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
14_22.word_by_word: ततः then, जीमूतगणप्रणादः thundering of a cluster of clouds, प्रतीतः quickly, सूर्यात्मजः son of Sungod, शौर्यविवृद्धतेजाः lustre enhanced by valour, अनिलचञ्चलोर्मि: waves lashed by the wind become restless, सरित्पतिर्वा (like the lord of rivers) ocean, त्वरया quick, नादम्  sound, अमुञ्चत् let loose.

15_1.shloka: [Tara suspects Sugriva's intention -- advises Vali to make alliance with Rama -- obstructs Vali from going for war]अथ तस्य निनादं तं सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।शुश्रावान्तः पुर गतो वाली भ्रातुरमर्षणः4.15.1।।
15_1.translation: The indignant Vali, who was in the harem, heard the roaring of his venerable brother, Sugriva.
15_1.word_by_word: अथ then, महात्मनः venerable, भ्रातुः brother, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, तं निनादम् that sound, आन्तःपुरगतः into the inner chambers, अमर्षणः indignant, वाली Vali, शुश्राव heard.

15_2.shloka: श्रुत्वा तु तस्य निनदं सर्वभूतप्रकम्पनम्।मदश्चैकपदे नष्टः क्रोधश्चापतितो महान्4.15.2।।
15_2.translation: The roar (of Sugriva) that frightened all beings gave Vali's vanity a jolt and at once   aroused in him violent rage.
15_2.word_by_word: तस्य his, सर्वभूतप्रकम्पनम् that shook all creatures, निनदम् roar, श्रुत्वा having heard, एकपदे at once, मदः च vanity नष्टः lost, महान्  violent, क्रोधः rage, आपादितश्च was aroused

15_3.shloka: स तु रोषपरीताङ्गो वाली सन्ध्याकनकप्रभः।उपरक्त इवादित्यस्सद्यो निष्प्रभतां गतः4.15.3।।
15_3.translation: Overcome with anger, Vali looked pale like the eclipsed Sun with the golden radiance faded from  his face.
15_3.word_by_word: ततः then, रोषपरीताङ्गःovercome with anger, कनकप्रभः radiant like gold, वालीVali, उपरक्तः eclipsed, आदित्यः इव like the Sun, सद्यःat once, निष्प्रभताम्  pale, गतः became

15_4.translation: Vali, who looked fierce with his teeth and whose eyes shone like a flaming fire through anger looked like a pond with the lotuses and their stalks uprooted.
15_4.word_by_word: दंष्ट्राकरालः of fierce teeth, क्रोधात्  in  anger, दीप्ताग्निसन्निभः like the flaming fire, वाली Vali, उत्पतितपद्मस्तु a pond with uprooted lotuses, समृणालः with the stalks, ह्रदः इव like a pond

15_5.shloka: शब्दं दुर्मर्षणं श्रुत्वा निष्पपात ततो हरिः।वेगेन चरणन्यासैर्दारयन्निव मेदिनीम्4.15.5।।
15_5.translation: Unable to tolerate Sugriva's roar, Vali stepped out hurriedly, taking long strides as if breaking the earth.
15_5.word_by_word: ततः then, हरिः Sugriva, दुर्मर्षणम् intolerable, शब्दम् sound, श्रुत्वा on hearing, वेगेन hurriedly, पदन्यासैः  long strides, मेदिनीम् earth, दारयन्निव as if breaking, निष्पपात rushed out

15_6.shloka: तं तु तारा परिष्वज्य स्नेहाद्दर्शितसौहृदाः।उवाच त्रस्तसम्भ्रान्ता हितोदर्कमिदं वचः4.15.6।।
15_6.translation: Tara, perplexed out of fear, glanced at Vali lovingly, embraced him and gave him wise counsel:
15_6.word_by_word: तारा Tara, तम् him, स्नेहात् with love, परिष्वज्य embraced, दर्शितसौहृदाः glanced lovingly, त्रस्तसम्भ्रान्ता perplexed out of fear, हितोदर्कम् a good counsel, इदं वचः these words, उवाच spoke

15_7.shloka: साधु क्रोधमिमं वीर नदीवेगमिवागतम्।शयनादुत्थितः काल्यं त्यज भुक्तामिव स्रजम्4.15.7।।
15_7.translation: 'O valiant Vali anger has overtaken you like the flood of a river. It is natural for you to be angry at this time, but shake off your anger just as the wise discard a flower  garland already used up.
15_7.word_by_word: वीर valiant Vali, नदीवेगमिव like the flood of river, आगतम् come, इमम् this, क्रोधम् with anger, काल्यम् entertained at this time, शयनात् from bed, उत्थितः got up, भुक्ताम् used up, स्रजमिव like a flower garland, साधु the wise, त्यज give up.

15_8.shloka: काल्यमेतेन सङ्ग्रामं करिष्यसि च वानर।वीर ते शत्रुबाहुल्यं फल्गुता वा न विद्यते4.15.8।।
15_8.translation: 'O monkey fight him only tomorrow morning. By this you are not going to prove your weakness or increase your respect for the enemy.
15_8.word_by_word: वानर monkey, एतेन with him, काल्यम्  tomorrow morning, सङ्ग्रामम् fight, करिष्यसि wish to  wage, वीर hero, ते to you, शत्रुबाहुल्यम् respect enemy more, फल्गुता वा weak also, न विद्यते  not become

15_9.shloka: सहसा तव निष्क्रामो मम तावन्न रोचते।श्रूयतां चाभिधास्यामि यन्निमित्तं निवार्यसे4.15.9।।
15_9.translation: 'I do not like your rashness. I will explain the reason I am preventing you. Listen:
15_9.word_by_word: सहसा rashly, तव you, निष्क्रामः exit, मम for me, न रोचते तावम् do not feel good, यन्निमित्तम् for what reason, निवार्यसे you are prevented, अभिधास्यामि I will explain, श्रूयताम् listen.

15_10.shloka: पूर्वमापतितः क्रोधात्स त्वामाह्वयते युधि।निष्पत्य च निरस्तस्ते हन्यमानो दिशो गतः4.15.10।।
15_10.translation: 'Earlier, he (Sugriva) came  and challenged you to a duel. You struck him in anger, and defeated, he fled, running in all directions. Now his challenge rouses my suspicion.
15_10.word_by_word: सः he, पूर्वम् earlier, क्रोधात् raged, आपतितः came, त्वाम् you, आह्वयते  challenging you, ते foryou, निष्पत्य  attacked, निरस्तः thrown , हन्यमानः struck , दिशः directions, गतः went.

15_11.shloka: त्वया तस्य निरस्तस्य पीडितस्य विशेषतः।इहैत्य पुनराह्वानं शङ्कां जनयतीव मे4.15.11।।
15_11.translation: 'One who is defeated and badly mauled by you is again coming and inviting you to a duel in this manner arouses suspicion in me.
15_11.word_by_word: त्वया by you, निरस्तस्य defeated by you, विशेषतः specially, पीडितस्य hurt by you, तस्य his, इह here, पुनः again, एत्य after coming, आह्वानम् inviting you, मे to me, शङ्काम् suspicion, जनयतीव arouses.

15_12.shloka: दर्पश्च व्यवसायश्च यादृशस्तस्य नर्दतः।निनादश्चापि संरम्भो नैतदल्पं हि कारणम्4.15.12।।
15_12.translation: 'His determination, his insolence, his roaring, his arroganceall this cannot be for a small reason.
15_12.word_by_word: नर्दतः roaring, तस्य his, दर्पश्च and his arrogance, व्यवसायश्च determination also, निनादस्य roaring, संरम्भः insolence, एतत् all this, अल्पम् small, कारणम् cause, न हि cannot be.

15_13.shloka: नासहायमहं मन्ये सुग्रीवं तमिहागतम्।अवष्टब्धसहायश्च यमाश्रित्यैष गर्जति4.15.13।।
15_13.translation: 'Certainly Sugriva has not come here to give a warcry without any external help. Theperson whose refuge he has sought is not a small one.
15_13.word_by_word: इह here, आगतम् came, तं सुग्रीवम् that Sugriva, असहायम् without any help, न मन्ये not think so, अवष्टब्धसहाय certainly sought refuge, यम् big, आश्रित्य having taken help, एषः he, गर्जति is roaring.

15_14.translation: 'Sugriva is clever by nature. He is wise. Without assessing the ability of the ally he will not enter into friendship.
15_14.word_by_word: प्रकृत्या निपुणश्चैव naturally a clever, बुद्धिमांश्चैव wise person, वानरः monkey, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अपरीक्षितवीर्येण without testing the ability of the ally, सख्यम् friendship न एष्यति will not make

15_15.shloka: पूर्वमेव मया वीर श्रुतं कथयतो वचः।अङ्गदस्य कुमारस्य वक्ष्यामित्वा हितं वचः4.15.15।।
15_15.translation: 'O hero I have heard the news earlier from our son Angada. I will tell you what he had heard and what he has said to me:
15_15.word_by_word: वीर O hero, पूर्वमेव earlier, कथयतः what he spoke, कुमारस्य from the son, अङ्गदस्य of Angada, वचः news, मय by me, श्रुतम् heard, हितम् good, वचः words, अद्य now, वक्ष्यामि त्वा will tell you.

15_16.shloka: अङ्गदस्तु कुमारोऽयं वनान्तमुपनिर्गतः।प्रवृत्तिस्तेन कथिता चारै राप्तैर्निवेदिता4.15.16।।
15_16.translation: 'When our son Angada was out into the forest he had collected some reports from the spies which he has transmitted to me.
15_16.word_by_word: कुमारः son, अयम् अङ्गदः this Angada, वनान्तम् to the forest, उपनिर्गतः had gone, तेन by him, प्रवृत्ति: news, कथिता narrated, चारैः  by spies, निवेदिता revealed.

15_17.shloka: अयोध्याधिपतेः पुत्रौ शूरौ समरदुर्जयौ।इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातौ प्रथितौ रामलक्ष्मणौ4.15.17।।सुग्रीवप्रियकामार्थं प्राप्तौ तत्र दुरासदौ।
15_17.translation: 'Rama and Lakshmana, two heroic sons of the king of Ayodhya born of the Ikshvaku race, are invincible in war. They have come there to help Sugriva.
15_17.word_by_word: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of Ikshvaku, कुले race, जातौ both born, अयोध्याधिपतेः king of Ayodhya, पुत्रौ sons, शूरौ two heroic, समरदुर्जयौ inviacible in war, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, प्रस्थितौ both had, दुरासदौ both unconquerable, सुग्रीवप्रियकामार्थम् to please Sugriva, तत्र there, प्राप्तौ came.

15_18.shloka: तव भ्रातुर्हि विख्यातस्सहायो रणकर्कशः।रामः परबलामर्दी युगान्ताग्निरिवोत्थितः4.15.18।।
15_18.translation: 'Rama, famous for crushing foes in war, like the fire that breaks out at the dissolution of the world, has slain strong enemies like Khara and will help your brother.
15_18.word_by_word: रणकर्कशः  crushing the foes in war, विख्यातः famous man, उत्थितः sprung up, युगान्ताग्निरिव like fire at the end of creation, परबलामर्दी who slayed strong enemies like Khara, सः रामः that Rama, ते your, भ्रातुः brother's, सहायः हि will help.

15_19.shloka: निवासवृक्षः साधूनामापन्नानां परा गतिः।आर्तानां संश्रयश्चैव यशसश्चैकभाजनम्4.15.19।।
15_19.translation: 'He is like a sheltering tree to the virtuous, an ultimate refuge for the destitutes and a protector of the distressed. He is the sole repository of fame.
15_19.word_by_word: साधूनाम् to the virtuous people, निवासवृक्षः a sheltering tree, आपन्नानाम् to the destitutes, परा  supreme, गतिः refuge, आर्तानाम् to the distressed, संश्रयश्चैव protector, यशसः fame, एकभाजनम् sole repository.

15_20.shloka: ज्ञानविज्ञानसम्पन्नो निदेशे निरतः पितुः।धातूनामिव शैलेन्द्रो गुणानामाकरो महान्4.15.20।।
15_20.translation: 'He is endowed with the knowledge of science and scriptures. He stood by his father's command. He is like a mine of virtues just as the lord of the mountain is  a mine of minerals.
15_20.word_by_word: ज्ञानविज्ञानसम्पन्नः endowed with knowledge of scriptures science and, पितुः father's, निदेशे at the command, स्थितः stood by, शैलेन्द्रः lord of mountains, धातूनामिव like the mine of minerals, गुणानाम् for all virtues, महान् great, आकरः a mine.

15_21.shloka: तत्क्षमं न विरोधस्ते सह तेन महात्मना।दुर्जयेनाप्रमेयेन रामेण रणकर्मसु4.15.21।।
15_21.translation: 'Rama is immeasurable in prowess and unconquerable in war. Therefore, enmity with him is not desirable for you.
15_21.word_by_word: तत् therefore, महात्मना great, रणकर्मसु in war, दुर्जयेन unconquerable, अप्रमेयेन of immeasurable, तेन रामेण by that Rama, ते to you, विरोधः enmity, न क्षमम् not desirable.

15_22.shloka: शूर वक्ष्यामि ते किञ्चिन्न चेच्छाम्यभ्यसूयितुम्।श्रूयतां क्रियतां चैव तव वक्ष्यामि यद्धितम्4.15.22।।
15_22.translation: 'O hero, this I tell you not because I dislike you, but because I wish your welfare. Listen, and do as I say
15_22.word_by_word: शूर valiant, ते to you, किञ्चित् a little, वक्ष्यामि I will tell, अभ्यसूयितुम् not to dislike you, न इच्छामि not intend to, तव your, हितम् welfare, यत् वक्ष्यामि telling for your sake, श्रूयताम् please listen, क्रियतां च do as I say.

15_23.shloka: यौवराज्येन सुग्रीवं तूर्णं साध्वभिषेचय।विग्रहं मा कृथा वीर भ्रात्रा राजन्बलीयसा4.15.23।।
15_23.translation: 'O king O hero consecrate your brother Sugriva as prince at once. Do not create enmity with him.
15_23.word_by_word: वीर hero, राजन् king, त्वम् you, तूर्णम् swiftly, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, यौवराज्येन you may consecrate, अभिषेचय on consecration, यवीयसा with an younger one, भ्रात्रा brother, विग्रहम् enmity, मा कृथा do not have.

15_24.shloka: अहं हि ते क्षमं मन्ये तेन रामेण सौहृदम्।सुग्रीवेण च सम्प्रीतिं वैरमुत्सृज्य दूरतः4.15.24।।
15_24.translation: 'Leave enmity with Sugriva far behind. Make friendship with Rama. I think it is the right thing for you.
15_24.word_by_word: वैरम् enmity, दूरतः to a distance, उत्सृज्य shed, सुग्रीवेण with Sugriva, सम्प्रीतिम् love, तेन रामेण with Rama, सौहृदम् friendship, ते to you, क्षमम् is the right, अहम् I, मन्ये I think.

15_25.shloka: लालनीयो हि ते भ्राता यवीयानेष वानरः।तत्र वा सन्निहस्थो वा सर्वथा बन्धुरेव ते4.15.25।।
15_25.translation: 'This monkey is your younger brother and, therefore, deserves your protection. Whether he is here or there, he is your brother.
15_25.word_by_word: यवीयान् भ्राता he is your younger brother, एषः वानरः this monkey, ते to you, लालनीयः हि deserves your protection, तत्र there, सन् वा इहस्थो वा whether he is here(at kishkinda) or there (at Rishyamuka), सर्वथा all means, ते your, बन्धुरेव relation.

15_26.shloka: न हि तेन समं बन्धुं भुवि पश्यामि कञ्चन4.15.26।।दानमानादिसत्कारैः कुरुष्व प्रत्यनन्तरम्।वैरमेतत्समुत्सृज्य तव पार्श्वे स तिष्ठतु4.15.27।।
15_26.translation: 'Indeed I do not see any of your relatives comparable to him on earth. Give up enmity with him. Give him wealth. Give him respect. Keep him by your side.
15_26.word_by_word: तेन with him, समम् equal, बन्धुम् relation, कञ्चन whoever, भुवि on this earth, न पश्यामि हि I do not see, एतत् this, वैरम् enmity, समुत्सृज्य give up, दानमानादिसत्कारैः by honouring him, by giving wealth and respect, प्रत्यनन्तरम् after that, कुरुष्व you may do, सः he, तव your, पार्श्वे by the side, तिष्ठतु remain.

15_27.shloka: सुग्रीवो विपुलग्रीवस्तवबन्धुस्सदा मतः।भ्रातृस्सौहृदमालम्ब नान्या गतिरिहास्ति ते4.15.28।।
15_27.translation: 'Extend your brotherly affection to broadnecked Sugriva. He is always your great relation. There is no alternative for you other than this at present.
15_27.word_by_word: विपुलग्रीवः broadnecked, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तव your, महाबन्धुः great relation, मतः your, भ्रातृसौहृदम् brotherly affection, आलम्ब you extend, ते to you, इह now, अन्यागतिः alternative, नास्ति no

15_28.shloka: यदि ते मत्प्रियं कार्यं यदि चावैषि मां हिताम्।याच्यमानः प्रयत्नेन साधु वाक्यं कुरुष्व मे4.15.29।।
15_28.translation: 'Pray, do me this favour. Treat me as your wellwisher. Heed my  advice given with care.
15_28.word_by_word: ते to you, मत्प्रियम् a favour to me, कार्यं यदि if it is going to be done, माम् me, हिताम् a good counsel, अवेषि यदि if you treat me so, प्रयत्नेन by the effort, याच्यमानः pray you, मे my, वाक्यम् words, साधु please, कुरुष्व heed.

15_29.shloka: प्रसीद पथ्यं शृणु जल्पितं हि मेन रोष मेवानुविधातुमर्हसि।क्षमो हि ते कोसलराजसूनुनान विग्रहश्शक्रसमानतेजसा4.15.30।।
15_29.translation: 'Do not lose your temper. Quieten your mind. My advice is beneficial to you. You should not  fight with the prince of Kosala who is comparable to Indra in splendour.It is not proper for you.'
15_29.word_by_word: प्रसीद quieten your mind, मे my, पथ्यम् beneficial, जल्पितं word, शृणु listen, रोषमेव only anger, अनुविधातुम् follow, न अर्हसि you should not, शक्रसमानतेजसा resembling Indra in splendour, कोसलराजसूनुना with the prince of the kingdom of Kosala, ते you, विग्रहः enmity, न क्षमः हि not fit for you.

15_30.shloka: तदा हि तारा हितमेव वाक्यंतं वालिनं पथ्यमिदं बभाषे।न रोचते तद्वचनं हि तस्यकालाभिपन्नस्य विनाशकाले4.15.31।।
15_30.translation: Even though Tara gave good counsel to Vali at the hour of destruction, the advice did not find favour with him as he was under the influence of unfavourable time (seized by death).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चदशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fifteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
15_30.word_by_word: तदा then, तारा Tara, तं वालिनम् to Vali, हितम् counsel, पथ्यम् beneficial, इदं वाक्यम् these words, बभाषे spoke, कालाभिपन्नस्य influenced by bad time, तस्य his, विनाशकाले at the time of destruction, तत् वचनम् those words, न रोचते not liking.

16_1.shloka: [Tara's counsel to Vali -- fight between Vali and Sugriva -- Rama observes Sugriva's plight in the duel -- shoots an arrow at Vali.]तामेवं ब्रुवतीं तारां ताराधिपनिभाननाम्।वाली निर्भर्त्सयामास वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्4.16.1।।
16_1.translation: To these words of Tara with her Moonlike face, Vali replied reproachfully:
16_1.word_by_word: एवम् thus, ब्रुवतीम्  speaking, ताराधिपनिभाननाम् Moonlike face, तां ताराम् to such a Tara, वाली Vali, निर्भर्त्सयामास reproached, इदम् these, वचनं च words, अब्रवीत् spoke

16_2.shloka: गर्जतोऽस्य च सुसम्भ्रश्च भ्रातुः शत्रोर्विशेषतः।मर्षयिष्याम्यहं केन कारणेन वरानने4.16.2।।
16_2.translation: 'O lady with a charming face why should I tolerate the enemy (Sugriva) who is none other than my own younger brother, especially when he roars excitedly?
16_2.word_by_word: वरानने O lady with a charming face, भ्रातुः brother, विशेषतः especially, शत्रोः enemy, अस्य his, सुसम्रब्धम् excitement, गर्जतः as he roars, केन कारणेन for what reason, मर्षयिष्यामि should I tolerate?

16_3.translation: O timid lady to swallow insult (without facing the opponent) is worse than death forindomitable heroes (like me) who know no retreat in a battle.
16_3.word_by_word: भीरु O timid lady, समरेषु in combat, अनिवर्तिनाम् for those who do not turn back, अधर्षितानाम् for the invincible, शूराणाम् for heroes, धर्षणामर्षणम् to endure insult, मरणात् more than death, अतिरिच्यते is worse

16_4.shloka: सोढुं न च समर्थोऽहं युद्धकामस्य संयुगे।सुग्रीवस्य च सम्रम्भं हीनग्रीवस्य गर्जतः4.16.4।।
16_4.translation: 'When the weaknecked Sugriva roars eager to join a duel it is not right on my part to tolerate his arrogance,much less his warcry.
16_4.word_by_word: अहम् I am, संयुगे in battle, युद्धकामस्य desiring to fight, हीनग्रीवस्य of the weaknecked, गर्जतः  who roars, सुग्रीवस्य of Sugriva, सम्रम्भम् flurry, सोढुम् to tolerate, न समर्थः not right

16_5.shloka: न च कार्यो विषादस्ते राघवं प्रति मत्कृते।धर्मज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च कथं पापं करिष्यति4.16.5।।
16_5.translation: 'You need not be concerned about me on account of Rama. How can one who knows dharma and who has a sense of gratitude commit sin?
16_5.word_by_word: मत्कृते for me, राघवं प्रति with respect to Rama, ते to you, विषादः worry, न कार्यः no need, धर्मज्ञश्च for a knower of dharma, कृतज्ञश्च a grateful person, पापम् sin, कथम् how, करिष्यति will he do

16_6.shloka: निवर्तस्व सह स्त्रीभिः कथं भूयोऽनुगच्छसि।सौहृदं दर्शितं तारे मयि भक्ति: कृता त्वया4.16.6।।
16_6.translation: 'Go back with all the women of the harem. Why do you follow me again? Your devotion towards me is evident from the sincere concern expressed by you.
16_6.word_by_word: स्त्रीभिः सह along with women, निवर्तस्व you may return, भूयः again, कथम् how, अनुगच्छसि following, त्वया by you, सौहृदम् concern, दर्शितं (तावत्) shown by you, मयि to me, भक्तिः devotion, कृता is fixed

16_7.shloka: प्रतियोत्स्याम्यहं गत्वा सुग्रीवं जहि सम्भ्रमम्।दर्पमात्रं विनेष्यामि न च प्राणैर्विमोक्ष्यते4.16.7।।
16_7.translation: 'I shall accept the challenge and fight with Sugriva. Give up your anxiety. I will destroy  his pride, not his life.
16_7.word_by_word: अहम् I am, गत्वा after going, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, प्रतियोत्स्यामि will fight accepting his challenge, सम्भ्रमम् anxiety, जहि give up, अस्य his, दर्पमात्रं pride, विनेष्यामि I will subdue, प्राणैः with life, न विमोक्ष्यते not be relieved

16_8.shloka: अहं ह्याजौस्थितस्यास्य करिष्यामि यथेप्सितम्।वृक्षैर्मुष्टिप्रहारैश्च पीडितः प्रतियास्यति4.16.8।।
16_8.translation: 'When he faces me in the battlefield, I will hit him with trees and fists, and he will run back  for life.
16_8.word_by_word: अहम् I, इति आजौ in the battlefield, स्थितस्य when he stands, अस्य his, यत् whatever, ईप्सितम् desire, करिष्यामि I will do, वृक्षैः by the trees, मुष्टिप्रहारैश्च by hitting with fists, पीडितः hurt, प्रतियास्यति will run back

16_9.shloka: न मे गर्वितमायस्तं सहिष्यति दुरात्मवान्।कृतं तारे सहांयत्वं सौहृदं दर्शितं मयि4.16.9।।
16_9.translation: 'That evilminded Sugriva cannot bear my mighty, hard blows. Tara you could shower your affection on me and extend help (in passing secret information obtained through Angada)
16_9.word_by_word: दुरात्मवान् an evilminded one, मे my, गर्वितम् pride, अयस्तम्  hard strokes, न सहिष्यति will not tolerate, तारे O Tara, सहायत्वम् helpful attitude, कृतम् to do, मयि for me, सौहृदम्  affection, दर्शितम् you have shown

16_10.shloka: शापिताऽपि मम प्राणैर्निवर्तस्व जयेन च।अहं जित्वा निवर्तिष्ये तमहं भ्रातरं रणे4.16.10।।
16_10.translation: 'I make a vow even on my life and my victory. Pray return with the retinue. I will be back only after winning the encounter with my brother.
16_10.word_by_word: मम my, प्राणैः with life, शापिता अपि even a vow on my life, जयेन  on victory, निवर्तस्व  I will return, अहम् I, रणे in encounter, तं भ्रातरम् that brother, जित्वा after winning, अहम् I, निवर्तिष्ये    will return

16_11.shloka: तं तु तारा परिष्वज्य वालिनं प्रियवादिनी।चकार रुदती मन्दं दक्षिणा सा प्रदक्षिणम्4.16.11।।
16_11.translation: Pleasing in her words, Tara then embraced Vali and sobbing, circumambulated Vali in compliance (to his advice).
16_11.word_by_word: प्रियवादिनी a lady  pleasant in speech, दक्षिणा a compliant, सा तारा that Tara, तं वालिनम् that Vali, परिष्वज्य having embraced, मन्दम् faintly रुदती weeping, प्रदक्षिणम् circumambulated, चकार went

16_12.shloka: ततः स्वस्त्ययनं कृत्वा मन्त्रविद्विजयैषिणी।अन्तःपुरं सह स्त्रीभिः प्रविष्टा शोकमोहिता4.16.12।।
16_12.translation: The wise counsellor, Tara bade him farewell, wishing him victory and then, overwhelmed with sorrow, entered the inner apartment followed by the womenfolk.
16_12.word_by_word: ततः then, मन्त्रवित् a lady wellversed in mantras, विजयैषिणी a lady who wished victory, स्वस्त्ययनम्  hailing, कृत्वा uttering, शोकमोहिता overwhelmed with sorrow, स्त्रीभिः सह along with women, अन्तःपुरम् inner apartments, प्रविष्टा entered

16_13.shloka: प्रविष्टायां तु तारायां सह स्त्रीभिस्स्वमालयम्।नगरान्निर्ययौ क्रुद्धो महासर्प इव श्वसन्4.16.13।।
16_13.translation: After Tara and other women returned to their abode, Vali departed from the city,  hissing  like a huge angry cobra.
16_13.word_by_word: तारायाम् when Tara, स्त्रीभिस्सह along with women, स्वम् her, आलयम् abode, प्रविष्टायाम् after she entered, कुद्दः angry , महासर्प इव like a huge serpent, श्वसन् breathing, नगरात् from the city, निर्ययौ came out.

16_14.shloka: स निश्श्वस्य महातेजा वाली परमरोषणः।सर्वतश्चारयन् दृष्टिं शत्रुदर्शनकाङ्क्षया4.16.14।।
16_14.translation: The mighty Vali, breathing heavily, looked around to find where his enemy was.
16_14.word_by_word: महातेजा: brilliant, वाली Vali, परमरोषणः very angrily, विश्श्वस्य breathing heavily, शत्रुदर्शनराङ्क्षया with a desire to see the enemy, सर्वतः in all directions, दृष्टिम् sight, चारयन् sending.

16_15.shloka: स ददर्श ततश्श्रीमान् सुग्रीवं हेमपिङ्गलम्।सुसंवीतमवष्टब्धं दीप्यमानमिवानलम्4.16.15।।
16_15.translation: There Vali saw Sugriva in lustrous, red gold complexion standing ready for a combat steady like glowing fire.
16_15.word_by_word: ततः then, श्रीमान् lustrous, सः he, हेमपिङ्गलम् of red gold complexion, सुसंवीतम् ready to combat, अवष्टब्धम् steady, दीप्यमानम् glowing bright, अनलम् इव like fire, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, ददर्श saw

16_16.shloka: स तं दृष्ट्वा महावीर्यं सुग्रीवं पर्यवस्थितम्।गाढं परिदधे वासो वाली परमरोषण:4.16.16।।
16_16.translation: On seeing the great hero Sugriva standing firmly, the enraged Vali tied his upper cloth (around his loin) tightly.
16_16.word_by_word: परमरोषण: in mighty rage, महावीर्यं great hero, सः वाली Vali, पर्यवस्थितम्  standing firmly तं सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, वासः (upper) cloth, गाढम् tightly, परिदधे tied up

16_17.shloka: स वाली गाढसंवीतो मुष्टिमुद्यम्य वीर्यवान्।सुग्रीवमेवाभिमुखो ययौ योद्धुं कृतक्षणः4.16.17।।
16_17.translation: Vali tied up his cloth tightly, raised his fist and advanced towards Sugriva, ready for the encounter.
16_17.word_by_word: गाढसंवीतः with cloth tied tightly, वीर्यवान् brave, सः वाली Vali, मुष्टिम् fist, उद्यम्य advanced towards, योद्धुम् for combat, कृतक्षणः waiting for the moment impatiently, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, अभिमुखः towards, ययौ went

16_18.shloka: श्लिष्टं मुष्टिं समुद्यम्य संरब्धतरमागतः।सुग्रीवोऽपि समुद्दिश्य वालिनं हेममालिनम्4.16.18।।
16_18.translation: Sugriva also lifted his fist firmly and advanced more impatiently towards Vali adorned with a golden necklace.
16_18.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अपि also, श्लिष्टम् firmly closed, मुष्टिम् fist, समुद्यम्य lifting up, हेममालिम् adorned with gold necklace, वालिनम् Vali, समुद्दिश्य directing towards, संरब्धतरम् more impatiently, आगतः reached

16_19.shloka: तं वाली क्रोधताम्राक्षस्सुग्रीवं रणपण्डितम्।आपतन्तं महावेगमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्4.16.19।।
16_19.translation: While Sugriva, expert in combat, advanced swiftly to pounce upon (his enemy), Vali whose eyes turned red in anger said:
16_19.word_by_word: वाली Vali, क्रोधताम्राक्षः whose eyes red in anger, रणपण्डितम् expert in warfare, महावेगम् of great speed, आपतन्तम् pouncing upon, तं सुग्रीवम् him Sugriva, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke

16_20.shloka: एष मुष्टिर्मयाबद्धो गाढस्सन्निहिताङ्गुलिः।मया वेगविमुक्तस्ते प्राणानादाय यास्यति4.16.20।।
16_20.word_by_word: सन्निसताङ्गुलिः closely held fingers, गाढः tight, एषः this, बद्धः महान्  clenched and big. मुष्टिः fist, मया by me, वेगविमुक्तः hit with formidable speed, ते your, प्राणान् life, आदाय on taking out, यास्यति will move away

16_21.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवः क्रुद्धो वालिनमब्रवीत्।तवैव चा हरन्प्राणान्मुष्टिः पततु मूर्धनि4.16.21।।
16_21.translation: This infuriated Sugriva who, looking at Vali, said 'This fist of mine will draw your life out, hitting your forehead'.
16_21.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, उक्तः सुग्रीवः Sugriva having been addressed, क्रुद्धः  angry, वालिनम् Vali, अब्रवीत् said, एषः thus, मुष्टिः fist, तव your, प्राणान् life, हरन्  take, मूर्धनि on your forehead, पततु let it hit

16_22.shloka: ताडितस्तेन सङ्कृद्धस्समभिक्रम्य वेगितः।अभवच्छोणितोद्गारी सोत्पीड इव पर्वतः4.16.22।।
16_22.translation: Struck by Vali, enraged Sugriva encountered Vali more aggresively. His body drenched in blood seemed a mountain with rivulets of blood flowing.
16_22.word_by_word: वेगितः speedily, समभिक्रम्य encountered him, तेन by him, ताडितः struck, सङ्कृद्धः enraged, शोणितोद्गारी  rivulets of blood, सोत्पेडः flowing, पर्वतः इव like a mountain, अभवत् appeared

16_23.shloka: सुग्रीवेण तु निस्सङ्गं सालमुत्पाट्य तेजसा।गात्रेष्वभिहतो वाली वज्रेणेव महागिरिः4.16.23।।
16_23.translation: With all his vigour, Sugriva uprooted a sala tree, pulled it out and struck Vali on the body, like a thunderbolt striking a huge mountain.
16_23.word_by_word: सुग्रीवेण तु by Sugriva also, तेजसा with vigour, निस्सङ्गम् pulled out, सालम् sala tree, उत्पाट्य  uprooted, वज्रेण with the thunderbolt, महागिरिः इव like a huge mountain, गात्रेषु on the body, अभिहतः struck.

16_24.shloka: स तु वाली प्रचलितस्सालताडनविह्वलः।गुरुभारसमाक्रान्तो नौ सार्थ इव सागरे4.16.24।।
16_24.translation: Struck by the blows of the sala tree, Vali also lost his balance like the heavily loaded ship of a trader shaken up in the ocean.
16_24.word_by_word: सालताडनविह्वलः hurt by the blows of the sala tree, सः he, वाली तु Vali also, सागरे in the ocean, गुरुभारसमाक्रान्तः heavily loaded, सार्थ trader's, नौः ship, इव like, प्रचलितः shaken up

16_25.shloka: तौ भीमबलविक्रान्तौ सुपर्णसमवेगिनौ।प्रवृद्धौ घोरवपुषौ चन्द्रसूर्याविवाम्बरे।परस्परममित्रघ्नौ च्छिद्रान्वेषणतत्परौ4.16.25।।
16_25.translation: Both of them endowed with terrible strength, fierce in appearance, and each seeking the weak points of the other advanced, as fast as Garuda, striking at the enemy. Their fight grew more and more fierce like the fight between Sun and Moon in the sky.
16_25.word_by_word: भीमबलविक्रान्तौ of terrific strength, सुपर्णसमवेगिनौ both as fast as Suparna (Garuda), घोरवपुषौ both of fierce appearance, परस्परम् each other, छिद्रान्वेषणतत्परौ both searching the weak points of the other, अमित्रघ्नौ both striking and trying to win over the other, तौ both, अम्बरे in the sky, चन्द्रसूर्याविव like Sun and Moon, प्रवृद्धौ both grew

16_26.shloka: ततोऽवर्धत वाली तु बलवीर्यसमन्वितः।सूर्यपुत्रो महावीर्यस्सुग्रीवः परिहीयते4.16.26।।
16_26.translation: In a short while Vali, endowed with great strength, gained the upper hand and Sugriva, son of the Sungod, was losing ground .
16_26.word_by_word: ततः then, बलवीर्यसमन्वितः endowed with strength and valour, वाली Vali, अवर्धत he grew, महावीर्यः mighty, सूर्यपुत्रः Sun's son, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, परिहीयते becomes weak

16_27.shloka: वालिना भग्नदर्पस्तु सुग्रीवो मन्दविक्रमः।वालिनं प्रति सामर्षो दर्शयामास लाघवम्4.16.27।।
16_27.translation: With his strength waning and pride crushed, Sugriva, anguished, exhibited shrewdness.
16_27.word_by_word: वालिना by Vali, भग्नदर्पः pride crushed, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, मन्दविक्रमः diminished in strength, सामर्षः anguished, वालिनं प्रति towards Vali, लाघवम्  shrewdness, दर्शयामास displayed

16_28.shloka: वृक्षैः स्सशाखै स्सशिखैर्वज्रकोटिनिभैर्नखैः4.16.28।।मुष्टिभिर्जानुभिः पद्भिर्बाहुभिश्च पुनः पुनः।तयोर्युद्धमभूद्घोरं वृत्रवासवयोरिव4.16.29।।
16_28.translation: Both like Vritra and Indra fought, hitting each other again and again with trees full of branches and tops, with their hard nails akin to thunderbolts and with their fists, knees, feet, etc.
16_28.word_by_word: तयोः both, वृक्षैः with trees, सशाखैः with branches, शिखरैः with tops, वज्रकोटिनिभैः by those  hard as tips of thunderbolts, नखैः with nails, मुष्टिभिः with fists, पद्भिः with feet, जानुभिः with knees, वृत्रवासवयोरिव like Vritra and Indra, पुनः पुनः again and again, घोरम् terrible, युद्धम् combat, अभूत् became.

16_29.shloka: तौ शोणिताक्तौ युध्येतां वानरौ वनचारिणौ।मेघाविव महाशब्दै स्तर्जमानौ परस्परम्4.16.30।।
16_29.translation: The monkeys, wanderers in the forest, both with blood stains fiercely clashed pointing at each other, roaring with dreadful sounds like two clouds.
16_29.word_by_word: वनचारिणौ wanderers of the forest, तौ both of them, वानरौ monkeys, शोणिताक्तौ both with blood stains, परस्परम् at each other, महाशब्दैः producing loud sound, मेघाविव like two clouds, तर्जमानौ pointing at each other, युध्येताम् clashed

16_30.translation: Raghava perceived that the monkey king Sugriva whose strength was waning was looking again and again in all directions (seeking help).
16_30.word_by_word: अथ then, सः राघवः Rama, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, दिशः different directions, वीक्षमाणम्  glancing, वानरेश्वरम् lord of monkeys, सुग्रीवं Sugriva, हीयमानम् waning (in strength), अपश्यत् observed

16_31.shloka: ततो रामो महातेजा आर्तं दृष्ट्वा हरीश्वरम्।शरं च वीक्षते वीरो वालिनो वधकारणात् 4.16.32।।
16_31.translation: Finding the king of the monkeys in distress, the heroic, brilliant Rama looked for an  arrow in order to kill Vali.
16_31.word_by_word: ततः then, महातेजाः brilliant, वीरः hero, रामः Rama, हरीश्वरम् king of monkeys, आर्तम् distress, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, वालिनः Vali's, वधकारणात् in order to kill, शरम् arrow, वीक्षते looked for

16_32.shloka: ततो धनुषि सन्धाय शरमाशीविषोपमम्।पुरयामास तच्चापं कालचक्रमिवान्तकः4.16.33।।
16_32.translation: Rama then fixed an arrow which resembled a venomous snake, on to his bow looking like the very deathwheel of Yama and stretched it fully.
16_32.word_by_word: ततः then, आशीविषोपमम् poisonous like a snake, शरम् arrow, धनुषि at the bow, सन्धाय having fixed, अन्तकः lord of death, कालचक्रमिव like the wheel of death, तत् चापम् that bow, पुरयामास stretched at fully.

16_33.shloka: तस्य ज्यातलघोषेण त्रस्ताः पत्ररथेश्वराः।प्रदुद्रुवुर्मृगाश्चैव युगान्त इव मोहिताः4.16.34।।
16_33.translation: As if scared by the twang of the bowstring, winged and feathered birds and animals ran frightened in different directions.
16_33.word_by_word: तस्य his, ज्यातलघोषेण by the twang of the bowstring, त्रस्ताः terrified, पत्ररथेश्वराः winged and feathered birds, मृगाश्चैव like animals, युगान्ते at the time of dissolution, मोहिताः इव as though frightened, प्रदुद्रुवुः ran in all directions.

16_34.shloka: मुक्तस्तु वज्रनिर्घोष: प्रदीप्ताशनिसन्निभः।राघवेण महाबाणो वालिवक्षसि पातितः4.16.35।।
16_34.translation: As Rama shot the mighty arrow, it went like a blazing lightning with a thunderous sound and pierced into the chest of Vali.
16_34.word_by_word: राघवेण by Rama, मुक्तः released, वज्रनिर्घोषः sounding like the thunderbolt, प्रदीप्ताशनिसन्निभः like blazing lightning, महाबाणः mighty arrow, वालिवक्षसि  into the chest of Vali, पातितः pierced

16_35.shloka: ततस्तेन महातेजा वीयौटत्सिक्तः कपीश्वरः।वेगेनाभिहतो वाली निपपात महीतले4.16.36।।
16_35.translation: Then the powerful monkey king Vali, who was proud of his might, fell down on earth, struck by the fast flying arrow.
16_35.word_by_word: ततः then, महातेजाः powerful, वीयौत्सक्तः proud of his strength, कपीश्वरः king of monkeys,वाली Vali, तेन by such, वेगेन with speed, अभिहतः was hit, महीतले on the earth, निपपात fell down

16_36.shloka: इन्द्रध्वज इवोद्धूतः पौर्णमास्यां महीतले।आश्वयुक्समये मासि गतश्रीको विचेतनः4.16.37।।
16_36.translation: Vali fell lustreless on the ground. He was thrown down unconscious like the banner (hoisted in honour) of Indra on the fullmoon day of Aswayuja month.
16_36.word_by_word: आश्वयुक्समये in the month of Aswayuja, मासि in a month, पौर्णमास्याम् on the full Moon day, महीतले on the earth, उद्धूतः was thrown down, इन्द्रध्वज इव like Indra's staff, वाली Vali, गतश्रीको lost his brilliance, विचेतनः fell unconscious

16_37.shloka: नरोत्तमः कालयुगान्तकोपमंशरोत्तमं काञ्चनरूप्यभुषितम्।ससर्ज दीप्तं तममित्रमर्दनंसधूममग्निं मुखतो यथा हरः4.16.38।।
16_37.translation: The arrow of Rama, distinguished among men, adorned with silver and gold, which could crush the enemy shone like fire and smoke emitted from the mouth of Rudra at the time of dissolution (at the end of the aeon).
16_37.word_by_word: नरोत्तमः distinguished among men, कालयुगान्तकोपमम् like the destroyer of the world, काञ्चनरूप्यभाषितम् adorned with gold and silver, दीप्तम् glittering, अमित्रमर्दनम् that which can crush the enemy, तं शरोत्तमम् that best of arrows, हरः  Hara (Rudra), मुखतः from the  mouth, सधूमम् with smoke, अग्निम् इव like fire, ससर्ज released

16_38.translation: While Indra's son (Vali) fell unconscious on the ground, drenched in blood flowing, like a fully bloomed Asoka tree shaken down by the wind, he looked like Indra's flag fallen.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षोडशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
16_38.word_by_word: अथ then, वासवसूनुः son of Indra (Vali), आहवे in the combat, शोणिततोयविस्रवैः with blood flowing, उक्षितः drenched, अनिलोद्धतः blown by the wind, सुपुष्पिताशोक इव like the fully blossomed Asoka tree, विचेतनः without consciousness, सुविभ्रंशितेन्द्रध्वजवत् like Indra's flag post falling, क्षितिम् on the ground, गतः fallen

17_1.shloka: [Vali accuses Rama -- calls him deceitful -- reproaches Rama in many ways.]ततश्शरेणाभिहतो रामेण रणकर्कशः।पपात सहसा वाली निकृत्त इव पादपः4.17.1।।
17_1.translation: A tyrant in war, Vali struck by4.54.24 Rama's arrow, collapsed instantaneously like a tree felled down.
17_1.word_by_word: ततः then, रणकर्कशः  tyrant in war, वाली Vali, रामेण by Rama, शरेण by an arrow, अभिहतः struck, निकृत्तः  felled, पादप: the tree, इव like, सहसा instantaneously, पपात fell down

17_2.translation: Adorned with shining gold ornaments,Vali fell down with all his limbs touching the ground like Indra's flag when its ropes are loosened.
17_2.word_by_word: तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणः adorned with shining gold ornaments, सः he, मुक्तरश्मिः with the loosening of ropes, देवराजस्य Indra's, ध्वजः इव like the post, भूमौ on the ground, न्यस्तसर्वाङ्गः all limbs of body touching the ground, पपात fell down

17_3.shloka: तस्मिन्निपतिते भूमौ वानराणां गणेश्वरे।नष्टचन्द्रमिव व्योम न व्यराजत भूतलम्4.17.3।।
17_3.translation: When the lord of the monkey troops fell down, it was as though the earth lost itsbrightness like the sky loses its brightness devoid of the Moon.
17_3.word_by_word: वानराणाम् of the monkeys, गणेश्वरे lord of the troops, तस्मिन् him, भूमौ निपतिते when (he) fell on the ground, भूतलम् the earth, नष्टचन्द्रमिव like sky devoid of the Moon, व्योम sky, न व्यराजत not shine

17_4.shloka: भूमौ निपतितस्यापि तस्य देहं महात्मनः।न श्रीर्जहाति न प्राणा न तेजो न पराक्रमः4.17.4।।
17_4.translation: Even though the highsouled Vali's body had fallen on the ground, its  splendour, glow, life and valour had not left it.
17_4.word_by_word: भूमौ on the ground, निपतितस्यापि even though fell down, महात्मनः  highsouled, तस्य it, देहम् body, श्रीः splendour, न जहाति not left, प्राणाः life, न not, तेजः glow, न not, पराक्रमः valour

17_5.shloka: शक्रदत्ता वरा माला काञ्चनी वज्रभूषिता।दधार हरिमुख्यस्य प्राणांस्तेज्शियं च सा4.17.5।।
17_5.translation: As the most beautiful golden necklace, studded with diamonds, given by Indra was there on him, the life, brightness and splendour of Vali's body remained.
