20_21.word_by_word: सर्वतः all over, ताः those, वानर्यः female monkeys, तस्याः their, विलपितम् wailing, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अङ्गदम् Angada, परिगृह्य taking hold, दीनाः wretched women, दुःखार्ताः filled with sorrow, परिचुक्रुशुः cried bitterly.

20_22.shloka: किमङ्गदं साङ्गदवीरबाहोविहाय यास्यद्य चिरप्रवासम्।न युक्तमेवं गुणसन्निकृष्टंविहाय पुत्रं प्रियपुत्र गन्तुम्4.20.23।।
20_22.translation: 'O hero, adorned with armlets, why have you departed on a long journey, deserting your dear son Angada who possesses similar virtues like you? It is not proper.
20_22.word_by_word: साङ्गदवीरबाहो O hero adorned with armlets, अङ्गदम् Angada, विहाय deserting, चिरप्रवासम् on a long journey, किम् why, प्रयातः असि going, गुणसन्निकृष्टम् with qualities like yours, प्रियपुत्र  your dear son, पुत्रम् son, एवम् this way, न युक्तम् not proper to go.

20_23.shloka: किमप्रियं ते प्रिय चारुवेषमया कृतं नाथ सुतेन वा ते।सहाङ्गदां मां प्रविहाय वीरयत्प्रस्थितो दीर्घ मितः प्रवासम्4.20.24।।
20_23.translation: 'O darling, attractively dressed, you are leaving me and Angada and going too far.  What unpleasant deeds we have done (to deserve this).
20_23.word_by_word: प्रियचारुवेष  robed attractively, वीर esteemed one, नाथ lord, सहाङ्गदाम् with Angada, माम् me, विहाय leaving, इतः  this place, दीर्घम् long distance, प्रवासम् journey, यत् प्रस्थितः since you have begun, मया by me, ते to you, सुतेन वा or by your son, किम् what, अप्रियम् unpleasant, कृतम् done.

20_24.shloka: यद्यप्रियं किञ्चिदसम्प्रधार्यकृतं मया स्यात्तव दीर्घबाहो।क्षमस्व मे तद्धरिवंशनाथव्रजामि मूर्ध्ना तव वीर पादौ।।4.20.25।।
20_24.translation: 'O longarmed chief of the monkey clan O warrior pardon me any wrong done unknowingly, inconsiderately. I touch your feet with my head.'
20_24.word_by_word: दीर्घबाहो O longarmed one, हरिवंशनाथ chief of monkey clan, वीर warrior, असम्प्रधार्य unknowingly, मया by me, तव to you, अप्रियम् inconsiderately, किञ्चित् even a little, कृतं स्याद्यदि if done, मे mine, तत् that, क्षमस्व  may pardon, मूर्ध्ना by my head, तव your, पादो feet, व्रजामि I reach.

20_25.shloka: तथा तु तारा करुणं रुदन्तीभर्तुस्समीपे सह वानरीभिः।व्यवस्यत प्रायमुपोपवेष्टुमनिन्द्यवर्णा भुवि यत्र वाली4.20.26।।
20_25.translation: Beautiful Tara crying pathetically sat near her husband along with other female monkeys on the ground, determined to abstain from food and drink, awaiting death.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends  the twentieth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
20_25.word_by_word: अनिन्द्यवर्णा flawless complexion, तारा Tara, भर्तुः husband's, समीपे in the presence, वानरीभिः सह along with female monkeys, तथा similarly, करुणम् patheticaly, रुदन्ती  crying, वाली Vali, यत्र there, भुवि on the ground, प्रायम् उपोपवेष्टुम् sitting down by abstaining from food seeking death, व्यवस्यत determined.

21_1.shloka: [Hanuman consoles Tara -- requests her to ask Angada to perform the last rites for Vali -- Tara's reply.]ततो निपतितां तारां च्युतां तारामिवाम्बरात्।शनैराश्वासयामास हनुमान्हरियूथपः4.21.1।।
21_1.translation: Thereafter Hanuman, leader of the monkey clan, slowly consoled Tara who was (standing before her husband) like a star fallen from the sky.
21_1.word_by_word: ततः then, अम्बरात् from the sky, च्युताम् fallen down, तारामिव like a star, निपतिताम् fallen on the ground, ताराम् Tara, हरियूथपः leader of the monkey clan, हनुमान् Hanuman, शनैः slowly, आश्वासयामास consoled.

21_2.shloka: गुणदोषकृतं जन्तुस्स्वकर्म फलहेतुकम्।अव्यग्रस्तदवाप्नोति सर्वं प्रेत्य शुभाशुभम्4.21.2।।
21_2.translation: 'On departing from this mortal world an embodied soul reaps gradually the good and evil fruits of action performed under the notion of virtue or vice with an eye to their good or evil consequences.
21_2.word_by_word: जन्तुः an embodied soul, गुणदोषकृतम् by virtue of their good and bad deeds, फलहेतुकम् the fruits of actions, सर्वम् all, तत् that, शुभाशुभम् whether good and bad, कर्म deed, प्रेत्य after death, अव्यग्रः gradually, आप्नोति attains.

21_3.shloka: शोच्या शोचसि कं शोच्यं दीनं दीनाऽनुकम्पसे।कस्य कोवाऽनुशोच्योऽस्ति देहेऽस्मिन् बुद्बुदोपमे4.21.3।।
21_3.translation: 'For whom do you grieve except for yourself? You are miserable. Who are you sympathising with? Who are you grieving for? When this body itself  is like a bubble, who is worth grieving for?
21_3.word_by_word: शोच्या worry, शोच्यम् a matter to grieve, कम् whom, शोचसि you are grieving, दीना in a  miserable manner, अनुकम्पसे you show sympathy, अस्मिन् in this, देहे body, बुद्बुदोपमे likea bubble, कः who, कस्य for whom, अनुशोच्यः worthy of worrying, अस्ति now.

21_4.shloka: अङ्गदस्तु कुमारोऽयं द्रष्टव्यो जीवपुत्रया।अयत्यां च विधेयानि समर्थान्यस्य चिन्तय4.21.4।।
21_4.translation: 'You are mother of a surviving son, Angada. You have to look after him in times to come. Think of the duties to be performed now.
21_4.word_by_word: जीवपुत्रया  who has a son surviving, कुमारः prince, अयम् this, अङ्गदः Angada, द्रष्टव्यः should be looked after, आयत्याम् in future, अस्य his, विधेयानि duties, समर्थानि properly, चिन्तय you may think of.

21_5.shloka: जानास्यनियतामेवं भूतानामागतिं गतिम्।तस्माच्छुभं हि कर्तव्यं पण्डितेनैह लौकिकम्।।4.21.5।।
21_5.translation: 'You are aware of the uncertain and transient happenings in the lives of living beings. Therefore, a wise lady should do auspicious work in this world.
21_5.word_by_word: भूतानाम् for all beings, आगतिम् transient happenings, अनियताम् एव as it is unstable, जानासि you know, तस्मात् therefore, पण्डितेन by the wise, इह here, लौकिकम् worldly, शुभम् auspicious, कर्तव्यं हि is to be done.

21_6.shloka: यस्मिन्हरिसहस्राणि प्रयुतान्यर्बुदानि च।वर्तयन्ति कृतांशानि सोऽयं दिष्टान्तमागतः4.21.6।।
21_6.translation: 'Tens of millions of monkeys depended on this hero with their hopes on him. He has reached his ultimate destiny now to enjoy the fruits of his good deeds.
21_6.word_by_word: यस्मिन् in whom, कृतांशानि pinning their hopes, हरिसहस्राणि thousands of monkeys, प्रयुतानि in millions, अर्बुदानि च and tens of millions, वर्तयन्ति sustain, सः he, अयम् this, दिष्टान्तम् to enjoy the fruits of his good deeds, आगतः reached.

21_7.shloka: यदयं न्यायदृष्टार्थस्सामदानक्षमापरः।गतो धर्मजितां भूमिं नैनं शोचितुमर्हसि4.21.7।।
21_7.translation: 'This hero with a right vision, adopted the means of conciliation, charity and forgiveness (in his administration) and has finally reached a position through righteousness in his death. It is not proper to mourn for him.
21_7.word_by_word: न्यायदृष्टार्थः who has right vision, सामदानक्षमापरः adopts the sama(conciliation) dana (charity) and forgiveness (as means of administration), अयम् this hero, यत् such, धर्मजिताम् of those who win righteously, भूमिम् earth, गतः reached, एवम् in that way, शोचितुम् to mourn, नार्हसि not proper.

21_8.shloka: सर्वे हि हरिशार्दूलाः पुत्रश्चायं तवाङ्गदः।इदं हर्यृक्षपतिराज्यं च त्वत्सनाथमनिन्दिते4.21.8।।
21_8.translation: 'O blemishless lady these great monkeys including your son Angada and the entire kingdom of monkeys and bears are under your protection.
21_8.word_by_word: अनिन्दिते O blemishless lady, सर्वे all, हरिशार्दूलाः tigers among monkeys, तव your, पुत्रः son, अयम् this, अङ्गदश्च Angada's, हर्यृक्षपतिराज्यं च and the kingdom of monkeys and bears, त्वत्सनाथम्  under your protection.

21_9.shloka: ताविमौ शोकसन्तप्तौ शनैः प्रेरय भामिनि।त्वया परिगृहीतोऽयमङ्गदश्शास्तु मेदिनीम्4.21.9।।
21_9.translation: 'O fair sex Encourage these two griefstricken heroes (Angada and Sugriva) gently. Let Angada rule this earth under your protection.
21_9.word_by_word: भामिनि O fair sex, शोकसन्तप्तौ immersed in grief, तौ इमौ they both, शनैः slowly, प्रेरय you may encourage, त्वया by you, परिगृहीतः protected, अयम् this, अङ्गदः Angada, मेदिनीम् earth, शास्तु he may command.

21_10.shloka: सन्ततिश्च यथा दृष्टा कृत्यं यच्चापि साम्प्रतम्।राज्ञस्तत्क्रियतां सर्वमेष कालस्य निश्चयः4.21.10।।
21_10.word_by_word: सन्ततिः a son, यथा that way, दृष्टा after seeing, साम्प्रतम् presently, राज्ञः to king Vali, यत् all such thing, कृत्यं चापि and done, तत् that, सर्वम् all, क्रियताम् may be carried out, एषः this, कालस्य at this time, निश्चयः is the decision.

21_11.shloka: संस्कार्यो हरिराजश्च अङ्गदश्चाभिषिच्यताम्।सिंहासनगतं पुत्रं पश्यन्ती शान्तिमेष्यसि4.21.11।।
21_11.translation: 'Let all the rituals of the king of vanaras be performed. Let Angada be consecrated. You will attain peace of mind to see your son seated on the throne.'
21_11.word_by_word: हरिराजः king of monkeys, संस्कार्यः all rituals should be performed, अङ्गदश्च by Angada, अभिषिच्यताम् may be consecrated, सिंहासनगतम् seated on the throne, पुत्रम् son, पश्यन्ती while you are looking at him, शान्तिम् peace, एष्यसि you will attain.

21_12.shloka: सा तस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा भर्तृव्यसनपीडिता।अब्रवीदुत्तरं तारा हनूमन्तमवस्थितम्4.21.12।।
21_12.translation: On hearing Hanuman's words, Tara, tormented by the death of her husband said to Hanuman who was waiting for her reply:
21_12.word_by_word: भर्तृव्यसनपीडिता tormented by the husband's death, सा तारा that Tara, तस्य his, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अवस्थितम् waiting, हनूमन्तम् to Hanumanta, अवस्थितम् who was waiting, उत्तरम् reply, अब्रवीत् said.

21_13.translation: 'To embrace even the deadbody of this hero is better than (to embrace) a hundred prototypes of Angada.
21_13.word_by_word: अङ्गदप्रतिरूपाणाम् of those who may be prototypes of Angada, पुत्राणाम् of sons, शतम् one hundred, एकतः on one side, हतस्यापि even if he is slayed, अस्य his, वीरस्य warrior's, गात्रसंश्लेषणम् embracing the body, वरम् is better.

21_14.shloka: न चाहं हरिराजस्य प्रभवाम्यङ्गदस्य वा।पितृव्यस्तस्य सुग्रीवस्सर्वकार्येष्वनन्तरः4.21.14।।
21_14.word_by_word: अहम् I am, हरिराजस्य of the king of monkeys, अङ्गदस्य वा or about Angada, न प्रभवामि not the right, तस्य his, पितृव्यः father's brother, सर्वकार्येषु in all tasks, अनन्तरः herafter.

21_15.shloka: न ह्येषाबुद्धिरास्थेया हनूमन्नङ्गदं प्रति।पिता हि बन्धुः पुत्रस्य न माता हरिसत्तम4.21.15।।
21_15.translation: 'O Hanuman the best of monkeys, you need not think about (the future of) Angada. A father plans for a son and not (even) the mother.
21_15.word_by_word: हनुमान् O Hanuman, अङ्गदं प्रति for Angada, एषा that way, बुद्धि: thought, न आस्थेयाः not to be entertained, हरिसत्तम best of monkeys, पुत्रस्य son's, पिता father, बन्धुः relation, माता mother, न none else.

21_16.shloka: न हि मम हरिराजसंश्रयात्क्षमतरमस्ति परत्र चेह वा।अभिमुखहतवीरसेवितंशयनमिदं मम सेवितुं क्षमम्4.21.16।।
21_16.translation: There is nothing more befitting for me than joining the king of monkeys either here or in the next world. It is proper for me to resort to this resting place (pyre) used by this slain hero in front of me.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfirst sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
21_16.word_by_word: मम my, इह वा in this world or, परत्र वा or in the next world, हरिराजसंश्रयात् other than joining king of monkeys, क्षमतरम् a safer course, न अस्ति हि is not found, अभिमुखहतवीरसेवितम् used by this slain warrior in front of me, इदं this, शयनम् resting place, सेवितुम् to rest, मम for me, क्षमम् is fitting.

22_1.shloka: [Vali repents -- asks Sugriva  to take care of Angada and Tara -- hands over his golden necklace to Sugriva -- exhorts Angada.]वीक्षमाणस्तु मन्दासुस्सर्वतो मन्दमुच्छ्वसन्।आदावेव तु सुग्रीवं ददर्शत्वात्मजाग्रतः4.22.1।।
22_1.translation: Vali, gazing all around, breathing slowly and sighing feably beheld Sugriva at first instance, Sugriva who was standing in front of his own son.
22_1.word_by_word: मन्दासुः slowly, मन्दं feebly, उच्छ्वसन्  sighing, सर्वतः all over, वीक्षमाणः तु gazing all round, आदावेव at first instance, अग्रतः front, आत्मजः his own son, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, ददर्श saw.

22_2.shloka: तं प्राप्तविजयं वाली सुग्रीवं प्लवगेश्वरः।आभाष्य व्यक्तया वाचा सस्नेहमिदमब्रवीत्4.22.2।।
22_2.translation: Vali, the lord of monkeys, lovingly said to Sugriva, who had won a victory:
22_2.word_by_word: प्लवगेश्वरः lord of monkeys, वाली Vali, प्राप्तविजयम् had won a victory, तं सुग्रीवम् to that Sugriva, आभाष्य spoke, व्यक्तया addressing, वाचा words, सस्नेहम् with love, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

22_3.shloka: सुग्रीव दोषेण न मां गन्तुमर्हसि किल्बिषात्।कृष्यमाणं भविष्येण बुद्धिमोहेन मां बलात्4.22.3।।
22_3.translation: 'O Sugriva you ought not to accuse me of exiling you, and wresting your wife. Mymind was deluded by the force of fate that controls one's future.
22_3.word_by_word: सुग्रीव O Sugriva, माम् me, दोषेण by mistake, गन्तुम् exiling, न अर्हसि ought not to, किल्बिषात् due to mistake, भविष्येण in future, बुद्धिमोहेन by deluded, बलात् by force  माम् me, कृष्यमाणम् bound

22_4.shloka: युगपद्विहितं तात न मन्ये सुखमावयोः।सौहार्द भ्रातृयुक्तं हि तदिदं तात नान्यथा4.22.4।।
22_4.translation: 'O dear I believe that both of us are not destined to enjoy the love and happiness that come together to brothers.
22_4.word_by_word: तात O dear, आवयोः for both of us, सुखम् happiness, युगपत् at the same time, न मन्ये I also do not believe, भ्रातृयुक्तम् not right for brothers, तत् so, इदम् this, सौहार्दम् friendship between us, न अन्यथा not otherwise, जातम् is created.

22_5.shloka: प्रतिपद्य त्वमद्यैव राज्यमेषां वनौकसाम्।मामप्यद्यैव गच्छन्तं विद्धि वैवस्वतक्षयम्4.22.5।।
22_5.word_by_word: त्वम् you, अद्यैव just now, एषाम् of these, वनौकसाम् forest dwellers, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रतिपद्य accept, मामपि me also, अद्यैव now, वैवस्वतक्षयम् the abode of Vivasvan, lord of the death, गच्छन्तम्  going, विद्धि know.

22_6.shloka: जीवितं च हि राज्यं च श्रियं च विपुलामिमाम्।प्रजहाम्येष वै तूर्णं महच्चागर्हितं यशः4.22.6।।
22_6.translation: 'I am leaving this world soon, along with this vast kingdom, prosperity and untarnished fame.
22_6.word_by_word: एषः अहम् thus I, जीवितं च life also, राज्यं च even kingdom, इमाम् this, विपुलाम् vast, श्रियं च and prosperity, अगर्हितम् untarnished, यशः च and fame, तूर्णम् soon, एषः here I am, प्रजहामि leaving.

22_7.shloka: अस्यां त्वहमवस्थायां वीर वक्ष्यामि यद्वचः।यद्यप्यसुकरं राजन्कर्तुमेव तदर्हसि4.22.7
22_7.translation: 'O warrior king you should do whatever I request you at this hour even though it may not be easy.
22_7.word_by_word: वीर O warrior, राजन् O king, अस्यां अवस्थायाम् at this stage, अहम् I, यत् those, वचः words, वक्ष्यामि speaking, असुकरं not easy to do, यद्यपि even though, कर्तुमेव only to carry out, त्वम् you, अर्हसि ought to.

22_8.shloka: सुखार्हं सुखसंवृद्धं बालमेनमबालिशम्।बाष्पपूर्णमुखं पश्य भूमौ पतितमङ्गदम्4.22.8।।
22_8.translation: 'Look at this young Angada fallen on the ground, face flooded with tears. Raised with comfort, he deserves to be kept happy.
22_8.word_by_word: सुखार्हम् who deserves happiness, सुखसंवृद्धम् raised with comfort, बालम् young boy, अबालिशम् youthful, बाष्पपूर्णमुखम् tearful face, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम्  fallen down, अङ्गदम् Angada, पश्य see.

22_9.shloka: मम प्राणैः प्रियतरं पुत्रं पुत्रमिवौरसम्।मया हीनमहीनार्थं पर्वतः परिपालय4.22.9।।
22_9.translation: 'He is dearer to me than my life. Take care of him like your own son. He is separated from me. Take care of him in all respects, so that he is not deprived of anything.
22_9.word_by_word: मम my, प्राणैः more than life, प्रियतरम् dearer to me, मया by me, हीनम् separated, पुत्रम् son, औरसं पुत्रं इव like your own son, सर्वतः in all respects, अहीनार्थम् without being deprived of anything, परिपालय take care of him.

22_10.shloka: त्वमेवास्य हि दाता च परित्राता च सर्वशः।भयेष्वभयदश्चैव यथाऽहं प्लवगेश्वर।।4.22.10।।
22_10.translation: 'O lord of monkeys from now on, you alone will be his father, provider of everything, saviour and protector in danger.
22_10.word_by_word: प्लवगेश्वर O lord of monkeys, अहम् I, यथा as I am, त्वमेव you alone, अस्य his, (पिता father), दाता provider, सर्वशः of everything, परित्राता च and saviour, भयेषु in danger, अभयदश्चैव protector.

22_11.shloka: एष तारात्मज श्रीमांस्त्वया तुल्यपराक्रमः।रक्षसां च वधे तेषामग्रतस्ते भविष्यति4.22.11।।
22_11.translation: 'This prosperous son of Tara, your equal in valour, will remain with you in the forefront to crush demons.
22_11.word_by_word: श्रीमान् prosperous, त्वया to you, तुल्यपराक्रमः equal in valour, एषः this, तारात्मजः son of Tara, तेषाम् their, रक्षसाम् demons, वधे crush, ते to you, अग्रतः on the forefront, भविष्यति will remain.

22_12.shloka: अनुरूपाणि कर्माणि विक्रम्य बलवान्रणे।करिष्यत्येष तारेयस्तरस्वी तरुणोऽङ्गदः4.22.12।।
22_12.translation: 'This mighty hero Angada, son of Tara, is young and dynamic. He will strike (the enemy) in a fitting manner in war.
22_12.word_by_word: बलवान् strong, तारेयः of Tara's, तरस्वी fast, तरुणः young, एषः अङ्गदः this Angada, रणे in war, विक्रम्य strike, अनुरूपाणि fitting , कर्माणि deeds, करिष्यति will do.

22_13.shloka: सुषेणदुहिता चेयमर्थसूक्ष्मविमनिश्चये।औत्पातिके च विविधे सर्वतः परिनिष्ठिता4.22.13।।
22_13.translation: 'Tara, daughter of Sushena, is wise and efficient in discerning subtle matters and in foreseeing unexpected events.
22_13.word_by_word: सुषेणदुहिता daughter of Sushena, इयं च and she also , अर्थसूक्ष्मविनिश्चये in disecerning subtle matters, विविधे various, औत्पातिके च and in foreseeing events that come up suddenly, सर्वतःall over, परिनिष्ठिता very efficient( in crisis management),

22_14.shloka: यदेषा साध्विति ब्रूयात्कार्यं तन्मुक्तसंशयम्।न हि तारामतं किञ्चिदन्यथा परिवर्तते4.22.14।।
22_14.translation: 'Tara's opinion is never wrong. It does not change. Whatever she speaks is right and should be carried out without any doubt.
22_14.word_by_word: एषा she, यत् whatever, साधु इति treat it to be right, ब्रूयात् speak, तत् that, मुक्तसंशयम् without any doubt, कार्यम् work, तारामतम् her opinion, किञ्चत् even a little, अन्यथा otherwise, न परिवर्तते हि does not change.

22_15.shloka: राघवस्य च ते कार्यं कर्तव्यमविशङ्कया।स्यादधर्मो ह्यकरणे त्वां च हिंस्याद्विमानितः4.22.15।।
22_15.translation: 'You ought to carry out Rama's work without hesitation. If you do not, it will be unrighteous and harmful.
22_15.word_by_word: राघवस्य Rama's, कार्यं च work also, ते to you, अविशङ्कया without hesitation, कर्तव्यम्   duty, अकरणे not do, अधर्मः unrighteousness, स्यात् हि will be, अमानितः disobeyed, त्वाम् you, हिंस्यात् च will hurt.

22_16.shloka: इमां च मालामाधत्स्व दिव्यां सुग्रीव काञ्चनीम्।उदारा श्रीस्थिता ह्यास्यां सम्प्रजह्यान्मृते मयि4.22.16।।
22_16.translation: 'O Sugriva put on this divine golden necklace. It has great brilliance. Its present lustre may be gone when I am dead.'
22_16.word_by_word: सुग्रीव O Sugriva, दिव्यां divine, काञ्चनीम् golden, इमां मालाम् this necklace, अधत्स्व wear now, अस्याम् in it, स्थिता present, उदारा great, श्रीः brightness, मयि when me, मृते (when) dead,सम्प्रजह्यात् हि it will be gone.

22_17.shloka: इत्येवमुक्तस्सुग्रीवो वालिना भ्रातृसौहृदात्।हर्षं त्यक्त्वा पुनर्दीनो ग्रहग्रस्त इवोडुराट्4.22.17।।
22_17.translation: Thus spoken to by Vali with brotherly affection, Sugriva gave up joy (of victory) and appeared dull like the Moon eclipsed by planet Rahu.
22_17.word_by_word: वालिना by Vali, भ्रातृसौहृदात् due to brotherly affection, इत्येवम् thus, उक्तः spoken, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, हर्षम् happiness, त्यक्त्वा having given up , पुनः again, दीनः dull, ग्रहग्रस्तः eclipsed by planet Rahu, उडुराट् इव like the Moon.

22_18.shloka: तद्वालिवचनाच्छान्तः कुर्वन्युक्तमतन्द्रितः।जग्राह सोऽभ्यनुज्ञातो मालां तां चैव काञ्चनीम्4.22.18।।
22_18.translation: On hearing Vali's words, Sugriva became composed with no illfeeling. Considering it to be proper, he received with his permission the golden necklace.
22_18.word_by_word: सः he, तद्वालिवचनात् by the words of Vali, शान्तः became composed, अतन्द्रितः without any illfeeling, युक्तम् proper, कुर्वन् carrying out, अभ्यनुज्ञातः with the permission, काञ्चनीम् golden, तां मालाम् that necklace, जग्राह received.

22_19.shloka: तां मालां काञ्चनीम् दत्त्वा दृष्ट्वाचैवात्मजं स्थितम्।संसिद्धः प्रेत्यभावाय स्नेहादङ्गदमब्रवीत्4.22.19।।
22_19.translation: Having given the golden necklace to Sugriva,Vali, feeling ready to depart, looked at his son Angada who stood by and spoke affectionately:
22_19.word_by_word: काञ्चनीम् golden, तां मालाम् that necklace, दत्त्वा having given, स्थितम् him who stood by, आत्मजं च and son, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, प्रेत्यभावाय with a feeling of preparedness for death, संसिद्धः ready to depart, स्नेहात् with affection, अङ्गदम् to Angada, अब्रवीत् said.

22_20.shloka: देशकालौ भजस्वाद्य क्षममाणः प्रियाप्रिये।सुखदुःख सह: काले सुग्रीववशगो भव4.22.20।।
22_20.translation: 'Enduring pleasure or pain equally  with due regard to time and place favourable to you or otherwise, you should submit to the will of Sugriva.
22_20.word_by_word: अद्य now, प्रियाप्रिये dear or otherwise, क्षममाणः forgiving, देशकालौ regard  to time and place, भजस्व serve, काले in time, सुखदुःखसहः enduring pleasure and pain equally, सुग्रीववशगः भव submit to Sugriva's will.

22_21.shloka: यथा हि त्वं महाबाहो लालितस्सततं मया।न तथा वर्तमानं त्वां सुग्रीवो बहुमंस्यते।।4.22.21।।
22_21.translation: 'O longarmed one you have always been affectionately brought up by me. Sugriva may not rear you that way.
22_21.word_by_word: महाबाहो O longarmed one, त्वम् you, सततम् always, मया by me, यथा as, लालितः affectionately, तथा in that way, वर्तमानम् as in the present, त्वाम् to you, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, न बहुमंस्यते not bring you up.

22_22.shloka: माऽस्यामित्रैर्गतं गच्छेर्मा शत्रुभिररिन्दम।भर्तुरर्थपरो दान्तः सुग्रीववशगो भव4.22.22।।
22_22.translation: 'O conqueror of foes do not align with his enemies or with the friends of his enemies. Remain selfrestrained and loyal to Sugriva. Be subordinate to his will.
22_22.word_by_word: अरिन्दम O conqueror of enemies, अस्य his, अमित्रैः friends his enemies, गतम् in the past , मा गच्छेः  after my exit, शत्रुभिः with his enemies too, मा do not, भर्तुः protector's, अर्थपरः devoted to his interests, दान्तः selfrestrained, सुग्रीववशगः stand by Sugriva, भव you.

22_23.shloka: न चातिप्रणयः कार्यः कर्तव्योऽप्रणयश्च ते।उभयं हि महान्दोष स्तस्मादन्तरदृग्भव4.22.23।।
22_23.translation: 'You are not to be excessively friendly or otherise as both are serious mistakes. Therefore, be insightful.'
22_23.word_by_word: अतिप्रणयः excessively friendly, ते by you, न कार्यः should not be, अप्रणयश्च lack of love also, न कर्तव्यः not to be, उभयम् both, महान्दोषम् will amount to serious mistake, तस्मात्  therefore, अन्तरदृक् insightful, भव be.

22_24.translation: Having spoken this, tormented by the arrow, eyes popping out and his dreadful teeth ejected, Vali remained drained of life.
22_24.word_by_word: भृशम् intensely, शरसम्पीडितः formented by the arrow, इति thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, अथ then, विवृत्ताक्षः popping out his eyes, विवृतैः with opened, भीमैः with dreadful, दशनैः with teeth, उत्क्रान्तजीवितः dead, बभूव remained.

22_25.shloka: ततो विचुक्रुशुस्तत्र वानरा हरियूथपाः।परिदेवयमानास्ते सर्वे प्लवगपुङ्गवा:4.22.25।।
22_25.translation: Then the best of the monkeys and their troop leaders bewailed the death of Vali, crying bitterly.
22_25.word_by_word: ततः then, प्लवगपुङ्गवा: best of the monkeys, सर्वे all, ते वानराः the monkeys, हरियूथपाः leaders of monkey troops, परिदेवयमानाः bewailing, तत्र there, विचुक्रुशुः cried bitterly.

22_26.shloka: किष्किन्धा ह्यद्य शून्याऽसीत्स्वर्गते वानराधिपे।उद्यानानि च शून्यानि पर्वताः काननानि च4.22.26।।हते प्लवगशार्दूले निष्प्रभा वानराः कृताः।
22_26.translation: Lord of monkeys having gone to heaven, Kishkinda looked desolate including the pleasure gardens, the mountains and forests. The monkeys also became dull.
22_26.word_by_word: वानराधिपे when the lord of monkeys, स्वर्गते had gone to heaven,  किष्किन्धा Kishkinda, शून्या हि  is desolate, उद्यानानि च pleasure gardens, शून्यानि empty, पर्वताः mountains, काननानि च forests also, प्लवगशार्दूले tigers among monkeys, हते is killed, वानराः monkeys, निष्प्रभाः dull, कृताः became.

22_27.shloka: यस्य वेगेन महता काननानि वनानि च।पुष्पौघेणानुबध्यन्ते करिष्यति तदद्य कः4.22.27।।
22_27.translation: (The vanaras wailed aloud saying) 'The forests and gardens looked connected together with the flowers that swayed by his speed .Who can do that now?
22_27.word_by_word: यस्य whose, महता वेगेन at high speed, काननानि forests, वनानि च and gardens, पुष्पौघेण with heavy flow of flowers, अनुबध्यन्ते joined now, तत् that, अद्य now, कः who, करिष्यति can do?

22_28.shloka: येन दत्तं महद्युद्धं गन्धर्वस्य महात्मनः4.22.28।।गोलभस्य महाबाहोर्दशवर्षाणि पञ्च च।नैव रात्रौ न दिवसे तद्युद्धमुपशाम्यति4.22.29।।
22_28.translation: 'Great soul, Vali endowed with stout shoulders joined a duel with a gandharva called Golabha for fifteen years nonstop night and day.
22_28.word_by_word: येन by him, महात्मनः of the great self, महाबाहोः of strong shoulders, गोलभस्य of Golabha, गन्धर्वस्य of gandharva, दश ten, पञ्च five, च and, वर्षाणि years, महत् great, युद्धम् war, दत्तम् given, तत् युद्धम् that war, रात्रौ during night, नैव उपशाम्यति not stops, दिवसे during day, न not.

22_29.shloka: ततस्तु षोडशे वर्षे गोलभो विनिपातितः।हत्वा तं दुर्विनीतं तु वाली दंष्ट्राकरालवान्4.22.30।।सर्वाऽभयङ्करोऽस्माकं कथमेष निपातितः।
22_29.translation: 'In the sixteenth year Golabha, the uncontrollable enemy was killed by Vali with his dreadful fangs and rendered protection to everybody. How did he get killed?'
22_29.word_by_word: ततः then, षोडशे in the sixteenth, वर्षे year, गोलभः Golabha, विनिपातितः was thrown down, दंष्ट्राकरालवान्  of dreadful teeth, वाली Vali, दुर्विनीतम् the uncontrollable, तम् him, हत्वा on killing, अस्माकम् to us, सर्वाऽभयङ्करः rendering security, एषः such, कथम् how, निपातितः killed.

22_30.shloka: हते तु वीरे प्लवगाधिपे तदाप्लवङ्गमास्तत्र न शर्म लेभिरे।वनेचराः सिंहयुते महावनेयथा हि गावो निहते गवां पतौ4.22.31।।
22_30.translation: Just as the cattle get frightened when the leader of the herd gets killed in a huge forest full of lions, the young monkey became puzzled when the chief of monkeys got killed.
22_30.word_by_word: सिंहयुते in a place full of lions, महावने in a huge forest, गवाम् of cattle, पतौ the lord, निहते when killed, वनेचराः wanderers of the forest, गावः cows, यथा as, तदा then, वीरे when the hero, प्लवगाधिपे chief of monkeys, हते when killed, तत्र there, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, शर्म peace of mind, न लेभिरे not get.

22_31.shloka: ततस्तु तारा व्यसनार्णवाप्लुतामृतस्य भर्तुर्वदनं समीक्ष्य सा।जगाम भूमिं परिरभ्य वालिनंमहाद्रुमं छिन्नमिवाश्रिता लता4.22.32।।
22_31.translation: Then Tara, immersed in a sea of sorrow, looked at the face of her dead husband and sank, embracing Vali, like a creeper clinging to the massive tree when the tree is cut down.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentysecond sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.
22_31.word_by_word: ततः then, सा तारा that Tara, व्यसनार्णवाप्लुता immersed in the sea of calamity, मृतस्य of the dead, भर्तुः husband's, वदनम् face, समीक्ष्य seeing, छिन्नम् cut, महाद्रुमम् massive tree, आश्रिता clinging, लता इव like a creeper clinging, वालिनम् Vali, परिरभ्य having embraced him, भूमिम् on the ground, जगाम fell.

23_1.shloka: [Tara laments -- Vali regrets about Tara's fate -- Vali calls  Angada to witness Tara's plight]ततस्समुपजिघ्रन्ती कपिराजस्य तन्मुखम्।पतिं लोकाच्च्युतं तारा मृतं वचनमब्रवीत्4.23.1।।
23_1.translation: Tara kissed (smelt) the forehead of the king of monkeys who had departed and said:
23_1.word_by_word: ततः then, लोकाच्च्युतं  departed from the world, तारा Tara, कपिराजस्य  king of monkeys', तत् मुखम् his forehead, समुपजिघ्रन्ती smelt (kissed), मृतम् dead, पतिम् husband, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

23_2.shloka: शेषे त्वं विषमे दुःखमकृत्वा वचनं मम।उपलोपचिते वीर सुदुःखे वसुधातले4.23.2।।
23_2.translation: 'O hero, not caring for my words (of caution), you are now lying with great pain on hard stones on the ground.
23_2.word_by_word: वीर hero, मम my,वचनम् words, अकृत्वा not cared, त्वम् you, विषमे on a hard, उपलोपचिते carpeted with stones, सुदुःखे very painful, वसुधातले on the ground, दुःखम् sadly, शेषे  lying

23_3.shloka: मत्तः प्रियतरा नूनं वानरेन्द्र मही तव।शेषे हि तां परिष्वज्य मां च न प्रतिभाषसे4.23.3।।
23_3.translation: 'O lord of monkeys you lie in the end, embracing the earth and not replying to me.Surely you deem this earth dearer than me.
23_3.word_by_word: वानरेन्द्र O lord of monkeys, मही the earth, तव to you, मत्तः more than me, नूनम् surely, प्रियतरा dearer, हि indeed, ताम् to her, परिष्वज्य embracing, शेषे in the end, माम् me, न प्रतिभाषसे च  not replying me.

23_4.shloka: सुग्रीवस्य वशं प्राप्तो विधिरेषभवत्यहो।सुग्रीव एव विक्रान्तो वीर साहसिकप्रिय4.23.4।।
23_4.translation: 'O lover of brave deeds, fate has brought you under the sway of Sugriva, although he had lost to you.
23_4.word_by_word: वीर hero, साहसिकप्रिय one who determined and brave, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, वशं प्राप्तः you have lost to, सुग्रीव एव only Sugriva, विक्रान्तः valiant, एषः that way, विधिः fate, भवति declared, अहो Oh

23_5.shloka: ऋक्षवानरमुख्यास्त्वां बलिनः पर्युपासते।एषां विलपितं कृच्छ्रमङ्गदस्य च शोचतः4.23.5।।मम चेमा गिरः श्रुत्वा किं त्वं न प्रतिबुध्यसे।
23_5.translation: 'Oh powerful Vali leaders of the bears and monkeys, the entire lot are standing near you, wailing. Angada has been  crying in grief. How is it that you are not rising up even after hearing their wailing voices and  my call? .
23_5.word_by_word: ऋक्षवानरमुख्याः leader of bears and monkeys, बलिनः powerful, त्वाम् your, पर्युपासते are standing near,एषाम् of these, कृच्छ्रम् entire, विलपितम् wailing, शोचतः crying in grief, अङ्गदस्य च Angada's, मम my, इमाः these, गिरः words,  श्रुत्वा on hearing, त्वम् you, किम् why, न प्रतिबुध्यसे you are not getting up.

23_6.shloka: इदं तच्छूरशयनं यत्र शेषे हतो युधि।शायिता निहता यत्र त्वयैव रिपवः पुरा4.23.6।।
23_6.translation: 'Earlier you have killed enemies in combats and made them lie down where now you lie.
23_6.word_by_word: त्वयैव by yourself, पुरा earlier, निहताः killed, रिपवः enemies, यत्र there, शायिताः they are made to lie down, तत् that, शूरशयनम् the reclining place for heroes, इदम् this, युधि in war, हतः killed, यत्र where, (तत्र there), शेषे you are lying.

23_7.shloka: विशुद्धसत्त्वाभिजन प्रिययुद्ध मम प्रिय।मामनाथां विहायैकां गतस्त्वमसि मानद4.23.7।।
23_7.translation: 'O venerable hero, born in a pure and noble family, you are a lover of battles. Now you have left me an orphan.
23_7.word_by_word: विशुद्धसत्त्वाभिजन born into pure and noble clan, प्रिययुद्ध O lover of battle, मानद O venerable one, मम प्रिय my dear, त्वम् you, अनाथाम् an orphan, माम् me, एकाम् विहाय leaving me alone, गतः went.

23_8.shloka: शूराय न प्रदातव्या कन्या खलु विपश्चिता।शूरभार्यां हतां पश्य सद्यो मां विधवां कृताम्4.23.8।।
23_8.translation: 'It is said by wise men that a girl should not be given in marriage to a warrior. See me,  the wife of a warrior, now rendered a widow.
23_8.word_by_word: विपश्चिता by wise men, कन्या a girl, शूराय for a warrior, न प्रदातव्या should not be given in marriage, सद्यः presently, विधवां कृताम्  rendered a widow, हताम् killed, शूरभार्याम् wife of a warrior, माम् me, पश्य you may see.

23_9.shloka: अवभग्नश्च मे मानो भग्ना मे शाश्वती गतिः4.23.9।।अगाधे च निमग्नाऽस्मि विपुले शोकसागरे।
23_9.translation: 'My pride is crushed. My husband, the ultimate resort for me is shattered.I amplunged in a vast, bottomless ocean of grief.
23_9.word_by_word: मे my, मानः pride, अवभग्नश्च  is crushed, मे my, शाश्वती गतिः ultimate resort, भग्ना is shattered, अगाधे in a bottomless, विपुले in a vast, शोकसागरे in ocean of sorrow, निमग्ना plunged, अस्मि I am.

23_10.shloka: अश्मसारमयं नूनमिदं मे हृदयं दृढम्4.23.10।।भर्तारं निहतं दृष्ट्वा यन्नाद्य शतधा कृतम्।
23_10.translation: 'My heart is surely made of hard stone yet it has not split into a hundred pieces even on seeing my husband slain৷৷
23_10.word_by_word: निहतम्  killed, भर्तारम् husband, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, यत् since, अद्य now, शतधा into a hundred, न कृतम् not broken, मे my, दृढम् hard, इदं हृदयम् this heart, अश्मसारमयम् made of stone, नूनम् surely.

23_11.shloka: सुहृच्चैव हि भर्ता च प्रकृत्या मम च प्रियः।आहवे च पराक्रान्तश्शूरः पञ्चत्वमागतः4.23.11।।
23_11.translation: 'He was my husband, my friend and naturally my loving king. He was powerful in battle.Alas the hero has died.
23_11.word_by_word: मम my, प्रकृत्या by nature, प्रियः dear, सुहृच्छैव a friend also, भर्ता च and husband, आहवे in  battle, पराक्रान्तः a powerful, शूरः hero, पञ्चत्वम् death, आगतः reached.

23_12.shloka: पतिहीना तु या नारी कामं भवतु पुत्रिणी।धनधान्यैस्सुपूर्णाऽपि विधवेत्युच्यते बुधैः4.23.12।।
23_12.translation: 'Even if a woman without husband, is blessed with sons and abundant wealth and grain, still learned people call her a widow.
23_12.word_by_word: या नारी any woman, पतिहीना without husband, पुत्रिणी mother of sons, भवतु कामम् even so, धनधान्यैस्सुपूर्णाऽपि a prosperous lady with wealth and grain in abundance, बुधैः by learned people, विधवेति only a widow, उच्यते is called so.

23_13.shloka: स्वगात्रप्रभवे वीर शेषे रुधिरमण्डले।क्रिमिरागपरिस्तोमे त्वमात्मशयने यथा4.23.13।।
23_13.translation: 'O hero how is it that you are lying in a crimson bed of the pool of blood flowing from your body?
23_13.word_by_word: वीर O hero, स्वगात्रप्रभवे flowing from your body, रुधिरमण्डले in a pool of blood, क्रिमिरागपरिस्तोमे  crimson bed, त्वमात्मशयने in sleeping, यथा as such, शेषे you are lying.

23_14.shloka: रेणुशोणितसंवीतं गात्रं तव समन्ततः।परिरब्धुं न शक्नोमि भुजाभ्यां प्लवगर्षभ 4.23.14।।
23_14.translation: 'O bull among monkeys how can I embrace you with my arms as your body is covered with dust particles and blood?.
23_14.word_by_word: प्लवगर्षभ O bull among monkeys, समन्ततः all over, रेणुशोणितसंवीतम् covered with dust particles and blood, तव गात्रम् your body, भुजाभ्याम् with my arms, परिरब्धुम् to embrace, न शक्नोमि not able to.

23_15.shloka: कृतकृत्योऽद्य सुग्रीवो वैरेऽस्मिन्नतिदारुणे।यस्य रामविमुक्तेन हृतमेकेषुणा भयम्4.23.15।।
23_15.translation: 'Sugriva has achieved his goal in his dreadful enmity (with you). His fear is dispelled by a single arrow released by Rama.
23_15.word_by_word: अतिदारुणे very dreadful, अस्मिन् वैरे his enmity, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अद्य now, कृतकृत्यः has achieved his goal, यस्य at whose, भयम् fear, रामविमुक्तेन released by Rama, एकेषुणा one single arrow, हृतम् is dispelled.

23_16.shloka: शरेण हृदि लग्नेन गात्रसंस्पर्शने तव।वार्यामि त्वां निरीक्षन्ती त्वयि पञ्चत्वमागते4.23.16।।
23_16.translation: 'The arrow which has pierced your body prevents me from embracing you. I am only looking at you lying (not removing the arrow lest you die).'
23_16.word_by_word: त्वयि your, पञ्चत्वम् death, आगते reached, हृदि in the chest,  शरेण by the arrow,  लग्नेन by  arrow pierced, गात्रसंस्पर्शने touching limbs, वार्यामि refrain from, त्वां your, निरीक्षन्ती only looking at you.

23_17.shloka: उद्ववर्ह शरं नीलस्तस्य गात्रगतं तदा।गिरिगह्वरसंलीनं दीप्तमाशीविषं यथा4.23.17।।
23_17.translation: Then Nila took out the arrow from Vali's heart with due effort as one would pull out a glowing serpent hidden in the mountain cave.
23_17.word_by_word: तदा then, नीलः Nila, तस्य his, गात्रगतम् deadbody, शरम् arrow, गिरिगह्वरसंलीनम् hidden in the mountain cave(heart), दीप्तम् glowing, आशीविषं यथा like a serpent, उद्ववर्ह made effort.

23_18.shloka: तस्य निष्कृष्यमाणस्य बाणस्य च बभौ द्युतिः।अस्तमस्तकसंरुद्धो रश्मिर्दिनकरादिव4.23.18।।
23_18.translation: As the arrrow(drenched in blood) was being pulled out, its glow looked like the Sun's rays obstructed by the peak of the western mountain.
23_18.word_by_word: निष्कृषमाणस्य as it was being pulled out, तस्य of that, बाणस्य arrow's, द्युतिः glow, दिनकरात् Sun's, अस्तमस्तकसंरुद्धः obstructed by the peak of the western mountain, रश्मिः इव like the rays, बभौ appeared.

23_19.shloka: पेतुः क्षतजधारास्तु व्रणेभ्यस्तस्य सर्वशः।ताम्रगैरिकसम्पृक्ता धारा इव धराधरात्4.23.19।।
23_19.translation: The streams of blood that flowed all over from the wounds of his body appeared like streams of water mixed with red and copper colour.
23_19.word_by_word: तस्य from his, व्रणेभ्यः wound, क्षतजधाराः streams of blood, धराधरात् from a mountain, ताम्रगैरिकसम्पृक्ताः red mixed with copper, धाराः इव like the streams, सर्वशः all over, पेतुःflowed.

23_20.translation: She (Tara) wiped the body wounded with the weapon and covered with wardust,  sprinkling her tear drops from her eyes.
23_20.word_by_word: रणरेणुना wardust, अवकीर्णम् covered, भर्तारम् husband, विमार्जन्ती wiped, अस्त्रसमाहतम्  wounded with the weapon, शूरम् warrior, नयनजैः water from the eyes, अप्रैः with tears, सिषेच sprinkled.

23_21.shloka: रुधिरोक्षितसर्वाङ्गं दृष्ट्वा विनिहतं पतिम्।उवाच तारा पिङ्गाक्षं पुत्रमङ्गदमङ्गना4.23.21।।
23_21.translation: Turning to the body of her husband fully drenched in blood, thus spoke Tara to her tawnyeyed  son Angada:
23_21.word_by_word: अङ्गना woman, तारा Tara, विनिहतम् killed, रुधिरोक्षितसर्वाङ्गम्  all parts of his body drenched in blood, पतिम् husband, दृष्ट्वा seeing, पुत्रम् son, पिङ्गाक्षम् tawnyeyed, अङ्गदम् Angada, उवाच said.

23_22.shloka: अवस्थां पश्चिमां पश्य पितुः पुत्र सुदारुणाम्।सम्प्रसक्तस्य वैरस्य गतोऽन्तः पापकर्मणा4.23.22।।
23_22.translation: 'O son you see the most terrific end of your father on whom enmity forced sinful deeds.
23_22.word_by_word: पुत्र Son, पितुः of father, सुदारुणाम् most terrific, पश्चिमां at the end, अवस्थाम् condition, पश्य  see, पापकर्मणा on account of the sinful deeds, सम्प्रसक्तस्य that which was forced on him, वैरस्य out of the enmity, अन्तः end, गतः reached.

23_23.shloka: बालसूर्योदयतनुं प्रयान्तं यमसदनम्।अभिवादय राजानं पितरं पुत्र मानदम्4.23.23।।
23_23.translation: 'O son offer salutations to your venerable father, the king, departing for the abode of Yama (lord of death) looking (red with blood) like the rising Sun.'
23_23.word_by_word: पुत्र son, बालसूर्योदयतनुम्  body (red) like the rising Sun, यमसदनम् abode of Yama, प्रयान्तम् departing , राजानम् king, मानदम् venerable, पितरम् father, अभिवादय offer salutations.

23_24.shloka: एवमुक्तस्समुत्थाय जग्राह चरणौ पितुः।भुजाभ्यां पीनवृत्ताभ्यामङ्गदोऽहमिति ब्रुवन्4.23.24।।
23_24.translation: Thus advised by Tara, Angada got up, clasped his father's feet with his stout arms, and saluted, saying, 'I am Angada.'
23_24.word_by_word: एवम् that way, उक्तः  advised, समुत्थाय  got up, अहम् I am, अङ्गदः Angada, इति thus, ब्रुवन् speaking, पीनवृत्ताभ्याम् stout, भुजाभ्याम् both shoulders, पितुः of father, चरणौ feet, जग्राह clasped.

23_25.shloka: अभिवादयमानं त्वामङ्गदं त्वं यथा पुरा।दीर्घायुर्भव पुत्रेति किमर्थं नाभिभाषसे4.23.25।।
23_25.translation: 'Why do you not, with the words 'May you live long'', bless, as before, your son Angada who is greeting you? (said Tara).
23_25.word_by_word: त्वाम् to you, अभिवादयमानम् saluting, अङ्गदम् Angada, त्वम् you, पुत्र son, दीर्घायुः longlived, भव be, इति thus, किमर्थं why, यथा पुरा like earlier, नाभिभाषसे not speaking?

23_26.shloka: अहं पुत्रसहाया त्वामुपासे गतचेतसम्।सिंहेन निहतं सद्यो गौस्सवत्सेव गोवृषम्4.23.26।।
23_26.translation: 'Just like a cow followed by its calf would attend upon a mighty bull struck by a lion I will wait with my son upon you who have lost consciousness (died).
23_26.word_by_word: सद्यः now, सिंहेन by a lion, निहतम् struck, गोवृषम् mighty bull, सवत्सा along with her calf, गौः इव like a calf, पुत्रसहाया wait upon with son, अहम् I am, गतचेतसम् lost consciousness (died), त्वाम् you, उपासे I serve you.

23_27.shloka: इष्ट्वा सङ्ग्रामयज्ञेन रामप्रहरणाम्भसि।अस्मिन्नवभृथे स्नातः कथं पत्न्या मया विना4.23.27।।
23_27.translation: 'You have performed a warsacrifice. You have bathed in the waters of Rama's weapon signifying the end of the sacrifice. How did you take this customary bath without me, your wife?
23_27.word_by_word: सङ्ग्रामयज्ञेन इष्ट्वा having performed a sacrificial war, पत्न्या with wife, मया विना without me, रामप्रह्ररणाम्भसि in the water of Rama's arrow, अस्मिन् in this, अवभृथे in this bath taken at the end of a sacrifice, कथम् how, स्नातः did you bathe?

23_28.shloka: या दत्ता देवराजेन तव तुष्टेन संयुगे।शातकुम्भमयीं मालां तां ते पश्यामि नेह किम्4.23.28।।
23_28.translation: 'Why do I not see on your chest the golden necklace gifted by the king of the gods (Indra), pleased with you in the battle?
23_28.word_by_word: संयुगे in the battle, तुष्टेन  pleased, देवराजेन by the king of gods (Indra), या such one, तव to your, दत्ता gifted, ताम् that one, शातकुम्भमयीं a golden one, मालाम् necklace, इह now, किम् why, न पश्यामि I do not see.

23_29.shloka: राज्यश्रीर्न जहाति त्वां गतासुमपि मानद।सूर्यस्यावर्तमानस्य शैलराजमिव प्रभा4.23.29।।
23_29.translation: 'O venerable one, even though life has departed from you, kingly glory does not leave you any more than the light of the setting son leaves the king of mountains. (western mountain)
23_29.word_by_word: मानद venerable, शैलराजम् king of mountains, आवर्तमानस्य as he returns, सूर्यस्य the Sun's, प्रभा इव like light, राज्यश्रीः kingly glory, गतासुम् अपि even though departed, त्वाम् you, न जहाति not left.

23_30.shloka: न मे वचः पथ्यमिदं त्वया कृतंन चास्मि शक्ता हि निवारणे तव।हता सपुत्राऽस्मि हतेन संयुगेसह त्वया श्रीर्विजहाति मामिह4.23.30।।
23_30.translation: 'You have not followed my advice. I did not have the capacity to prevent you from going to war. The result is, you are killed and I am ruined along with my son. The goddess of fortune also is deserting me as well as your son.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रयोविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentythird sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
23_30.word_by_word: त्वया by you, मे mine, पथ्यम् proper, इदं वचः these words, न कृतम् not followed, तव your, निवारणे in preventing, शक्ता capable, न अस्मि च हि I was not, संयुगे in war, हतेन one who is killed, सुपुत्रा along with my son, हतास्मि I am dead, श्रीः goddess of fortune, त्वया सह along with you, मामिह from me, विजहाति has deserted.

24_1.shloka: [Sugriva blames himself for his action -- praises Vali for his virtues -- seeks Rama's permission to immolate himself -- Rama consoles -- Tara pleads with Rama to slay her.]तां चाश्रुवेगेन दुरासदेनत्वभिप्लुतां शोकमहार्णवेन।पश्यंस्तदा वाल्यनुजस्तरस्वीभ्रातुर्वधेनाप्रतिमेन तेपे4.24.1।।
24_1.translation: Sugriva, the unassailable younger brother of Vali, perceiving Tara overwhelmed in the ocean of grief felt agonized for the killing of his brother of incomparable power.
24_1.word_by_word: दुरासदेन by the unassailable, शोकमहार्णवेन by the ocean of grief, अश्रुवेगेन with the flood of tears, अभिप्लुताम् overwhelmed, ताम् her,पश्यन् perceiving, तदा then, तरस्वी powerful, वाल्यनुजः younger brother of Vali (Sugriva), अप्रतिमेन incomparable, भ्रातुः वधेन over killing of the brother, तेपे agonized.

24_2.shloka: स बाष्पपूर्णेन मुखेन वीक्ष्यक्षणेन निर्विण्णमना मनस्वी।जगाम रामस्य शनैस्समीपंभृत्यैर्वृतसम्परिदूयमानः4.24.2।।
24_2.translation: Face drenched with tears, highly sensitive Sugriva glanced at Tara for a moment.Pained and depressed at heart, and surrounded by attendants, he slowly approached Rama.
24_2.word_by_word: बाष्पपूर्णेन filled with tears, मुखेन face, क्षणेन for a moment, वीक्ष्य glanced, निर्विण्णमनाः  depressed soul, मनस्वी highly sensitive, सः Sugriva, सम्परिदूयमानः pained, भृत्यैः by attendants, वृतः surounded, शनैः slowly, रामस्य to Rama, समीपम् presence, जगाम reached.

24_3.shloka: स तं समासाद्य गृहीतचापमुदात्तमाशीविषतुल्यबाणम्।यशस्विनं लक्षणलक्षिताङ्गमवस्थितं राघव मित्युवाच4.24.3।।
24_3.translation: Duly approaching the illustrious Rama, endowed with auspicious signs, who stood with his bow and serpentlike arrows, Sugriva thus submitted:
24_3.word_by_word: सः he (Sugriva), गृहीतचापम् stood with the bow, उदात्तम् magnanimous, आशीविषतुल्यबाणम्  with sepentlike arrow, यशस्विनम् illustrious, लक्षणलक्षिताङ्गम् endowed with auspicious features, अवस्थितम् him, who stood, तं राघवम् that Rama, समासाद्य went near, इति thus, उवाच spoke.

24_4.shloka: यथा प्रतिज्ञातमिदं नरेन्द्रकृतं त्वया दृष्टफलं च कर्म।ममाद्य भोगेषु नरेन्द्रपुत्रमनो निवृत्तं सहजीवितेन4.24.4।।
24_4.translation: 'Your majesty you have struck down Vali as promised and the consequences of your action are seen now. O prince, however, my mind is not interested in the enjoyment of pleasures. I have no interest in life.
24_4.word_by_word: नरेन्द्र O king, त्वया by you, यथा as, प्रतिज्ञातम् promised, इदम् this, दृष्टफलम् seen the result, कर्म deed, कृतम् done, नरेन्द्रपुत्र son of a king, सह जीवितेन along with life, अद्य now, मम to me, मनः mind, भोगेषु in pleasures, निवृत्तम् not interested.

24_5.shloka: अस्यां महिष्यां तु भृशं रुदन्त्यापुरे च विक्रोशति दुःखतप्ते।हतेऽग्रजे संशयितेऽङ्गदे चन राम राज्ये रमते मनो मे4.24.5।।
24_5.translation: 'O Rama when the queen (Tara) is weeping, plunged in deep sorrow, the entire city is lamenting in agony, my elder brother is dead and the survival of Angada is uncertain, my mind no longer longs for the enjoyment of the kingdom.
24_5.word_by_word: राम Rama, अस्याम् when she, महिष्याम् this queen, भृशम् deeply, रुदन्त्याम्  is weeping, दुःखतप्ते agonized, पुरे in the city, विक्रोशति wailing, नृपे the king, हते killed, अग्रजे च and my elder brother, संशयिते uncertain, अङ्गदे Angada's life, मे to me, मनः mind, राज्ये in the kingdom, न रमते not interested.

24_6.shloka: क्रोधादमर्षादतिविप्रधर्षाद्भ्रातुर्वधो मेऽनुमतः पुरस्तात्।हते त्विदानीं हरियूथपेऽस्मिन्सुतीव्रमिक्ष्वाकुकुमार तप्स्ये।।4.24.6।।
24_6.translation: 'O prince of the Ikshvaku family, the anger due to my exilement and my intolerance of his harsh words, had made the killing of my brother agreeable to me earlier. Now that the leader of the monkey clan is killed I am  intensely hurt.
24_6.word_by_word: पुरस्तात् earlier, क्रोधात् owing to wrath, अमर्षात् due  to intolerance, अतिविप्रधर्षात् unable to tolerate harsh words, भ्रातुः of brother's, वधः killing, मे to me, अनुमतः agreeable, इक्ष्वाकुवर O prince of the Ikshvakus, इदानीम् now, अस्मिन् this, हरियूथपे leader of monkeys, हते killed, सुतीक्ष्णम् intensely, तप्स्ये I am pained.

24_7.shloka: श्रेयोऽद्य मन्ये मम शैलमुख्येतस्मिन्निवासश्चिरमृश्यमूके।यथा तथा वर्तयतस्स्ववृत्त्यानेमं निहत्य त्रिदिवस्य लाभः4.24.7।।
24_7.translation: 'I now feel dwelling long on the great mountain Rishyamuka  as usual and somehow  eking out a livelihood is preferable to attaining heaven as a sequel to the death of my brother.
24_7.word_by_word: अद्य now, स्ववृत्त्या natural manner, यथा तथा as usual, वर्तयतः maintaining, मम myself, तस्मिन् on that, शैलमुख्ये great mountain, ऋश्यमूके on Rishyamuka, चिरम् for a long time, निवासः residence, श्रेयः is better, मन्ये I think, इमम् him, निहत्य killing, त्रिदिवस्य even heaven, लाभः attainment, न not.

24_8.shloka: न त्वां जिघांसामि चरेति यन्मामयं महात्मा मतिमानुवाच।तस्यैव तद्राम वचोऽनुरूपमिदं पुनः कर्म च मेऽनुरूपम्4.24.8।।
24_8.translation: 'O Rama when the wise, highsouled Vali said to me, 'I do not like to kill you in this place be gone from here', his words reflected his nobility. This action of mine (killing of Vali) is, on the other hand, in consonance with my nature.
24_8.word_by_word: राम O Rama, महात्मा highsouled, मतिमान् wise, अयम् this , त्वा you, न जिघांसामि I do not like to kill you, चर you may move about, इति this, यत् that Vali, माम् to me, उवाच had said, तत् पुनः again that, तस्यैव to him, अनुरूपम् was fitting, इदम् this, वचः words, कर्म च and that action, मे of mine, अनुरूपम् is in keeping with my nature.

24_9.shloka: भ्राता कथं नाम महागुणस्यभ्रातुर्वधं राघव रोचयेत।राज्यस्य दुःखस्य च वीर सारंविचिन्तयन्कामपुरस्कृतऽस्सन्4.24.9।।
24_9.translation: 'O Rama prompted by passion, without thinking of the difference between obtaining the kingdom to satisfy one's desire and the consequent grief, which brother would  be willing to kill his virtuous elder brother?
24_9.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, वीर hero, कामपुरस्कृतऽस्सन् succumbed to passion, भ्राता brother, राज्यस्य  kingdom's, दुःखस्य च of grief, सारम् essence, चिन्तयन् thinking, महागुणस्य of a virtuous, भ्रातुः brother's, वधम् killing, कथम् नाम how can, रोचयेत to accept.

24_10.translation: 'The idea of killing me was not acceptable to his noble nature, while my wicked thought caused his death.
24_10.word_by_word: स्वमाहात्म्याव्यतिक्रमात् transgress one's own noble nature, मे वधः killing, मतः acceptable, नासीत् was not, मम me, बुद्धिदौरात्म्यात् due to my wicked thought, प्राणहारी slayer, व्यतिक्रमः overlooking आसीत् became.

24_11.shloka: द्रुमशाखावभग्नोऽहं मुहुर्तं परिनिष्टनन्।सान्त्वयित्वा त्वनेनोक्तो न पुनः कर्तुमर्हसि4.24.11।।
24_11.translation: 'When my brother hit me with the branch of a tree I screamed for a while. But he pacified me and said it was improper and he would not repeat it.
24_11.word_by_word: द्रुमशाखावभग्नः with the branch of a tree, मुहूर्तम् for a while, परिनिष्टनन् screamed, अहम् I, अनेन by him, सान्त्वयित्वा conciliating words, पुनः again, कर्तुम् to do, न अर्हसि not proper, उक्तः told.

24_12.shloka: भ्रातृत्वमार्यभावश्च धर्मश्चानेन रक्षितः।मया क्रोधश्च कामश्च कपित्वं च प्रदर्शितम्4.24.12।।
24_12.translation: 'Thus while nobility, a feeling of respect,brotherliness and duty was shown to me by my brother, I exhibited wrath, passion and  frivolity, the nature of the monkey.
24_12.word_by_word: अनेन by him, भ्रातृत्वम् brotherliness आर्यभावश्च feeling of respect, धर्मश्च feeling of duty, रक्षितः protected, मया by me, क्रोधश्च anger, कामश्च passion, कपित्वं च monkey nature, प्रदिर्शितम् is exhibited.

24_13.translation: 'O king  just as Indra committed sin by killing Tvashta, I have reaped the sin by  killing my brorther which is unthinkable, avoidable, undesirable and ignoble.
24_13.word_by_word: नरेन्द्र O king, भ्रातुः a brother's, वधात् with his death, त्वाष्ट्रवधात् by killing Tvashta, इन्द्र Indra, इव similarly, अचिन्तनीयम् unthinkable, परिवर्जनीयम् avoidable, अनीप्सनीयम् undesirable, स्वनवेक्षणीयम् ignoble, इम्म् this, पाप्मानम् sinful act, प्राप्तः अस्मि I committed.

24_14.shloka: पाप्मानमिन्द्रस्य मही जलं चवृक्षाश्च कामं जगृहुः स्त्रियश्च।को नाम पाप्मानमिमं क्षमेतशाखामृगस्य प्रतिपत्तुमिच्छेत्।।4.24.14।।
24_14.translation: 'Trees owned the sin of Indra and it was shared by the earth, water and women voluntarily.But who is there to pardon a monkey and own the sin?
24_14.word_by_word: कामं surely, इन्द्रस्य Indra's, पाप्मानम् sinful action, मही earth, जलं च and water, वृक्षाश्च andtrees, स्त्रियश्च women, जगृहुः received, शाखामृगस्य of an animal moving on branches of plants, a monkey, इमम् this, पाप्मानम् sin, को नाम who will, क्षमेत will pardon, प्रतिपत्तुम् to receive, इच्छेत will desire.

24_15.shloka: नार्हामि सम्मानमिमं प्रजानांन यौवराज्यं कुत एव राज्यम्।अधर्मयुक्तं कुलनाशयुक्तमेवंविधं राघव कर्म कृत्वा4.24.15।।
24_15.translation: 'O Rama having acted in an unrighteous manner, which destroys the clan, I am not fit to accept the respect of people nor the status of a prince regent, what to speak of kingship?
24_15.word_by_word: राघव Rama, अधर्मयुक्तम् unrighteous, कुलनाशयुक्तम् that which destroys the clan, एवंविधम् such, कर्म deed, कृत्वा having done, प्रजानाम् of people, इमम् this, सम्मानम् respect, न अर्हामि I am not fit, यौवराज्यम् heirapparent , न not, राज्यम् kingdom, कुत एव what to say.

24_16.shloka: पापस्य कर्ताऽस्मि विगर्हितस्यक्षुद्रस्य लोकापकृतस्य चैव।शोको महान्मामभिवर्ततेऽयंवृष्टेर्यथा निम्नमिवाम्बुवेगः4.24.16।।
24_16.translation: 'I have committed a sin which is condemned by the world. This intense grief has engulfed me just as the flow of rain water inundates the lowlying area when it rains.
24_16.word_by_word: विगर्हितस्य of a condemned one, क्षुद्रस्य of a mean act, लोकापकृतस्य  act harmful to the world, पापस्य of sin, कर्ता committed, अस्मि I have, वृष्टेः अम्बुवेगः इव similar to the speed of rain water (that reaches low levels), महान् great, अयं शोकः this sorrow, माम् me, निम्नम् to a lowlying area, इव like, अभिवर्तते engulfed.

24_17.translation: 'The elephant of sin (hanging heavily on me) has a tail of treacherous killing of one's own brother, which has resulted in deep sorrow in the form of a trunk, eyes, head and tusks.This elephant is striking at me as he would strike the bank of a river when he grows strong and gets puffed up with the pride of energy. (The idea of a proud elephant striking at the target is superimposed on the sin committed by Sugriva.The animal's tail is  the killing of a brother. Sugriva's remorse spreads all over the body trunk, eyes, head and tusks of the animal. As a proud elephant strikes at the river bank the sin is striking at Sugriva to destroy him. The Rupaka here is perfect and total).
24_17.word_by_word: सोदर्यघातापरगात्रवालः slaying of brother forming a tail of the body, सन्तापहस्ताक्षिशिरोविषाणः  remorse forming the trunk, eyes, head and tusks, एनोमयः sinful, दृप्तः proud, प्रवृद्धः growing, हस्ती elephant, माम् me, नदीकूलमिव like the banks of a river, अभिहन्ति is striking me.

24_18.shloka: अंहो बतेदं नृवराविषह्यंनिवर्तते मे हृदि साधुवृत्तम्।विवर्णमग्नौ परितप्यमानंकिट्टं यथा राघव जातरूपम्4.24.18।।
24_18.translation: 'O distinguished Rama this anxiety is unbearable for me. My good behaviour is relegated to the back of my heart unable to bear the sin, just like the dirt surfaces pushing the bright colour of gold when burnt in fire.
24_18.word_by_word: नृवर O distinguished sire, राघव O Rama, मे in my, हृदि in heart, साधुवृत्तम् good behaviour, इदम् this, अंहः this anxiety, अविषह्य unbearable, अग्नौ in fire, परितप्यमानम् beingburnt, विवर्णम्  brightens in colour, जातरूपम् gold, किट्टं यथा like the dirt, निवर्तते turned, बत indeed.

24_19.shloka: महाबलानां हरियूथपानामिदं कुलं राघव मन्निमित्तम्।अस्याङ्गदप्यापि च शोकतापादर्धस्थितप्राणमितीव मन्ये।।4.24.19।।
24_19.translation: 'O Rama this race of mighty monkey chiefs is as though reduced to a halfdead state because of my action and the grief of Angada.
24_19.word_by_word: राघव Rama, मन्नमित्तम् on my account, अस्य of this, अङ्गदस्य Angada's, शोकतापात् च due to remorse, महाबलानाम् of the strong one's, हरियूथपानाम् of the leaders of monkey troops, इदं कुलम् this race, अर्धस्थितप्राणम् halfdead, इतीव like this, मन्ये I feel.

24_20.shloka: सुतस्सुलभ्यस्सुजनस्सुवश्यःकुतस्तु पुत्रस्सदृशोऽङ्गदेन।न चापि विद्येत स वीर देशोयस्मिन्भवेत्सोदरसन्निकर्षः4.24.20।।
24_20.translation: 'One can find easily a son who is controllable and accessible in need but it is difficultto find a good son like Angada, who is virtuous and mighty and who is respectful to parents. O warrior (Rama), there is no place where I can get a brother like Vali. (A brother cannot be made. His relationship is natural. Rama stresses the same subhashita in Yuddhakanda when Lakshmana swooned).
24_20.word_by_word: अङ्गदेन with Angada, सदृशः find, सुजनः a good man सुलभ्य easily accessible in need, सुवश्यः सुतः  easily controllable son, पुत्रः son, कुतः while, वीर O warrior, यस्मिन् wherever, सोदरसन्निकर्षः association with a brother, भवेत् may be, सः देशः चापि place too, न विद्येत not there.

24_21.shloka: यद्यङ्गदो वीरवरार्ह जीवेत्जीवेच्छ माता परिपालनार्थम्।विना तु पुत्रं परितापदीनातारा न जीवेदिति निश्चितं मे4.24.21।।
24_21.word_by_word: यदि if, वीरवरार्हः  mighty hero, अङ्गदः Angada, जीवेत् may live, माता his mother, परिपालनार्थम् to take care  जीवेत् will live, पुत्रं विना तु without her son, परितापदीना dejected and miserable, तारा Tara, न जीवेत् will not live, इति this, मे my, निश्चितम् it is my firm belief.

24_22.shloka: सोऽहं प्रवेक्ष्याम्यतिदीप्तमग्निंभ्रात्रा च पुत्रेण च सख्यमिच्छन्।इमे विचेष्यन्ति हरिप्रवीरास्सीतां निदेशे तव वर्तमानाः4.24.22।।
24_22.translation: 'I am a sinner. I desire to enter the blazing fire (for atonement) in order to maintain friendship with my brother and son. At your command these vanara leaders will goround and search for Sita.
24_22.word_by_word: सः अहम् I, भ्रात्रा च and with brother, पुत्रेण च and with the son, सख्यम् friendship, इच्छन् desiring, अतिदीप्तम्  blazing, अग्निम् fire, प्रवेक्ष्यामि I will enter, इमे these, हरिप्रवीराः monkey leaders, तवनिदेशे as per your command, वर्तमानाः go around, सीताम् for Sita, विचेष्यन्ति will search.

24_23.shloka: कृत्स्नं तु ते सेत्स्यति कार्यमेतन्मय्यप्रतीते मनुजेन्द्रपुत्रकुलस्य हन्तारमजीवनार्हंरामानुजानीहि कृतागसं माम्4.24.23।।
24_23.translation: 'O prince Rama even if I am dead the entire task of yours, will be accomplished by the  vanara race. I have ruined the whole race. I am sinful and not fit to live. Permit me (to enter fire).
24_23.word_by_word: मनुजेन्द्रपुत्र O prince, राम Rama, मयि myself, अप्रतीतेऽपि even if dead, ते your, कृत्स्नम् entire, एतत् कार्यम् this task, सेत्स्यति will be accomplished, कुलस्य of the whole race, हन्तारम् who has killed, अजीवनार्हम् unfit to live, कृतागसम् sinful, माम् to me, अनुजानीहि permit.

24_24.shloka: इत्येवमार्तस्य रघुप्रवीरःश्रुत्वा वचो वाल्यनुजस्य तस्य।सञ्जातबाष्पः परवीरहन्तारामो मुहूर्तं विमना बभूव4.24.24।।
24_24.translation: Rama, the hero of the Raghu dynasty, a destroyer of the enemy heroes, was moved to tears. He lost composure for a moment when he heard Sugriva's lament.
24_24.word_by_word: रघुप्रवीरः  hero of the Raghu dynasty, परवीरहन्ता killer of enemy heroes, रामः Rama, आर्तस्य of the pitiable one, वालिजघन्यजस्य of Vali's brother, इत्येवम् in  this manner, वचः words, श्रुत्वा  hearing, सञ्जातबाष्पः shedding tears in grief, मुहूर्तम्  for a while, विमनाः disconsolate, बभूव remained.

24_25.shloka: तस्मिन् क्षणेऽभीक्ष्णमवेक्ष्यमाणःक्षितिक्षमावान्भुवनस्य गोप्ता।रामो रुदन्तीं व्यसने निमग्नांसमुत्सुकः सोऽथ ददर्श ताराम्4.24.25।।
24_25.translation: In that moment, Rama,the protector of the world, tolerant like the earth, beheld Tara plunged in grief, looking at him again and again and weeping.
24_25.word_by_word: क्षितिक्षमावान् tolerant like the earth, भुवनस्य of the world, गोप्ता protector, सः रामः that Rama, तस्मिन् in that, क्षणे  a moment, समुत्सुकः with kindly, अभीक्ष्णम् keenly, अवेक्षमाणः while looking, अथ then, व्यसने in grief, निमग्नाम् plunged in, रुदन्तीम् weeping, ताराम् Tara, ददर्श saw.

24_26.shloka: तां चारुनेत्रां कपिसिंहनाथांपतिं समाश्लिष्य तदा शयानाम्।उत्थापयामासुरदीनसत्त्वांमन्त्रिप्रधानाः कपिवीरपत्नीम्4.24.26।।
24_26.translation: The foremost ministers of Vali lifted up the beautifuleyed, noble Tara, wife of the monkey hero clinging to the body of her husband, a lion among monkeys.
24_26.word_by_word: चारुनेत्राम्  beautiful eyed, कपिसिंहनाथाम् whose lord was a great lion among monkeys, तदा then, पतिम् lord, समाश्लिष्य by clinging, शयानाम् while lying down, अदीनसत्त्वाम् a noble lady, कपिवीरपत्नीम् wife of the heroic monkey, ताम् her, मन्त्रिप्रधानाः principal ministers, उत्थापयामासु: made her get up.

24_27.shloka: सा विस्फुरन्ती परिरभ्यमाणाभर्तुस्सकाशादपनीयमाना।ददर्श रामं शरचापपाणिंस्वतेजसा सूर्यमिव ज्वलन्तम्4.24.27।।
24_27.translation: While Tara was clinging to her husband and struggling, and was being removed from there, she saw effulgent Rama holding bow and arrows glittering like the Sun.
24_27.word_by_word: परिरभ्यमाणा while she was clinging, भर्तुः husband's, सकाशात् from his presence, अपनीयमाना while she was taken away, सा she, विस्फुरन्ती struggling, शरचापपाणिम् wielding bow and arrows, स्वतेजसा by his effulgence, सूर्यमिव like the Sun, ज्वलन्तम् glowing, रामम् Rama, ददर्श saw.

24_28.shloka: सुसंवृतं पार्थिपलक्षणैश्चतं चारुनेत्रं मृगशाबनेत्रा।अदृष्टपूर्वं पुरुषप्रधानमयं स काकुत्स्थ इति प्रजज्ञे4.24.28।।
24_28.translation: The fawneyed Tara saw the magnificent man of Kakutstha family endowed with all royal marks and beautiful eyes, whom she had never seen before and knew he was Rama.
24_28.word_by_word: मृगशावनेत्रा  fawneyed, पार्थिवलक्षणैः with all royal marks, सुसंवृतम् him who was endowed with, चारुनेत्रम् beautifuleyed, अदृष्टपूर्वम् never seen before, पुरुषप्रधानम् a magnificent man, तम् him, अयम् this, सः he, काकुत्स्थ: of Kakutstha family, इति this, प्रजज्ञे recognized.

24_29.shloka: तस्येन्द्रकल्पस्य दुरासदस्यमहानुभावस्य समीपमार्या।आर्ताऽतितूर्णं व्यसनाभिपन्नाजगाम तारा परिविह्वलन्ती4.24.29।।
24_29.translation: The noble Tara, desperate, agonised, totally shaken up quickly went near the magnanimous Rama,  who was like Indraunapproachable.
24_29.word_by_word: आर्या noble, आर्ता desperate, व्यसनम् agony, प्रपन्ना  experiencing, तारा Tara, परिविह्वलन्ती lady shaken up, इन्द्रकल्पस्य equal to Indra, दुरासदस्य unapproachable, महानुभावस्य great man's, तस्य his, समीपम् proximity, अतितूर्णम् quickly, जगाम went.

24_30.shloka: सा तं समासाद्य विशुद्धसत्त्वाशोकेन सम्भ्रान्तशरीरभावा।मनस्विनी वाक्यमुवाच तारारामं रणोत्कर्षणलब्धलक्षम्4.24.30।।
24_30.translation: Wise Tara, baffled out of grief and agitated, with pure consciousness, approached Rama,  eminent in warfare who could hit the target. And spoke:
24_30.word_by_word: शोकेन out of sorrow, सम्भ्रान्तशरीरभावा a baffled lady with an agitated feeling, मनस्विनी wise, सा तारा that Tara, विशुद्धसत्त्वम् of pure consciousness, रणोत्कर्षणलब्धलक्षम् who could achieve his target due to his preeminence in warfare, तं रामम् Rama, समासाद्य after approaching, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच said.

24_31.translation: 'You are immeasurable, unassailable, self controlled, and best among the righteous. Your fame never diminishes. You have great sense of discrimination. You are known to possess forbearance like the mother earth. Your eyes are redcornered (which is a sign of valour).
24_31.word_by_word: त्वम् you, अप्रमेयश्च immeasurable, दुरासदश्च unassailable, जितेन्द्रियश्च a selfcontrolled man, उत्तमधार्मेकश्च best among the righteous, अक्षय्यकीर्तिश्च of undecaying fame, विचक्षणश्चwith a sense of discrimination, क्षितिक्षमावान् with forbearance like earth, क्षतजोपमाक्षः  redcorner eyed

24_32.translation: 'You are wielding bow and arrows. You possess mighty human limbs that have the power to destroy the enemy .You  have assumed a divine human body.
24_32.word_by_word: आत्तबाणासनबाणपाणिः wielder of bow and arrows, महाबलः mighty, संहननोपपन्नः has power to destroy, त्वम् you, मनुष्यदेहाभ्युदयम्  mighty limbs human, विहाय leaving, दिव्येन a divine, देहाभ्युदयेन assumed a form, युक्तः endowed.

24_33.shloka: येनैक बाणेन हतः प्रियो मेतेनैव मां त्वं जहि सायकेन।हता गमिष्यामि समीपमस्यन मामृते राम रमेत वाली4.24.33।।
24_33.translation: 'O warrior kill me by the same single arrow with which you killed my beloved lord,Vali. I will join him after death as he will not be happy without me.
24_33.word_by_word: वीर O warrior, येन by whom, एक बाणेन with a single arrow, मे प्रियः my beloved, हतः killed, तेन एव by the same, मां me, त्वम् you, माम् me, सायकेन with an arrow, जहीहि you may kill, हता killed, अस्य his, समीपम् near, गमिष्यामि I will go, मां विना without me, वाली Vali, न रमेत will not be happy.

24_34.shloka: स्वर्गेऽपि पद्मामलपत्रनेत्रस्समेत्य सम्प्रेक्ष्य च मामपश्यन्।न ह्येष उच्चावचताम्रचूडाविचित्रवेषाप्सरसोऽभजिष्यत्।।4.24.34।।
24_34.translation: 'If Vali with eyes of clear petals of a lotus does not see me in heaven, he may not join the wonderfully dressed apsarasas adorned with different kinds of red flowers in their hair.
24_34.word_by_word: पद्मामलपत्रनेत्र with eyes of clear petals of a lotus, एषः he, स्वर्गे अपि even in heaven, समेत्य after reaching, सम्प्रेक्ष्य looking around, माम् me, अपश्यन् by not seeing me, उच्चावचताम्रचूडा adorned with different kinds of reddish flowers in hair, विचित्रवेषाप्सरसः wonderfully dressed apsarasas, न अभजिष्यत् would not join them.

24_35.shloka: स्वर्गेऽपि शोकं च विवर्णतां चमया विना प्राप्प्यति वीर वाली।रम्ये नगेन्द्रस्य तटावकाशेविदेहकन्यारहितो यथा त्वम्4.24.35।।
24_35.translation: 'O Rama Vali will experience sorrow and become pale bereft of me even in heaven just as you are filled with sorrow even on a delightful mountain slope bereft of princess of Videha.
24_35.word_by_word: वीर O hero, विदेहकन्यारहितः without the princess of Videha, Sita, त्वम् you, नगेन्द्रस्य a mountain's, रम्ये in a delightful, तटावकाशे on the slopes, यथा as, वाली Vali, स्वर्गेऽपि even in heaven, मया विना without me, शोकं च and in grief, विवर्णतां च and pale, प्राप्स्यति will get.

24_36.shloka: त्वं वेत्थ यावद्वनिताविहीनःप्राप्नोति दुःखं पुरुषः कुमारः।तत्त्वं प्रजानन् जहि मां न वालीदुःखं ममादर्शनजं भजेत4.24.36।।
24_36.translation: 'You are aware of the grief of a young man separated from his wife. Kill me so that I can go to Vali. Let not Vali experience the sorrow of not seeing me.
24_36.word_by_word: कुमारः young, पुरुषः man, वनिताविहीनः separated from wife, दुःखम् grief, प्राप्नोति will get, त्वम् you, नेत्थ तावत् you are aware of it, तत् that, प्रजानन् while knowing, त्वम् you, माम् me, जहि  kill me, वाली Vali, मम of me, अदर्शनजम् arising due to my absence, दुःखम् sorrow, न भजेत he will not experience.

24_37.shloka: यच्चापि मन्येत भवान्महात्मास्त्रीघातदोषो न भवेत्तु मह्यम्।आत्मेयमस्येति च मां जहि त्वंन स्त्रीवधस्स्यान्मनुजेन्द्रपुत्र।।4.24.37।।
24_37.translation: 'O prince as you are great, you might think of the blemish of killing a woman. Since Tara is Vali's soul, you may kill me. It will not amount to killing a woman.(You will only be killing the soul of Vali by killing Tara).
24_37.word_by_word: मनुजेन्द्रपुत्र O prince, महात्मा great, भवान् you, मह्यम् to me, स्त्रीघातदोषः blemish of killing a woman, न भवेत् will not have, मन्येत think, यच्च as it is, इयम् she, अस्य his, आत्मा soul, इति thus, माम् me, त्वम् you, जहि kill, स्त्रीवधः killing a woman, न स्यात् may not be incurred.

24_38.shloka: शास्त्रप्रयोगाद्विविधाच्च वेदादात्माह्यनन्यः पुरुषस्य दाराः।दाराप्रदानान्नहि दानमन्यत्प्रदृश्यते ज्ञानवतां हि लोके4.24.38।।
24_38.translation: 'The  sacred texts as well as Vedic statements declare that wife is an inseparable part of the  husband's soul. To the learned, there is no greater offering in the world than restoring the wife to her husband. You will not beget any sin by killing me.
24_38.word_by_word: शास्त्रप्रयोगात् by the procedure ordained in the sastras, विविधात् in many ways, वेदात् from statements in the Vedas, दाराः a wife, पुरुषस्य husband's, आत्माह्यचन्यः an inseparable part of the soul, लोके in the world, दारप्रदानात् restoring a wife to her husband, अन्यत् other than that, दानम् an offering, ज्ञानवताम् for the learned people, न प्रदृश्यते हि is not seen.

24_39.shloka: त्वं चापि मां तस्य मम प्रियस्यप्रदास्य से धर्ममवेक्ष्य वीरअनेन दानेन न लप्स्यसे त्वमधर्मयोगं मम वीर घातात्4.24.39।।
24_39.translation: 'O gallant prince  if you give me away to my dear lord, carefully considering dharma, you will not be committing any adharma by killing me since it will be an offering.
24_39.word_by_word: वीर O gallant prince, त्वं चापि you also, धर्मम् dharma, अवेक्ष्य considering carefully, माम् me, मम प्रियस्य to my beloved, तस्य to him, प्रदास्यसे give away, त्वम् you, अनेन by this, दानेन by the offering, मम my, घातात् by killing me, अधर्मयोगम्  folly of committing an unrighteous act, न लप्स्यसे will not incur.

24_40.shloka: आर्तामनाथामपनीयमानामेवं विधामर्हसि मां निहन्तुम्।अहं हि मातङ्गविलासगामिनाप्लवङ्गमानामृषभेण धीमता4.24.40।।विना वरार्होत्तमहेममालिनाचिरं न शक्ष्यामि नरेन्द्र जीवितुम्।इत्येवमुक्तस्तु विभुर्महात्मातारां समाश्वास्य हितं बभाषे4.24.41।।
24_40.translation: 'O king it is proper on your part to kill me as I am in great distress. I am a helpless orphan torn away from her husband.O king I will not live long without the wise leader of monkeys who walked majestically like an elephant and wore the choicest golden necklace'. Implored by Tara this way, the great soul, Rama, lord of the earth said to Tara these words of consolation:
24_40.word_by_word: नरेन्द्र king, आर्ताम् to the helpless , अनाथाम् to an orphan, अपनीयमानाम् a woman torn away, एवं विधाम् to this state, माम् me, निहन्तुम् to kill, अर्हसि you should, अहम् I, मातङ्गविलासगामिना with the majestic gait of a proud elephant, धीमता wise, वरार्होत्तमहेममालिना adorned with the choicest golden necklace, प्लवङ्गमानां ऋषभेण विना without the bull among the monkeys, चिरम् for a long time, जीवितुम् to live, न शक्ष्यामि not be able, इत्येवम् in this manner, उक्तः having implored, विभुः lord of the earth, महात्मा a great soul, ताराम् Tara, समाश्वास्य  consoling, हितम् advice, बभाषे spoke.

24_41.shloka: मा वीरभार्ये विमतिं कुरुष्वलोको हि सर्वो विहितो विधात्रा।तं चैव सर्वं सुखदुःखयोगंलोकोऽब्रवीत्तेन कृतं विधात्रा।।4.24.42।।
24_41.translation: 'O wife of a valiant warrior Do not lose heart. The entire world is controlled by the creator. People maintain that joy and sorrow are foreordained.
24_41.word_by_word: वीरभार्ये O wife of a valiant one, विमतिम् disconsolate thought, माकुरुष्व not entertain, सर्वः all, लोकः worlds, विधात्रा by the creator, विहितः हि is fixed, सर्वम् all, तम् such, सुखदुःखयोगं चैव state of happiness and sorrow also, तेन विधात्रा by that creator, कृतम् done, लोकः people, अब्रवीत् have maintained.

24_42.shloka: त्रयोऽहि लोका विहितं विधानंनातिक्रमन्ते वशगा हि तस्य।प्रीतिं परां प्राप्स्यसि तां तथैवपुत्रस्तु ते प्राप्स्यति यौवराज्यम्।धात्रा विधानं विहितं तथैवन शूरपत्नयः परिदेवयन्ति4.24.43।।
24_42.word_by_word: त्रयः all the three, लोकाः (अपि) worlds also, तस्य his, वशगाः हि are under his control, विहितम् destined, विधानम् course, न अतिक्रमन्ते do not overstep the arrangement, पराम् supreme, तां प्रीतिम् such happiness, तथैव by that, प्राप्स्यसि will get, ते your, पुत्रश्च also son, यौवराज्यम् heirapparent, प्राप्स्यति will get, धात्रा by the creator, विधानम् arrangement, तथैव in such a manner, विहितम् is determined, शूरपत्नयः wives of warriors, न परिदेवयन्ति will not be wailing.

24_43.shloka: आश्वासिता तेन तु राघवेणप्रभावयुक्तेन परन्तपेन।सा वीरपत्नी ध्वनता मुखेनसुवेषरूपा विरराम तारा4.24.44।।
24_43.translation: Consoled by the influential Rama, scorcher of enemies, Tara the charming wife of a warrior, stopped wailing aloud.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुर्विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
24_43.word_by_word: प्रभावयुक्तेन by the influential, परन्तपेन by the scorcher of enemies, राघवेण by Rama, तेन by him, आश्वासिता a lady consoled, वीरपत्नी wife of a warrior, ध्वनता loud with wail, मुखेन countenance, सुवेषरूपा charming appearance, सा तारा that Tara, विरराम stopped.

25_1.shloka: [Rama exhorts Tara  on fate and time -- preparation for the funeral -- grief of monkeys and Angada -- performance of funeral rites.]सुग्रीवं चैव तारां च साङ्गदं सहलक्ष्मणः।समानशोकः काकुत्स्थ स्सान्त्वयन्निदमब्रवीत्।।4.25.1।।
25_1.translation: Rama and Lakshmana were equally sad. Rama, scion of the Kakutstha race, consoled Sugriva, Tara as well as Angada in the following words:
25_1.word_by_word: सहलक्ष्मणः accompanied by Lakshmana, समानशोकः equally sad, चैव also, काकुत्स्थ Kakutstha (Rama), सुग्रीवं Sugriva, साङ्गदम् along with Angada, तारां च and Tara, सान्त्वयन् pacifying, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

25_2.shloka: न शोकपरितापेन श्रेयसा युज्यते मृतः।यदत्रानन्तरं कार्यं तत्समाधातुमर्हथ4.25.2।।
25_2.translation: 'No lamentation revives the dead. So you should take up whatever is required now.
25_2.word_by_word: शोकपरितापेन by lamenting, मृतः the dead, श्रेयसा with wellbeing, न युज्यते will not gain, अत्र here, यत् whatever, अनन्तरम् later, कार्यम् should be done, तत् that, समाधातुम् to take up, अर्हथ you may do.

25_3.shloka: लोकवृत्तमनुष्ठेयं कृतं वो बाष्पमोक्षणम्।न कालादुत्तरं किञ्चित्कर्म शक्यमुपासितुम्4.25.3।।
25_3.translation: 'You have to go the worldly way. You have shed tears enough. Time is passing. You cannot perform the funeral after the lapse of appropriate time.
25_3.word_by_word: लोकवृत्तम् worldly way, अनुष्ठेयम् should be performed, वः by you, बाष्पमोक्षणम् shedding tears, कृतम् is done, कालात्  after lapse of time, उत्तरम् later, परम् supreme, किञ्चित् कर्म even a little task, उपासितुम् to be engaged in, न शक्यम् not possible.

25_4.shloka: नियतिः कारणं लोके नियतिः कर्मसाधनम्।नियतिस्सर्वभूतानां नियोगेष्विह कारणम्4.25.4।।
25_4.translation: 'Fate is the cause of the world. Fate is the means of accomplishment. Fate assigns duties to all beings.
25_4.word_by_word: लोके  the worlds, नियतिः fate, कारणम् cause, नियतिः fate, कर्मसाधनम् to accomplish tasks, इह here, सर्वभूतानाम् for all beings, नियोगेषु  to assign respective duties, नियतिः fate, कारणम् is the cause.

25_5.shloka: न कर्ता कस्यचित्कश्चिन्नियोगे चापिनेश्वरः।स्वभावे वर्तते लोकस्तस्य कालः परायणम्4.25.5।।
25_5.translation: 'No one can control another's action. No one including God can be the agent of action. No one has the power to entrust duty to others. This entire world is governed by one's own nature. Nature in turn is governed by Time (fate).
25_5.word_by_word: कस्यचित् for any one, नियोगे in controlling, कश्चित् any one, कर्ता agent of action, न not even, ईश्वरः अपि च Iswara also, न not, लोकः world, स्वभावे by nature, वर्तते follows, तस्य for that, कालः only time, परायणम् ultimate cause.

25_6.shloka: न कालः कालमत्येति न कालः परिहीयते।स्वभावं च समासाद्य न कश्चिदतिवर्तते4.25.6।।
25_6.translation: 'God (though independent) does not deviate from Time. Time cannot be escaped ortrangressed. It cannot be condoned or avoided. No one can transgress their own nature.
25_6.word_by_word: कालः Iswara, कालम् time, न अत्येति not deviate, कालः fate, न परिहीयते is not subjected any concession, कश्चित् anybody, स्वभावम् one's own nature, समासाद्य after exercising, न अतिवर्तते cannot transgress.

25_7.shloka: न कालस्यास्ति बन्धुत्वं न हेतुर्न पराक्रमः।न मित्रज्ञातिसम्बन्धः कारणं नात्मनो वशः4.25.7।।
25_7.translation: 'Time has no consideration for relationship, friendship, or kinship or valour. Time itself is the cause. It is never under one's control.
25_7.word_by_word: कालस्य Time, बन्धुत्वम् relationship, नास्ति is not there, आत्मनो वशः self itself, हेतुः reason, न no, पराक्रमः valour, न not, मित्रज्ञातिसम्बन्धः relationship based on friendship, कारणम् cause, न no.

25_8.shloka: किं तु कालपरीणामो द्रष्टव्यस्साधु पश्यता।धर्मश्चार्थश्च कामश्च कालक्रमसमाहिताः4.25.8।।
25_8.translation: 'However a wise man should visualise the turn of events in course of time with the right vision. Dharma, artha and kama are controlled by an order laid down by Time.
25_8.word_by_word: किं तु however, साधु properly, पश्यता by a person who can see, कालपरीणामः effect of fate, द्रष्टव्यः should be visualised, धर्मश्च and dharma, अर्थश्च even wealth, कामश्च and pleasures, कालक्रमसमाहिताः are ordained by an order which is controlled by fate.

25_9.shloka: इतस्स्वां प्रकृतिं वाली गतःप्राप्तः क्रियाफलम्।धर्मार्थकाम संयोगैः पवित्रं प्लवगेश्वरः4.25.9।।
25_9.translation: 'Vali, king of monkeys is dead and gone. He acted according to his own nature and attained the sacred fruit of his action comensurate with dharma, wealth and pleasuresin this world.
25_9.word_by_word: प्लवगेश्वरः king of monkeys, वाली vali, इतः dead, स्वाम् his own, प्रकृतिम् nature, गतः has reached, धर्मार्थकामसंयोगैः with the combination of dharma, wealth and pleasures, पवित्रम् sacred, क्रियाफलम् result of his action, प्राप्तः attained.

25_10.shloka: स्वधर्मस्य च संयोगाज्जितस्तेन महात्मना।स्वर्गः परिगृहीतश्च प्राणानपरिरक्षता4.25.10।।
25_10.translation: 'Great Vali has earned a place in heaven by virtue of his own dharma and not caring for his own life .He has got the heavenly position he earned.
25_10.word_by_word: प्राणान् life, अपरिरक्षिता by not protecting, तेन महात्मना by that great soul, स्वधर्मस्य सम्योगात् by virtue of his own dharma, स्वर्गः heaven, जितः won, परिगृहीतश्च has been accepted.

25_11.shloka: एषा वै नियतिश्शेष्ठा यां गतो हरियूथपः।तदलं परितापेन प्राप्तकालमुपास्यताम्4.25.11।।
25_11.translation: 'The state attained by the chief of monkeys is an excellent one.Therefore there is no need to regret. Attend to your duties (relating to rites)'
25_11.word_by_word: हरियूथपः chief of monkeys, याम् whichever, गतः has gone, एषा this, नियतिः destiny, श्रेष्ठा वै is the very best, तत् therefore, परितापेन to regret, अलम् no need of, प्राप्तकालम् at this time, उपास्यताम् attend.

25_12.shloka: वचनान्ते तु रामस्य लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा।अवदत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं सुग्रीवं गतचेतसम्4.25.12।।
25_12.translation: Seeing Sugriva had lost his senses, Lakshmana, the slayer of enemy warriors humbly said at the end of Rama's address:
25_12.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, वचनान्ते at the end of his address, परवीरहा slayer of enemy warriors, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, गतचेतसम् he who had lost his senses, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, प्रश्रितम् humbly, वाक्यम् these words, अवदत् said.

25_13.shloka: कुरु त्वमस्य सुग्रीव प्रेतकार्यमनन्तरम्।ताराङ्गदाभ्यां सहितो वालिनो दहनं प्रति।।4.25.13।।
25_13.translation: 'O Sugriva perform with Tara and Angada the funeral obsequies relating to the cremation of Vali.
25_13.word_by_word: सुग्रीव O Sugriva, त्वम् you, ताराङ्गदाभ्याम् with Tara and Angada, सहितः along with, अस्य his, अनन्तरम् later, प्रेतकार्यम् funeral rites, कुरु you may do, वालिनः for Vali, दहनं प्रति for the cremation.

25_14.shloka: समाज्ञापय काष्ठानि शुष्कानि च बहूनि च।चन्दनादीनि दिव्यानि वालिसंस्कारकारणात्4.25.14।।
25_14.translation: 'Let the best of dry logs and sandalwood be ordered for the funeral rites of Vali.
25_14.word_by_word: शुष्कानि dried, बहूनि many, काष्ठानि logs of wood, दिव्यानि best one, चन्दनादीनि च sandalwood and such things, वालिसंस्कार कारणात् for the funeral rites of Vali, समाज्ञापय  order.

25_15.shloka: समाश्वासय चैनं त्वमङ्गदं दीनचेतसम्।मा भूर्बालिशबुद्धिस्त्वं त्वदधीनमिदं पुरम्4.25.15।।
25_15.translation: 'Pacify the despondent Angada so that he does not entertain childish thoughts any more. This city is under your control (now).
25_15.word_by_word: त्वम् you, दीनचेतसम् despondent, एनम् him, अङ्गदम् Angada, समाश्वासय you may pacify, त्वम् you, बालिशबुद्धिः मा भूः you may not be childish, इदं पुरम् this city, त्वदधीनम् is under you.

25_16.shloka: अङ्गदस्त्वानयेन्माल्यं वस्त्राणि विविधानि च।घृतं तैलमथो गन्धान्यच्चात्र समनन्तरम्4.25.16।।
25_16.translation: 'Let Angada for his part collect garlands of many kinds, clothes, clarified butter, oil, fragrants and all that is required to be procured.
25_16.word_by_word: अङ्गदस्तु Angada for his part, माल्यम् garlands, विविधानि of many kinds, वस्त्राणि च clothes, घृतम् clarified butter, तैलम् oil, अथो now, गन्धानि fragrants, अत्र here, यत् whatever, समनन्तरम् is required to be collected, आनयेत् let him get.

25_17.shloka: त्वं तार शिबिकां शीघ्रमादायागच्छ सम्भ्रमात्।त्वरा गुणवती युक्ता ह्यस्मिन्काले विशेषतः4.25.17।।
25_17.translation: 'O Tara quickly get a swiftmoving litter fastened with ropes specially  suitable for this occasion.
25_17.word_by_word: तार Tara (a monkey), त्वम् you, सम्भ्रमात् hasten, शीघ्रम् quickly, शिबिकाम् litter, आदाय after getting, आगच्छ may come, त्वरा swiftly, गुणवती tied with ropes, विशेषतः specially, अस्मिन्काले at this time, युक्ता हि will be proper.

25_18.translation: 'Let those who are strong and capable among the monkeys be ready to carry  the dead body of Vali on a litter'.
25_18.word_by_word: शिबिकावाहनोचिताः those monkeys who can carry the litter, समर्थाः capable ones, बलिनश्चैव and strong also, प्लवगाः monkeys, सज्जीभवन्तु let them get ready, वालिनम् Vali's, निर्हरिष्यन्ति they will carry him.

25_19.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु सुग्रीवं सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः।तसौ भ्रातृसमीपस्थो लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा4.25.19।।
25_19.translation: Having thus spoken to Sugriva, Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, slayer of enemies, stood by his brother
25_19.word_by_word: सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः the delight of Sumitra, परवीरहा slayer of enemies, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana,सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, भ्रातृसमीपस्थः near his brother, स्थौ stood.

25_20.shloka: लक्ष्मणस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा तारस्सम्भ्रान्तमानसः।प्रविवेश गुहां शीघ्रं शिबिकासक्तमानसः4.25.20।।
25_20.translation: On hearing Lakshmana, Tara in an excited state quickly entered the cave city to get the litter.
25_20.word_by_word: तारः Tara, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सम्भ्रान्तमानसः with exited mind, शिबिकासक्तमानसः entrusted to get a latter, शीघ्रम्  quickly, गुहाम् cave, प्रविवेश entered.

25_21.shloka: आदाय शिबिकां तारस्स तु पर्यापतत्पुनः।वानरैरुह्यमानां तां शूरैरुद्वहनोचितैः4.25.21।।
25_21.translation: Tara jumped in on to the litter carried by strong monkeys.
25_21.word_by_word: सः तारः that Tara, उद्वहनोचितैः by those who can carry, शूरैः by heroes, वानरैः by monkeys, उह्यमानाम् being carried, ताम् that, शिबिकाम् litter, आदाय after getting, पुनःagain, पर्यापतत् jumped in.
