40_21.word_by_word: सप्तराज्योपशोभितम् prosperous and divided into seven kingdoms, यवद्वीपम् island of Java, सुवर्णाकरमण्डितम् glittering with gold mines, सुवर्णरूप्यकं चैव island of gold and silver, रत्नवन्तम् rich in gems, यवद्वीपम् island of Java, अतिक्रम्य going beyond, शिशिरोनाम Sisira by name, देवदानवसेवितः frequented by gods and demons, पर्वतः mountains, शृङ्गेण with a peak, दिवम् sky, स्पृशति touching, सर्वे all, सहिताः together, एतेषाम् of those, गिरिदुर्गेषु inaccesible mountains, प्रपातेषु at water falls, वनेषु च and in forests, यशस्विनीम् famed, रामपन्तीम् Rama's wife, मार्गध्वम् search for.

40_22.shloka: ततो रक्तजलं शोणमगाधं शीघ्रगामिनम्।गत्वा पारं समुद्रस्य सिद्धचारणसेवितम्।।4.40.33।।तस्य तीर्थेषु रम्येषु विचित्रेषु वनेषु च।रावण स्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः।।4.40.34।।
40_22.translation: 'Therefrom reach out to the swiftflowing river Sona which has redcoloured waters. Then crossing the sea which is the abode of Siddhas and Charanas search the different rivers reaching the sea, and the picturesque and wonderful forests to trace the abode of Ravana who has stolen Sita.
40_22.word_by_word: ततः then, रक्तजलम् having red coloured water, शीघ्रगामिनम् fastflowing, शोणमगाधम् deep river Sona, (प्राप्य after reaching there), समुद्रस्य ocean's, सिद्धचारणसेवितम् inhabited by Siddhas and Charanas, पारम् to the opposite side, गत्वा on going, तस्य its, रम्येषु in delightful, तीर्थेषु in rivers, वचित्रेषु wonderful, वनेषु च and forests, ततस्ततः here and there, वैदेह्या along with Vaidehi, रावणः Ravana, मार्गितव्यः should be sought for.

40_23.shloka: तत स्समुद्रद्वीपांश्च सुभीमान्द्रष्टुमर्हथ।ऊर्मिमन्तं समुद्रं च क्रोशन्तमनिलोद्धतम्।।4.40.35।।
40_23.translation: 'Then you may continue your search in the frightening islands of the sea as well as the sea which roars when stirred up by the wind.
40_23.word_by_word: ततः then, सुभीमान् fierce, समुद्रद्वीपांश्च islands of the ocean, समुद्रं च and the ocean, अनिलोद्धतम् swept by wind, क्रोशन्तम् roaring, ऊर्मिमन्तम् stirred up by waves, द्रष्टुम् to see, अर्हथ it is proper for you.

40_24.shloka: तत्रासुरा महाकायाश्छायां गृह्णन्ति नित्यशः।ब्रह्मणा समनुज्ञाता दीर्घकालं बुभुक्षिताः।।4.40.36।।
40_24.translation: 'Demons of huge bodies catch the shadows of passersby in that place as they have been hungry for long and have the permission of Brahma to do so.
40_24.word_by_word: तत्र there, दीर्घकालम् for a long time, बुभुक्षिताः very hungry people, महाकायाः those of huge body, असुराः demons, ब्रह्मणा by Brahma, समनुज्ञाताः have been permitted, नित्यम् ever, छायाम् shadow, गृह्णन्ति will be catching.

40_25.shloka: तं कालमेघप्रतिमं महोरगनिषेवितम्।अभिगम्य महानादं तीर्थेनैव महोदधिम्।।4.40.37।।ततो रक्तजलं भीमं लोहितं नाम सागरम्।गत्वा प्रेक्ष्यथ तां चैव बृहतीं कूटशाल्मलीम्।।4.40.38।।
40_25.translation: 'Reach out to the great roaring ocean which looks like a black cloud at the time of dissolution, inhabited by great serpents.Go through the bank of the river, and touch the frightening sea named Lohita of red coloured water.You will see a huge silkcotton tree in that place.
40_25.word_by_word: कालमेघप्रतिमम् looking like black clouds at the time of dissolution, महोरगनिषेवितम् inhabited by great serpents, महानादम् roaring, महोदधिम् great ocean, रक्तजलं with red colured water, तीर्थेनैव through the river bank, अभिगम्य after reaching there, लोहितं नाम called Lohita, सागरम् sea, गत्वा going there, बृहतीम् a huge one, ताम् that one, कूटशाल्मलीम् Salmali tree (silkcotton tree), प्रेक्ष्यथ seeing, चैव also.

40_26.shloka: गृहं च वैनतेयस्य नानारत्नविभूषितम्।तत्र कैलाससङ्काशं विहितं विश्वकर्मणा।।4.40.39।।
40_26.translation: 'You would see there a house of Garuda constructed by Visvakarma. It looks like the Kailasa mountain and is adorned with different kinds of gems.
40_26.word_by_word: तत्र there, नानारत्नविभूषितम् adorned with diffrent kinds of gems, कैलाससङ्काशम् lookinglike the Kailasa mountain, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, विहितम् constructed, वैनतेयस्य Garuda's, गृहम् house, च also.

40_27.shloka: तत्र शैलनिभा भीमा मन्देहा नाम राक्षसाः।शैलशृङ्गेषु लम्बन्ते नानारूपा भयावहाः।।4.40.40।।
40_27.translation: 'There are frightening demons called Mandehas of different forms, fearsome as huge mountains hanging down the mountain peaks.
40_27.word_by_word: तत्र there, शैलशृङ्गेषु on the mountain cliffs, शैलनिभा: huge as mountain, भीमाः frightening, नानारूपाः of different forms, भयावहाः fearsome, मन्देहाः नाम called Mandehas, राक्षसाः demons, लम्बन्ते will be hanging down.

40_28.shloka: ते पतन्ति जले नित्यं सूर्यस्योदयनं प्रति।निहता ब्रह्मतेजोभिरहन्यहनि राक्षसाः।।4.40.41।।अभितप्ताश्च सूर्येण लम्बन्ते स्म पुनः पुनः।
40_28.translation: 'Those demons  keep dropping down in water at the time of Sunrise every day, by the power of Gayatri mantras recited by brahmins scorched by the heat of the Sun. Again and again they keep hanging  on to the cliffs.
40_28.word_by_word: ते those, राक्षसाः demons, अहन्यहनि every day, सूर्योदयनं प्रति at the time of Sunrise, नित्यम् always, सूर्येण by the Sun's heat, अभितप्ताः scorched, ब्रह्मतेजोभिः by the power of mantras recited by brahmins, निहताः dead, जले in water, पतन्ति drop down, पुनः पुनः again and again, लम्बन्ते स्म keep hanging on.

40_29.shloka: ततः पाण्डुरमेघाभं क्षीरोदं नाम सागरम्।।4.40.42।।गत्वा द्रक्ष्यथ दुर्धर्षा मुक्ताहारमिवोर्मिभिः।
40_29.translation: 'You who are unassailable by the enemies, will see the milky ocean appearing like clouds, resembling a pearl necklace with its rows of waves.
40_29.word_by_word: दुर्धर्षाः one who is unassailable by the enemies, ततः then, गत्वा after going, पाण्डुरमेघाभम् appearing like white clouds, ऊर्मिभिः white waves, मुक्ताहारमिव like pearl chain, क्षीरोदं नाम  milky ocean by name, सागरम् ocean, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

40_30.shloka: तस्य मध्ये महान् श्वेतो ऋषभो नाम पर्वतः।।4.40.43।।दिव्यगन्धैः कुसुमितै राजितैश्च नगैर्वृतः।सरश्च राजतैः पद्मैर्ज्वलितैर्हेमकेसरैः।।4.40.44।।नाम्ना सुदर्शनं नाम राजहंसैस्समाकुलम्।
40_30.translation: 'In the midst of that ocean stands a majestic white mountain named Rishaba surrounded by trees filled with silver flowers emitting wonderful fragrance.There is also a lake named Sudarsana with glittering silver lotuses having gleaming golden filaments. Royal swans inhabit these surroundings.
40_30.word_by_word: तस्य मध्ये in the middle, दिव्यगन्धैः with wonderful fragrances, कुसुमितैः flowering, राजितैः  glowing, नगैः with mountains, वृतः surrounded, ऋषभो नाम called Rishaba, श्वेतः white, पर्वतः mountain, ज्वलितैः with glittering, हेमकेसरैः with golden filaments, राजतैः with silver, पद्मैः with lotuses, राजहंसैः with royal swans, समाकुलम् surrounded, नाम्ना known as, सुदर्शनं नाम called Sudarsana, सरश्च lake.

40_31.translation: 'The deities, called charanas, yakshas and kinneras, also apsarasas keep comingthere to stoll by that lotus pond.
40_31.word_by_word: विबुधाः deities, चारणाः charanas, यक्षाः yakshas, किन्नराश्च even kinneras, अप्सरोगणाः groups of apasaras, हृष्टाः joyfully, रिरंसवः those desirous of strolling, तां that, नलिनीम् lotus pond, समभिगच्छन्ति keep coming.

40_32.shloka: क्षीरोदं समतिक्रम्य तदा द्रक्ष्यथ वानराः।।4.40.46।।जलोदं सागरं शीघ्रं सर्वभूतभयावहम्।
40_32.translation: 'O monkeys going beyond the milky ocean you will see the seas most dreadful to all creatures.
40_32.word_by_word: वानराः O monkeys, क्षीरोदम् milky ocean, समतिक्रम्य going beyond, सर्वभूतभयावहम् most dreadful to all creatures, जलोदम् ocean, सागरम् sea, शीघ्रं swiftly, तदा then, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

40_33.shloka: तत्र तत्कोपजं तेजः कृतं हयमुखं महत्।।4.40.47।।अस्याहुस्तन्महावेगमोदनं सचराचरम्।
40_33.translation: 'Here is born Hayamukha, out of the fastspreading fire of anger of the ocean. Its movable and  immovable creatures constitute his food.
40_33.word_by_word: तत्र there, तत्कोपजम् born out of his anger, महत् great, हयमुखम् face of horse, तेजः bright, कृतम् is created, सचराचरम् both movable and immovable creatures, महावेगम् very fast, तत् that, अस्य its, ओदनम् food, आहुः they said.

40_34.shloka: तत्र विक्रोशतां नादो भूतानां सागरौकसाम्।।4.40.48।।श्रूयते च समर्थानां दृष्ट्वा तद्बडबामुखम्।
40_34.translation: 'You can hear the sounds of helpless oceanic creatures crying loudly on seeing the burning face of Vadava.
40_34.word_by_word: तत्र there, तत् that, बडबामुखम् burning face of Vadava, दृष्ट्वा seeing, असमर्थानाम् of the weak, विक्रोशताम् crying loudly, सागरौकसाम् dwelling in the sea, भूतानाम् of creatures, नादः sound, श्रूयते is heard.

40_35.shloka: स्वादूदस्योत्तरे देशे योजनानि त्रयोदश।।4.40.49।।जातरूपशिलो नाम महान्कनकपर्वतः।
40_35.translation: 'Thirteen yojanas to the north of this ocean of pure waters is a huge golden mountain called Jatarupasila.
40_35.word_by_word: स्वादूदस्य of the ocean of tasty water, उत्तरे देशे  the north direction, त्रयोदश thirteen, योजनानि yojanas, महान् huge, कनकपर्वतः golden mountain, जातरूपशिलो नाम called Jatarupasila.

40_36.shloka: तत्र चन्द्रप्रतीकाशं पन्नगं धरणीधरम्।।4.40.50।।पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षं ततो द्रक्ष्यथ वानराः।आसीनं पर्वतस्याग्रे सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम्।।4.40.51।।सहस्रशिरसं देवमनन्तं नीलवाससम्।
40_36.translation: 'O monkeys on top of the mountain you will see Ananta, a thousandhooded serpent seated, as bright as the Moon, robed in blue, with large eyes like lotus petals bearing the load of the earth, and revered by all beings.
40_36.word_by_word: वानराः O monkeys, ततः then, तत्र there, पर्वतस्य mountain's, अग्रे on the top, आसीनम् seated, चन्द्रप्रतीकाशम् resembling the Moon in brightness, पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षम् of large eyes like lotus petals, सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् revered by all beings, सहस्रशिरसम् thousandheaded, नीलवाससम् robed in blue cloth, देवम् worshipped, धरणीधरम् bearing the load of the earth, अनन्तम् Ananta, पन्नगम् serpent, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

40_37.shloka: त्रिशिराः काञ्चनः केतुस्तालस्तस्य महात्मनः।।4.40.52।।स्थापितः पर्वतस्याग्रे विराजति सवेदिकः।
40_37.translation: 'Highsouled Ananta's flag is a threeheaded golden palm tree shining on an altar on top of the mountain.
40_37.word_by_word: महात्मनः  highsouled, तस्य पर्वतस्य of that mountain, अग्रे on top, स्थापितः is fixed, केतुः flag of Ananta, त्रिशिराः triplecrowned, काञ्चनः golden, सवेदिकः with an altar, तालः Tala,विराजति shining.

40_38.shloka: पूर्वस्यां दिशि निर्माणं कृतं तत् त्रिदशेश्वरैः।।4.40.53।।ततः परं हेममय श्श्रीमानुदयपर्वतः।तस्य कोटिर्दिवं स्पृष्ट्वा शतयोजनमायता।।4.40.54।।जातरूपमयी दिव्या विराजति सवेदिका।
40_38.translation: 'The flag of Ananta is fixed by the gods in the eastern direction. Beyond that stands the famous golden mountain behind which the sun rises. Its golden peak with a divine altar spread over a hundred yojanas touches heaven.
40_38.word_by_word: तत् that, निर्माणम् arrangement , पूर्वस्यां दिशि in the eastern quarter, त्रिदशेश्वरैः by the gods, कृतम् done, ततः परम् beyond that, हेममयः full of gold, श्रीमान् famous, उदयपर्वतः mountain behind which the sun rises, तस्य its, जातरूपमयी golden, दिव्या divine, सवेदिका that altar, शतयोजनम् a hundred yojanas, आयता long, कोटिः the edge, दिवम् sky, स्पृष्ट्वा touching, विराजति shining.

40_39.translation: 'The place looks beautiful with salas, palmyras, tamalas and karnikara trees in full bloom. These golden, divine flowers shine like the Sungod.
40_39.word_by_word: जातरूपमयैः golden form, दिव्यैः divine, सूर्यसन्निभैः resembling the Sun, पुष्पितैः flowering, सालैः with  salas, तालैः with palmyras, तमालैश्च with tamalas, कर्णिकारैश्च with karnikaras also, शोभते enchanting.

40_40.shloka: तत्र योजनविस्तारमुच्छ्रितं दशयोजनम्।।4.40.56।।शृङ्गं सौमनसं नाम जातरूपमयं ध्रुवम्।
40_40.translation: 'There is a huge golden peak called Saumanas of ten yojanas in height spread over a breadth of one yojana.
40_40.word_by_word: तत्र there, योजनविस्तारम् spread over a yojana, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, उच्छ्रितम् tall, जातरूपमयम् golden, ध्रुवम् certainly, सौमनसं नाम called Saumanasa, शृङ्गम् peak.

40_41.shloka: तत्रपूर्वं पदं कृत्वा पुरा विष्णुस्त्रिविक्रमे।।4.40.57।।द्वितीयं शिखरे मेरोश्चकार पुरुषोत्तमः।
40_41.translation: 'When the supreme being, Visnu took his three strides as Lord Vamana, he placed his first foot on this peak and the second on the peak of mount Meru.
40_41.word_by_word: पुरुषोत्तमः supreme being, विष्णुः Visnu, पुरा formerly, त्रिविक्रमे taking three strides, पूर्वम् first, तत्र there, पदम् foot, कृत्वा after that, द्वितीयम् second, मेरोः Meru's, शिखरे on the peak, चकार placed.

40_42.shloka: त्तरेण परिक्रम्य जम्बूद्वीपं दिवाकरः।।4.40.58।।दृश्यो भवति भूयिष्ठं शिखरं तन्महोच्छ्रयम्।
40_42.translation: 'The Sun circumabulates Jambu island  and when he arrives at this lofty cliff of the mountain, it takes the northern direction and becomes visible to the world.
40_42.word_by_word: दिवाकरः Sun, जम्बूद्वीपं उत्तरेण north of Jambu island, परिक्रम्य circumambulating, महोच्छ्रयम् very tall, तत् that, शिखरम् peak, भूयिष्ठम् greatly, दृश्यः is seen, भवति will be.

40_43.shloka: तत्र वैखानसा नाम वालखिल्या महर्षयः।।4.40.59।।प्रकाशमाना दृश्यन्ते सूर्यवर्णास्तपस्विनः।
40_43.translation: 'Over there the great ascetics Vaikhanasas and Valakhilyas appear  like the radiating Sun.
40_43.word_by_word: तत्र there, सूर्यवर्णाः those with the lustre of the Sungod, तपस्वीनः great ascetics, वैखानसानाम named Vaikhanasas, वालखिल्याः महर्षयः Valakhilya sages, प्रकाशमानाः radiating, दृश्यन्ते appear.

40_44.shloka: अयं सुदर्शनो द्वीपः पुरो यस्य प्रकाशते।।4.40.60।।यस्मिं स्तेजश्च चक्षुश्च सर्वप्राणभृतामपि।
40_44.translation: 'The region in front of this mountain is called Sudarsana Island. This island is where the Sun who gives all beings the ability to see rises.
40_44.word_by_word: यस्य its, पुरः in front of, सर्वप्राणभृतामपि  for all beings, चक्षुश्च the (ability to see with) eye, प्रकाशते shines, तत् that, तेजः glow, यस्मिन् therefore, अयम् this, सुदर्शनः द्वीपः island of Sudarsana.

40_45.shloka: शैलस्य तस्य शृङ्गेषु कन्दरेषु वनेषु च।।4.40.61।।रावणस्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः।
40_45.translation: You should search for Ravana and Vaidehi on the peak of that mountain, in the caves, in the forests here and there.
40_45.word_by_word: तस्य शैलस्य of that mountain, शृङ्गेषु on the peak, कन्दरेषु in the caves, वनेषु च in the forests, ततस्ततः here and there, रावणः Ravana, वैदेह्यासह with Vaidehi, मार्गितव्यः may be looked for.

40_46.shloka: काञ्चनस्य च शैलस्य सूर्यस्य च महात्मनः।।4.40.62।।आविष्टा तेजसा सन्ध्या पूर्वा रक्ता प्रकाशते।
40_46.translation: 'The early morning twilight appears bright red because of the glow of the golden mountain as well as of the great Sungod.
40_46.word_by_word: काञ्चनस्य of the golden, शैलस्य mountain's, महात्मनः of the great, सूर्यस्य च and Sun's, तेजसा with brightness, आविष्टा filled, पूर्वा सन्ध्या early morning twilight, रक्ता red in colour, प्रकाशते will be glowing.

40_47.shloka: पूर्वमेतत्कृतं द्वारं पृथिव्या भुवनस्य च।।4.40.63।।सूर्यस्योदयनं चैव पर्वा ह्येषा दिगुच्यते।
40_47.translation: 'Here is the entrance for the earth as well as for all the worlds and since the Sun also rises from this place it is called the eastern direction.
40_47.word_by_word: पूर्वम् east, एतत् this, पृथिव्याः earth's, भुवनस्य for the world, द्वारम् entrance, सूर्यस्य Sun's, उदयनं च rise also, कृतम् was made, एषा this, पूर्वा दिक् eastern direction, उच्यते is being called.

40_48.shloka: तस्य शैलस्य पृष्ठेषु निर्झरेषु गुहासु च।।4.40.64।।रावण स्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः।
40_48.translation: 'You may look for Ravana and also for Vaidehi even behind the mountain on the plains and also near the mountain streams and caves all over.
40_48.word_by_word: तस्य शैलस्य this mountain's, पृष्ठेषु on the plain land, निर्झरेषु by the mountain streams, गुहासु च and in caves, वैदेह्या सह along with Vaidehi, रावणः Ravana, ततस्ततः all over, मार्गितव्यः should be searched.

40_49.shloka: ततः परमगम्या स्याद्दिक्पूर्वा त्रिदशावृता।।4.40.65।।रहिता चन्द्रसूर्याभ्यामदृश्या तिमिरावृता।
40_49.translation: 'Beyond, there is no Sun or Moon. Darkness pervades. It is neither accessible norvisible. It is guarded by the gods.
40_49.word_by_word: ततः परम् beyond that, त्रिदशावृता guarded by gods, चन्द्रसूर्याभ्याम् by Moon and Sun, रहिता not present, तिमिर darkness, आवृता pervaded by, पूर्वादिक् eastern direction, अगम्या स्यात् not possible to reach, अदृश्या invisible.

40_50.shloka: शैलेषु तेषु सर्वेषु कन्दरेषु वनेषु च।।4.40.66।।ये च नोक्ता मया देशा विचेया तेषु जानकी।
40_50.translation: 'You should look for Janaki everywhere -- on the mountains, in the lakes and  in the places not indicated by me.
40_50.word_by_word: तेषु among those, शैलेषु on the mountains, सर्वेषु everywhere, कन्दरेषु in the caves, वनेषु च in the forests, मया my, ये those, देशाः spots, नोक्ताः not mentioned, तेषु in those places, जानकी Janaki, विचेया should be searched.

40_51.shloka: एतावद्वानरैश्शक्यं गन्तुं वानरपुङ्गवाः।।4.40.67।।अभास्करममर्यादं न जानीमस्ततः परम्।
40_51.translation: 'O chieftains monkeys can go that far. We know not what lies beyond those boundaries where no Sun shines.
40_51.word_by_word: वानरपुङ्गवाः O chieftains of monkeys, एतावत् till there, वानरैः by monkeys, गन्तुम् to go, शक्यम् is possible, अभास्करम् where there is no Sunlight, अमर्यादं च devoid of boundaries, ततः परम् beyond that, न जानीमः is not known to us.

40_52.shloka: अधिगम्य तु वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च।।4.40.68।।मासे पूर्णे निवर्तध्वमुदयं प्राप्य पर्वतम्।
40_52.translation: 'Reaching the mountain behind which the sun rises, look for Vaidehi and the home of Ravana and return by the month's end.
40_52.word_by_word: उदयं पर्वतम् the mountain behind which the sun rises, प्राप्य after reaching, वैदेहीम् for Vaidehi, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च home, अधिगम्य after reaching, मासे in one month, पूर्णे before completion, निवर्तध्वम् you may return.

40_53.shloka: ऊर्ध्वं मासान्न वस्तव्यं वसन्वध्यो भवेन्मम।।4.40.69।।सिद्धार्थास्सन्निवर्तध्वमधिगम्य तु मैथिलीम्।
40_53.translation: 'If you do not report within one month, you will be killed. May you see Maithili and come back after reaching the goal.
40_53.word_by_word: मासात् ऊर्ध्वम् beyond one month, न वस्तव्यम् you should not stay away, वसन् while one stays, मम to me, वध्यः will be killed, सिद्धार्थाः accomplishing the goal, मैथिलीम् Maithili, अधिगम्य reaching, सन्निवर्तध्वम् return.

40_54.shloka: महेन्द्रकान्तां वनषण्डमण्डितांदिशं चरित्वा निपुणेन वानराः।अवाप्य सीतां रघुवंशजप्रियांततो निवृत्तास्सुखिनो भविष्यथ।।4.40.70।।
40_54.translation: 'O monkeys go about the beloved quarter (east) of Indra bestowed with differnt kinds of forests and groves. Look out carefully for Rama's beloved Sita, spot her and return, you will live happily.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकांडे चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortieth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
40_54.word_by_word: वानराः O monkeys, महेन्द्रकान्ताम् Indra's beloved, वनषण्डमण्डिताम् bestowed with different kinds of forests and groves, दिशम् quarter, निपुणेन carefully, चरित्वा after going about, रघुवंशजप्रियाम् Rama's beloved, सीताम् Sita, अवाप्य after finding, ततः then, निवृत्ताः returning, सुखिनः happy ones, भविष्यथ you will be.

41_1.shloka: [Sugriva sends another troop including Hanuaman, Nila, Angada and Jambavan in the southern direction]ततः प्रस्थाप्य सुग्रीवस्तन्महद्वानरं बलम्।दक्षिणां प्रेषयामास वानरानभिलक्षितान्।।4.41.1।।
41_1.translation: Sugriva then sends in the southern direction another vanara army known for their excellence.
41_1.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, महत् great, तत् that, वानरं बलम् monkey army, प्रस्थाप्य after despatching, ततः then, अभिलक्षितान् those recognised for excellence, वानरान् monkeys, दक्षिणाम् southern direction, प्रेषयामास sent forth.

41_2.shloka: नील मग्निसुतं चैव हनुमन्तं च वानरम्।पितामहसुतं चैव जाम्बवन्तं महाबलम्।।4.41.2।।सुहोत्रं च शरारिं च शरगुल्मं तथैव च।गजं गवाक्षं गवयं सुषेणमृषभं तथा।।4.41.3।।मैन्दं च द्विविदं चैव विजयं गन्धमादनम्।उल्कामुखमसङ्गं च हुताशनसुतावुभौ।।4.41.4।।अङ्गदप्रमुखान्वीरान्वीर: कपिगणेश्वरः।वेगविक्रमसम्पन्नान्सन्दिदेश विशेषवित्।।4.41.5।।
41_2.translation: The extraordinary Sugriva commanded Nila, son of the firegod, Hanuman, the formidable, Jambavan, son of Brahma, Suhotra, Sarari, Saragulma, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sushena, Vrishabam, Mainda, Dvivida, Vijaya, Gandhamadana, the two sons of Firegod, Ulkamuka and Asanga including Angada, leader of the group, to proceed. All of them were endowed with speed and valour.
41_2.word_by_word: वीरः hero, विशेषवित् extraordinary, कपिगणेश्वरः leader of the monkey army, अग्निसुतम् son of the firegod, नीलम् Nila, वानरम् monkey, हनुमन्तं च  and Hanumantha, पितामहसुतम् son ofBrahma, महाबलम् of formidable strength, जाम्बवन्तं Jambavanta चैव also, सुहोत्रं च Suhotra and also, शरारिं च Sarari and, तथैव च so also, शरगुल्मम् Saragulma, गजम् Gaja, गवाक्षम् Gavaksha, गवयम् Gavaya, सुषेणम् Sushena, तथा so also, वृषभम् Vrisabha, मैन्दं च Mainda and, द्विविदं चैव Dvivida also, विजयम् Vijaya, गन्धमादनम् Gandhamadana, उल्कामुखम् Ulkamukha, असङ्गं च Asanga, हुताशनसुत son of firegod, उभौ both, अङ्गदप्रमुखान् Angada, वेगविक्रमसम्पन्नान् those endowed with speed and valour, वीरान् heroes, सन्दिदेश delivered the message.

41_3.translation: Then Sugriva ordered mighty Angada to lead the group of the heroic monkeys in the southern direction.
41_3.word_by_word: अथ then, तेषाम् of them, हरिवीराणाम् of those monkeys, महाबलम् one of formidable strength, अङ्गदम् Angada, अग्रेसरम् leader, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern direction, आदिशत् ordered.

41_4.shloka: ये केचन समुद्देशास्तस्यां दिशि सुदुर्गमाः।कपीशः कपिमुख्यानां स तेषां तानुदाहरत्।।4.41.7।।
41_4.translation: Sugriva, the monkey king, explained to the monkey chiefs about the inaccessible places in the southern direction.
41_4.word_by_word: तस्यां दिशि in that quarter, दुर्गमाः inaccessible, ये केचन those, समुद्देशाः spots, सः कपीशः the monkey king, कपिमुख्यानाम् to the chieftains of monkeys, तानुदाहरत् he gave an account.

41_5.shloka: सहस्रशिरसं विन्ध्यं नानाद्रुमलतायुतम्।नर्मदां च नदीं रम्यां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.8।।ततो गोदावरीं रम्यां कृष्णवेणीं महानदीम्।वरदां च महाभागां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.9।।मेखलामुत्कलां चैव दशार्णनगराण्यपि।आश्ववन्तीमवन्तीं च सर्वामेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.10।।
41_5.translation: 'Search for Sita all over Vindhya of a thousand peaks filled with several trees and creepers, and along the river Narmada. Then proceed to Godavari, lovely Krishnaveni, Mahanadi, Varada and Mahabhaga inhabited by terrific serpents.You may search Mekhala, Utkala and Dasarna cities, Asvavanti and Avanti countries also.
41_5.word_by_word: सहस्रशिरसम् of thousand peaks, नानाद्रुमलतायुतम् filled with several trees and creepers, विन्ध्यम् Vindhya, नर्मदां नदीं च and river Narmada, ततः then, रम्याम् delightful, गोदावरीम् Godavari, महानदीम् Mahanadi, कृष्णवेणीम् Krishnaveni, महाभागाम् Mahabhaga, महोरगनिषेविताम् inhabited by terrific serpents, वरदां च and Varada river, मेखलाम् river Mekhala, उत्कलां च एव Utkala also, दशार्णनगराण्यपि towns of Dasarna, आश्ववन्तीम् Asvavanti, अवन्तीम् Avanti, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत you may survey.

41_6.shloka: विदर्भानृषिकांश्चैव रम्यान्माहिषकानपि।तथा वङ्गान्कलिङ्गांश्च कौशिकांश्च समन्ततः।।4.41.11।।अन्वीक्ष्य दण्डकारण्यं सपर्वतनदीगुहाम्।नदीं गोदावरीं चैव सर्वमेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.12।।तथैवान्ध्रांश्च पुण्ड्रांश्च चोलान्पाण्ड्यांत्स केरलान्।
41_6.translation: 'Look for Sita in the countries of Vidarbha and Rishika, in the picturesque country of Mashaka, Vanga and Kalinga and all over Kausika. Look for her in mountains caves and on river banks, in Dandaka forest, in Godavari, in Andhra also in Pundra, Chola and Pandya countries and all over Kerala.
41_6.word_by_word: विदर्भान् in Vidarbha, ऋषिकांश्चैव and in Rishika, रम्यान् picturesque, माहिषकानपि country of  Mahishaka, तथा so also, वङ्गकलिङ्गांश्च Vanga and Kalinga, समन्ततः all over, कौशिकांश्च Kausika, सपर्वतनदीगुहाम् in the mountains, river banks and caves, दण्डकारण्यम् in Dandakaforest, अन्वीक्ष्य after searching for, गोदावरीं Godavari, नदीं river, चैव also, तथैव in the same way, आन्ध्रांश्च Andhra also, पुण्ड्रांश्च country Pundra even, चोलान् Chola, पाण्ड्यांत्स Pandya country, केरलान् Kerala, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत search.

41_7.shloka: अयोमुखश्च गन्तव्यः पर्वतो धातुमण्डितः।।4.41.13।।विचित्रशिखर श्श्रीमांश्चित्रपुष्पितकाननः।सचन्दनवनोद्देशो मार्गितव्यो महागिरिः।।4.41.14।।
41_7.translation: 'Look for Sita all over mount Ayomukha (known as Malaya), rich in ores. It has wonderful peaks. It looks colourful with the forest in bloom. This great mountain is full of sandalwood forest.
41_7.word_by_word: धातुमण्डितः with ores, विचित्रशिखर wonderful peaks, श्रीमान् rich, चित्र पुष्पितकाननः a forest full of colourful flowers, अयोमुखः पर्वतः mount Ayomukha, गन्तव्यः should visit, सचन्दनवनोद्देशः of sandalwood forest, महागिरिः great mountain, मार्गितव्यः search.

41_8.shloka: ततस्तामापगां दिव्यां प्रसन्नसलिलां शिवाम्।तत्र द्रक्ष्यथ कावेरीं विहितामप्सरोगणैः।।4.41.15।।
41_8.translation: 'Then you will see the sacred river Cauvery with pure and auspicious water, where celestial nymphs sport.
41_8.word_by_word: ततः then, दिव्याम् wonderful, प्रसन्नसलिलां शिवाम् river with pure and sacred waters, अप्सरोगणैः  celestial nymphs, विहिताम sport, ताम् that, कावेरीम् Cauvery, आपगाम् river, तत्र there, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

41_9.translation: 'Dwelling on the top of that Malaya mountain you will find celebrated sage Agastya, resplendent like the Sun.
41_9.word_by_word: महौजसम् a person shining brightly, तस्य its, नगस्य mountain's, अग्रे on the top, आसीनम्  seated, आदित्यसङ्काशम् like the Sun, ऋषिसत्तमम् a celebtated sage, अगस्त्यम् Agastya, द्रक्ष्यथ you find.

41_10.shloka: ततस्तेनाभ्यनुज्ञाताः प्रसन्नेन महात्मना।ताम्रपर्णीं ग्राहजुष्टां तरिष्यथ महानदीम्।।4.41.17।।
41_10.translation: 'You will then come cross the great river Tamraparni infested with alligators. Cross it with the permission of the sage pleased (with you).
41_10.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रसन्नेन by the pleasing one, महात्मना by the great soul, तेन by him, अनुज्ञाताः permitted, अथ then, ग्राहजुष्टाम् inhabited by alligators, ताम्रपर्णीम् Tamraparni, महानदीम् great river, तरिष्यथ cross.

41_11.shloka: सा चन्दनवनैर्दिव्यै प्रच्छन्ना द्वीपशालिनी।कान्तेव युवति: कान्तां समुद्रमवगाहते।।4.41.18।।
41_11.translation: 'With its wonderful islands covered with lovely sandalwood forests, the river mingles with the ocean just as a young beloved meets her lover.
41_11.word_by_word: दिव्यै: lovely, चन्दनवनैः with sandalwood forests, प्रच्छन्ना covered, द्वीपशालिनी with wonderful islands, सा that, युवति: young lady, कान्तां beloved, इव like, समुद्रम् ocean, अवगाहते reaches.

41_12.shloka: ततो हेममयं दिव्यं मुक्तामणिविभूषितम्।युक्तं कवाटं पाण्ड्यानां गता द्रक्ष्यथ वानराः।।4.41.19।।
41_12.translation: 'O monkeys leaving that river, you will find encrusted with pearls the wonderful golden gate of the city of Pandyas (modern Madurai).
41_12.word_by_word: वानरा: O monkeys, ततः then, युक्तम् fitted, हेममयम् full of gold, दिव्यम् endearing, मुक्तामणिविभूषितम् encrusted with pearls, पाण्ड्यानाम् Pandyas', कवाटम् gate, गताः you reach,  द्रक्ष्यथ you will find.

41_13.shloka: ततस्समुद्रमासाद्य सम्प्रधार्यार्थनिश्चयम्।अगस्त्येनान्तरे तत्र सागरे विनिवेशितः।।4.41.20।।चित्रनानानगः श्रीमान्महेन्द्र: पर्वतोत्तमः।जातरूपमयः श्रीमानवगाढो महार्णवम्।।4.41.21।।
41_13.translation: 'Then on reaching the sea shore, decide the course of action. Sage Agastya has set up (between the moat of the city and and the sea) a glorious golden mountain Mahendra. Filled with colourful trees, it stretches into the sea.
41_13.word_by_word: ततः then, समुद्रम् ocean, आसाद्य after reaching, अर्थनिश्चयम् decision, सम्प्रधार्य after arriving at, अगस्त्येन by Agastya, तत्र there, सागरे in the sea, अन्तरे inside, विनिवेशितः set up, चित्रनानानगः filled with colourful trees, श्रीमान् rich, महेन्द्रः Mahendra, पर्वतोत्तमः best of mountains, जातरूपमयः full of gold, श्रीमान् rich, महार्णवम् great sea, अवगाढः immersed into.

41_14.shloka: नानाविधैर्नगै स्सर्वैलताभिश्चोपशोभितम्।देवर्षियक्षप्रवरैरप्सरोभिश्च सेवितम्।।4.41.22।।सिद्धचारणसङ्घैश्च प्रकीर्णं समनोरमम्।तमुपैति सहस्राक्षः सदा पर्वसु पर्वसु।।4.41.23।।
41_14.translation: 'That mountain with several kinds of colourful trees and vines is frequented by gods, sages and prominent yakshas like siddhas and charanas. It is exceedingly delightful and even the thousandeyed Indra keeps visiting this place on full and new Moon days.
41_14.word_by_word: नानाविधैः with different kinds of, सर्वैः by all, नगैः with trees, लताभिश्च even with vines, उपशोभितम् delightful, देवर्षियक्षप्रवरैः with gods, sages, yakshas, अप्सरोभिश्च and also with celestial nymphs, सेवितम् inhabited by, सिद्धचारणसङ्घैश्च with siddhas, charanas, प्रकीर्णम्scattered about, सुमनोरमम् very enchanting, तम् him, सहस्राक्षः thousandeyed Mahendra, पर्वसु पर्वसु on all full and new Moon days, सदा always, उपैति keeps coming.

41_15.shloka: द्वीपस्तस्यापरे पारे शतयोजनमायतः।अगम्यो मानुषैर्दीप्तस्तं मार्गध्वं समन्ततः।।4.41.24।।
41_15.translation: 'Beyond this, on the other side of the sea stretching over an area of a hundred yojanas is an island difficult to reach for humans. Which you may explore.
41_15.word_by_word: तस्य its, अपरे पारे on the other side, शतयोजनमायतः stretched over a distance of a hundred yojanas, मानुषैः for human beings, अगम्यः inaccessible, दीप्तः glittering, द्वीपः island, तम् that place, समन्ततः all over there, मार्गध्वम् explore.

41_16.shloka: तत्र सर्वात्मना सीता मार्गितव्या विशेषतः।स हि देशस्तु वध्यस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः।।4.41.25।।राक्षसाधिपतेर्वासस्सहस्राक्षसमद्युतेः।
41_16.word_by_word: तत्र सीता there Sita, विशेषतः specially there, सर्वात्मना by all, मार्गितव्या search for, सः that, देशः region, वध्यस्य who deserves to be killed, दुरात्मनः of the evilminded, राक्षसाधिपतेः of the lord of demons, सहस्राक्षसमद्युतेः equal to thousandeyed Indra in radiance, रावणस्य Ravana's, वासः abode.

41_17.shloka: दक्षिणस्य समुद्रस्य मध्ये तस्य तु राक्षसी।।4.41.26।।अङ्गारकेति विख्याता छायामाकृष्य भोजिनी।
41_17.translation: 'In the midst of the southern sea is a famous ogress, Angaraka (also Simhika) by name who swallows humans by capturing them even by their shadows.
41_17.word_by_word: तस्य of that, समुद्रस्य of the sea, मध्ये in the midst, छायाम् shadow, आकृष्य after catching, भोजिनी she swallows, अङ्गारकेति Angaraka by name, विख्याता famous, राक्षसी ogress.

41_18.translation: 'In this way make sure wherever you have a doubt (of Sita's presence) and proceed to look for the consort of Rama, king of limitless lustre.
41_18.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, संशयान् doubts, निस्संशयान् making sure, कृत्वा after making, नष्टसंशयाः without any doubt, अमिततेजसः of the very effulgent, नरेन्द्रस्य king's, पत्नीम् wife, मृगयध्वम्  look for.

41_19.shloka: तमतिक्रम्य लक्ष्मीवान्समुद्रे शतयोजने।।4.41.28।।गिरिः पुष्पितको नाम सिद्धचारणसेवितः।
41_19.word_by_word: तम् that island, अतिक्रम्य after crossing, शतयोजने a hundred yojanas, समुद्रे in the sea, लक्ष्मीवान् prosperous island, सिद्धचरणसेवितः inhabited by siddhas and charanas, पुष्पितकोनाम named Pushpithaka, गिरिः mountain.

41_20.translation: 'It looks bright, spreading its radiance like the Sun and Moon. It is surrounded by the sea. Its peaks appear as though scratching the sky.
41_20.word_by_word: चन्द्रसूर्यांशुसङ्काशः bright like the radiance of Sun and Moon, सागराम्बुसमाश्रयः surrounded by seawater, अम्बरम् sky, विपुलैः with extended, शृङ्गैः with the peaks, विलिखन्निव as if scratching, भ्राजते shines.

41_21.shloka: तस्यैकं काञ्चनं शृङ्गं सेवतेऽयं दिवाकरः।।4.41.30।।श्वेतं राजतमेकं च सेवतेऽयं निशाकरः।न तं कृतघ्नाः पश्यन्ति न नृशंसा न नास्तिकाः।।4.41.31।।
41_21.translation: 'The Sun resorts to its golden peak. The Moon rests over its silver peak. Neither the ungrateful, nor the mean nor the unbelievers can behold this (phenomenon).
41_21.word_by_word: तस्य its, एकम् one, शृङ्गम् peak, काञ्चनम् is golden, यम् which, दिवाकरः Sun, सेवते resorts to, एकम् one, श्वेतम् white one, राजतम् silver, अयं this, निशाकरः Moon, सेवते resorts, तम् him, कृतघ्नाः ungrateful, न पश्यन्ति cannot see, नृशंसाः the mean, न not, नास्तिकाः unbelievers, न not.

41_22.shloka: प्रणम्य शिरसा शैलं तं विमार्गत वानराः।तमतिक्रम्य दुर्धर्ष स्सूर्यवान्नाम पर्वतः।।4.41.32।।अध्वना दुर्विगाहेन योजनानि चतुर्दश।
41_22.translation: 'O monkeys bowing down to that mountain, proceed in search of Sita. O unassailable vanaras, beyond this mountain is another called Suryavan. It is at a distance of fourteen yojanas and it is difficult to cover that distance.
41_22.word_by_word: वानराः O monkeys, तं शैलम् that mountain, शिरसा bowing down your head, विमार्गत  search, दुर्धर्ष: unassailable, तम् that, अतिक्रम्य beyond this, दुर्विगाहेन by a difficult one, अध्वना travelling, चतुर्दश योजनानि fourteen yojanas, सूर्यवान्नाम called Suryavanam, पर्वतः mountain.

41_23.translation: 'Beyond that mountain lies Vaidyuta, a hill with trees yielding lovely fruits in all seasons which can satisfy all desires.
41_23.word_by_word: ततः then, तमपि even the mountain, अतिक्रम्य going beyond, सर्वकामफलैः with those yielding wishfulfilling fruits, सर्वकालमनोहरैः delightful in all seasons, वृक्षैः with trees, वैद्युतोनाम named Vaidyuta, पर्वतः mountain.

41_24.shloka: तत्र भुक्त्वा वरार्हाणि मूलानि च फलानि च।।4.41.34।।मधूनि पीत्वा मुख्यानि परं गच्छत वानराः।
41_24.translation: 'O monkeys eat your cherlshed roots and fruits and drink the best of honey there and proceed further.
41_24.word_by_word: वानराः O monkeys, तत्र there, वारार्हाणि choicest, मूलानि च roots and, फलानि च fruits, भूक्त्वा after eating, मुख्यानि best of, मधूनि honey, पीत्वा on drinking, परम् further, गच्छत go.

41_25.shloka: तत्र नेत्रमनःकान्तः कुञ्जरो नाम पर्वतः।।4.41.35।।अगस्त्यभवनं यत्र निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा।
41_25.translation: 'There you will find a mountain called Kunjara pleasing to the eye and pleasing to the heart. That is the hermitage of Agastya built by Visvakarma.
41_25.word_by_word: तत्र there, नेत्र मनःकान्तः pleasing to the eye and heart, कुञ्जरो नाम called Kunjara, पर्वतः mountain,यत्र there,विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma,अगस्त्यभवनम् home of Agastya, निर्मितम् is built.

41_26.shloka: तत्र योजनविस्तारमुच्छ्रितं दशयोजनम्।।4.41.36।।शरणं काञ्चनं दिव्यं नानारत्नविभूषितम्।
41_26.translation: 'The hermitage of Agastya is one yojana in breadth and ten yojanas in height. It is wonderful, built of gold and adorned with many gems.
41_26.word_by_word: तत्र there, योजनविस्तारम् a yojana in breadth, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, उच्छ्रितम् tall, दिव्यम् wonderful, नानारत्नविभूषितम् adorned with many gems, काञ्चनम् gold, शरणम् dwelling.

41_27.shloka: तत्र भोगवती नाम सर्पाणामालयः पुरी।।4.41.37।।विशालकक्ष्या दुर्धर्षा सर्वतः परिरक्षिता।रक्षिता पन्नगैर्घोरैस्तीक्ष्णदष्ट्रैरैर्महाविषैः।।4.41.38।।सर्पराजो महाप्राज्ञो यस्यां वसति वासुकिः।
41_27.translation: 'There on that mountain (Kunjara) stands a city called Bhogavati, which is the abode of serpents. It has wide corridors. Guarded on all sides, it is unassailable since it is protected by venomous serpents with sharp fangs. The wise serpent king Vasuki resides there. (Bhogavati is the replica of the city of the same name in Patala, the sixth subterranean region)
41_27.word_by_word: तत्र there, विशालकक्ष्या a place with broad corridors, दुर्धर्षा an unassailable place, सर्वतः everywhere, परिरक्षिता protected, घोरैः by dreadful ones, तीक्ष्णं दष्ट्रै with sharp fangs, महाविषैः with highly poisonous ones, पन्नगैः with serpent, रक्षिता protected, सर्पाणाम् of serpents, आलयः abode, भोगवती नाम named Bhogavati, पुरी city, यस्याम् in it, सर्पराजः serpent king, महाप्राज्ञो very wise, वासुकिः Vasuki, वसति resides.

41_28.shloka: निर्याय मार्गितव्या च सा च भोगवती पुरी।।4.41.39।।तत्र चानन्तरा देशा ये केचन सुसम्वृताः।
41_28.translation: 'Emerging from this city of Bhogavati, search all possible hidden places.
41_28.word_by_word: सा that, भोगवती पुरी city of Bhogavati, मार्गितव्या search, निर्याय after coming out, तत्र there, सुसम्वृताः well covered, ये केचन those as may be, अनन्तरा देशाः hidden locations

41_29.shloka: तं च देशमतिक्रम्य महानृषभसंस्थितः।।4.41.40।।सर्वरत्नमयः श्रीमान् ऋषभो नाम पर्वतः।
41_29.translation: 'With this place passed, you will see a huge mountain named Rishaba of the size of a bull  filled with all gems.
41_29.word_by_word: तं देशम्  that place, अतिक्रम्य after crossing, ऋषभसंस्थितः of the size of a bull, सर्वरत्नमयः filled with all gems, श्रीमान् rich, ऋषभोनाम named Rishaba, महान् huge, पर्वतःmountain

41_30.shloka: गोशीर्षकं पद्मकं च हरिश्यामं च चन्दनम्।।4.41.41।।दिव्यमुत्पद्यते यत्र तच्चैवाग्निसमप्रभम्।
41_30.translation: 'There grow sandal trees of amazing colours like that of gorochana, padmaka (like lotus), greenish black and red as fire.
41_30.word_by_word: यत्र in that place, गोशीर्षकम् gorochana, पद्मकं च padmaka, हरिश्यामं च greenish black, चन्दनम् sandal, अग्निसमप्रभम् bright red like fire, दिव्यम् amazing, तच्चैव that itself, उत्पद्यते grows

41_31.shloka: न तु तच्चन्दनं दृष्टवा स्प्रष्टव्यं च कदाचन।।4.41.42।।रोहिता नाम गन्धर्वा घोरा रक्षन्ति तद्वनम्।
41_31.translation: 'Never touch when you see the sandal trees, for they are guarded by dreadful gandharvas named Rohitas.
41_31.word_by_word: तत् then, चन्दनम् sandal, दृष्टवा seeing, कदाचन ever, न स्प्रष्टव्यं तु do not touch, घोरां dreadful, तत् वनम् that forest, रोहिता: नाम named Rohita, गन्धर्वाः gandharva, रक्षन्ति protect.

41_32.shloka: तत्र गन्धर्वपतयः पञ्च सूर्यसमप्रभाः।।4.41.43।।शैलूषो ग्रामणी श्शिग्रु श्शुभ्रो बभ्रुस्तथैव च।रविसोमाग्निवपुषां निवासः पुण्यकर्मणाम्।।4.41.44।।
41_32.translation: 'Five ghandharva kings named Sailusha, Gramani, Sigru, Subhra and Babhru who have the radiance like the Sun reside there. It is the abode of those who have done meritorious deeds.They glow like Sun, Moon and Fire.
41_32.word_by_word: तत्र there, शैलूषः Sailusha, ग्रामणीः Gramani, शिग्रु Sigru, शुभ्र: Subhra, तथैव so also, बभ्रुः Babhru, सूर्यसमप्रभाः with the Sun's radiance, पञ्च five, गन्धर्वपतयः Gandharva kings, रविसोमाग्निवपुषाम् with radiance like the Sun, Moon and Fire, पुण्यकर्मणाम् of those who have done meritorious deeds, निवासः dwelling.

41_33.shloka: अन्ते पृथिव्या दुर्धर्षास्तत्र स्वर्गजितः स्थिताः।ततः परं न वस्सेव्यः पितृलोक स्सुदारुणः।।4.41.45।।
41_33.translation: 'The divine people who have earned a place in heaven stay there at the end of their life on earth. Beyond, lies the dreadful world of deceased ancestors. It is not possible for you to enter that place.
41_33.word_by_word: ततः then, पृथिव्याः the earth, अन्ते at the end, दुर्धर्षाः unassailable, स्वर्गजितः those who had conquered heaven, स्थिताः stay in, ततःपरम् beyond that place, सुदारुणः dreadful, पितृलोकः world of the deceased ancestors, वः for you, सेव्यः possible to enter, नः not.

41_34.shloka: राजधानी यमस्यैषा कष्टेन तमसा वृता।एतावदेव युष्माभिर्वीरा वानरपुङ्गवाः।।4.41.46।।शक्यं विचेतुं गन्तुं वा नातो गतिमतां गतिः।
41_34.translation: 'O heroic monkeys that is the capital of Yama (god of death) covered with pitch darkness. You can go till that place. Beyond, there is no access for the earthlings.
41_34.word_by_word: वीरा: वानरपुङ्गवाः heroic monkeys, एषा that is, यमस्य राजधानी capital of Yama, कष्टेन with pitch, तमसा darkness, आवृता covered, युष्माभिः by you folks, एतावदेव till there only, विचेतुम् to search, गन्तुं वा or to go, शक्यम् possible, अतः beyond this place, गतिमताम् for those who advance, गतिः path, न not.

41_35.shloka: सर्वमेतत्समालोक्य यच्चान्यदपि दृश्यते।।4.41.47।।गतिं विदित्वा वैदेह्या स्सन्निवर्तितुमर्हथ।
41_35.translation: 'Ransack this and all other places you can see. You should search for the whereabouts of Vaidehi before you return.
41_35.word_by_word: एतत् this, सर्वम् all over, अन्यत् other, यच्च whatever, दृश्यते you can see, समालोक्य after ransacking, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, गतिम् whereabouts, विदित्वा after knowing, सन्निवर्तितुम् to return, अर्हथ you will.

41_36.shloka: यस्तु मासान्निवृत्तोऽग्रे दृष्टा सीतेति वक्ष्यति।।4.41.48।।मत्तुल्यविभवो भोगै स्सुखं स विहरिष्यति।
41_36.translation: 'He who returns  in a month to announce Sita has been found will spend his life in luxury with as much prosperity as I do have.
41_36.word_by_word: यः whoever, मासात् by one month, अग्रे before, निवृत्तः returns, सीता Sita, दृष्टा is seen, इति thus, वक्ष्यति tells me, सः he, मत्तुल्यविभवः he will be as rich as I am, भोगैः in luxury, सुखम् happily, विहरिष्यति will enjoy.

41_37.shloka: ततः प्रियतरो नास्ति मम प्राणाद्विशेषतः।।4.41.49।।कृतापराधो बहुशो मम बन्धुर्भविष्यति।
41_37.translation: 'None will be dearer to me than he. Even if he has made a mistake, he will be to me dear and near.
41_37.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रियतरः dear, मम to me, प्राणात् more than life, विशेषतः specially, बहुशः by all means, कृतापराधः even if he has made a mistake, मम to me, बन्धुः dear and close, भविष्यति will be.

41_38.shloka: अमितबलपराक्रमा भवन्तोविपुलगुणेषु कुलेषु च प्रसूताः।मनुजपतिसुतां यथा लभध्वंतदधिगुणं पुरुषार्थमारभध्वम्।।4.41.50।।
41_38.translation: (Note:The Vindhya range and the several rivers mentioned here are not south of Kishkinda.The inconsistency is irreconcilable. Candidly speaking the geographical description is not at all factual. Some interpolator in the north (Kurukshetra as central region) has committed several anachronous inconsistencies betraying his ignorance of  geography.)इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्दाकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
41_38.word_by_word: भवन्तः all of you, अमितबलपराक्रमाः immeasurably mighty and powerful, विपुलगुणेषु with many virtues, कुलेषु in families, प्रसूताः you are born, मनुजपतिसुताम् daughter of the king, यथा in whatever way, लभध्वम् you find, तदधिगुणम् possesing meritorious quality, पुरुषार्थम् righteous pursuit, आरभध्वम् you may begin.

42_1.shloka: [Sugriva sends the next army in the western direction -- describes rivers, mountains and places in the west.]अथ प्रस्थाप्य सुग्रीवस्तान्हरीन्दक्षिणां दिशम्।अब्रवीन्मेघसङ्काशं सुषेणं नाम यूथपम्।।4.42.1।।
42_1.translation: After sending the monkeys in the southern direction, Sugriva said to the cloudlike troop leader called Sushena.
42_1.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तान् them, हरीन् monkeys, दक्षिणां दिशम् in the southernquarter, प्रस्थाप्य having sent, अथ now, मेघसङ्काशम्  resembling a cloud, सुषेणं नाम known as Sushena, यूथपम् troop leader, अब्रवीत् said.

42_2.shloka: तारायाः पितरं राजा श्वशुरं भीमविक्रमम्।अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमभिगम्य प्रणम्य च।।4.42.2।।
42_2.translation: King (Sugriva) went with folded hands to Tara's father, his fatherinlaw, of terrifying valour, offered salutation and said:
42_2.word_by_word: राजा king, तारायाः Tara's, पितरम् father, श्वशुरम् his fatherinlaw, भीमविक्रमम् a hero of terrifying valour, अभिगम्य having gone, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, प्रणम्य च having offered salutation, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

42_3.translation: Sugriva  spoke to the great lustrous monkey Archisman, son of the eminent sage Marichi who possessed the wisdom and prowess of Indra and was comparable to Vaineteya (Garuda) in lustre. He also spoke to the other sons of Maricha, called Marichas, who were very strong and known as Archismalas (garlands of continuous glow) and asked all of them to proceed in the western direction.
42_3.word_by_word: मरीचिपुत्रम् son of Marichi, मारीचम् Maricha, महाकपिम् great monkey, शूरैः with brave ones, कपिवरैः with best monkeys, वृतम् surounded, महेन्द्रसदृशद्युतिम् glowing like Mahendra, बुद्धिविक्रमसम्पन्नम् with wisdom and bravery, वैनतेयसमद्युतिम् equal to Garuda in lustre, अर्चिष्मन्तम् a person filled with lustre, मरीचिपुत्रान् sons of Maricha, अर्चिर्मालान् Archirmala's, महाबलान् valiant ones, ऋषिपुत्रांश्च sons of sages, सर्वान् all, मारीचान् Maricha's, प्रतीचीं दिशम् to western quarter, आदिशत् instructed.

42_4.shloka: द्वाभ्यां शतसहस्राभ्यां कपीनां कपिसत्तमाः।।4.42.5।।सुषेणप्रमुखा यूयं वैदेहीं परिमार्गतः।
42_4.translation: 'O foremost of monkeys with Sushena as your group leader accompanied by two hundred thousand vanaras, go and search for Vaidehi.
42_4.word_by_word: कपिसत्तमाः foremost of monkeys, यूयम् you, सुषेण प्रमुखाः having Sushena as leader, कपीनाम् among monkeys, द्वाभ्याम् with two, शतसहस्राभ्याम् hundred thousands, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, परिमार्गत: search.

42_5.shloka: सुराष्ट्रान्सहबाह्लीकान् श्चन्द्रचित्रांस्तथैव च।।4.42.6।।स्फीताञ्जनपदान्रम्यान्विपुलानि पुराणि च।पुन्नागगहनं कुक्षिं वकुलोद्दालकाकुलम्।।4.42.7।।तथा केतकषण्डांश्च मार्गध्वं हरियूथपाः।
42_5.translation: 'O leaders of monkeys search for Sita in the countries of Saurashtra, and also Bahlika, Chandrachitra, in delightful villages and vast towns, also in Kukshi covered haphazardly with punnaga, bakula and uddalaka trees as well as ketaka shrubs.
42_5.word_by_word: हरियूथपाः leaders of monkeys, सौराष्ट्रान् in the country of Saurashtra, तथैव च and similarly,सहबाह्लीकान् even in Bahlika, श्चन्द्रचित्रां in chandrachitra, स्फीतान् prosperous, रम्यान् delightful, जनपदान् villages, विपुलानि vast, पुराणि च towns, पुन्नागगहनम् punnaga grove, वकुलोद्दालकाकुलम्  haphazard distribution of punnaga, bakula and uddalaka trees, कुक्षिम् in kukshi, तथा similarly, केतकखण्डांश्च in Kethaka shrubs, मार्गध्वम् search.

42_6.shloka: प्रत्यक्स्रोतोगमाश्चैव नद्यश्शीतजलाश्शिवाः।।4.42.8।।तापसानामरण्यानि कान्तारा गिरयश्च ये।तत्रस्थलीं मरुप्रायामत्युच्चशिरसश्शिलाः।।4.42.9।।गिरिजालावृतां दुर्गां मार्गित्वा पश्चिमां दिशम्।ततः पश्चिममासाद्य समुद्रं द्रष्टुमर्हथ।।4.42.10।।तिमिनक्रायुतजलमक्षोभ्यमथ वानराः।
42_6.translation: 'O monkeys the auspicious rivers with cool waters flow towards the western region. Search in the groves inhabited by ascetics, other forests, mountains, cliffs, in the desertland. Search in the inaccessible western region surrounded by mountains. Then proceed to the western ocean infested with whales and alligators, which cannot be easily disturbed.
42_6.word_by_word: वानराः O monkeys, प्रत्यक्स्रोतोगमाः those flowing to the west, शीतजलाः cool waters, शिवाः sacred, नद्यश्चैव rivers too, तापसानां in hermits, अरण्यानि woods, ये those, कान्तारा: गिरयश्च forests and mountains, तत्र there, मरुप्रायाः dry, स्थलीं lands, अत्युच्चशिरसाः high peaks, शिलाःmountains, गिरिजालावृताम् surrounded by mountain ranges, दुर्गाम् inaccessible, दिशम् direction, मार्गित्वा after searching, पश्चिमां western side, ततः then, समुद्रम् the sea, पश्चिमम् the western, आसाद्य after reaching, द्रष्टुम् to see, अर्हथ it is proper for you, तिमिनक्रायुतजलम् water infested with whales and alligators, अक्षोभ्यम् which cannot be agitated, अथ then, वानराः monkeys.

42_7.shloka: ततः केतकषण्डेषु तमालगहनेषु च।।4.42.11।।कपयो विहरिष्यन्ति नारिकेलवनेषु च।
42_7.translation: 'There the monkeys may roam about the Ketaka shrubs, tamala thickets and coconut groves.
42_7.word_by_word: ततः then, कपयः monkeys, केतकषण्डेषु in the ketaka shrubs, तमालगहनेषु च in the thickets of tamala trees, नारिकेलवनेषु च and in coconut groves, विहरिष्यन्ति roam.

42_8.shloka: तत्र सीतां च मार्गध्वं निलयं रावणस्य च।।4.42.12।।वेलातलनिविष्टेषु पर्वतेषु वनेषु च।मुरचीपत्तनं चैव रम्यं चैव जटीपुरम्।।4.42.13।।अवन्तीमङ्गलोपां च तथा चालक्षितं वनम्।राष्ट्राणि च विशालानि पत्तनानि ततस्ततः।।4.42.14।।
42_8.translation: 'Look for Sita as well as the residence of Ravana.You should find the whereabouts of Sita in the mountains and forests located on the sea shore. Search in the city of Murachi, beautiful city of Jata, Avanti, Angalopa and in the unnoticed forestland. Look for her in the vast kingdoms and cities all over.
42_8.word_by_word: तत्र there,वेलातलनिविष्टेषु among those on the sea shore tract, पर्वतेषु in mountains, वनेषु in groves, सीतां च Sita's, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च  residence, मार्गध्वम् search, मुरचीपत्तनं चैव town of Murachi, रम्यम् beautiful, जटपुरं चैव and in the city of Jata, अवन्तीम् in Avanti, अङ्गलोपां च  in Angalopa city, तथा so also, अलक्षितम् unnoticed, वनम्  forest, ततस्ततः here and there, राष्ट्रणिच kingdoms, विशालानि vast, पत्तनानि towns

42_9.shloka: सिन्धुसागरयोश्चैव सङ्गमे तत्र पर्वतः।महान्हेमगिरिर्नाम शतशृङ्गो महाद्रुमः।।4.42.15।।
42_9.translation: 'There is a lofty mountain with a hundred peaks and great trees at the confluence of river Sindhu and the sea. It is known as Hemagiri (golden mountain).
42_9.word_by_word: सिन्धुसागरयोः of sindhu and the sea, सङ्गमे at the confluence, तत्र there, हेमगिरिर्नाम known as Hemagiri, शतशृङ्गःof hundred peaks, महाद्रुमःgreat trees,  पर्वतःmountain,

42_10.shloka: तस्य प्रस्थेषु रम्येषु सिंहाः पक्षगमाः स्थिताः।तिमिमत्स्यगजांश्चैव नीडान्यारोपयन्ति ते।।4.42.16।।
42_10.translation: 'On the slopes of that mountain you will find lions called Pakshagamas, that is lions with wings. They carry  the whales, fishes and elephants from the sea to their shelters on the beautiful mountain slopes.
42_10.word_by_word: तस्य its, रम्येषु beautiful, प्रस्थेषु slopes, पक्षगमाः with wings, सिंहाः lions, स्थिताः are sheltered, ते they, तिमिमत्स्यगजांश्चैव whales fishes and elephants from the sea, नीडानि in their shelters (caves), आरोपयन्ति place

42_11.shloka: तानि नीडानि सिंहानां गिरिशृङ्गगताश्च ये।दृप्तास्तृप्ताश्च मातङ्गास्तोयदस्वननिस्वनाः।।4.42.17।।विचरन्ति विशालेऽस्मिंस्तोयपूर्णे समन्ततः।
42_11.translation: 'The proud elephants wandering on the mountain slopes, and on the vast tract filled with water would be happy trumpeting like thundering clouds. They roam in the caves of lions.
42_11.word_by_word: गिरिशृङ्गगताः roaming on the slopes, तोयदस्वननिस्वनाः sounding like thundering clouds, दृप्ताः proud, तृप्ताश्च satisfied, ये those, मातङ्गाः elephants, समन्ततः everywhere, तोयपूर्णे filled with water, अस्मिन् they, विशाले broad, सिंहानाम् lions', नीडानि in the dens, विचरन्ति roam about

42_12.shloka: तस्य शृङ्गं दिवस्पर्शं काञ्चनं चित्रपादपम्।।4.42.18।।सर्वमाशु विचेतव्यं कपिभिः कामरूपिभिः।
42_12.translation: 'The monkeys capable of assuming any form at their will should search the scraping peaks of the golden mountain (Himagiri) with colourful trees without delay.
42_12.word_by_word: तस्य दिवस्पर्शम् touching the sky, चित्रपादपम् colourful trees, काञ्चनम् golden, शृङ्गम् peak, सर्वम् all, कामरूपिभिः by those who can assume any form, कपिभिः by monkeys, आशु at once , विचेतव्यम् look for carefully

42_13.shloka: कोटिं तत्र समुद्रे तु काञ्चनीं शतयोजनाम्।।4.42.19।।दुर्दर्शां  पारियात्रस्य गतां द्रक्ष्यथ वानराः।
42_13.translation: 'O monkeys you will see the dazzling golden tip of a mountain called Pariyatra towards the end of the sea. It is extended over a hundred yojanas and  dificult to gaze because of its brilliance.
42_13.word_by_word: वानराः monkeys, तत्र there, गतां on reaching, समुद्रे तु in the end of the sea, पारियात्रस्य of Pariyatra, शतयोजनाम् hundred yojanas, काञ्चनीम् golden, दुर्दर्शाम् difficult to see  (because of its brilliance), कोटिम् tip, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see

42_14.translation: 'There dwell twentyfour crore of terrific gandharvas blazing like fire who can assume any form.They lead an ascetic life.
42_14.word_by_word: तत्र there, तपस्विनाम् of seers, अग्निनिकाशानाम् blazing like fire, घोराणाम् terrific, कामरूपिणाम् who can assume any form, गन्धर्वाणाम् of gandharvas, चतुर्विंशत् twentyfour, कोट्यःcrores, वसन्ति reside

42_15.translation: 'Collected together in thousands, and radiating like fire, they live there. Even the very brave vanaras should not go close to them.
42_15.word_by_word: सहस्रशः in thousands, समवेताः assembled together, प्रतीकाशाः appearing like, ते you, भीमविक्रमैः with very brave ones, वानरैः by monkeys, नात्यासादयितव्याः not to go very close to them, पावकार्चिःwith fire likeglow

42_16.shloka: नादेयं च फलं तस्माद्देशात्किञ्चित् प्लवङ्गमैः।।4.42.22।।दुरासदा हि ते वीरा स्सत्त्ववन्तो महाबलाः।फलमूलानि ते तत्र रक्षन्ते भीमविक्रमाः।।4.42.23।।
42_16.translation: 'You should not pluck any fruits from those woods, for courageous gandharvas protect the fruits of the trees. It is difficult to go there, for those heroes have frightening bravery.
42_16.word_by_word: तस्मात् देशात् from that country, प्लवङ्गमैः by monkeys, फलम् fruits, किञ्चित् a little, नादेयम् should not be taken, सत्त्ववन्तः courageous, महाबलाः strong, ते वीराः those heroes, दुरासदाः हि  difficult to go there, भीमविक्रमाः heroes of frightening bravery, ते they, तत्र there, फलमूलानि fruits and roots, रक्षन्ते keep protecting

42_17.shloka: तत्र यत्नश्च कर्तव्यो मार्गितव्या च जानकी।न हि तेभ्यो भयं किञ्चित्कपित्वमनुवर्तताम्।।4.42.24।।
42_17.translation: 'Exert yourself in your search for Janaki. Indeed there will be no fear from them, if you behave like normal monkeys in a natural way.
42_17.word_by_word: तत्र there, यत्नश्च effort, कर्तव्यः should put in, जानकी Janaki, मार्गितव्या च and search, कपित्वम् monkeyish nature, अनुवर्तताम्  follow, तेभ्यः from them, भयम् fear, किञ्चित् a little, न हि not there

42_18.shloka: तत्र वैढूर्यवर्णाभो वज्रसंस्थानसंस्थितः।नानाद्रुमलताकीर्णो वज्रो नाम महागिरिः।।4.42.25।।श्रीमान्समुदितस्तत्र योजनानां शतं समम्।गुहास्तत्र विचेतव्या प्रयत्नेन प्लवङ्गमाः ।।4.42.26।।
42_18.translation: '(Beyond) there  is a glorious mountain called Vajra of the colour of Vaidurya, hard as a diamond with different kinds of trees and vines.The  mountain extends evenly to a stretch of a hundred yojanas.There are caves in the mountain where you may look for her with due effort.
42_18.word_by_word: प्लवङ्गमाः O monkeys, तत्र there, वैढूर्यवर्णाभः of the colour of Vaidurya, वज्रसंस्थानसंस्थितः strong as a diamond, नानाद्रुमलताकीर्णः with different trees and vines, श्रीमान् glorious, वज्रोनाम named Vajra, महागिरि: great mountain, तत्र there, योजनानां शतम् of hundred yojanas, समम् even, समुदितः extended, तत्र there, गुहाः cave, प्रयत्नेन with great effort, विचेतव्याः you may look for

42_19.shloka: चतुर्भागे समुद्रस्य चक्रवान्नाम पर्वतः।तत्र चक्रं सहस्रारं निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा।।4.42.27।।
42_19.translation: 'Then move to the fourth part (of the western sea) where you will see  a mountain called Chakravan occupying a quarter part of the sea.You will find there a thousandspiked wheel built by Visvakarma.
42_19.word_by_word: समुद्रस्य of the sea, चतुर्भागे in the one fourth part, चक्रवान् नाम Chakravan, पर्वतः mountain, तत्र there, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, सहस्रारम् thousand spiked, चक्रम् wheel, निर्मितम् constructed

42_20.shloka: तत्र पञ्चजनं हत्वा हयग्रीवं च दानवम्।आजहार ततश्चक्रं शङ्खं च पुरुषोत्तमः।।4.42.28।।
42_20.translation: 'It was there that the Supreme Lord Visnu, having slain Hayagriva and Panchajanam,  recovered the discus and conch for himself.
42_20.word_by_word: तत्र there, पुरुषोत्तमः supreme Lord Visnu, हयग्रीवम् Hayagriva , दानवम् demon, हत्वा having killed, ततः then, चक्रम् discus, पञ्चजनम् Panchajanam, शङ्खं च conch, आजहार brought

42_21.shloka: तस्य सानुषु चित्रेषु विशालासु गुहासु च।रावण स्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्तत स्ततः।।4.42.29।।
42_21.translation: 'Look for Vaidehi and Ravana in the wide caves and colourful slopes of the (Chakravan) mountain.
42_21.word_by_word: तस्य its, चित्रेषु in colourful ones, सानुषु on the slopes, विशालासु in wide places, गुहासु च in the caves, रावणः Ravana, वैदेह्या सहा with Vaidehi, ततस्ततः here and there, मार्गितव्यः search for

42_22.shloka: योजनानां चतुष्षष्टिर्वराहो नाम पर्वतः।सुवर्णशृङ्गस्सुश्रीमा नगाधे वरुणालये।।4.42.30।।
42_22.translation: 'Plunge deep down into the sea and you will see a goldenpeaked mountain called Varaha, the residence of Varuna.It is extended over sixty four yojanas in the sea.
42_22.word_by_word: अगाधे in the deep, वरुणालये in the sea,चतु:ष्षष्टिः sixtyfour, योजनानां of yojanas, सुवर्णशृङ्गः golden peaked, वराहो नाम called Varaha, पर्वतः mountain सु श्रीमान् illustrious

42_23.shloka: तत्र प्राग्ज्योतिषं नाम जातरूपमयं पुरम्।यस्मिन्वसति दुष्टात्मा नरको नाम दानवः।।4.42.31।।
42_23.translation: 'On the (Varaha) mountain is the city called Pragjyotisha, which is full of gold.There lives the  evilminded demon Naraka.
42_23.word_by_word: तत्र there, पाग्ज्योतिषं नाम named Pragjyotisha, जातरूपमयम् full of gold, पुरम् city, यस्मिन् in it, दुष्टात्मा evilminded, नरको नाम named Naraka, दानवः demon, वसति dwells

42_24.shloka: तत्र सानुषु चित्रेषु विशालासु गुहासु च।रावणस्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः।।4.42.32।।
42_24.translation: 'There all over the wonderful slopes and wide caves look for Vaidehi and Ravana.
42_24.word_by_word: तत्र there, चित्रेषु  wonderful spots, सानुषु on slopes, विशालासु  wide, गुहासु च in caves also, रावणः Ravana, वैदेह्या सह with Vaidehi, ततस्ततः everywhere, मार्गितव्यः may be looked for

42_25.word_by_word: तम् that, काञ्चनान्तरनिर्दरः caves inside all covered with gold, तं शैलेन्द्रम् that lord of mountain, अतिक्रम्य after crossing, धाराप्रस्रवणायुतः with waterfalls, सर्वसौवर्णः all gold, पर्वतः mountain

42_26.shloka: तं गजाश्च वराहाश्च सिंह व्याघ्राश्च सर्वतः।अभिगर्जन्ति सततं तेन शब्देन दर्पिताः।।4.42.34।।
42_26.word_by_word: सर्वतः everywhere, गजाश्च elephants, वराहाश्च boars, सिंहाः lions, व्याघ्राश्च tigers, तेन by their, शब्देन sound, दर्पिताः puffed with pride, तम् them, सततम्  always, अभिगर्जन्ति will be roaring

42_27.shloka: यस्मिन्हरिहय्शीमान्महेन्द्रः पाकशासनः।अभिषिक्तः सुरै राजा मेघवान्नाम पर्वतः।।4.42.35।।
42_27.translation: 'Possessor of tawny horses, king Indra who killed demon Pakasasana was consecrated by gods at this mountain since known as Meghavan.
42_27.word_by_word: हरिहयः one who has tawnycoloured horses, श्रीमान् prosperous, पाकशासनः Pakasasana, महेन्द्रः Indra, यस्मिन् in that, सुरैः by gods, राजा king, अभिषिक्तः is consecrated, सः he, मेघवान्नाम Meghavan by name, पर्वतः mountain

42_28.shloka: तमतिक्रम्य शैलेन्द्रं महेन्द्रपरिपालितम्।षष्टि र्गिरिसहस्राणि काञ्चनानि गमिष्यथ।।4.42.36।।तरुणादित्यवर्णानि भ्राजमानानि सर्वतः।जातरूपमयैर्वृक्षै शोभितानि सुपुष्पितैः।।4.42.37।।
42_28.translation: 'On crossing the hill ruled by Indra you will reach the rows of sixty thousand mountains of gold shining like the brilliance of the rising Sun. The mountains glow with golden trees filled with bloom.
42_28.word_by_word: महेन्द्रपरिपालितम् governed by Indra, तम् that, शैलेन्द्रम् lord of mountains, अतिक्रम्य after crossing, तरुणादित्यवर्णानि with the colour of the rising Sun, काञ्चनानि golden, षष्टि गिरिसहस्राणि sixty thousand mountains, सर्वतः everywhere, भ्राजमानानि shining, सुपुष्पितैः with blooming  flowers, जातरूपमयैःfull of gold, वृक्षैःtrees, शोभितानि enchanting, गमिष्यथ you will reach

42_29.shloka: तेषां मध्ये स्थितो राजा मेरुरुत्तरपर्वतः।आदित्येन प्रसन्नेन शैलो दत्तवरः पुरा।।4.42.38।।
42_29.translation: 'In the midst of the sixty thousand hills stands Meru, King of mountains. It is the northern mountain, blessed by the Sungod with a boon in the past.
42_29.word_by_word: तेषाम् among them, मध्ये in the midst, राजा king, मेरुः Meru, उत्तरपर्वतः northern mountain, स्थितः stands, पुरा earlier, शैलः mountain, प्रसन्नेन by the pleased ones, आदित्येन by  Aditya, दत्तवरः blessed

42_30.shloka: तेनैव मुक्तश्शैलेन्द्रस्सर्व एव त्वदाश्रयाः।मत्प्रसादाद्भविष्यन्ति दिवा रात्रं च काञ्चनाः।।4.42.39।।त्वयि ये चापि वत्स्यन्ति देवगन्धर्वदानवाः।ते भविष्यन्ति रक्ताश्च प्रभया काञ्चनप्रभाः।।4.42.40।।
42_30.translation: 'The Sungod said to mount Meru, 'By my grace all the trees and hillocks of this king of mountains will shine in golden red, the gods, gandharvas and demons who dwell here will have golden radiance '.
42_30.word_by_word: शैलेन्द्रःking of mountains, तेन by him, एवम् in that way, उक्तः has been told, त्वदाश्रयाःthose who shelter there, एव only, दिवा day, रात्रं च and night, मत्प्रसादात् by my grace, काञ्चनाः golden, भविष्यन्ति will be, ये those, वत्स्यन्ति reside, ते चापि they also, प्रभया with radiance, रक्ताश्च like red colour, काञ्चनप्रभाः have golden radiance, भविष्यन्ति will be, देवगन्धर्वदानवाः gods, gandharvas and demons

42_31.shloka: विश्वे देवाश्च मरूतो वसवश्च दिवौकसः।आगम्य पश्चिमां सन्ध्यां मेरुमुत्तमपर्वतम्।।4.42.41।।आदित्यमुपतिष्ठन्ति तैश्च सूर्योऽभिपूजितः।अदृश्यस्सर्वभूतानामस्तं गच्छतिपर्वतम्।।4.42.42।।
42_31.translation: The Visvadevas, Vasus, Maruts, and the gods reach Meru, this great king of mountains, in the evening twilight. Worshipped by them, the Sungod sets behind the mountain and becomes invisible to all beings.
42_31.word_by_word: विश्वेदेवाश्च Visvadevas, वसवः Vasus, मरुतश्च Maruts दिवौकसः gods, पश्चिमां सन्ध्याम् in the evening twilight, उत्तमपर्वतम् king of mountains,मेरुम् Meru, आगम्य after coming over, आदित्यम् Sun, उपतिष्ठन्ति they serve, सूर्यः Sun, तैः by them, अभिपूजितः worshipped, सर्वभूतानाम् for all beings, अदृश्यः unseen, अस्तं पर्वतम् to the western mountain behind which the sun sets, गच्छति goes

42_32.shloka: योजनानां सहस्राणि दश तानि दिवाकरः।मुहूर्तार्धेन तं शीघ्रमभियाति शिलोच्चयम्।।4.42.43।।
42_32.translation: 'Crossing ten thousand yojanas swiftly in half a moment, the Sun touches the mount behind which he sets.
42_32.word_by_word: दिवाकरः Sun, मुहूर्तर्धेन in half a moment, योजनानाम् of yojanas, तानि those, दशसहस्राणि ten thousand, शिलोच्चयम् to the mountain ranges, शीघ्रम् swiftly, अभियाति reaches,

42_33.shloka: शृङ्गे तस्य महद्दिव्यं भवनं सूर्यसन्निभम्।प्रासादगणसम्बाधं विहितं विश्वकर्मणा।।4.42.44।।
42_33.translation: 'There is a great divine abode glowing like the Sungod on the peak of the mountain.It is a cluster of mansions built  by Visvakarma.
42_33.word_by_word: तस्य its,शृङ्गे on the peak, प्रासादगणसम्बाधम् cluster of mansions, सूर्यसन्निभम् shining like Sun, महत्great, दिव्यम् wonderful, भवनम् building, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, विहितम् is built

42_34.translation: 'It is the residence of Varuna, who holds the noose in his hand.It is an enchanting place, full of trees attracting flocks of various birds.
42_34.word_by_word: चित्रैः with colourful, नानापक्षिसमाकुलैः with flocks of different kinds of birds, तरुभिः with trees, शोभितम् enchanting, महात्मनः of great, पाशहस्तस्य one who holds the noose in hand, वरुणस्य Varuna's, निकेतम् residence

42_35.shloka: अन्तरा मेरुमस्तं च तालो दशशिरा महान्।जातरूपमय्शीमान्भ्राजते चित्रवेदिकः।।4.42.46।।
42_35.translation: 'Between mount Asta (the mountain behind which the Sun sets) and Meru there is a shining golden palm tree with ten high peaks and wonderful altars around.
42_35.word_by_word: मेरुम् Meru, अस्तं च from Asta, अन्तरा between, दशशिराः ten peaks, जातरूपमयः golden, श्रीमान् shining, चित्रवेदिकः with wonderful altars, महान् great, तालः palm tree, भ्राजते shines

42_36.shloka: तेषु सर्वेषु दुर्गेषु सरस्सु च सरित्सु च।रावणस्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्तत स्ततः।।4.42.47।।
42_36.translation: 'Look for Vaidehi and Ravana all over those inaccessible mountains, lakes and rivers.
42_36.word_by_word: सर्वेषु in all, तेषु दुर्गेषु in those inaccessible mountains, सरस्सु च in lakes, सरित्सु च in rivers, ततस्ततः every where, वैदेह्या सह along with Vaidehi, रावणः Ravana, मार्गितव्यः look for

42_37.shloka: यत्र तिष्ठति धर्मज्ञस्तपसा स्वेन भावितः।मेरुसावर्णिरित्येव ख्यातो वै ब्रह्मणा समः।।4.42.48।।
42_37.translation: 'The sage Merusavarna, knower of dharma, famous for his penance and comparable to Brahma lives there with him on Meru.
42_37.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञः knower of dharma, स्वेन on his own, तपसा with penance, भावितः he is identified, ब्रह्मणा with Brahma, समः equal, मेरुसावर्णिः इत्येव known as Meru Savarna, ख्यातः popular, यत्र there, तिष्ठति lies

42_38.shloka: प्रष्टव्यो मेरुसावर्णिर्महर्षिः सूर्यसन्निभः।प्रणम्य शिरसा भूमौ प्रवृत्तिं मैथिलीं प्रति।।4.42.49।।
42_38.translation: 'Bow down, touch the feet of the seer Merusavarna, who glows like the Sun and then enquire from him about Sita.
42_38.word_by_word: सूर्यसन्निभः glowing like the Sun, महर्षिः seer, मेरुसावर्णिः Merusavarna who glows like Meru, शिरसा with head, भूमौ touching ground, प्रणम्य bowing down, मैथिलीं Maithili प्रति with regard to  प्रवृत्तिम् information, प्रष्टव्यः enquire

42_39.shloka: एताव ज्जीवलोकस्य भास्करो रजनीक्ष्ये।कृत्वा वितिमिरं सर्वमस्तं गच्छति पर्वतम्।।4.42.50।।
42_39.translation: 'The world of living beings is extended to this extent. The Sun dispels darkness at the end of the night and thereafter reaches the mountain behind which he sets (at the end of the day).
42_39.word_by_word: भास्करः Sun, जीवलोकस्य of the world of living beings, एतावत् to this extent, सर्वम् all, रजनीक्ष्ये at the end of the night, वितिमिरम् devoid of darkness, कृत्वा after doing, अस्तं पर्वतम् mountain behind which the sun sets, गच्छति reaches

42_40.shloka: एतावद्वानरैश्शक्यं गन्तुं वानरपुङ्गवाः।अभास्करममर्यादं न जानीमस्ततः परम्।।4.42.51।।
42_40.translation: 'O great monkeys you can go only up to that point. The Sun's rays do not extend beyond this and it has no boundaries.We do not know about the area beyond this limit.
42_40.word_by_word: वानरपुङ्गवाः O great monkeys, एतावत् to this limit, वानरैः by monkeys, गन्तुम् to go, शक्यम् possible, अभास्करम्  devoid of the Sun, अमर्यादं च without boundaries, ततः परम् beyond that, न जानीमः we do not know

42_41.shloka: अधिगम्य तु वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च।अस्त पर्वतमासाद्य पूर्णे मासे निवर्तत।।4.42.52।।
42_41.translation: 'Go and find out Sita and the abode of Ravana. After this, return to the mountain behind which the Sun sets and come back on completion of a month.
42_41.word_by_word: वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च abode, अधिगम्य after finding out, अस्तं पर्वतम् Astha mountain, आसाद्य after reaching, मासे a month, पूर्णे in completion of, निवर्तत you may return

42_42.shloka: ऊर्ध्वं मासान्न वस्तव्यं वसन् वध्यो भवेन्मम।सहैव शूरो युष्माभिश्श्वशुरो मे गमिष्यति।।4.42.53।।
42_42.translation: 'If you tarry beyond a month, you will be slain. My fatherin law, the brave hero will go with your group.
42_42.word_by_word: मासात् more than a month, ऊर्द्वम् beyond that, न वस्तव्यम् you should not stay, वसन् while staying, मम to me, वध्यः to be killed, भवेत् you may be, युष्माभिः by you सहैव along with you, मे my, शूरः brave, श्वशुरः fatherinlaw, गमिष्यति will go

42_43.shloka: श्रोतव्यं सर्वमेतस्य भवद्भिर्दिष्टकारिभिः।गुरुरेष महाबाहुश्श्वशुरो मे महाबलः।।4.42.54।।
42_43.translation: 'You should obey him. You are meant to carry out his orders. He is not only my fatherinlaw but also a valiant, strong and powerful hero and my preceptor.
42_43.word_by_word: दिष्टकारिभिः by those who carry out orders, भवद्भि: by you, एतस्य his, सर्वम् all, श्रोतव्यम् listen, महाबाहुः strongarmed one, महाबलःvery strong, एषः he, मे my, श्वशुरः fatherinlaw, गुरुः teacher

42_44.shloka: भवन्तश्चापि विक्रान्ताः प्रमाणं सर्व कर्मसु।प्रमाणमेनं संस्थाप्य पश्यध्वं पश्चिमां दिशम्।।4.42.55।।
42_44.translation: 'My fatherinlaw will be your leader. His authority will be final in all matters. Accepthis authority and look for Vaidehi in the western direction.
42_44.word_by_word: विक्रान्ताः advancing heroes, सर्वः all, भवन्तश्चापि you too, प्रमाणम् leader, कर्मसु in performing, एनम् him, प्रमाणमेन as authority, संस्थाप्य having placed him, पश्चिमां दिशम् western quarter, पश्यध्वम् look for

42_45.shloka: दृष्टायां तु नरेन्द्रस्य पत्न्याममिततेजसः।कृतकृत्या भविष्यामः कृतस्य प्रतिकर्मणा।।4.42.56।।
42_45.translation: 'We will be achieving our goal when the consort of the highly glorious king Rama is found. And we will return the help he has rendered.
42_45.word_by_word: अमिततेजसः of the glorious, नरेन्द्रस्य king's, पत्नयाम् when the wife, दृष्टायाम् when she is seen, कृतस्य of the help, प्रतिकर्मणा by helping in return, कृतकृत्याः those who achieve their target, भविष्यामः we will be

42_46.shloka: अतोऽन्यदपि यत्कार्यं कार्यस्यास्य हितं भवेत्।सम्प्रधार्य भवद्भिश्च देशकालार्थसंहितम्।।4.42.57।।
42_46.translation: 'You may do any work after careful thinking, if it helps to achieve the purpose, and if the work to be performed is in accordance with time and place.'
42_46.word_by_word: अस्य कार्यस्य of this task, अतः thus, अन्यदपि anything else, यत् whichever, हितम् good, भवेत् may be, देशकालार्थसंहितम् in accordance with time and place, भवद्भि: by you, सम्प्रधार्य after carefully thinking over, कार्यम् task to be carried out

42_47.shloka: ततः सुषेणप्रमुखाः प्लवङ्गामाःस्सुग्रीव वाक्यं निपुणं निशम्य।आमन्त्य्र सर्वे प्लवगाधिपं तेजग्मुर्दिशं तां वरुणाभिगुप्ताम्।।4.42.58।।
42_47.translation: Sushena and other leaders heard the expert advice of Sugriva, and took leave of him.They went towards the western direction ruled by Varuna.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीये आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysecond Sarga in the Kishkinda Kanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed  by sage Valmiki.
42_47.word_by_word: ततः then, सुषेणप्रमुखाः Sushena and other leaders, ते प्लवङ्गमा: those monkeys, सुग्रीववाक्यम् Sugriva's words, निपुणम् expert, निशम्य after listening, सर्वे all, प्लवगाधिपम् monkey leaders, आमन्त्य्र took leave, वरुणाभिगुप्ताम् ruled by Varuna, तां दिशम् that direction, जग्मुः went

43_1.shloka: [Sugriva sends the next contingent in the northern direction towards the Himalayas -- countries and places in the north described.]ततस्सन्दिश्य सुग्रीवश्श्वशुरं पश्चिमां दिशम्।वीरं शतवलिं नाम वानरं वानरर्षभः।।4.43.1।।
43_1.translation: Sugriva, the bull among monkeys, having sent his fatherinlaw in the western direction, said to Satavali, troop leader of the monkeys:
43_1.word_by_word: वानरर्षभः bull among monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, श्वशुरम् to fatherinlaw, पश्चिमां दिशम् western side, सन्दिश्य having assigned, ततः then, नाम called, वीरम् troop leader, वानरम् of monkeys, शतवलिं Satavali.

43_2.shloka: उवाच राजा धर्मज्ञस्सर्ववानरसत्तमम्।वाक्यमात्म हितं चैव रामस्य च हितं तथा।।4.43.2।।
43_2.translation: 'Righteous king Sugriva said to the foremost among the monkeys, Satavali what would help his cause as well as the cause of Rama:
43_2.word_by_word: राजा king, धर्मज्ञः knower of dharma, सर्ववानरसत्तमः foremost among all the monkeys, तथा in that way, आत्महितं च एव for his own welfare, रामस्य च and Rama's also, हितम् good, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.

43_3.translation: 'Take like you a hundred thousand courageous heroes, your ministers and the sons of Vaivasvata. And begin your expedition.
43_3.word_by_word: त्वद्विधानाम् like you, वनौकसाम् the foresters, शतसहस्रेण a hundred thousand, वृतः take, स्वमन्त्रिभिः with ministers also, वैवस्वतसुतैस्सार्धम् along with the sons of the Sungod, प्रतिष्ठस्व  get going.

43_4.shloka: दिशं ह्युदीचीं विक्रान्तां हिमशैलावतंसकाम्।सर्वतः परिमार्गध्वं रामपत्नीमनिन्दिताम्।।4.43.4।।
43_4.translation: 'Look all over the northern direction adorned with mighty Himavan as its earring, for the spouse of blameless Rama
43_4.word_by_word: विक्रान्तां mighty, हिमशैलावतंसकाम् having Himavan as its earring, उदीचीं दिशम् in the northern direction, अनिन्दिताम् blameless, रामपत्नीम् Rama's spouse, सर्वतः all over, परिमार्गध्वम् search for.

43_5.shloka: अस्मिन्कार्येविनिर्वृत्ते कृते दाशरथेः प्रिये।ऋणान्मुक्ता भविष्यामः कृतार्थार्थविदां वराः।।4.43.5।।
43_5.translation: 'We should be succeessful in our endeavour when we have completed the task dear to Rama. We will be redeemed of our debt to him.
43_5.word_by_word: कृतार्थविदां वराः successful in our endeavour, अस्मिन् in this, कार्ये in this work, विनिवृत्ते returned, दाशरथेः Dasarathi's, प्रिये कृते when the task dear to him is done, ऋणान् from the debt, मुक्ताः redeemed, कृतार्थाः sucessful, भविष्यामः we will be.

43_6.shloka: कृतं हि प्रियमस्माकं राघवेण महात्मना।तस्य चेत्प्रतिकारोऽस्ति सफलं जीवितं भवेत्।।4.43.6।।
43_6.translation: 'Highsouled Rama has done a great service to us earlier. We will be blessed if we aresuccessful in helping Rama in return.
43_6.word_by_word: महात्मना highsouled, राघवेण by Rama, अस्माकम् for us, प्रियम् dear, कृतं हि is done, तस्य for that, प्रतिकारः a help in return, अस्ति चेत् if there is anything, जीवितम् life, सफलम् sucessful, भवेत् will be(blessed).

43_7.shloka: अर्थिनः कार्यनिर्वृत्तिमकर्तुरपि यश्चरेत्।तस्य स्यात्सफलं जन्म किं पुनः पूर्वकारिणः।।4.43.7।।
43_7.translation: 'Our life becomes fruitful when we help a person who was not helped us. What to speak of returning the help one has rendered.
43_7.word_by_word: यः whoever, अकर्तुरपि who has not helped, अर्थिनः by a needy man, कार्यनिर्वृत्तिम् fulfilling the task, चरेत् if one takes up, तस्य his, जन्म life, सफलं स्यात् will be fruitful, पूर्वकारिणः one who has helped earlier, किं पुनः what to say.

43_8.shloka: एतां बुद्धिमवस्थाय दृश्यते जानकी यथा।तथा भवद्भिः कर्तव्यमस्मत्प्रियहितैषिभिः।।4.43.8।।
43_8.translation: 'Keeping this in mind, you, as my wellwishers, should act in a way Janaki can be traced.
43_8.word_by_word: एताम् such, बुद्धिम् mind, अवस्थाय after taking such a stand, अस्मत्प्रियहितैषिभिः by our well wishers, भवद्भिः by you, जानकी Janaki, यथा in such a way, दृश्यते is seen, तथा like that, कर्तव्यम् should be done.

43_9.shloka: अयं हि सर्वभूतानां मान्यस्तु नरसत्तमः।अस्मासु चागत: प्रीती रामः परपुरञ्जयः।।4.43.9।।
43_9.translation: 'This Rama who can conquer the capitals of enemies is great. He loves and is loved by all living beings including ourselves.
43_9.word_by_word: अयम् this, नरसत्तमः king, परपुरञ्जयः  who can conquer the capitals of enemies, रामः Rama, सर्वभूतानाम् for all beings, मान्यः revered, अस्मासु at us also, प्रीतिं गतः he loves.

43_10.shloka: इमानि वनदुर्गाणि नद्यश्शैलान्तराणि च।भवन्तः परिमार्गन्तु बुद्धिविक्रमसम्पदा।।4.43.10।।
43_10.translation: 'You are rich in wisdom and valour. You should search for Sita everywhere including inaccessible forests and mountain ranges.
43_10.word_by_word: भवन्तः by your, बुद्धिविक्रमसम्पदा rich wisdom and valour, इमानि these, वनदुर्गाणि inacessible forests, नद्यः rivers, शैलान्तराणि च mountain ranges,परिमार्गन्तु search.

43_11.shloka: तत्र म्लेच्छान्पुलिन्दांश्च शूरसेनांस्तथैव च।प्रस्थलान्भरतांश्चैव कुरूंश्च सह मद्रकैः।।4.43.11।।काम्बोजान्यवनां श्चैव शकानारट्टकानपि।बाह्लीकानृषिकां श्चैव पौरवानथ टङ्कणान्।।4.43.12।।चीनान्परमचीनांश्च नीहारांश्च पुनः पुनः।अन्विष्यदरदांश्चैव हिमवन्तं तथैव च।।4.43.13।।
43_11.translation: 'Search in the countries of Mlechas, Pulindas, Surasenas, Prasthalas, Bharatas, Madrakas, Kurus, Kambojas and even Yavanas, Shakas, Rattakas, Bahlikas, Rishikas, Pauravas, Tankanas, Cheenas, Paramacheenas, Niharas, Daradas and in the Himalaya mountains again and again in order to find her.
43_11.word_by_word: तत्र there, म्लेच्छान् Mlechhas, पुलिन्दांश्च Pulindas, तथैव च so also, शूरसेनान् Surasenas, प्रस्थलान् Prasthalas, भरतांश्चैव Bharatas, मद्रकै सह along with Madrakas, कुरूंश्च and also Kurus, काम्बोजान्यवनांश्चैव Kambojas and Yavanas, शकान् Shakas, आरट्टकानपि च Arattakas, बाह्लीकान् Bahlikas, ऋषिकांश्चैव Rishikas, पौरवान् Pauravas, अथ and then, टङ्कणान्  Tankanas, चीनान् Cheenas, परमचीनांश्च in Paramacheena, नीहारांश्च Niharas, दरदांश्चैव Daradas also, पुनःपुनः again and again, अन्विष्य  searching, हिमवन्तम्  Himavanta, विचिन्वथ search.

43_12.translation: 'There you should explore the dwelling of Ravana and Vaidehi, in the thickets of lodhra and lotuses and in the woods of devadaru.
43_12.word_by_word: लोध्रपद्मकषण्डेषु in the thickets of Lodhra and lotuses, देवदारुवनेषु च and in the woods of Devadaru, रावणः Ravana, ततस्ततः everywhere, वैदेह्या सह Vaidehi, मार्गितव्यः explore.

43_13.shloka: ततस्सोमाश्रमं गत्वा देवगन्धर्वसेवितम्।कालं नाम महासानुं पर्वतं तु गमिष्यथ।।4.43.15।।
43_13.translation: 'Then go and explore the hermitage of Soma inhabited by gods and gandharvas and also the great summits of mount Kala.
43_13.word_by_word: ततः then, देवगन्धर्वसेवितम् inhabited by gods and gandharvas, सोमाश्रमम् hermitage of Soma, गत्वा after visiting, महासानुम् great slopes, कालं नाम named Kala, पर्वतं तु the mountain also, गमिष्यथ go and explore.

43_14.shloka: महत्सु तस्य शैलस्य निर्दरेषु गुहासु च।विचिनुध्वं महाभागां रामपत्नींततस्ततः।।4.43.16।।
43_14.translation: 'Look for that great lady, Rama's consort, in the big caves and caverns all over the mountain.
43_14.word_by_word: तस्य that mountain's, महत्सु mighty one's, शैलस्य mountain's, निर्दरेषु in caverns, गुहासु च in caves as well, महाभागाम् great lady, ततस्ततः everywhere, रामपत्नीम् Rama's wife, विचिनुध्वं  search for.

43_15.shloka: तमतिक्रम्य शैलेन्द्रं हेमगर्भं महागिरिम्।ततस्सुदर्शनं नाम गन्तुमर्हथ पर्वतम्।।4.43.17।।
43_15.translation: 'Crossing this lord of hills filled with gold, you should reach the great mountain called Sudarsana.
43_15.word_by_word: हेमगर्भम् filled with gold, शैलेन्द्रम् lord of mountain, तम् that, महागिरिम् great mountain, अतिक्रम्य after passing , ततः then, सुदर्शनं नाम called Sudarsana, पर्वतम् mountain, गन्तुम् to go, अर्हथ it is proper for you.

43_16.shloka: ततो देवसखो नाम पर्वतः पतगालयः।नानापक्षिगणाकीर्णो विविधद्रुमभूषितः।।4.43.18।।
43_16.translation: 'Then proceed to mount Devasakha inhabited by a variety of birds adorning the trees.
43_16.word_by_word: ततः from there, पतगालयः nests of birds, नानापक्षिगणाकीर्णः full of different kinds of birds, विविधद्रुमभूषितः adorned with different kinds of trees, देवसखो नाम Devasakha by name, पर्वतः mountain.

43_17.shloka: तस्य काननषण्डेषु निर्घरेषु गुहासु च।रावणस्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः।।4.43.19।।
43_17.translation: 'You should search for Ravana as well as Vaidehi everywhere in the thickets of that hill, near the mountain streams and also in caves.
43_17.word_by_word: तस्य its, काननषण्डेषु in the thickets, निर्घरेषु near mountain streams, गुहासु च in caves, रावणः Ravana, वैदेह्यासह and Vaidehi, ततस्ततः everywhere, मार्गितव्यः should be searched.

43_18.translation: 'Beyond, there is a desolate place of hundred yojanas with no trace of life, no mountains, no trees, no rivers.
43_18.word_by_word: तम् those, अतिक्रम्य after passing, अपर्वतनदीवृक्षम् a location without mountains, rivers and trees, सर्वसत्त्ववर्जितम् a desolate place without trace of life, सर्वतः all over, शतयोजनम् hundred yojanas, आकाशम् vacant space.

43_19.shloka: तं तु शीघ्रमतिक्रम्य कान्तारं रोमहर्षणम्।कैलासं पाण्डुरं शैलं प्राप्य हृष्टा भविष्यथ।।4.43.21।।
43_19.translation: 'Crossing that horripilating, desolate place quickly, you will be happy to reach the snowy Kailasa mountain.
43_19.word_by_word: कान्तारम् fearsome, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, तम् that, शीघ्रम् quickly, अतिक्रम्य after crossing, पाण्डुरम् pale white, कैलासम् Kailasa, प्राप्य on reaching, शैलम् mountain, हृष्टाः happy, भविष्यथ you will be.

43_20.shloka: तत्र पाण्डुरमेघाभं जाम्बूनदपरिष्कृतम्।कुबेरभवनं रम्यं निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा।।4.43.22।।
43_20.translation: 'There is an exquisite mansion of Kubera built by Visvakarma which, embellished with gold, looks like a pale white cloud.
43_20.word_by_word: तत्र there, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, निर्मितम् built, पाण्डुरमेघाभम् like pale white cloud, जाम्बूनदपरिष्कृतम् embellished with gold, रम्यम् exquisite, कुबेरभवनम् mansion of Kubera.

43_21.translation: 'There is a large lotus pond with many lotuses and lilies, inhabited by swans and ducks and frequented by groups of apasaras.
43_21.word_by_word: यत्र where, प्रभूतकमलोत्पला with many lotuses and lilies, हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा inhabited by swans and ducks, अप्सरोगणसेविता frequented by groups of apasaras, विशाला large, नलिनी lotus pond.

43_22.shloka: तत्र वैश्रवणो राजा सर्वभूतनमस्कृतः।धनदो रमते श्रीमान्गुह्यकैस्सह यक्षराट्।।4.43.24।।
43_22.translation: 'Kubera, son of Vaisravana, a prosperous king of the yakshas (demigods) worshipped by all beings dwells there with Guhyakas.
43_22.word_by_word: तत्र there, वैश्रवणः Vaisravana, राजा king, सर्वभूतनमस्कृतः worshipped by all beings, यक्षराट् Yaksha king, श्रीमान् prosperous, धनदः Kubera, गुह्यकैः सह along with Guhyakas, रमते enjoying.

43_23.shloka: तस्य चन्द्रनिकाशेषु पर्वतेषु गुहासु च।रावणः सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः।।4.43.25।।
43_23.translation: 'Look for Vaidehi and Ravana all over the caves and mountains of Kilasa of the colour of the moon.
43_23.word_by_word: तस्य its, चन्द्रनिकाशेषु of the colour of the Moon, पर्वतेषु in mountains, गुहासु च and caves, ततस्ततः here and there, वैदेह्या सह with Vaidehi, रावणः Ravana, मार्गितव्यः you may look for.

43_24.shloka: क्रौञ्चं तु गिरिमासाद्य बिलं तस्य सुदुर्गमम्।अप्रमत्तै: प्रवेष्टव्यं दुष्प्रवेशं हि तत्स्मृतम्।।4.43.26।।
43_24.translation: 'Therefrom proceed to mount krauncha mountain and enter carefully its cave which is reportedly difficult to access.
43_24.word_by_word: क्रौञ्चं गिरिम् mountain Krauncha, आसाद्य after reaching, सुदुर्गमम् most diffficult place to access, तस्य बिलम् its entrance, अप्रमत्तै:carefully, प्रवेष्टव्यम् you may enter, तत् that, दुष्प्रवेशम् difficult to enter, स्मृतम् हि it is stated.

43_25.shloka: वसन्ति हि महात्मानस्तत्र सूर्यसमप्रभाः।देवैरप्यर्चिता स्सम्यग्देवरूपा महर्षयः।।4.43.27।।
43_25.translation: 'Great ascetics live there. Worshipped even by the gods, these highsouled godlike ascetics shine like the very Sun.
