43_25.word_by_word: तत्र there (in krauncha caves), सूर्यसमप्रभाः radiant like the Sun, देवैः अपि even by the gods, अर्चिताः worshipped, देवरूपाः  form of gods, महात्मानः highsouled, महर्षयः ascetics, सम्यक् properly, वसन्ति हि live there.

43_26.shloka: क्रौञ्चस्य तु गुहाश्चान्या स्सानूनिशिखराणि च।निर्दराश्च नितम्बाश्च विचेतव्या स्ततस्ततः।।4.43.28।।कौञ्चस्य शिखरं चापि निरीक्ष्य च ततस्ततः।
43_26.translation: 'Ransack the peaks of Krauncha, its caves, caverns and ridges.
43_26.word_by_word: क्रौञ्चस्य Krauncha's, शिखरं चापि peak also, ततस्ततः all over, निरीक्ष्य after observing, क्रौञ्चस्य Krauncha's, अन्याः other, गुहाश्च caves also, सानूनि summits, शिखराणि च peaks, निर्दराश्च and caverns also, नितम्बाश्च ridges, ततस्ततः everywhere, विचेतव्याः search.

43_27.shloka: अवृक्षं कामशैलं च मानसं विहगालयम्।न गतिस्तत्र भूतानां देवदानव रक्षसाम्।।4.43.29।।
43_27.translation: 'There is a mountain region known as Kama, and Manasa where there are no trees. It is a bird sanctuary. Not only living beings, even gods, demons and rakshas have no access to that place.
43_27.word_by_word: अवृक्षम् without trees, विहगालयम् abode of birds, मानसम् Manasa, कामशैलम् mountain Kama, तत्र there, भूतानाम् for all living beings, गतिः access, न not, देवदानव gods, demons, रक्षसां च rakshas, न not.

43_28.shloka: स च सर्वैर्विचेतव्यस्ससानुप्रस्थभूधरः।क्रौञ्चं गिरिमतिक्रम्य मैनाको नाम पर्वतः।।4.43.30।।
43_28.translation: 'Beyond mount Krauncha you will find Mainaka. All of you should search for Sita in the plain lands and the ridges of the mountain.
43_28.word_by_word: ससानुप्रस्थभूधरः the mountain including its plain lands and ridges, सः that mountain, सर्वैः by all of you, विचेतव्यः it has to be searched, क्रौञ्चं गिरिम् Krauncha mountain, अतिक्रम्य after passing, मैनाको नाम called Mainaka, पर्वतः mountain.

43_29.shloka: मयस्य भवनं यत्र दानवस्य स्वयं कृतम्।।4.43.31।।मैनाकस्तु विचेतव्य स्ससानुप्रस्थकन्दरः।स्त्रीणामश्वमुखीनां तु निकेतास्तत्र तत्र तु।।4.43.32।।
43_29.translation: 'There on Mainaka a demon, called Maya has built a mansion all by himself. Try to look in the plain lands, ridges and deep caves of Mainaka and in the residences of kinnera women with faces of horses.
43_29.word_by_word: यत्र there, दानवस्य demon's, मयस्य Maya's, स्वयं कृतम् built personally by him, भवनम् mansion, ससानुप्रस्थकन्दरः with table lands and deep caves, मैनाकः Mainaka, विचेतव्यः you may look, तत्र तत्र here and there, अश्वमुखीनां स्त्रीणाम् of kinnera women with horseface, निकेताः residences.

43_30.shloka: तं देशं समतिक्रम्य आश्रमं सिद्धसेवितम्।सिद्धा वैखानसास्तत्र वालखिल्याश्च तापसाः।।4.43.33।।
43_30.translation: 'On passing that place, you will come across a hermitage inhabited by siddhas and ascetics, Vaikhanasas and Valakilyas.
43_30.word_by_word: तं देशम् that place, समतिक्रम्य after passing, सिद्धसेवितम् inhabited by siddhas, आश्रमम् hermitage, तत्र there, सिद्धाः siddhas, वैखानसाः vaikhanasas, तापसाः ascetics, वालखिल्याश्च and Valakilyas.

43_31.shloka: वन्द्यास्ते तु तपस्सिद्धास्तपसा वीतकल्मषाः।प्रष्टव्या चापि सीतायाः प्रवृत्तिर्विनयान्वितैः।।4.43.34।।
43_31.translation: 'They deserve  your reverence since they are accomplished ascetics.They are cleansed of sins by their penance.You should be polite when you ask them for information  about Sita.
43_31.word_by_word: ते they, तपस्सिद्धाः accomplished ascetics, तपसा with penance, वीतकल्मषाः free of sins, वन्द्यान् those revered sires, विनयान्वितैः politely, सीतायाः about Sita, प्रवृत्ति: information, प्रष्टव्या चापि you should ask.

43_32.word_by_word: तत्र there, हेमपुष्करसञ्छन्नम् covered with golden lotuses, तरुणादित्यसङ्काशैः by those bright like the rising Sun, शुभैः auspicious, हंसैः swans, विचरितम् they move along, वैखानसम् Vykaanasam, सरः lake.

43_33.shloka: औपवाह्यः कुबेरस्य सार्वभौम इति स्मृतः।गजः पर्येति तं देशं सदा सह करेणुभिः।।4.43.36।।
43_33.word_by_word: सार्वभौमः इति called Sarvabhauma, स्मृतः he is known, कुबेरस्य Kubera's, औपवाह्याः royal mount, गजः elephant, करेणुभिः सह with female elphants, सदा ever, तं देशम् in that place, पर्येति keep roaming.

43_34.translation: 'If you cross that region, you will find no Sun, no Moon, no stars, no cloud, no sound.
43_34.word_by_word: तत् that, सरः pond, समतिक्रम्य beyond that, नष्टचन्द्रदिवाकरम् Sun and Moon not seen, अनक्षत्रगणम् no stars, निष्पयोदम्  no clouds  move, अनादितम् no sound heard, व्योम silent.

43_35.translation: 'That (Sunless) land shines like the radiance of the Sungod with the presence of selfeffulgent ascetics who have attained perfection in penance.
43_35.word_by_word: देवकल्पैः  equal to gods, स्वयंप्रभैः selfeffulgent ones, विश्राम्यद्भिः by the living, तपस्सिद्धैः perfected by austerities, सः देशः that place, अर्कस्य Sun's, गभस्तिभिरिव like the Sun rays, प्रकाशते shines.

43_36.shloka: तं तु देशमतिक्रम्य शैलोदा नाम निम्नगा।उभयोस्तीरयोस्तस्याः कीचका नाम वेणवः।।4.43.39।।ते नयन्ति परं तीरं सिद्धान्प्रत्यानयन्ति च।
43_36.translation: 'Passing that region you will reach a mountain stream called Sailoda. On both the banks of the stream are bamboo groves called Kichakas. They waft the siddhas to and from the river. (Kichakas bend forward forming an arch and thus help sages to cross the river.)
43_36.word_by_word: तं तु देशम् that region, अतिक्रम्य on passing, शैलोदानाम called Sailoda, निम्नगा mountainstream, तस्याः its, उभयोः both, तीरयोः on the banks, कीचकाः नाम called Kichakas, वेणवः bamboos, ते you, सिद्धान् ascetics, परं तीरम् to the other bank, नयन्ति going, प्रत्यानयन्ति च and get back.

43_37.shloka: उत्तराः कुरवस्तत्र कृतपुण्यप्रतिश्रयाः।।4.43.40।।ततः काञ्चनपद्माभिः पद्भिनीभिः कृतोदकाः।नीलवैडूर्यपत्राभिर्नद्यस्तत्र सहस्रशः।।4.43.41।।रक्तोत्पलवनैश्चात्र मण्डिताश्च हिरण्मयैः।
43_37.translation: 'Thereafter you will reach the country of UttaraKuru, a resort for those who have done meritorious deeds.There are lotus ponds with golden lotuses with bluish and greenish leaves.There are thousands of rivers adorned with red and night lotuses of gold.
43_37.word_by_word: तत्र there, कृतपुण्यप्रतिश्रयाः those who did meritorious deeds, उत्तराः कुरवः UttaraKuru country, ततः  there, काञ्चनपद्माभिः  beds of golden lotuses, पद्भिनीभिः with lotus groves, कृतोदकाः brimming with water, नीलवैढूर्यपत्राभिः blue and green leaves, नद्यः rivers, सहस्रशः in thousands, अत्र here, हिरण्मयैः with golden ones, रक्तोत्पलवनैः with red lotuses, मण्डिताः are adorned with.

43_38.shloka: तरुणादित्यसङ्काशैर्भान्ति तत्र जलाशयाः।।4.43.42।।महार्हमणिरत्नैश्च काञ्चनप्रभकेसरैः।निलोत्पलवनैश्चित्रै स्स देश स्सर्वतो वृतः।।4.43.43।।निस्तुलाभिश्च मुक्ताभिर्मणिभिश्च महाधनैः।
43_38.translation: 'There are tanks and lakes filled with lotuses shining like the rising Sun with lotus leaves having the colour of precious emeralds. The lotus filaments look like golden threads. The entire place is full of blue lotus groves, exquisite pearls and other gems.
43_38.word_by_word: तत्र there, जलाशयाः tanks and lakes, तरुणादित्यसङ्काशैः glowing red like the rising Sun,  भान्ति adorned with, सः देशः in that place, सर्वतः all over, महार्हमणिरत्नैश्च with excellent leaves of the colour of precious emeralds, काञ्चनप्रभकेसरैः with filaments like golden threads, चित्रैः with wonderful, नीलोत्पलवनैः with clusters of blue lotus groves, निस्तुलाभिः with incomaparable, मुक्ताभिः with pearls, महाधनैः with very valuable, मणिभिश्च with gems also, वृतः covered.

43_39.translation: 'There the sandy river banks are rich with all kinds of colourful gems resplendent with the brightness of gold. Gold and gems glowing like fire in the best of mountains have entered these rivers.
43_39.word_by_word: तत्र there, निम्नगाः rivers, जातरूपैः golden, उद्भूतपुलिनाः sandy banks have appeared, सर्वरत्नमयैः with all kinds of gems, चित्रैः  colourful ones, जातरूपमयैः  golden, हुताशनसमप्रभैः  glowing like fire, नगोत्तमैः  best of mountains, अवगाढाः have entered, अपि and.

43_40.shloka: नित्यपुष्पफलास्तत्र नगाः पत्त्ररथाकुलाः।।4.43.45।।दिव्यगन्धरसस्पर्शाः सर्वान्कामान् स्रवन्ति च।नानाकाराणि वासांसि फलन्त्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः।।4.43.46।।
43_40.translation: 'There the trees are filled with flowers and fruits in all seasons. Birds rest on them.  By their excellent fragrance, taste and smooth feel the fruits and flowers satisfy the desires of all. Some other excellent trees provide barks of various kinds which are used for cloth.
43_40.word_by_word: तत्र there, नगाः trees, नित्यपुष्पफलाः always in bloom and laden with fruits, पत्त्ररथाकुलाः filled with birds, दिव्यगन्धरसस्पर्शाः with divine fragrance and feel and touch, सर्वान् all, कामान् desires, स्रवन्ति च emit, अन्ये other, नगोत्तमाः excellent trees, नानाकाराणि of different kinds, वासांसि clothes, फलन्ति provide.

43_41.shloka: मुक्ता वैढूर्यचित्राणि भूषणानि तथैव च।स्त्रीणां चाप्यनुरूपाणि पुरुषाणां तथैव च।।4.43.47।।सर्वर्तुसुख सेव्यानि फलन्त्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः।महार्हाणि विचित्राणि हैमान्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः।।4.43.48।।
43_41.translation: 'Some other great trees (of the region) provide ornaments suitable for both men and women studded with precious pearls and vaidurya which give pleasure in all seasons.  Other trees put forth beautiful and highly valuable ornaments.
43_41.word_by_word: अन्ये others, नगोत्तमाः excellent trees, अपि also, स्त्रीणाम् for women, तथैव च similarly, पुरुषाणाम् for men, अनुरूपाणि suitable ones, मुक्तावैडूर्यचित्राणि studded with wonderful pearls and vaidurya gems, तथैव च and similarly, सर्वर्तुसुखसेव्यानि which give pleasure in all seasons, भूषणानि ornaments, हैमान् golden, अन्ये other, नगोत्तमाः trees, महार्हाणि विचित्राणि wonderful and highly valuable ones, फलन्ति yield.

43_42.shloka: शयनानि प्रसूयन्ते चित्रास्तरणवन्ति च।मनःकान्तानि माल्यानि फलन्त्यत्रापरे द्रुमाः।।4.43.49।।
43_42.translation: 'The trees of that region deliver beds with colourful spreads. Some trees yield garlands of flowers pleasing to the heart.
43_42.word_by_word: अत्र here, अपरे others, द्रुमाः trees, चित्रास्तरणवन्ति bed spreads of different colours, शयनानि  beds, प्रसूयन्ते yield, मनःकान्तानि those that are pleasing to the heart, माल्यानि garlands, फलन्ति yield.

43_43.shloka: पानानि च महार्हाणि भक्ष्याणि विविधानि च।स्त्रियश्च गुणसम्पन्ना रूपयौवनलक्षिताः।।4.43.50।।
43_43.translation: 'Some trees bring forth many  good quality drinks, eatables and also virtuous  women, young and beautiful.
43_43.word_by_word: महार्हाणि good, पानानि drinks, विविधानि many kinds, भक्ष्याणि च and eatables, गुणसम्पन्नाः virtuous, रूपयौवनलक्षिताः marked by beauty and youth, स्त्रियश्च women also.

43_44.shloka: गन्धर्वाः किन्नरास्सिद्धा नागा विद्याधरास्तथा।रमन्ते सततं स्तत्र नारीभिर्भास्करप्रभाः।।4.43.51।।
43_44.translation: There gandharvas, kinneras, siddhas, nagas and vidyadharas, radiant like the Sun, are seen sporting with their female companions.
43_44.word_by_word: भास्करप्रभाः radiant like Sun, गन्धर्वाः gandharvas, किंनराः kinneras, सिद्धाः siddhas, नागाः nagas, तथा similarly, विद्याधराः vidyadharas, तत्र there, सततं always, नारीभिः with women, रमन्ते are sporting.

43_45.shloka: सर्वे सुकृतकर्माण स्सर्वे रतिपरायणाः।सर्वे कामार्थसहिता वसन्ति सहयोषितः।।4.43.52।।
43_45.translation: 'By virtue of their meritorious deeds (done in the previous birth) they live a luxurious life of riches and sensual pleasures with their female partners.
43_45.word_by_word: सर्वे all,सुकृतकर्माणः of meritorious deeds , सर्वे all, रतिपरायणाः intent on sensual pleasures, सर्वे all, कामार्थसहिताः for fulfilment of kama and artha, सहयोषितः along with their female companions, वसन्ति live.

43_46.translation: 'Pleasing sounds of heavenly musicvocal and instrumental and laughter of celestial beings are ever heard in that region.
43_46.word_by_word: सोत्कृष्टहसितस्वनः sounds of laughter of celestial beings, सर्वभूतमनोहरः pleasing to all beings, गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषः sounds of vocal and instrumental music, तत्र there, सततम् continually, श्रूयते heard.

43_47.shloka: तत्र नामुदितः कश्चिन्नास्ति कश्चिदसत्प्रियः।अहन्यहनि वर्धन्ते गुणास्तत्र मनोरमाः।।4.43.54।।
43_47.translation: 'There nobody is unhappy or inclined towards evil deeds and virtues in people go increasing day by day.
43_47.word_by_word: तत्र there, अमुदितः unhappy, कश्चिन् any one, न not, असत्प्रियः who likes bad deeds, कश्चित् any one, न not, नास्ति not there, अहन्यहनि day by day, मनोरमाः delightful, गुणाः virtues, वर्धन्ते increase.

43_48.shloka: समतिक्रम्य तं देशमुत्तरः पयसां निधिः।तत्र सोमगिरिर्नाम मध्ये हेममयो महान्।।4.43.55।।
43_48.translation: 'Cross it and, you will reach the northern sea. In its midst is the great golden mountain, Somagiri.
43_48.word_by_word: तं देशम् in that place, अतिक्रम्य after crossing that place, उत्तरः northern, पयसां निधिः sea, तत्र there, मध्ये in the midst, हेममयः golden, महान् great, सोमगिरिर्नाम Somagiri,

43_49.shloka: इन्द्रलोकगता ये च ब्रह्मलोकगताश्च ये।देवास्तं समवेक्षन्ते गिरिराजं दिवं गताः।।4.43.56।।
43_49.translation: 'Only those who have reached the world of Indra and Brahma in heaven can see that  king of mountains.
43_49.word_by_word: ये those, इन्द्रलोकगताः gone to the world of Indra, ये those, ब्रह्मलोकगताश्च gone to Brahma's world, देवाः deities, दिवम् heaven, गताः gone, तम् that, गिरिराजम् king of mountains, समवेक्षन्ते can view.

43_50.shloka: स तु देशो विसूर्योऽपि तस्य भासा प्रकाशते।सूर्यलक्ष्म्याऽभिविज्ञेयस्तपतेव विवस्वता।।4.43.57।।
43_50.translation: 'That place gets light and heat even though there is no Sun.
43_50.word_by_word: सः देशः that place, विसूर्योऽपि though without Sun, सूर्यलक्ष्मयभिऽविज्ञेयः appears as if Sun'sradiance, तपता with blazing, विवस्वता इव by the Sun,  इव as if, तस्य his, भासा by light, प्रकाशते shines.

43_51.shloka: भगवानपि विश्वात्मा शम्भुरेकादशात्मकः।ब्रह्मा वसति देवेशो ब्रह्मर्षिपरिवारितः।।4.43.58।।
43_51.translation: 'Even divine beings, the elevenfold Samhbu, the allpervading Visnu and Lord Brahma surrounded by Brahmarshis (divine seers) reside there.
43_51.word_by_word: भगवानपि even divine being, विश्वात्मा allpervading Visnu, एकादशात्मकः elevenfold, शम्भुः Sambhu, ब्रह्मर्षिपरिवारितः surrounded by divine seers, Brahmarshis, देवेशः lord of gods, ब्रह्मा Brahma, वसति reside.

43_52.shloka: न कथञ्चन गन्तव्यं कुरूणामुत्तरेण वः।अन्येषामपि भूतानां नातिक्रामति वै गतिः।।4.43.59।।
43_52.translation: 'You should not go beyond the north of Kuru. No living being can trespass it.
43_52.word_by_word: कुरूणामुत्तरेण to the north of Kuru, कथञ्चन however, वः for you, न गन्तव्यम् should not go, अन्येषाम् for other, भूतानाम् अपि other living beings also, गतिः movement, नातिक्रामति transgresses.

43_53.shloka: स हि सोमगिरिर्नाम देवानामपि दुर्गमः।तमालोक्य ततः क्षिप्रमुपावर्तितुमर्हथ।।4.43.60।।
43_53.translation: 'It is difficult even for gods to reach Somagiri. You should return immediately afterseeing that mountain.
43_53.word_by_word: सोमगिरिर्नाम Somagiri by name, सः that mountain, देवानामपि even for gods, दुर्गमः inaccessible, तम् them, आलोक्य after seeing, ततः that place, क्षिप्रम् at once, उपावर्तितुम् to return, अर्हथ not proper for you.

43_54.shloka: एतावद्वानरैश्शक्यं गन्तुं वानरपुङ्गवाः।अभास्करममर्यादं न जानीमस्ततः परम्।।4.43.61।।
43_54.translation: 'O monkey leaders it is not possible for monkeys to go beyond. The Sun does not shine beyond that place and it is not visible. We do not know what lies beyond that (Somagiri).
43_54.word_by_word: वानरपुङ्गवाः O monkeys, एतावत् until there, वानरैः by monkeys, गन्तुम् to go, शक्यम् possible, अभास्करम् Sunless, अमर्यादं च not visible, ततः परम् beyond that, न जानीमः we do not go.

43_55.shloka: सर्वमेतद्विचेतव्यं यन्मया परिकीर्तितम्।यदन्यदपि नोक्तं च तत्रापि क्रियतां मतिः।।4.43.62।।
43_55.translation: 'You should keep in mind the places described. You may also think of other places I might have omitted.
43_55.word_by_word: मया by me, यत् whatever, परिकीर्तिम् is mentioned, एतत् all this, सर्वम् every where, विचेतव्यम् explore, अन्यदपि even other places, यत् whatever, नोक्तम् is told, तत्रापि च there also, मतिः mind, क्रियताम् you may apply.

43_56.shloka: ततः कृतं दाशरथेर्महत्प्रियंमहत्तरं चापि ततो मम प्रियम्।कृतं भविष्यत्यनिलानलोपमाविदेहजादर्शनजेन कर्मणा।।4.43.63।।
43_56.translation: 'O heroic monkeys comparable to fire If you are successful in finding Vaidehi you will be carrying out your duty.  Rama will be highly pleased by your action. My pleasure will be even greater.
43_56.word_by_word: अनिलानलोपमाः comparable to fire, ततः that, विदेहजादर्शनजेन arising out of meeting Vaidehi, कर्मणा by that act, दाशरथेः to Rama, महत् great, प्रियम् pleasure, कृतम् is done, ततः अपि andeven great also, मम to me, महत्तरम् greater, प्रियम् pleasure, कृतम् done, भविष्यति you will be.

43_57.shloka: ततः कृतार्थाः सहितास्सबान्धवाःमयाऽर्चितास्सर्वगुणैर्मनोरमैः।चरिष्यथोर्वीं प्रति शान्तशत्रवस्सहप्रिया भूतधराः प्लवङ्गमाः।।4.43.64।।
43_57.translation: 'O monkeys, when you have accomplished your goal, you will be honoured by me as though you have returned after scoring a victory over the enemy. You will roam this earth with your relatives, rejoicing in the company of your loved ones.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends of fortythird sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
43_57.word_by_word: भूतधराः supporters of all beings, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, ततः then, कृतार्थाः accomplish your goal, सहिताः along with, सबान्धवाः your relations, मया by me, मनोरमैः  by delightful ones, सर्वगुणैः by all virtues, अर्चिताः honoured, शान्तशत्रवः those who vanquished their enemies, सहप्रियाः with your loved ones, उर्वीम् प्रति towards the earth, चरिष्यथ you will be honoured

44_1.shloka: [Sugriva speaks very highly of Hanuman to Rama -- Rama hands in his ring to Hanuman as a mark of identification.]विशेषेण तु सुग्रीवो हनूमत्यर्थमुक्तवान्।स हि तस्मिन्हरिश्रेष्ठे निश्चितार्थोऽर्थसाधने।।4.44.1।।
44_1.translation: Sugriva mentioned about the capacity of Hanuman, the best of monkeys as he knew he would surely succeed in accomplishing the task.
44_1.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, विशेषेण particularly, हनूमति in Hanuman, अर्थम् purpose (of the mission), उक्तवान् mentioned, सः he, अर्थसाधने in accomplishing the goal, तस्मिन् हरिश्रेष्ठे great among the monkeys, निश्चितार्थः हि one who was sure of success.

44_2.shloka: अब्रवीच्च हनूमन्तं विक्रान्तमनिलात्मजम्।सुग्रीवः परमप्रीतः प्रभु स्सर्ववनौकसाम्।।4.44.2।।
44_2.translation: Sugriva, king of the monkeys, spoke, highly pleased, to Hanuman, the warrior son of the Windgod advancing towards him:
44_2.word_by_word: सर्ववनौकसाम् for all the monkeys, प्रभुः king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, परमप्रीतः very pleased, विक्रान्तम् advancing, अनिलात्मजम् son of the Windgod, हनूमन्तम् to Hanumanta, अब्रवीच्च spoke.

44_3.shloka: न भूमौ नान्तरिक्षे वा नाम्बरे नामरालये।नाप्सु वा गतिसङ्गं ते पश्यामि हरिपुङ्गव।।4.44.3।।
44_3.translation: 'O best of monkeys I scarcely see a hero comparable to your speed on earth or in space or sky or heaven or water.
44_3.word_by_word: हरिपुङ्गव O best of monkeys, भूमौ on earth, ते to you, गतिसङ्गम् who can equal your movement, न पश्यामि I do not see, अन्तरिक्षे वा or in space, न nor, अम्बरे in sky, न nor, अमरालये in heaven, न nor, अप्सु वा or in water.

44_4.word_by_word: सासुराः including demons, सहगन्धर्वाः along with gandharvas, सनागनरदेवताः along with the nagas, men and gods, ससागरधराधराः including on the seas, mountains, सर्वलोकाः all worlds, ते to you, विदिताः are known.

44_5.shloka: गतिर्वेगश्च तेजश्च लाघवं च महाकपे।पितुस्ते सदृशं वीर मारुतस्य महौजसः।।4.44.5।।
44_5.translation: 'O hero, O great monkey in movement, speed, brilliance and quickness you are similar to your mighty father, the Windgod.
44_5.word_by_word: वीर O hero, महाकपे O great monkey, ते your, गतिः in movement, वेगश्च in speed, तेजश्च in brilliance, लाघवं च in movement and speed, पितुः father's, महौजसः mighty, मारुतस्य of the Windgod, सदृशम् similar.

44_6.shloka: तेजसा वापि ते भूतं न समं भुवि न विद्यते।तद्यथा लभ्यते सीता तत्त्वमेवोपपादय।।4.44.6।।
44_6.translation: 'I do not know any living being equal to you in brilliance on this earth. Therefore, you alone know how to secure Sita.Go ahead
44_6.word_by_word: तेजसा वापि in brilliance, ते to you, समम् equal, भूतम् a being, भुवि in the world, न विद्यते does not exist, तत् therefore, सीता Sita, यथा as such, लभ्यते is secured, तत् that way, त्वमेव you alone, अपपादय should go ahead.

44_7.shloka: त्वय्येव हनुम न्नस्ति बलं बुद्धिः पराक्रमः।देशकालानुवृत्तिश्च नयश्च नयपण्डित।।4.44.7।।
44_7.translation: 'O learned Hanuman I am of opinion that in you alone rest strength, wisdom, prowess, ability to act in accordance with time and place and knowledge of statecraft'.
44_7.word_by_word: नयपण्डित O learned one, हनुमन् Hanuman, बलम् strength, बुद्धिः wisdom, पराक्रमः prowess, देशकालानुवृत्तिश्च acting in accordance with time and place, नयश्च  knowledge of statecraft, त्वय्येव in you only, अस्ति I exist.

44_8.shloka: ततः कार्यसमासङ्गमवगम्य हनूमति।विदित्वा हनुमन्तं च चिन्तयामास राघवः।।4.44.8।।
44_8.translation: Having understood that Hanuman was capable of accomplishing the goal, Rama started reflecting as follows:
44_8.word_by_word: ततः then, राघवः Rama, हनूमति in Hanuman, कार्यसमासङ्गम् responsibility of achieving the goal, अवगम्य having understood, हनुमन्तं च Hanuman also, विदित्वा knowing, चिन्तयामास reflected.

44_9.translation: 'This  monkey  king, Sugriva has confidence in Hanuman that he will by all means accomplish the task.'
44_9.word_by_word: अयम् this, हरीश्वरः monkey king, सर्वथा all means, हनूमति Hanumanta, निश्चितार्थः sure, कार्यसाधने in accomplishing the task, हनुमान् Hanuman, निश्चितार्थकरश्चापि sure of accomplishing the task.

44_10.shloka: तदेवं प्रस्थितस्यास्य परिज्ञातस्य कर्मभिः।भर्त्रा परिगृहीतस्य ध्रुवः कार्यफलोदयः।।4.44.10।।
44_10.translation: 'The king Sugriva knows for sure that if Hanuman goes forth, success is assured. So he favours him.'
44_10.word_by_word: तत् since, एवम् in that way, प्रस्थितस्य of a person who goes forth, कर्मभिः with his tasks, परिज्ञातस्य who is known, भर्त्रा king Sugriva, परिगृहीतस्य favoured, अस्य his, कार्यफलोदयः success in his task, ध्रुवः sure.

44_11.shloka: तं समीक्ष्य महातेजा व्यवसायोत्तरं हरिम्।कृतार्थ इव संवृत्तः प्रहृष्टेन्द्रियमानसः।।4.44.11।।
44_11.translation: The mighty Rama was happy in his heart to see Hanuman. He felt as if the task is achieved.
44_11.word_by_word: महातेजाः mighty Rama, व्यवसायोत्तरम् with a resolute answer, तम् him, Hanuman, हरिम् monkey, समीक्ष्य on looking at, प्रहृष्टेन्द्रियमानसः very glad at heart, कृतार्थ इव as if he has accomplished, संवृत्तः he became.

44_12.translation: Rama, scorcher of enemies, gladly gave Hanuman a ring inscribed with his name as a mark of identification by princess (Sita). And said:
44_12.word_by_word: ततः then, परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, प्रीतः delighted, स्वनामाङ्कोपशोभितम् one on which his name is inscribed, अङ्गुलीयम् ring, राजपुत्र्या: to the princess, अभिज्ञानम् as a token of recognition, तस्य to him, ददौ gave.

44_13.translation: 'O distinguished monkey Janaka's daughter will greet you without any hesitation when you present this signet to her. She will know that you have come from me.
44_13.word_by_word: हरिश्रेष्ठ O distinguished monkey, अनेन by this, चिह्नेन by this signet, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, त्वाम् you, मत्सकाशात् from me, अनुप्राप्तम् have come to her, अनुद्विग्ना without any hesitation, अनुपश्यति will greet you.

44_14.shloka: व्यवसायश्च ते वीर सत्त्वयुक्तश्च विक्रमः।सुग्रीवस्य च सन्देशस्सिद्धिं कथयतीव मे।।4.44.14।।
44_14.translation: 'O great hero your enterprise,  prowess coupled with courage and Sugriva's message to you seem to indicate to me about the success of your mission'.
44_14.word_by_word: वीर O hero, ते your, व्यवसायः efforts, सत्त्वयुक्तः endowed with prowess, विक्रमश्च courage, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, सन्देशश्च message to you, मे to me, सिद्धिम् achievement, कथयतीव as if telling me.

44_15.shloka: स तद्गृह्य हरिश्रेष्ठः स्थाप्य मूर्ध्नि कृताञ्जलिः।वन्दित्वा चरणौ चैव प्रस्थितः प्लवगोत्तमः।।4.44.15।।
44_15.translation: The foremost among the monkeys took the ring given to him, placed it on his forehead and saluated it with folded palms. He then prostrated at the feet of Rama and departed.
44_15.word_by_word: प्लवगोत्तमः foremost of the monkeys, सः he, हरिश्रेष्ठः greatest of monkeys, गृह्य after taking, मूर्ध्नि on his forehead, स्थाप्य after placing, कृताञ्जलिः saluted with folded palms, चरणौ चैव and the feet also, वन्दित्वा having offered salutation, प्रस्थितः departed.

44_16.shloka: स तत्प्रकर्षन् हरीणां महद्बलंबभूव वीरः पवनात्मजः कपिः।गताम्बुदे व्योम्नि विशुद्धमण्डलःशशीव नक्षत्रगणोपशोभितः।।4.44.16।।
44_16.translation: Like the moon adorned by hosts of stars in the cloudless sky, the mighty heroic Hanuman, the great son of the Windgod, shone in the midst of the army of monkeys.
44_16.word_by_word: हरीणाम् of monkeys, महत् great, तत् बलम् that army, प्रकर्षन् being foremost among them, वीरः hero, पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, सः कपिः that monkey, गताम्बुदे cloudless, व्योम्नि in the sky, नक्षत्रगणोपशोभितः adorned by hosts of stars, शशीव like the Moon, बभूव appeared.

44_17.shloka: अतिबल बलमाश्रितस्तवाहंहरिवरविक्रम विक्रमैरनल्पैः।पवनसुत यथाऽभिगम्यते साजनकसुता हनुमं स्तथा कुरुष्व।।4.44.17।।
44_17.translation: O Hanuman son of the Windgod, O valiant among the Vanaras, I bank on your strength. Do whatever you can with your mighty valour so that the daughter of Janaka can be found.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
44_17.word_by_word: अतिबल O mighty one, हरिवरविक्रम O valiant among the vanaras, पवनसुत O son of the Windgod, हनुमन् O Hanuman, अहम् I, तव your, बलम् strength, आश्रितः depending, अनल्पैः with mighty, विक्रमैः valour, सा that, जनकसुता daughter of Janaka, यथा in such a way, अभिगम्यते can be found, तथा in such a way that, कुरुष्व do.

45_1.shloka: [Sugriva once again addresses all troops -- the vanaras departRama and Lakshmana return to Prasravana mountain]सर्वांश्चाहूय सुग्रीवः प्लवगान् प्लवगर्षभः।समस्तानब्रवीद्भूयो रामकार्यर्थसिद्धये।।4.45.1।।एवमेतद्विचेतव्यं यन्मया परिकीर्तितम्।
45_1.translation: Summoning the entire body of vanaras, Sugriva, the bull among monkeys, said, 'Go to the places I have described and look for  Sita in order to fulfil Rama's objective'.
45_1.word_by_word: प्लवगर्षभः bull of among monkeys, भूयः further, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, सर्वान् all, प्लवगान् vanaras, आहूय  called, रामकार्यर्थसिद्धये for fulfilling the objective of Rama, समस्तान् all of them, अब्रवीत् addressed, मया by me, यत् whatever, परिकीर्तितम् described, एवम् in the same way, एतत् thus, विचेतव्यम् you should search.

45_2.shloka: तदुग्रशासनं भर्तुर्विज्ञाय हरिपुङ्गवाः।।4.45.2।।शलभा इव सञ्छाद्य मेदिनीं सम्प्रतस्थिरे।
45_2.translation: Having understood Sugriva's strict orders, the forces of monkeys started moving. They spread like locusts all over the earth.
45_2.word_by_word: हरिपुङ्गवाः best of monkeys, भर्तुः king's, तत् that, उग्रशासनम् strict order, विज्ञाय having understood, मेदिनीम् the whole earth, शलभा इव like locusts, सञ्छाद्य covered, सम्प्रतस्थिरे started moving.

45_3.translation: Rama accompanied by Lakshmana stayed back at Prasravana mountain looking forward for the expiry of the month fixed for the monkeys to trace Sita's whereabouts.
45_3.word_by_word: रामः Rama, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, यः such, सीताधिगमे sin tracing the whereabouts of Sita, कृतः was fixed, तं मासम् that month, प्रतीक्षमाणः waiting, तस्मिन् प्रस्रवणे on that Prasravana mountain, न्यवसत् stayed.

45_4.shloka: उत्तरां तु दिशं रम्यां गिरिराजसमावृताम्।।4.45.4।।प्रतस्थे सहसा वीरो हरिश्शतवलिस्तदा।
45_4.translation: Then the monkey warrior Satavali departed for the north, surrounded by kings of mountains.
45_4.word_by_word: तदा then, शतवालिः Satavali, वीरः warrior, हरिः monkey, गिरिराजसमावृताम् surrounded by kings of mountains, रम्याम् lovely, उत्तरां दिशम् northern direction, सहसा at once, प्रतस्थे started their journey.

45_5.shloka: पूर्वां दिशं प्रतिययौ विनतो हरियूथपः।।4.45.5।।ताराङ्गदादिसहितः प्लवङ्गो  मारुतात्मजः।अगत्याचरितामाशां दक्षिणां हरियूथपः।।4.45.6।।
45_5.translation: Vinata, leader of the monkeys, set out for the eastern direction.The troop leader,  son of the Windgod along with Angada and Tara left for the south inhabited by Agastya.
45_5.word_by_word: हरियूथपः leader of monkeys, विनतः Vinata, पूर्वां दिशं प्रति towards the east, ययौ started, हरियूथपः leader of the monkeys, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, प्लवगः monkey, ताराङ्गदादिसहितः along with Tara and Angada, अगस्त्याचरिताम् inhabited by Agastya, दक्षिणाम् आशाम् to the southern quarter.

45_6.shloka: पश्चिमां तु भृशं घोरां सुषेणः प्लवगेश्वरः।प्रतस्थे हरिशार्दूलो दिशं वरुणपालिताम्।।4.45.7।।
45_6.translation: 'The chieftain Sushena, tiger among the monkeys, started quickly for the fearsome western direction ruled by Varuna.
45_6.word_by_word: प्लवगेश्वरः chieftain of monkeys, हरिशार्दूलः tiger among monkeys, सुषेणः Sushena, वरुणपालिताम् ruled by Varuna, दिशम् side, भृशम् quickly, घोराम् fearsome, पश्चिमां दिशम्  western side, प्रतस्थे started.

45_7.shloka: ततस्सर्वा दिशो राजा चोदयित्वा यथातथम्।कपिसेनापतीन्मुख्यान्मुमोद सुखितस्सुखम्।।4.45.8।।
45_7.translation: Sugriva, chief of the army of monkeys, having sent the leaders to all quarters felt relieved and rejoiced.
45_7.word_by_word: ततः then, मुख्यान् of chieftans, राजा king, कपिसेनापतीन् chief of the army of monkeys, यथातथम् properly, सर्वाःदिशः all quarters, चोदयित्वा having sent, सुखितः  relieved, सुखम् मुमोद rejoiced.

45_8.shloka: एवं सम्बोधितास्सर्वे राज्ञा वानरयूथपाः।स्वां स्वां दिशमभिप्रत्त्य त्वरिता सम्प्रतस्थिरे।।4.45.9।।
45_8.translation: Addressed thus  by the king, all the monkeys departed quickly from there for their respective directions with all enthusiasm.
45_8.word_by_word: राज्ञा by the king, एवम् in that way, सम्बोधिताः having been addressed, सर्वे all, वानरयूथपाः leaders of the monkeys, स्वां स्वाम् in their respective, दिशम् direction, अभिप्रेत्य bound, त्वरिताः quickly, सम्प्रतस्थिरे departed from there.

45_9.shloka: नदन्तश्चोन्नदन्तश्च गर्जन्तश्च प्लवङ्गमाः।क्ष्वेलन्तो धावमानाश्च विनदन्तो महाबलाः।।4.45.10।।
45_9.translation: The powerful monkeys went gallopping and chattering, leaping and screaming.
45_9.word_by_word: महाबलाः mighty, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, नदन्तः making noise, उन्नदन्तश्च loudly, गर्जन्तश्चchattering, क्ष्वेलन्तः leaping, विनदन्तः screaming, धावमानाश्च gallopping.

45_10.shloka: एवं सम्बोदितास्सर्वे राज्ञा वानरयूथपाः।आनयिष्यामहे सीतां हनिष्यामश्च रावणम्।।4.45.11।।
45_10.translation: Thus addressed by the king, the leaders of the monkeys shouted, 'We will kill Ravana and get back Sita'.
45_10.word_by_word: राज्ञा by the king, एवम् in that way, सम्बोदिता:having addressed, सर्वे all, वानरयूथपाः the leaders of monkeys, सीताम् Sita, आनयिष्यामहे we will get, रावणम् Ravana, हनिष्यामश्च we will kill.

45_11.shloka: अहमेको हनिष्यामि रावणं प्राप्तमाहवे।ततश्चोन्मथ्य सहसा हरिष्ये जनकात्मजाम्।।4.45.12।।
45_11.translation: 'I shall kill Ravana singlehanded in war and quickly get back Janaka's daughter churning (the enemy army).' (said one)
45_11.word_by_word: अहम् I am, एकः alone, आहवे in a war, प्राप्तम् faced, रावणम् Ravana, हनिष्यामि I will kill, ततश्च there after, उन्मथ्य after churning, सहसा at once, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, आहरिष्ये I will get.

45_12.shloka: वेपमानां श्रमेणाद्य भवद्भिः स्थीयतामिति।एक एवाहरिष्यामि पातालादपि जानकीम्।।4.45.13।।
45_12.translation: 'I will alone restore Sita, exhausted and trembling (in fear), even from the nether world.Wait here' (said another leader).
45_12.word_by_word: श्रमेण with exhaustion, वेपमानाम् trembling, जानकीम् Sita, पातालादपि even from the nether most world, एक एव I alone, आहरिष्यामि I will get, अद्य now, भवद्भिः you, स्थीयताम् wait, इति thus.

45_13.shloka: वधिष्याम्यहं वृक्षान् दारयिष्याम्यहं गिरीन्।धरणीं दारयिष्यामि क्षोभयिष्यामि सागरान्।।4.45.14।।
45_13.translation: 'I will smash trees, shatter mountains, cleave the earth and churn up the seas'. (said a another).
45_13.word_by_word: अहम् I, वृक्षान् trees, वधिष्यामि will smash, गिरीन् mountains, दारयिष्यामि I will cleave, धरणीम् earth, दारयिष्यामि break open, सागरान् seas, क्षोभयिष्यामि I will churn.

45_14.shloka: अहं योजनसङ्ख्यायाः प्लविता नात्र संशयः।शतं योजनसङ्ख्यायाश्शतं समधिकं ह्यहम्।।4.45.15।।
45_14.translation: 'I can doubtless cross a distance of a hundred yojanas' said one. Another said,' I can leap a hundred yojanas more'.
45_14.word_by_word: अहम् I, योजनसङ्ख्यायाः शतम् cross a hundred yojanas, प्लविता leap, अहम् I, शतयोजनसङ्ख्यायाः cross a distance of hundred yojanas, समधिकम् more, अत्र here, संशयः doubt, न no.

45_15.shloka: भूतले सागरे वाऽपि शैलेषु च वनेषु च।पातालस्यापि वा मध्ये न ममाच्छिद्यते गतिः।।4.45.16।।
45_15.translation: 'I can go unobstruted on the earth, or even in the sea, on the mountains, in the forests or even to the centre of the underworld'. (said another)
45_15.word_by_word: भूतले on the earth, सागरे वाऽपि or even in the sea, शैलेषु च and in mountains also, वनेषु च  in forest also, पातालस्य of the underworld, मध्येवापि in the midst also, मम my, गतिः movement, न आच्छिद्यते is not obstructed.

45_16.shloka: इत्येकैकं तदा तत्र वानरा बलदर्पिताः।ऊचुश्च वचनं तत्र हरिराजस्य सन्निधौ।।4.45.17।।
45_16.translation: The monkeys uttered such words in the presence of their king, being proud of their prowess.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfifth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
45_16.word_by_word: तदा then, बलदर्पिताः proud of prowess, वानराः monkeys, तत्र his, तस्य their, हरिराजस्य of the king of monkeys', सन्निधौ in the presence of, एकैकः each one of them, इति thus, वचनम् words, ऊचुः spoke.

46_1.shloka: [Sugriva narrates the fight between Dundubhi and Vali and explains how he has come to acquire knowledge of geogrphy of all quarters]गतेषु वानरेन्द्रेषु रामस्सुग्रीवमब्रवीत्।कथं भवान्विजानीते सर्वं वै मण्डलं भुवः।।4.46.1।।
46_1.translation: When the chieftains of the monkeys left, Rama enquired Sugriva, how he had come to know  the regions of the entire earth (which is a mandala. a circular form).
46_1.word_by_word: वानरेन्द्रेषु when the monkey chieftains, गतेषु had gone, रामः Rama, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, अब्रवीत् said, भवान् you, भुवः of the earth, सर्वम् entire, मण्डलम् region, कथम् how, विजानीते do you know

46_2.shloka: सुग्रीवस्तु ततो राममुवाच प्रणतात्मवान्।श्रूयतां सर्वमाख्यास्ये विस्तरेण नरर्षभ।।4.46.2।।
46_2.translation: Then offering reverential salutation to Rama, Sugriva said, 'I shall narrate in detail. Listen, O bull among men
46_2.word_by_word: ततः then, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रणतात्मवान् offered reverential salutation, रामम् to Rama, उवाच spoke, सर्वम् all, विस्तरेण in detail, आख्यास्ये narrate, नरर्षभ O Rama, श्रूयताम् listen.

46_3.shloka: यदा तु दुन्दुभिं नाम दानवं महिषाकृतिम्।परिकालयते वाली मलयं प्रति पर्वतम्।।4.46.3।।तदा विवेश महिषो मलयस्य गुहां प्रति।विवेश वाली तत्रापि मलयं तज्जिघांसया।।4.46.4।।
46_3.translation: Vali chased the demon Dundubhi in buffalo form into a cave of mount Malaya in order to kill him.
46_3.word_by_word: वाली Vali, महिषाकृतिम् in buffalo form, दुन्दुभिं नाम named Dundubhi, दानवम् demon, यदा when, मलयं पर्वतं प्रति till the mount Malaya, प्रतिकालयते wished to kill him, तदा then, महिषः buffalo, मलयस्य Malaya's, गुहां प्रति towards the cave, विवेश entered, वाली Vali, तज्जिघांसया with the intention of killing him, तत्रापि into that, मलयम् Malaya, विवेश entered.

46_4.shloka: ततोऽहं तत्र निक्षिप्तो गुहाद्वारि विनीतवत्।न च निष्क्रामते वाली तदा संवत्सरे गते4.46.5।।
46_4.translation: 'Then I waited at the entrance of the cave with due loyalty. A year passed. Yet Vali did not return.
46_4.word_by_word: ततः then, विनीतवत् with due loyalty, अहम् I, तत्र there, गुहाद्वारि निक्षिप्तः I was made to wait at the entrance of the cave, तदा then, संवत्सरे when a year, गते passed, वाली Vali, न निष्क्रामते not returned.

46_5.shloka: ततः क्षतजवेगेन आपुपूरे तदा बिलम्।तदहं विस्मितो दृष्ट्वा भ्रातृशोकविषार्दितः।।4.46.6।।
46_5.translation: 'There seeing the cave overflowing with the gushing blood, I was bewildered, thinking that my brother might have been killed. I suffered intense agony.
46_5.word_by_word: ततः then, बिलम् cave, क्षतजवेगेन with the speed of the gushing blood, आपुपूरे filled with, तदा then, अहम् I, तत् that, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, विस्मितः bewildered, भ्रातुः brother, शोकविषार्दितः suffered intense agony.

46_6.shloka: अथाऽहं कृतबुद्धिस्तु सुव्यक्तं निहतो गुरुः।शिला पर्वतसङ्काशा बिलद्वारि मया कृता।।4.46.7।।अशक्नुव न्निष्क्रमितुं महिषो विनशेदिति।
46_6.translation: 'Thereafter, convinced that my brother was killed, I placed a mountainsize rock at the entrance of the cave so that Dundubhi will be destroyed, unable to come out of the cave.
46_6.word_by_word: अथ then, गुरुः brother Vali, सुव्यक्तम् it is evident, निहतः killed, अहम् I, कृतबुद्धिः I thought, महिषः buffalo, निष्क्रमितुम् to return, अशक्नुवन् being unable, विनशेदिति should be destroyed, मया by myself, पर्वतसङ्काशा of the mountain size, शिला rock, बिलद्वारि at the entrance of, कृता placed.

46_7.shloka: ततोऽहमागां किष्किन्धां निराशस्तस्य जीविते।।4.46.8।।राज्यं च सुमहत्प्राप्य तारया रुमया सह।मित्रैश्च सहितस्तत्र वसामि विगतज्वरः।।4.46.9।।
46_7.translation: 'I lost hope of his life and came back to Kishkinda. Having got the kingdom, and also Ruma and Tara, I was anointed king and ruled it fearlessly with all friends.
46_7.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, तस्य his, जीविते about his life, निराशः lost hope, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkinda, आगाम् I came, सुमहत्  great, राज्यं च kingdom also, रुमया सह with Ruma, तार या with Tara, प्राप्य having got, तत्र there, मित्रैः with friends, सहितः accompanied, विगतज्वरः fearlessly, वसामि I lived.

46_8.shloka: आजगाम ततो वाली हत्वा तं दानवर्षभम्।ततोऽहमददां राज्यं गौरवाद्भययन्त्रितः।।4.46.10।।
46_8.word_by_word: ततः then, दानवर्षभम् bull among monsters वाली Vali, तम् him, हत्वा after killing, आजगाम he came, ततः then, अहम् I, भययन्त्रितः constrained with fear, गौरवात् with respect, राज्यम् kingdom, अददाम् returned.

46_9.shloka: स मां जिघांसुर्दुष्टात्मा वाली प्रव्यथितेन्द्रियः।परिकालयते क्रोधाद्धावन्तं सचिवैस्सह।।4.46.11।।
46_9.translation: 'The evilminded Vali, having lost his selfcontrol, ran after me in anger, to kill me and my ministers. I kept running.
46_9.word_by_word: दुष्टात्मा evilminded, सः वाली that Vali, प्रव्यथितेन्द्रियः having lost control over his senses, सचिवैस्सह along with ministers, धावन्तम् while I was running, माम् me, जिघांसुः to kill, क्रोधात् enraged, परिकालयते ran after me.

46_10.shloka: ततोऽहं वालिना तेन साऽनुबद्धः प्रधावितः।नदीश्च विविधाः पश्यन्वनानि नगराणि च।।4.46.12।।
46_10.word_by_word: ततः then, तेन by him, वालिना by Vali, अनुबद्धः chased, सः अहम् that I was, विविधाः many, नदीः rivers, वनानि forests, नगराणि च towns, पश्यन् while seeing, प्रधावितः I ran.

46_11.shloka: आदर्शतलसङ्काशा ततो वै पृथिवी मया।अलातचक्रप्रतिमा दृष्टा गोष्पदवत्तदा।।4.46.13।।
46_11.word_by_word: ततः then, मया by me, पृथिवी the earth, आदर्शतलसङ्काशा like the surface of a mirror, अलातचक्रप्रतिमा  like a circling of fireband, दृष्टा seen, गोष्पदवत् as though it is of the size of cow's hoof, तदा then.

46_12.shloka: पूर्वां दिशं ततो गत्वा पश्यामि विविधान् द्रुमान्।पर्वतन्श्च नदी  रम्यास्सरांसि विविधानि च।।4.46.14।।
46_12.translation: 'Then I ran in the eastern direction and saw many trees, lakes, rivers and beautiful mountains.
46_12.word_by_word: ततः then, पूर्वां दिशम् eastern quarter, गत्वा after going, विविधान् several, द्रुमान् trees, नदीन् rivers, रम्यान् delighting, पर्वतान् mountains, विविधानि many, सरांसि च lakes also, पश्यामि see (saw).

46_13.shloka: उदयं तत्र पश्यामि पर्वतं धातुमण्डितम्।क्षीरोदं सागरं चैव नित्यमप्सरसालयम्।।4.46.15।।
46_13.translation: 'There I saw, filled with minerals the mountain behind which the Sun rises and the milky ocean frequented by the apsaras.
46_13.word_by_word: तत्र there, धातुमण्डितम् embellished with minerals, उदयं पर्वतम् mountain behind which the Sun rises, नित्यम् always, अप्सरसालयम् frequented by apsaras, क्षीरोदं सागरं चैव the milky ocean also, पश्यामि see (saw).

46_14.shloka: परिकालयमानस्तु वालिनाऽभिद्रुत स्तदा।पुनरावृत्य सहसा प्रस्थितोऽहं तदा विभो।।4.46.16।।
46_14.translation: 'O king chased thus by Vali, I ran and turned back and ran againfast.
46_14.word_by_word: विभो O king, वालिना by Vali, परिकालयमानः chased away, अहम् I, तदा then, अभिद्रुतः I ran, तदा then, पुनः again, आवृत्य I turned back, सहसा at once, प्रस्थितः I left.

46_15.shloka: पुनरावर्तमानस्तु वालिनाऽभिद्रुतोद्रुतम्।दिशस्तस्यास्ततो भूयः प्रस्थितो दक्षिणां दिशम्।विन्ध्यपादपसङ्कीर्णां चन्दनद्रुमशोभिताम्।।4.46.17।।
46_15.translation: 'Then chased by Vali, I changed my present direction from the east towards the southern quarter where Vindhya mountain stood with its, beautiful sandal trees.
46_15.word_by_word: पुनः again, आवर्तमानः changing, वलिना by Vali, द्रुतम् fast, अभिद्रुतः chased, ततः then, तस्याः that, दिशः direction, भूयः turned, विन्ध्यपादपसङ्कीर्णाम् filled with the mountains of Vindhya and trees, चन्दनद्रुमशोभिताम् filled with beautiful sandal trees, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern quarter, प्रस्थितः ran.

46_16.shloka: द्रुमशैलांस्ततः पश्यन्भूयो दक्षिणतोऽपराम्।पश्चिमां च दिशं प्राप्ता वालिना समभिद्रुतः।।4.46.18।।
46_16.translation: 'I was looking at the trees and mountains in the southern direction, I reached the western quarter pursued by Vali.
46_16.word_by_word: द्रुमशैलां trees and mountains, दक्षिणतः from the southern quarter, अपराम् another, पश्यन् while seeing, भूयः again, वालिना by Vali, समभिद्रुतः chased, पश्चिमां दिशम् western quarter, प्राप्ताः I reached.

46_17.shloka: सम्पश्यन्विविधान्देशानस्तं च गिरिसत्तमम्।प्राप्य चास्तं गिरिश्रेष्ठमुत्तरां सम्प्रधावितः।।4.46.19।।
46_17.translation: 'Looking at the places around, I reached the best of mountains where the Sun sets (I found Vali still chasing me) and ran towards the north.
46_17.word_by_word: विविधान् many, देशान् places, गिरिसत्तमम् best of mountains, अस्तं च where the Sun sets, पश्यन् while I was seeing, गिरिश्रेष्ठम् foremost of mountains, अस्तम् where the Sun sets, प्राप्य having  reached, उत्तराम्  northern, सम्प्रधावितः ran.

46_18.shloka: हिमवन्तं च मेरुं च समुद्रं च तथोत्तरम्।यदा न विन्दं शरणं वालिना समभिद्रुतः।।4.46.20।।तदा मां बुद्धिसम्पन्नो हनूमान्वाक्यमब्रवीत्।
46_18.translation: 'I saw Himavan and mount Meru on the north and the northern sea. Still pursued by Vali, I could not know where to go when wise Hanuman spoke to me these words:
46_18.word_by_word: हिमवन्तं च Himavanta also, मेरुं च Meru also, तथा so also, उत्तरं समुद्रं च even the northern sea, वालिना by Vali, समभिद्रुतः chased, यदा when, शरणम् protection, न विन्दम् I did not get, तदा then, बुद्धिसम्पन्नः wise, हनूमान् Hanuman, माम् to me, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत्  spoke.

46_19.shloka: इदानीं मे स्मृतं राजन्यथा वाली हरीश्वरः।।4.46.21।।मतङ्गेन तदा शप्तो ह्यस्मिन्नाश्रममण्डले।प्रविशेद्यदि वै वाली मूर्धाऽस्य शतधा भवेत्।।4.46.22।।तत्र वासस्सुखोऽस्माकं निरुद्विग्नो भविष्यति।
46_19.translation: 'I remembed Matanga's curse to Vali, king of monkeys. Vali would not enter the site of Matanga's hermitage as his head would break into a hundred pieces if he did'. Therefore  we thought it would be safe for us to reside in that place.
46_19.word_by_word: राजन् O king, हरीश्वरः king of monkeys, वाली Vali, तदा then, मतङ्गेन by Mathanga, यथा as, शप्तः cursed, मे to me, इदानीम् now, स्मृतम् I remembered, वाली Vali, अस्मिन् in this, आश्रममण्डले hermitage site, प्रविशेद्यदि if he enters, अस्य his, मूर्धा head, शतधा hundred pieces, भवेत् will become, तत्र there, अस्माकम् to us, वासः residence, सुखः happy, निरुद्विग्नः peaceful, भविष्यति will be.

46_20.shloka: ततः पर्वतमासाद्य ऋष्यमूकं नृपात्मज।।4.46.23।।न विवेश तदा वाली मतङ्गस्य भयात्तदा।
46_20.translation: 'O prince Rama then I reached mount Rishyamuka which Vali did not enter out of fearof the curse of Matanga.
46_20.word_by_word: नृपात्मज  O prince Rama, ततः from that place, ऋष्यमूकं पर्वतम् mountain Rishyamuka, तदा then, आसाद्य having reached, वाली Vali, मतङ्गस्य Matanga's, भयात् out of fear of, तदा then, न विवेश did not enter.

46_21.translation: 'O king that way I surveyed the entire earth directly and returned to this cave and lived here.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षटचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysixth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
46_21.word_by_word: राजन् king, एवम् in that manner, तदा then, कत्स्नम् पृथिवीमण्डलम् entire earth, प्रत्यक्षम् saw directly, मया by me, उपलक्षितम् is surveyed, गुहाम् this cave, ततः thereafter, आगतः reached, अस्मि I am.

47_1.shloka: [Return of Satavali, Vinata and Sushena with no news of Sita.]दर्शनार्थं तु वैदेह्यास्सर्वतः कपियूधपाः।व्यादिष्टाः कपिराजेन यथोक्तं जग्मुरञ्जसा।।4.47.1।।
47_1.translation: The leaders of vanara troops went fast in all directions to look for Vaidehi following the instructions of  the king of vanaras.
47_1.word_by_word: कपिराजेन by the king of monkeys, व्यादिष्टाः commanded, कपियूधपाः leaders of vanara troops, यथोक्तम् as instructed, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, दर्शनार्थम् to look for, अञ्जसा swiftly, सर्वतः all directions, जग्मुः went.

47_2.shloka: सरांसि सरित काक्षानाकाशं नगराणि च।नदीदुर्गांस्तथा शैलान्विचिन्वन्ति समन्ततः।।4.47.2।।
47_2.translation: They went looking everywhere in the tanks, in the bottom of rivers, in towns, in the sky and similarly in inaccessible rivers, mountains, and forts surrounded by rivers.
47_2.word_by_word: ते they, सरांसि tanks, सरित: कक्षान् bottom of rivers, आकाशम् sky, नगराणि च and towns, तथा similarly, नदीदुर्गान् forts surrounded by rivers, शैलान् mountains, समन्ततः every where, विचिन्वन्ति looking for.

47_3.translation: The troop leaders of the monkeys instructed by Sugriva searched in all placesincluding mountains and forests.
47_3.word_by_word: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, समाख्याताः instructed, सर्वे all, वानरयूथपाः vanara troop leaders, सशैलवनकाननान् including forests and mountains, प्रदेशान्  places, विचिन्वन्ति searched.

47_4.shloka: विचित्य दिवसं सर्वे सीताधिगमने धृताः।समायान्ति स्म मेदिन्यां निशाकालेषु वानराः।।4.47.4।।
47_4.translation: The monkeys used to search for Sita all day determinedly and at night assemble at one place.
47_4.word_by_word: सर्वे all, वानराः monkeys, सीताधिगमने in search of Sita, धृताः determined, दिवसम् all day, विचित्य after searching, निशाकालेषु during nights also, मेदिन्याम् on the ground, समायान्ति स्म used to meet one another.

47_5.shloka: सर्वर्तुकमान् देशेषु वानारास्सफलद्रुमान्।आसाद्य रजनीं शय्यां चक्रुस्सर्वेष्वहस्सु ते।।4.47.5।।
47_5.translation: The monkeys would search all day and by night reach for rest the branches of the trees that bear fruits in all seasons.
47_5.word_by_word: ते वानराः those monkeys, सर्वेषु अहस्सु all day, सर्वर्तुकामान् in all seasons, सफलद्रुमान् fruitbearing trees, देशेषु in countries, आसाद्य having reached, रजनीम् in the night, शय्याम् resting place, चक्रुः they made.

47_6.shloka: तदहः प्रथमं कृत्वा मासे प्रश्रवणं गताः।कपिराजेन सङ्गम्य निराशाः कपियूधपाः।।4.47.6।।
47_6.translation: The monkey leaders thus spent a month doing what they did daily and returning disappointed, met the monkey king on mount Prasravana.
47_6.word_by_word: तत् अहः that day, प्रथमम् first, कृत्वा having passed off, मासे in the month, कपियूधपाः monkey leaders, निराशाः disappointed, प्रस्रवणम् mountain Prasravana, गताः gone, कपिराजेन by the king of vanaras, सङ्गम्य after meeting.

47_7.shloka: विचित्य तु दिशं पूर्वां यथोक्तां सचिवैस्सह।अदृष्ट्वा विनतस्सीतामाजगाम महाबलः।।4.47.7।।
47_7.translation: Having searched for Sita as instructed by  Sugriva, powerful Vinita returned along with the ministers unable to find Sita.
47_7.word_by_word: महाबलः powerful, विनतः Vinata, सचिवैः सह along with the ministers, यथोक्ताम् as instructed, पूर्वां दिशम् eastern side, विचित्य having searched, सीताम् Sita, अदृष्ट्वा not able to see, आजगाम returned.

47_8.shloka: उत्तरां च दिशं सर्वां विचित्य स महाकपिः।आगतस्सह सैन्येन वीरश्शतवलिस्तदा।।4.47.8।।
47_8.translation: Then the great monkey hero Satabali came back from the northern direction along with the army after searching in vain for Sita.
47_8.word_by_word: तदा then, वीरः hero, महाकपिः great monkey, शतबलः Satabala, सैन्येन सह with the army, सर्वाम् all, उत्तरां दिशम् northern direction, विचित्य after searching, आगतः came back.

47_9.shloka: सुषेणः पश्चिमा माशां विचित्य सह वानरैः।समेत्य मासे सम्पूर्णे सुग्रीवमुपचक्रमे।।4.47.9।।
47_9.translation: Sushena searched for a full month in the western quarter along with the monkeys and returned to report to Sugriva.
47_9.word_by_word: सुषेणः Sushena, वानरैस्सह along with the monkeys, पश्चिमाम् आशाम् western side, विचित्य having searched, मासे in a month, सम्पूर्णे when completed, समेत्य after coming back, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, उपचक्रमे reported.

47_10.shloka: तं प्रस्रवणपृष्ठस्थं समासाद्याभिवाद्य च।आसीनं सह रामेण सुग्रीवमिदमब्रवीत्।।4.47.10।।
47_10.translation: Sushena came to Sugriva, seated with Rama at Prasravana mountain, offered salutations and spoke:
47_10.word_by_word: रामेण सह along with Rama, आसीनम् seated, प्रस्रवणपृष्ठस्थम् on the Prasravana mountain, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, आसाद्य came near, अभिवाद्य च and offered salutations, इदम् thus, अब्रवीत् spoke.

47_11.shloka: विचिताः पर्वतास्सर्वे वनानि गहनानि च।निम्नगास्सागरान्ताश्च सर्वे जनपदाश्च ये।।4.47.11।।
47_11.translation: 'We searched for her in the mountains, in inaccessible forests, in rivers and seas and also the countryside.
47_11.word_by_word: सर्वे all, पर्वताः mountains, विचिताः are searched, गहनानि inacccessible, वनानि च forests also, निम्नगाः rivers, सागरान्ताश्च in the seas, ये those, जनपदाश्च country side, सर्वे every where.

47_12.shloka: गुहाश्च विचितास्सर्वास्त्वया याः परिकीर्तिताः।विचिताश्च महागुल्मा लताविततसन्तताः।।4.47.12।।
47_12.translation: 'We searched for her in the caves, in places filled with extensive vines and huge bushes and in all places mentioned by you.
47_12.word_by_word: सर्वाः all, त्वया by your, परिकीर्तिताः mentioned, याः those, गुहाः caves, विचिताः searched, लताविततसन्तताः filled with extensive vines, महागुल्माः and huge bushes, विचिताः are searched.

47_13.shloka: गहनेषु च देशेषु दुर्गेषु विषमेषु च।सत्त्वान्यतिप्रमाणानि विचितानि हतानि च।।4.47.13।।ये चैव गहना देशा विचितास्ते पुनः पुनः।
47_13.translation: 'We searched again and again the interior, inaccessible and uneven locations,and killed huge animals. We searched in regions difficult to penetrate.
47_13.word_by_word: गहनेषु in the interiors, दुर्गेषु inaccessible, विषमेषु च and unevenplaces, देशेषु locations, अतिप्रमाणानि very huge, सत्त्वानि beings, विचितानि searched, हतानि च killed, गहनाः difficult interiors, ये those, देशाः places, ते those, पुनः पुनः again and again, विचिताः searched.

47_14.shloka: उदारसत्त्वाभिजनो महात्मास मैथिलीं द्रक्ष्यति वानरेन्द्रः।दिशं तु यामेव गता तु सीतातामास्थितोवायुसुतो हनूमान्।।4.47.14।।
47_14.translation: 'O king of monkeys we hope, his exhalted highness, the mighty vanara, son of the Windgod, Hanuman has gone in the direction in which Maithili has been carried off. He alone will find Sita and come back.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
47_14.word_by_word: वानरेन्द्र O king of monkeys, उदारसत्त्वाभिजनः exhalted by strength and birth, सः that, महात्मा  great person, मैथिलीम् Maithili, द्रक्ष्यति will see, सीता sita, याम् एव whichever, दिशम्  direction, गता is taken, ताम् that, वायुसुतः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, आस्थितः he has set out.

48_1.shloka: [Search in Vindhya -- disappointed -- troops sit in despair]सह ताराङ्गदाभ्यां तु गत्वा स हनुमान्कपिः।सुग्रीवेण यथोद्दिष्टं तं देशमुपचक्रमे।।4.48.1।।
48_1.translation: Hanuman, the monkey accompanied by Tara and Angada proceeded as instructed by Sugriva in the (South) direction.
48_1.word_by_word: कपिः monkey, हनुमान् Hanuman, ताराङ्गदाभ्यां सह along with Tara and Angada, गत्वा सा  going, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, यथोद्दिष्टम् as instructed, तम् them, देशम् place, उपप्रचक्रमे started.

48_2.shloka: स तु दूरमुपागम्य सर्वैस्तै: कपिसत्तमैः।विचिनोति स्म विन्ध्यस्य गुहाश्च गहनानि च।।4.48.2।।पर्वताग्रान्नदीदुर्गान्सरांसि विपुलान्द्रुमान्।वृक्षषण्डांश्च विविधान्पर्वतान्घनपादपान्।।4.48.3।।
48_2.translation: He went a long distance with other heroic monkeys, searching in the impenetrable caves of Vindhya mountain. They combed interior places, mountain peaks, fortresses surrounded by rivers, lakes, extensive groves of trees, bushes and thickets.
48_2.word_by_word: सः that, सर्वैः तैः they all, कपिसत्तमैः with heroic monkeys, दूरम् a distant place, उपागम्य having gone, ततः then, विन्ध्यस्य Vindhya's, गुहाश्च caves, गहनानि च impenetrable, विचिनोति searched, पर्वताग्रान् on the peaks of mountains, नदीदुर्गान् inaccessible fortress surrounded by rivers, सरांसि tanks, विपुलान्द्रुमान् huge trees, वृक्षषण्डांश्च collection of trees, विविधान् many, पर्वतान् mountains, घनपादपान् dense trees.

48_3.shloka: अन्वेषमाणास्ते सर्वे वानरास्सर्वतो दिशम्।न सीतां ददृशुर्वीरा मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम्।।4.48.4।।
48_3.translation: The heroic monkeys went searching all over the direction for the daughter of Janaka, but in vain.
48_3.word_by_word: वीराः heroes, ते वानराः the vanaras, सर्वे all, सर्वतो दिशम् all over in that direction, अन्वेषमाणाः  went searching, मैथिलीम् for Maithili, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, सीताम् Sita, न ददृशुः they did not see.

48_4.shloka: ते भक्षयन्तो मूलानि फलानि विविधानि च।अन्वेषमाणा दुर्धर्षान्यवसं स्तत्र तत्र ह।।4.48.5।।
48_4.translation: The unassailable monkeys ate roots and fruits and halted here and there at different places searching for Sita.
48_4.word_by_word: दुर्धर्षाः unassailable, ते those, विविधानि many, मूलानि roots, फलान्यपि and also fruits, भक्षयन्तः  eating, अन्वेषमाणाः searching, तत्र तत्र here and there, न्यवसन् dwelt.

48_5.shloka: स तु देशो दुरन्वेषो गुहागहनवान्महान्।निर्जलं निर्जनं शून्यं गहनं रोमहर्षणम्।।4.48.6।।
48_5.translation: They searched in dense forests, interior locations impassable, desolate and terrific, without water, and people.
48_5.word_by_word: गुहागहनवान् a location with impenetrable caves, महान् great, सः देशः that place, दुरन्वेषः is difficult to search, निर्जलम्  with no water, निर्जनम् no people, शून्यम् desolate, गहनम्  impassable, रोमहर्षणम् terrific.

48_6.shloka: त्यक्त्वा तु तं तदा देशं सर्वे वै हरियूथपाः।तादृशान्यप्यरण्यानि विचित्य भृशपीडिताः।।4.48.7।।देशमन्यं दुराधर्षं विविशु श्चाकुतो भयाः।
48_6.translation: Having searched all over in the forests and very difficult areas, the fearless, invincible vanaras moved forward, leaving that place and entered another areasearching.
48_6.word_by_word: तादृशानि such of those, अरण्यान्यपि even in the forests, विचित्य having searched, भृशपीडिताः very difficult, सर्वे all, हरियूथपाः vanara leaders, ततः then, तं देशम् that place, त्यक्त्वा after leaving, अकुतोभयाः fearless warriors, दुराधर्षम् unassailable, अन्यं देशम् other places, विविशुः entered.

48_7.shloka: यत्र वन्ध्यफला वृक्षा विपुष्पाः पर्णवर्जिताः।।4.48.8।।निस्तोयास्सरितो यत्र मूलं यत्र सुदुर्लभम्।
48_7.translation: As they marched forward, they entered a location where there were trees devoid of leaves, flowers and fruits and rivers without water and a place where it was difficult to get roots (for food).
48_7.word_by_word: यत्र where, वृक्षाः trees, वन्ध्यफलाः without fruits, विपुष्पाः without flowers, पर्णवर्जिताः without leaves, यत्र where, सरितः rivers, निस्तोयाः without water, यत्र there, मूलम् root, सुदुर्लभम् very difficult to get.

48_8.shloka: न सन्ति महिषा यत्र न मृगा न च हस्तिनः।।4.48.9।।शार्दूलाः पक्षिणो वापि ये चान्ये वनगोचराः।
48_8.translation: There were no buffaloes, no deer, no elephants, tigers or even  birds and  other wild animals.
48_8.word_by_word: यत्र where, महिषाः buffaloes, न सन्ति not found, मृगाः deer, न not, हस्तिनः elephants, शार्दूलाः tigers, पक्षिणो वापि  and even birds, वनगोचराः forest beasts, ये those, अन्ये च and other, न not,

48_9.shloka: न यत्रवृक्षा नौषध्यो न वल्ल्यो नापि वीरुधः।।4.48.10।।स्निग्धपत्रास्स्थले यत्र पद्मिन्यः फुल्लपङ्कजाः।प्रेक्षणीयास्सुगन्धाश्च भ्रमरैश्चापिवर्जिताः।।4.48.11।।
48_9.translation: There were no medicinal plants, no vines or creepers spreading on the ground.The lotus creepers on the dry ground had shining leaves,beautiful and fragrant blooms devoid of bees.
48_9.word_by_word: यत्र where, वृक्षाः trees, न not, ओषध्यः medicinal plants, न not, वल्ल्यः vines, न not, वीरुधः creepers spreading on ground, न not, यत्र where, स्निग्धपत्राः shining leaves, स्थले on the dry ground, पद्मिन्यः lotus creepers, फुल्लपङ्कजाः in full bloom, प्रेक्षणीयाः beautiful to look, सुगन्धाश्च fragrant ones, भ्रमरैश्चापिवर्जिताः devoid of bees.

48_10.translation: There was a sage called Kandu who was truthful, outrageous and shorttempered. He observed strict austerities and was rich in penance.
48_10.word_by_word: सत्यवादी truthful, महाभागः an eminent acsetic, तपोधनः rich in penance, परमामर्षी choleric tempered, नियमैः strict follower of austerities, दुष्प्रधर्षणः outrageous, कण्डुर्नाम called Kandu, महर्षिः sage.

48_11.shloka: तस्य तस्मिन्वने पुत्रो बालष्षोडशवार्षिकः।प्रणष्टो जीवितान्ताय क्रुद्धस्तत्र महामुनिः।।4.48.13।।
48_11.translation: The great sage was enraged because he had lost his sixteenyearold son in the forest.
48_11.word_by_word: तस्मिन् वने in that forest, तस्य his, षोडशवार्षिकः sixteen years old, पुत्रः son, बाल: young boy, तत्र there, जीवितान्ताय  died, प्रणष्टः was lost, महामुनिः great sage, क्रुद्धः enraged.

48_12.shloka: तेन धर्मात्मना शप्तं कृत्स्नं तत्रमहद्वनम्।अशरण्यं दुराधर्षं मृगपक्षिविवर्जितम्।।4.48.14।।
48_12.translation: Cursed by the great righteous sage the entire forest turned barren, unfit to harbour  living beings and became devoid of even beasts and birds.
48_12.word_by_word: तत्र there, महत् great, कृत्स्नम् entire, वनम् forest, अशरण्यम् barren, दुराधर्षम् unfit to harbour, मृगपक्षिविवर्जितम् without beasts and birds, तेन by him, धर्मात्मना by the righteous sage, शप्तम् cursed.

48_13.shloka: तस्य ते काननान्ताश्च गिरीणां कन्दराणि च।प्रभवनि नदीनां च विचिन्वन्ति समाहिताः।।4.48.15।।
48_13.translation: The monkeys searched in the forest regions, in the mountains, rivers and sources of rivers with concentrated attention.
48_13.word_by_word: ते those, समाहिताः those with concentrated attention, तस्य his, काननान्ताश्च forest regions, गिरीणाम्  in the mountains, कन्दराणि च caves also, नदीनाम् प्रभवानि च sources of rivers also, विचिन्वन्ति searched.

48_14.shloka: तत्र चापि महात्मानो नापश्यञ्जनकात्मजाम्।हर्तारं रावणं वापि सुग्रीवप्रियकारिणः।।4.48.16।।
48_14.translation: Eager to please Sugriva, the great souls searched  in the forest region. Even there they   could not find Janaka's daughter and also Ravana who had abducted Sita.
48_14.word_by_word: महात्मानः great souls, सुग्रीवप्रियकारिणः eager to please Sugriva, तत्र चापि and there also, जनकात्मजाम् daughter of Janaka, हर्तारम् one who has abducted, रावणं वापि Ravana also, नापश्यन् could not see.

48_15.shloka: ते प्रविश्याऽशु तं भीमं लतागुल्मसमावृतम्।दद्दृशुः क्रूरकर्माणमसुरं सुरनिर्भयम्।।4.48.17।।
48_15.translation: (Then) they noticed a place covered with creepers and bushes. As soon as they entered the dreadful forest, they saw a demon of wicked deeds, unafraid even of gods.
48_15.word_by_word: ते they, लतागुल्मसमावृतम् covered with creepers and bushes, क्रूरम् dreadful, तम् that, प्रविश्य entering, आशु immediately, क्रूरकर्माणम् one of wicked deeds, सुरनिर्भयम् not even afraid of gods, असुरम् demon, दद्दृशुः they saw.

48_16.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा वानरा घोरं स्थितं शैलमिवापरम्।गाढं परिहितास्सर्वे दृष्ट्वा तान्पर्वतोपममान्।।4.48.18।।
48_16.translation: The monkeys beheld the dreadful demon standing firmly like a huge, incomparable mountain in front of them.
48_16.word_by_word: सर्वे all, वानराः monkeys, शैलम् इव like a mountain, स्थितम् stood, घोरम् dreadful, तम् they, अपरम् another, दृष्ट्वा saw, पर्वतोपमम् like a huge mountain, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा saw, गाढम् firmly, परिहिताः stood in attention.

48_17.shloka: सोऽपि तान्वानरान्सर्वान् नष्टा स्स्थेत्यब्रवीद्बली।अभ्यधावत सङ्कृद्धो मुष्टिमुद्यम्य संहितम्।।4.48.19।।
48_17.translation: Seeing the monkeys, the infuriated demon ran towards them, raising his fist firmly, saying, 'You are all as good as dead, now that I have caught you.'
48_17.word_by_word: सोऽपि he also, नष्टाः killed, स्थ you are, इति thus, तान् them, सर्वान् all, वानरान् monkeys, अब्रवीत् said, सङ्कृद्धः enraged, संहितम् held, मुष्टिम् the fist, उद्यम्य raising, अभ्यधावत ran towards them.

48_18.shloka: तमापतन्तं सहसा वालिपुत्रोऽङ्गदस्तदा।रावणोऽयमिति ज्ञात्वा तलेनाभिजघान ह।।4.48.20।।
48_18.translation: Mistaking him for Ravana, Angada, Vali's son at once pounced on him and slapped him with his palm.
48_18.word_by_word: तदा then, वालिपुत्रः Vali's son, अङ्गदः Angada, आपतन्तम् pouncing, तम् them, अयम् thisperson, रावणः is Ravana, इति thus, ज्ञात्वा on thinking, सहसा at once, तलेन  with his palm, अभिजघान ह slapped him.

48_19.shloka: स वालिपुत्राभिहतो वक्त्राच्छोणितमुद्वमन्।असुरोऽभ्यपतद्भूमौ पर्यस्त इव पर्वतः।।4.48.21।।
48_19.translation: Struck by Vali's son, the demon vomitting blood from the mouth, fell down on the ground like a mountain, uprooted.
48_19.word_by_word: वालिपुत्राभिहतः struck by the son of Vali, सः असुरः that demon, वक्त्रात् from the mouth, शोणितम् blood, उद्वमन्  vomitting, पर्यस्तः uprooted, पर्वतः इव like a mountain, भूमौ on the ground, अभ्यपतत् overturned.

48_20.shloka: तेऽपि तस्मिन्निरुच्छवासे वानरा जितकाशिनः।व्यचिन्वन्प्रायशस्तत्र सर्वं तद्गिरिगह्वरम्।।4.48.22।।
48_20.translation: He breathed his last, and the monkeys who won went searching almost all over the mountain caves.
48_20.word_by_word: तस्मिन् his, निरुच्छवासे  he breathed his last, जितकाशिनः  vanaras who won him, ते they, तत्र there, प्रायशः probably, सर्वम् all over, तत् that, गिरिगह्वरम् mountain cave, व्यचिन्वन्  searched, अपि also.

48_21.shloka: विचितं तु ततः कृत्वा सर्वे ते काननं पुनः।अन्यदेवापरं घोरं विविशुर्गिरिगह्वरम्।।4.48.23।।
48_21.translation: Again they searched the forest and  entered another dreadful mountain cave.
48_21.word_by_word: सर्वे all, ते they, काननं पुनः again in the forest, विचितम् searched, कृत्वा having done, ततः then, अन्यदेव a different, घोरम् dreadful, अपरम् another, गिरिगह्वरम् mountain cave, विविशुः entered.

48_22.shloka: ते विचित्य पुनः खिन्ना विनिष्पत्य समागताः।एकान्ते वृक्षमूले तु निषेदुर्दीनमानसाः।।4.48.24।।
48_22.translation: Having searched again, the disappointed monkeys collected together under a tree, dejected at heart and sat down in silence.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends of the fortyeighth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the forst epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
48_22.word_by_word: ते they, पुनः again, खिन्नाः ever sad, विनिष्पत्य having searched, समागताः collected together, दीनमानसाः those dejected at heart, एकान्ते in a secluded corner, वृक्षमूले under a tree, निषेदुः sat down.

49_1.shloka: [ Angada encourages the troops to search the silver mountain.]अथाङ्गदस्तदा सर्वान्वानरानिदमब्रवीत्।परिश्रान्तो महाप्राज्ञस्समाश्वास्य शनैर्वचः।।4.49.1।।
49_1.translation: Wise Angada, exhausted after the search, collected the monkeys, and consoling them, said slowly:
49_1.word_by_word: अथ then, परिश्रान्तः an exhausted person, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, अङ्गदः Angada, तदा then, सर्वान् all, वानरान् the vanaras, समाश्वास्य consoled, शनैः slowly, इदम् these, वचः words, अब्रवीत् said.

49_2.shloka: वनानि गिरयो नद्यो दुर्गाणि गहनानि च।दर्यो गिरिगुहाश्चैव विचितानि समन्ततः।।4.49.2।।तत्र तत्र सहास्माभिर्जानकी न च दृश्यते।तद्वा रक्षो हृता येन सीता सुरसुतोपमा।।4.49.3।।
49_2.translation: 'We have searched here, there, everywhere, in dense forests, hills, forts, impenetrable caverns and mountain ranges. But we could find neither Janaki who is like a goddess nor the demon who abducted her.
49_2.word_by_word: अस्माभिः by all of us, सह along with, वनानि forests, गिरयः the mountains, नद्यः the rivers, दुर्गाणि inaccessible forts, गहनानि च dense, दर्यः caves, गिरिगुहाश्चैव and the mountain ranges also, समन्ततः all over, तत्र तत्र everywhere, विचितानि searched, जानकी Janaki, न दृश्यते is not seen, तदा then, सीता Sita, हृता येन by one who has stolen, सुरसुतोपमा one who is like a goddess, रक्षः च raksha, वा or.

49_3.word_by_word: नः for us, महान् long, कालः time, यातः over, सुग्रीवश्च Sugriva also, उग्रशासनः  strict in administration, तस्मात् therefore, भवन्तः all of you, सहिताः together, समन्ततः all over, विचिन्वन्तु you may search for.

49_4.shloka: विहाय तन्द्रीं शोकं च निद्रां चैव समुत्थिताम्।विचिनुध्वं यथा सीतां पश्यामो जनकात्मजाम्।।4.49.5।।
49_4.translation: 'You should keep searching on till we see Sita, Janaka's daughter, giving up laziness and sorrow and sleep that is overpowering us.
49_4.word_by_word: समुत्थिताम् overpowering us, तन्द्रीं laziness, शोकं च and sorrow, निद्रां चैव even sleep, विहाय after giving up, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, सीताम् Sita, पश्यामः we will see, यथा so also, विचिनुध्वम् you may search.

49_5.translation: 'It is said, zeal, capability, and fortitude can overcome defeat and lead to success. Therefore I am saying this.
49_5.word_by_word: अनिर्वेदम् zeal, दाक्ष्यं च capability and, मनसः mind's, अपराजयं च robust optimism, कार्यसिद्धिकराणि conducive  to success, आहुः is said, तस्मात् therefore, अहम् I am, एतत् all this, ब्रवीमि I am telling you.

49_6.shloka: अद्यापि तद्वनं दुर्गं विचिन्वन्तु वनौकसः।खेदं त्यक्त्वा पुनस्सर्वैर्वनमेतद्विचीयताम्।।4.49.7।।
49_6.translation: 'Search this impenetrable forest even now, O you denizens of this forest Give up grief, let us all once again ransack this forest.
49_6.word_by_word: अद्यापि even now, वनौकसः you forestdwellers, दुर्गम् difficult to enter, तत् वनम् that forest, विचिन्वन्तु search, सर्वैः by all, खेदम् grief, त्यक्ता giving up, पुनः again, वनमेव forest itself, विचीयताम् search.

49_7.shloka: अवश्यं क्रियमाणस्य दृश्यते कर्मणः फलम्।अलं निर्वेदमागम्य न हि नो मीलनं क्षमम्।।4.49.8।।
49_7.word_by_word: क्रियमाणस्य being carried on, कर्मणः of the deed, फलम् result, अवश्यम् certainly, दृश्यते will be seen, अलम् enough, निर्वेदम् despair, आगम्य experiencing, नः for us, मीलनम् closing eyes, न क्षमम् हि not proper.

49_8.shloka: सुग्रीवः कोपनो राजा तीक्ष्णदण्डश्च वानरः।भेतव्यं तस्य सततं रामस्य च महात्मनः।।4.49.9।।
49_8.translation: 'Sugriva, the monkey king, is wrathful and awards severe punishment. We should ever bear in mind the (purpose of the) great self, Rama.
49_8.word_by_word: वानरः monkey, राजा king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, कोपनः an angry one, तीक्ष्णदण्डश्च severe punishment, तस्य his, महात्मनः of the great self, रामस्य च of Rama also, सततम् ever, भेतव्यम् we have to fear.

49_9.shloka: हितार्थमेतदुक्तं वः क्रियतां यदि रोचते।उच्यतां वा क्षमं यन्नस्सर्वेषामेव वानराः।।4.49.10।।
49_9.translation: 'I have said all this for your good. You may carry it out, if it pleases you. Speak freely if there is any other course left for all of us, O monkeys'
49_9.word_by_word: वानराः O monkeys, वः हितार्थम् for your benefit, एतत् all this, उक्तम् said, रोचते यदि if itpleases you, क्रियताम् it may be done, यत् whatever, सर्वेषामेव for all of you, क्षमम् right, नः for us, उच्यताम् you may tell.

49_10.shloka: अङ्गदस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा वचनं गन्धमादनः।उवाचाव्यक्तया वाचा पिपासाश्रमखिन्नया।।4.49.11।।
49_10.translation: Having heard Angada, Gandhamadana worn out by thirst and exhaustion, replied in a feeble tone:
49_10.word_by_word: अङ्गदस्य Angada's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, गन्धमादनः Gandhamadana, पिपासाश्रमखिन्नया worn out by thirst and exhaustion, अव्यक्तया feebly, वाचा with language, वचनम् these words, उवाच expressed.

49_11.shloka: सदृशं खलु वो वाक्यमङ्गदो यदुवाच ह।हितं चैवानुकूलं च क्रियतामस्य भाषितम्।।4.49.12।।
49_11.translation: 'What Angada says is appropriate, beneficial and also favourable. Carry out his command.
49_11.word_by_word: अङ्गदः Angada, यत् वाक्यम् those words, उवाच ह expressed, वः for us, सदृशं खलु appropriate too, हितं चैव good also, अनुकूलं च even favourable, अस्य his, भाषितम्  utterance, क्रियताम् carry out.

49_12.shloka: पुनर्मार्गामहै शैलान्कन्दरांश्च दरीस्तथा।काननानि च शून्यानि गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च।।4.49.13।।
49_12.translation: 'Once again let us explore the mountains, caverns, forests, desolate places and mountain streams.
49_12.word_by_word: पुनः once again, शैलान् mountains, कन्दरांश्च valleys also, तथा similarly, दरीः caverns, शून्यानि desolate places, काननानि च and forests, गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च mountain streams, मार्गामहै we will explore again.

49_13.shloka: यथोद्दिष्टानि सर्वाणि सुग्रीवेण महात्मना।विचिन्वन्तु वनं सर्वे गिरिदुर्गाणि सर्वशः।।4.49.14।।
49_13.word_by_word: सर्वे all of you, सर्वशः everywhere, महात्मना by great self, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, यथोद्दिष्टानि as pointed out, सर्वाणि all places, गिरिदुर्गाणि mountains, विचिन्वन्तु search, वनम् forest.

49_14.translation: Once again the  monkeys rose up and started exploring the mountain ranges of Vindhya and the forests surrounding the southern side.
49_14.word_by_word: ततः then, महाबलाः mighty, ते वानराः those monkeys, पुनः again, समुत्थाय after getting up, विन्ध्यकाननसङ्कीर्णाम् filled with forests surrounding the ranges of Vindhya, दक्षिणां दिशम् in the southern side, विचेरुः started exploring.

49_15.shloka: ते शारदाभ्रप्रतिमं श्रीमद्रजतपर्वतम्।शृङ्गवन्तं दरीमन्तमधिरुह्य च वानराः।।4.49.16।।तत्र लोध्रवनं रम्यं सप्तपर्णवनानि च।व्यचिन्वंस्ते हरिवरास्सीता दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः।।4.49.17।।
49_15.translation: Eager to find Sita, the best of monkeys climbed the silver mountain rich with peaks and caverns resembling the autumnal clouds. And looked out into the Lodhra grove and the garden of seven leaves (banara plantations).
49_15.word_by_word: सीतादर्शनकाङ्क्षिण: eager to see Sita, हरिवराः best of monkeys, ते वानराः those monkeys, शारदाभ्रप्रतिमम् resembling the autumn clouds, श्रीमत् rich, शृङ्गवन्तम् endowed with peaks,दरीमन्तम् with caverns, रजतपर्वतम् silver mountain, अधिरुह्य having ascended, तत्र there, रम्यम् enchanting, लोध्रवनम् Lodhra grove, सप्तपर्णवनानि च and gardens of seven leaves, व्यचिन्वंस्ते they looked out.

49_16.shloka: तस्याग्रमधिरूढास्ते श्रान्ता विपुलविक्रमाः।न पश्यन्ति स्म वैदेहीं रामस्य महिषीं प्रियाम्।।4.49.18।।
49_16.translation: Even after scaling up the peak, the exhausted, heroic monkeys could not find Vaidehi, the dear queen of Rama.
49_16.word_by_word: तस्य its, अग्रम् peak, अधिरूढाः they climbed, विपुलविक्रमाः very brave ones, ते they, श्रान्ताः   exhausted, रामस्य Rama's, प्रियां महिषीम् dear queen, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, न पश्यन्ति स्म  did not find.

49_17.shloka: ते तु दृष्टिगतं कृत्वा तं शैलं बहुकन्दरम्।अवारोहन्त हरयो वीक्षमाणास्समन्ततः।।4.49.19।।
49_17.translation: Having looked all over the mountain and many caverns, those monkeys got down from the mountain.
49_17.word_by_word: ते हरयः those monkeys, दृष्टिगतम् having seen all over, बहुकन्दरम् having many caves, तं शैलम् that mountain, कृत्वा after doing so, समन्ततः everywhere, वीक्षमाणाः while looking at, अवारोहन्त descended.

49_18.shloka: अवरुह्य ततो भूमिं श्रान्ता विगतचेतसः।स्थित्वा मुहूर्तं तत्राथ वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रिताः।।4.49.20।।
49_18.translation: Descending to the foothills, the exhausted monkeys became quiet. Fatigued and disheartened, they assembled under a tree, stood for a moment and then lay down.
49_18.word_by_word: ततः then, भूमिम् ground, अवरुह्य descending down, श्रान्ताः tired, विगतचेतसः dejected atheart, तत्र there, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, स्थित्वा having stood, अथ and then, वृक्षमूलम् under a tree, उपाश्रिताः lay down.

49_19.shloka: ते मुहूर्तं समाश्वस्ताः किञ्चिद्भग्नपरिश्रमाः।पुनरेवोद्यताः कृत्स्नां मार्गितुं दक्षिणां दिशम्।।4.49.21।।
49_19.translation: Resting for a while, the frustrated monkeys resumed their search throughout the southern direction.
49_19.word_by_word: ते they, मुहूर्तम् for a while, समाश्वस्ताः took rest, किञ्चित् a little, भग्नपरिश्रमाः frustrated, पुनरेव once again, कृत्स्नाम् entire, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern side, मार्गितुम् to search, उद्यताः decided.

49_20.translation: The bulls among vanaras and Hanuman, the chief of the group again started exploring  everywhere in the Vindhya range starting from the beginning.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyninth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
49_20.word_by_word: हनुमत्प्रमुखाः Hanuman being the prominent one of the group, प्लवगर्षभाः bulls among the vanaras, प्रस्थिताः started search, आदितः from the beginning, तावत् all over, विन्ध्यमेव  Vindhya range itself, समन्ततः everywhere, विचेरुः roamed.

50_1.shloka: [Rikshabila cave -- meeting with Svayamprabha.]सह ताराङ्गदाभ्यां तु सङ्गम्य हनुमान्कपिः।विचिनोति स्म विन्ध्यस्य गुहाश्च गहनानि च।।4.50.1।।
50_1.translation: Hanuman, together with the monkeys, Tara and Angada, searched in the impenetrable places and caves of Vindhya.
50_1.word_by_word: कपिः Monkey, हनुमान् Hanuman, ताराङ्गदाभ्यां सह along with Tara and Angada, सङ्गम्य together with, विन्ध्यस्य Vindhya, गुहाश्च caves, गहनानि च and impenetrable places, विचिनोति स्म searched for.

50_2.shloka: सिंहशार्दूलजुष्टेषु शिलाश्च सरितस्तदा।विषमेषु नगेन्द्रस्य महाप्रस्रवणेषु च।।4.50.2।।
50_2.translation: They also searched near rivers, mountain streams, hill ranges, caves of lions and tigers, in the rock shelters and difficult spots of vast mountains.
50_2.word_by_word: तदा then, सरितः rivers, सिंहशार्दूलजुष्टेषु inhabited by lions and tigers, शिलाश्च rocks, नगेन्द्रस्य vast mountain, विषमेषु in difficult spots, महाप्रस्रवणेषु च near mountain streams also.

50_3.shloka: आसेदुस्तस्य शैलस्य कोटिं दक्ष्णिपश्चिमाम्।तेषां तत्रैव वसतां स कालो व्यत्यवर्तत।।4.50.3।।
50_3.translation: They reached the end of the southwest side of the mountain(Vindhya). While theywere still there, the time stipulated for them (to find Sita) had slipped.
50_3.word_by_word: तस्य शैलस्य that mountain's, दक्ष्णिपश्चिमाम् southwest side, कोटिम् end of, आसेदुः reached, तेषाम् for them, तत्रैव while being there, वसताम् while they stayed, सः कालः that time, व्यत्यवर्तत slipped.

50_4.shloka: स हि देशो दुरन्वेषो गुहागहनवान्महान्।तत्र वायुसुतस्सर्वं विचिनोति स्म पर्वतम्।।4.50.4।।
50_4.translation: The son of the Windgod, Hanuman, searched all over the mountains and caves and woods difficult to access in that southwestern region of the mountain.
50_4.word_by_word: गुहागहनवान् a difficult mountain range, caves and woods, महान् great, सः देशः that place, दुरन्वेषः difficult to search in, वायुसुतः son of the Windgod, तत्र there, सर्वम् all, पर्वतम् mountains, विचिनोति स्म had searched.

50_5.shloka: परस्परेण हनुमा नन्योन्यस्याविदूरतः।गजो गवाक्षो गवयश्शरभो गन्धमादनः।।4.50.5।।मैन्दश्च द्विविदश्चैव सुषेणो जाम्बवान्नल:।अङ्गदो युवराजश्च तारश्च वनगोचरः।।4.50.6।।गिरिजालावृतान्देशान्मार्गित्वा दक्षिणां दिशम्।विचिन्वन्तस्ततस्तत्र ददृशुर्विवृतं बिलम्।।4.50.7।।दुर्गमृक्षबिलं नाम दानवेनाभिरक्षितम्।
50_5.translation: Having explored the region surrounded by a network of mountains, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda and also Dvivida, Sushena, Jambavan, Angada the heir apparent, Tara the forestdweller staying close to one another and Hanuman too not far from the others searched in the southern direction. While  they were exploring, they saw the mouth of a large cave called Rikshabilam, which had its mouth open,  guarded by a demon.
50_5.word_by_word: गजः Gaja, गवाक्षः Gavaksha, गवयः Gavaya, शरभः Sarabha, गन्धमादनः Gandhamadana, मैन्दश्च Mainda, द्विविदश्चैव Dvivida also, सुषेणः Sushena, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, युवराजः heir apparent, अङ्गदश्च Angada too, वनगोचरः forest dweller, तारश्च and Tara too, परस्परेण  close to one another, हनूमान् Hanuman, अन्योन्यस्य  one with the other, अविदूरतः not far away from one, गिरिजालावृतान् surrounded by a network of mountains, देशान्  locations, मार्गित्वा having searched, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern direction, ततः then, विचिन्वन्तः while exploring, तत्र there, दानवेन by a demon, अभिरक्षितम् guarded by, दुर्गम् large, ऋक्षबिलं नाम called Rikshabilam, विवृतम् open, बिलम् mouth of the cave, ददृशुः they saw.

50_6.translation: Overcome with hunger and thirst, the exhausted monkeys noticed a huge cave covered with creepers and bushes, while they were looking around for water.
50_6.word_by_word: क्षुत्पिपासापरीताः overcome by hunger and thirst, श्रान्ताः tired out, सलिलार्थिनः (desperately) looking for water, ते they, लतावृक्षैः with creepers and bushes, अवकीर्णम् spread with creepers and trees, महाबिलम् huge cave, ददृशुः saw.

50_7.shloka: तत्र क्रौञ्चाश्च हंसाश्च सारसाश्च विनिष्क्रमन्।।4.50.9।।जलार्द्राश्चक्रवाकाश्च रक्ताङ्गा: पद्मरेणुभिः।
50_7.translation: Just then, the kraunchas, swans, geese and chakravaka drenched in water with their limbs reddened with the pollen of lotuses were fluttering out (of the cave).
50_7.word_by_word: तत्र there, क्रौञ्चाश्च kraunchas, हंसाश्च swans, सारसाश्च geese, जलार्द्राः drenched in water, पद्मरेणुभिः covered by the pollen of lotuses, रक्ताङ्गाः wings red in colour, चक्रवाकाश्च chakravakas, विनिष्क्रमन् flying out of it.

50_8.translation: The bulls among the monkeys were bewildered when they reached the cave which was difficult to access.
50_8.word_by_word: ततः then, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys, सुगन्धि fragrant, दुरतिक्रमम् difficult to enter, तत्that, बिलम् cave, आसाद्य  reached, विस्मयव्यग्रमनसः bewildered, बभूवुः became.

50_9.translation: The brilliant host of monkeys experienced both fear and joy to see the cave difficult to enter.
50_9.word_by_word: तेजोवन्तः brilliant, महाबलाः forces, ते those, प्लवगोत्तमाः best of the monkeys, सञ्जातपरिशङ्काः afraid, संहृष्टाः they felt happy, तत् बिलम् that cave, अभ्यपद्यन्त that was difficult to enter.

50_10.translation: The cave was crowded with creatures of different kinds. It looked like the abode of the king of demons difficult (to enter), dreadful and impenetrable.
50_10.word_by_word: नानासत्त्वसमाकीर्णम् crowded with different kinds of creatures, दैत्येन्द्रनिलयोपमम् looked like the abode of king of the demons, दुर्दर्शम् fearful to look at, अति घोरम् highly dreadful, सर्वशः all over, दुर्विगाह्यं च and inaccessible.

50_11.translation: Then Hanuman, son of the Windgod who appeared like a huge mountain and knewabout forests spoke to the fellowmonkeys:
50_11.word_by_word: ततः then, पर्वतकूटाभः a being as huge as a mountain, कान्तारवनकोविदः knowledgeable of dense forests, पवनात्मजः son of the windgod, हनूमान् Hanuman, सर्वान् all, वानरान् monkeys, अब्रवीत् said:

50_12.shloka: गिरिजालावृतान्देशान्मार्गित्वा दक्षिणां दिशम्।।4.50.14।।वयं सर्वे परिश्रान्ता न च पश्याम मैथिलीम्।
50_12.translation: 'Going round the places covering all mountain ranges in the southern direction, we are spent. But we could not see Maithili.
50_12.word_by_word: वयम् we, सर्वे all, गिरिजालावृतान् having covered all the mountain ranges, देशान् places, मार्गित्वा having searched, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern side, परिश्रान्ताः exhausted, मैथिलीम् Maithili, न च पश्याम not see.

50_13.shloka: अस्माच्चापि बिलाद्धंसाः क्रौञ्चाश्च सह सारसैः।।4.50.15।।जलार्द्राश्चक्रवाकाश्च निष्पतन्ति स्म सर्वशः।नूनं सलिलवानत्र कूपो वा यदि वा ह्रदः।।4.50.16।।तथा चेमे बिलद्वारि स्निग्धास्तिष्ठन्ति पादपाः।
50_13.translation: 'From this cave have emerged several birds like sarasas, swans, kraunchas and chakravakas drenched in water. Surely there must be a source of plenty of water or well or a pond. Moreover there are shining( green) trees at the entrance of the cave (suggesting subsoil water).'
50_13.word_by_word: अस्मात् from this, बिलात् cave, हंसाः swans, सारसैः सह with sarasas, क्रौञ्चाश्च and kraunchas, जलार्द्राः drenched in water, चक्रवाकाश्च chakravakas also, सर्वशः all over, निष्पतन्ति स्म emerging, अत्र here, सलिलवान्  abundant water, कूपो वा well or, यदि वा so also, ह्रदः a pond, नूनम् surely, तथा like that, इमे these, बिलद्वारि at the entrance of the cave, पादपाः trees, स्निग्धाः shining, तिष्ठन्ति are present.

50_14.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा तद्बिलं सर्वे विविशुस्तिमिरावृतम्।।4.50.17।।अचन्द्रसूर्यं हरयो ददृशू रोमहर्षणम्।
50_14.translation: On hearing him, the monkeys entered the cave full of darkness. There was no light of the Moon or the Sun. It was a horripilating experience.
