50_14.word_by_word: इति thus, उक्त्वा having been told, सर्वे all, तिमिरावृतम् filled with darkness, तत् बिलम् that cave, विविशुः  entered, हरयः monkeys, अचन्द्रसूर्यम् where there is no Moon or Sun light, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, ददृशुः saw.

50_15.shloka: निशाम्य तस्मात् शिंहांश्च तांस्तांश्च मृगपक्ष्णिः।।4.50.18।।प्रविष्टा हरिशार्दूला बिलं तिमिरसंवृतम्।
50_15.translation: The tigers among the monkeys entered the dark cave reverberating with the sounds of lions, beasts and birds.
50_15.word_by_word: हरिशार्दूलाः tigers among monkeys, तस्मात् from, सिंहांश्च lions, तांस्तान् various types of, मृगपक्ष्णिः beasts and birds, निशाम्य after hearing their sounds, तिमिरसंवृतम् full of darkness, बिलम् cave, प्रविष्टाः entered.

50_16.shloka: न तेषां सज्जते चक्षुर्न तेजो न पराक्रमः।।4.50.19।।वायोरिव गतिस्तेषां दृष्टिस्तमसि वर्तते।
50_16.translation: The monkeys could not fix their eyes anywhere.Their lustre or valour could not help them. They moved like wind uninterrupted and their vision was lost in darkness.
50_16.word_by_word: तेषाम् their, चक्षु: eyes, न not, सज्जते was uninterrupted, तेजः brilliance, न not, पराक्रमः valour, न not, तेषाम् their, गतिः way, वायोरिव like the wind, दृष्टिः sight, तमसि in darkness, वर्तते moved

50_17.shloka: ते प्रविष्टास्तु वेगेन तद्बिलं कपिकुञ्जराः।।4.50.20।।प्रकाशमभिरामं च ददृशुर्देशमुत्तमम्।
50_17.translation: As the elephantlike monkeys entered the cave quickly, they saw bright light and an excellent delightful place.
50_17.word_by_word: तत् बिलम् that cave, वेगेन quickly, प्रविष्टाः they entered, ते कपिकुञ्जराः those elephantlikemonkeys, प्रकाशं च bright light, अभिरामं च delighting, उत्तमम् excellent, देशम् place, ददृशुः saw.

50_18.translation: Holding one another's hands, they went in for a distance of one  yojana inside the cave that was densely covered with several kinds of trees.
50_18.word_by_word: ततः then, अन्योन्यम् one another, सम्परिष्वज्य after holding on, दुर्गे in the dense, नानापादपसङ्कुले in a place filled with several kinds of trees, तस्मिन् बिले in that cave, योजनम् yojana, अन्तरम् inside, जग्मुः went.

50_19.translation: Having nearly lost their senses (without water to drink), the thirsty and bewildered monkeys were desperate for water.They wandered in the cave without feeling lazy for some time.
50_19.word_by_word: नष्टसंज्ञाः they nearly lost consciousness, तृषिताः thirsty ones, सम्भ्रान्ताः bewildered ones, सलिलार्थिनः they were desperate for water, ते they, अतन्द्रिताः without feeling lazy, तस्मिन् in that, बिले in the cave, कञ्चित्कालम् for a while, परिपेतुः wandered.

50_20.shloka: ते कृशा दीनवदनाः परिश्रान्ताः प्लवङ्गमाः।।4.50.23।।आलोकं ददृशुर्वीरा निराशा जीविते यदा।
50_20.translation: Exhausted and enfeebled, they saw with dejected faces a gleam of light at a time when they were desparate.
50_20.word_by_word: कृशाः weakened, दीनवदनाः having dejected faces, परिश्रान्ताः exhausted ones, ते they, वीराः heroes, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, यदा when, जीविते in life, निराशाः desperate, आलोकम् light,ददृशुः beheld.

50_21.shloka: ततस्तं देशमागम्य सौम्या वितिमिरं वनम्।।4.50.24।।ददृशुः काञ्चनान्वृक्षान्दीप्तवैश्वानरप्रभान्।सालां स्तालांश्च पुन्नागान्ककुभान्वञ्जुलान्धवान्।।4.50.25।।चम्पकान् नागवृक्षांश्च कर्णिकारांश्च पुष्पितान्।स्तबकैः काञ्चनैश्चित्रै रक्तै: किसलयैस्तथा।।4.50.26।।आपीडैश्च लताभिश्च हेमाभरणभूषितान्।तरुणादित्यसङ्काशान्वैढूर्यकृतवेदिकान्।।4.50.27।।विभ्राजमानान्वपुषा पादपांश्च हिरण्मयान्।नीलवैढूर्यवर्णाश्च पद्मिनीः पतगावृताः।।4.50.28।।महद्भि: काञ्चनैः पद्मैर्वृता बालार्कसन्निभैः।
50_21.translation: Having reached inside the cave the monkeys saw a forest shining like blazing fire, dispelling the surrounding darkness. There they noticed sala, tala, tamala, punnaga, vanjjula, dhava, champaka, and naga trees. They also saw blossoming plants of Karnikara, bunches of beautiful golden flowers and tender redcoloured leaves.They saw wonderful trees with creepers on top entwining them, and ornamented with gold  (like golden fruits), radiant like the dazzling rising Sun. There were altars encrusted with precious sapphire and vaidurya. The golden trees were shining bright. There were lotus creepers looking like sapphire and vaidurya.The ponds were filled with golden lotuses and were surrounded by birds.
50_21.word_by_word: सौम्याः gentle ones, ततः then, तं देशम् place, आगम्य having reached, वितिमिरम् devoid of darkness, वनम् forest, दीप्तवैश्वानरप्रभाम् light of burning fire, काञ्चनान् golden, वृक्षान् trees, सालान् salas, तालान् talas, तमालांश्च tamalas, पुन्नागान् punnagas, वञ्जुलान् vanjjulas, धवान् dhavas, चम्पकान् champakas, नागवृक्षांश्च naga trees, पुष्पितान् blossomed, कर्णिकारांश्च Karnikas also, काञ्चनैः golden, चित्रैः  wonderful, स्तबकैः  bunches, तथा so also, रक्तै: red ones, किसलयैः tender leaves, आपीडैः entwining, लताभिश्च with creepers, हेमाभरणभूषितान् adorned with golden ornaments, तरुणादित्यसङ्काशान् looking like effulgent rising Sun, वैदूर्यमयवेदिकान् raised structures encrusted with precious stones of Vaiduryas, वपुषा with their appearance, विभ्राजमानान् dazzling, हिरण्मयान् full of gold, पादपांश्च and trees, नीलवैदूर्यवर्णाः of the colours of sapphires and vaiduryas, पतगैः with birds, वृताः filled, बालार्कसन्निभैः by those looking like the rising Sun, काञ्चनैः with golden, महद्भि: byenchanting ones, पद्मैः lotuses, वृताः surrounded, पद्मिनीः lotus ponds, ददृशुः saw.

50_22.translation: There they saw golden fishes and huge tortoises in the pellucid water of the tank filled with lotus creepers.
50_22.word_by_word: सः that, जातरूपमयैः with those golden ones, मत्स्यैः with fish, महद्भि with huge, अथ and then, कच्छपैः with tortoises, प्रसन्नसलिलावृताः filled with pellucid water, नलिनीः lotus creepers, तत्र ददृशुः saw there.

50_23.shloka: काञ्चनानि विमानानि राजतानि तथैव च।।4.50.30।।तपनीयगवाक्षाणि मुक्ताजालावृतानि च।हैमराजतभौमानि वैदूर्यमणिमन्ति च।।4.50.31।।ददृशुस्तत्र हरयो गृहमुख्यानि सर्वशः।
50_23.translation: The vanaras beheld highrise palaces built with gold and silver. The windows fixed on the roof were golden, shaped like cow's eye with lattices of pearls. They also saw best of houses built in gold, silver and clay, decorated with precious gems including vaidurya.
50_23.word_by_word: हरयः monkeys, तत्र there, काञ्चनानि golden, तथैव similarly, राजतानि silver, विमानानि highrise palaces, तपनीयगवाक्षाणि golden windows (shaped like cow's eye fixed on the roofs and walls), मुक्ताजालावृतानि च covered with lattices of pearls, हैमराजतभौमानि made of gold, silver and mud (earth), वैदुर्यमणिमन्ति च decorated with precious gems of vaidurya, गृहमुख्यानि beautiful houses, सर्वशः all over, ददृशुः they saw.

50_24.translation: They saw trees bright like corals in full bloom and ripe fruits. Golden bees were found hovering around making all kinds of honey.
50_24.word_by_word: पुष्पितान् blossomed, फलिनः with ripe fruits, प्रवालमणिसन्निभान् trees bright like corals, वृक्षान् trees, काञ्चनभ्रमरांश्चैव golden bees also, मधूनि च and different kinds of honey, समन्ततः all over.

50_25.shloka: मणिकाञ्चनचित्राणि शयनान्यासनानि च।।4.50.33।।महार्हाणि चयानानि ददृशुस्ते समन्ततः।हैमराजतकांस्यानां भाजनानां च संञ्चयान्।।4.50.34।।
50_25.translation: They saw all over rich collections of beds, couches and highly valuable vehicles,  decorated beautifully with gems and gold.They also saw a large collection of shining utensils made of gold, silver and bronze.
50_25.word_by_word: ते they, मणिकाञ्चनचित्राणि wonderfully shining with gems and gold, महार्हाणि highly valuable ones, च also, यानानि vehicles, शयनानि beds, आसनानि च and couches, हैमराजतकांस्यानाम् made of gold, silver and bronze, भाजनानाम् of utensils, संञ्चयान् च collections, समन्ततः all over, ददृशुः they saw.

50_26.shloka: अगरूणां च दिव्यानां चन्दनानां च संञ्चायान्।शुचीन्यभ्यवहार्याणि मूलानि च फलानि च।।4.50.35।।
50_26.translation: There they noticed a wonderful collection of incense and sandal, tasty and pure eatables, roots and fruits
50_26.word_by_word: दिव्यानाम् of wonderful, अगरूणाम् of incense, चन्दनानाम् of sandal, सञ्चयान् collections, शुचीनि pure, अभ्यवहार्याणि eatables, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits.

50_27.shloka: महार्हाणि च पानानि मधूनि रसवन्ति च।दिव्यानामम्बराणां च महार्हाणां च सञ्चयान्।।4.50.36।।कम्बलानां च चित्राणामजिनानां च सञ्चयान्।
50_27.translation: (They found) excellent drinks and many kinds of honey, wonderful collections of clothes, colourful blankets and heaps of animal skin.
50_27.word_by_word: महार्हाणि very rich, पानानि drinks, रसवन्ति tasty, मधूनि many kinds of honey,  दिव्यानाम्    wonderful, महार्हाणाम् of valuable ones, अम्बराणाम् of clothes, सञ्चयान् च and collections, चित्राणाम् of colourful, कम्बलानां च of blankets, अजिनानां च of animal skins, सञ्चयान् collection.

50_28.translation: The monkeys marked here and there a collection of gold, glittering like blazing fire.
50_28.word_by_word: वानराः monkeys, तत्र तत्र here and there, विन्यस्तान् placed, दीप्तान् glittering, वैश्वानरप्रभान् like blazing fire, शुभ्रान् pure, जातरूपस्य gold, सञ्चयान् collections, ददृशुः observed.

50_29.shloka: तत्र तत्र विचिन्वन्तो बिले तस्मिन्महाबलाः।।4.50.38।।ददृशुर्वानराश्शूराः स्त्रियं काञ्चिददूरतः।
50_29.translation: While searching here and there in the cave, the strong and powerful monkeys discovered a woman not far from there.
50_29.word_by_word: महाबलाः strong, शूराः powerful, वानराः monkeys, तस्मिन्बिले in that cave, तत्र तत्र here andthere, विचिन्वन्तः while they searched, अदूरतः not far from there, काञ्चित् some, स्त्रियम् woman, ददृशुः saw.

50_30.translation: She was an ascetic in bark robes and deer skin blazing with lustre, restrained in her food. The monkeys got very frightened.
50_30.word_by_word: दृष्ट्वा on seeing, तां her, चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बराम् wearing deer skin and bark robes, नियताहाराम् restricted food, तेजसा with lustre, ज्वलन्तीमिव as if glowing, तापसीम् a female ascetic, भृशसन्त्रस्ता very much frightened.

50_31.shloka: विस्मिता हरयस्तत्र व्यवतिष्ठन्त सर्वशः।।4.50.40।।पप्रच्छ हनुमांस्तत्र काऽसि त्वं कस्य वा बिलम्।
50_31.translation: The amazed monkeys stopped there. Hanuman enquired, 'Who are you? Whose cave is this'?
50_31.word_by_word: हरयः monkeys, विस्मिताः amazed, तत्र there, सर्वशः all over, व्यवतिष्ठन्त stopped, तत्र there, हनुमान् Hanuman, पप्रच्छ enquired, त्वम् you, का असि who are, बिलम् cave, कस्य वा whose is it?

50_32.shloka: ततो हनूमान्गिरिसन्निकाशःकृताज्ञलिस्तामभिवाद्य वृद्धाम्।पप्रच्छ का त्वं भवनं बिलं चरत्नानि चेमानि वदस्व कस्य।।4.50.41।।
50_32.translation: Then Hanuman who was of the size of a mountain greeted the old lady with folded hands and enquired her 'Who are you? To whom does this mansion, this cave and these gems belong?'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends of fiftieth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic of the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
50_32.word_by_word: ततः then, गिरिसन्निकाशः resembling a mountain in size, हनूमान् Hanuman, कृताञ्जलिः offered salutations with folded palms, तां वृद्धाम् to that old lady, अभिवाद्य having greeted, पप्रच्छ enquired, त्वम् you, का who, भवनम् this mansion, बिलं च and cave, इमानि these, रत्नानि च  gems, कस्य whose, वदस्व  tell.

51_1.shloka: [The story of Svayamprabha]इत्युक्त्वा हनुमांस्तत्र पुनः कृष्णाजिनाम्बराम्।अब्रवीत्तां महाभागां तापसीं धर्मचारिणीम्।।4.51.1।।
51_1.translation: On meeting the distinguished, righteous ascetic woman robed in deer skin, Hanuman said:
51_1.word_by_word: तत्र there, हनुमान् Hanuman, इति thus, उक्त्वा having addressed, पुनः again, कृष्णाजिनाम्बराम् robed in deer skin, महाभागाम् a distinguished lady, धर्मचारिणीम् a righteous woman, तां तापसीम् ascetic woman, अब्रवीत् said.

51_2.shloka: इदं प्रविष्टास्सहसा बिलं तिमिरसंवृतम्।क्षुत्पिपासापरिश्रान्ताः परिखिन्नाश्च सर्वशः।।4.51.2।।
51_2.translation: 'We are exhausted with thirst and hunger. We are fatigued. (Hence) we entered this dark cave all at once(without waiting for permission).
51_2.word_by_word: क्षुत्पिपासापरिश्रान्ताः exhausted with hunger and thirst, सर्वशः by all means, परिखिन्नाश्च fatigued, तिमिरसंवृतम् filled with darkness, इदम् this, बिलम् cave, सहसा all at once, प्रविष्टाः entered.

51_3.shloka: महद्धरण्या विवरं प्रविष्टाः स्म पिपासिताः।इमां स्त्वेवंविधान्भावान्विविधानद्भुतोपमान्।।4.51.3।।दृष्ट्वा वयं प्रव्यथितास्सम्भ्रान्ता नष्टचेतसः।
51_3.translation: 'Thirst drove us into this cave on earth. We are amazed at the kind of many wonderful objects here and have nearly lost our senses. We are tormented with pain.
51_3.word_by_word: पिपासिताः thirsty, धरण्याः of the earth, महत् huge, विवरम् hole, प्रविष्टाः स्म we entered, एवं विधान् this kind, विविधान् many, अद्भुतोपमान् wonderful ones, इमान् these, भावान् feelings,दृष्ट्वा after seeing, वयम् we, नष्टचेतसः having lost conciousness nearly, सम्भ्रान्ताः amazed, प्रव्यथिताः we are pained.

51_4.shloka: कस्यैते काञ्चना वृक्षास्तरुणादित्यसन्निभाः।।4.51.4।।शुचीन्यभ्यवहार्याणि मूलानि च फलानि च।काञ्चनानि विमानानि राजतानि गृहाणि च।।4.51.5।।तपनीयगवाक्षाणि मणिजालावृतानि च।
51_4.translation: 'To whom do these golden trees resembling the rising Sun belong? For whom are these  tasty roots and fruits? Whose are these manystoreyed golden houses with glittering windows adorned with silver lattices encrusted with gems?
51_4.word_by_word: एते these, तरुणादित्यसन्निभाः resembling like the rising Sun, काञ्चनाः golden, वृक्षाः trees, शुचीनि pure, अभ्यवहार्याणि very tasty eatables, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits, काञ्चनानि golden, विमानानि storeyed structures, राजतानि silver, तपनीय गवाक्षाणि glittering golden windows, मणिजालावृतानि adorned with lattices encrusted with gems, गृहाणि च and houses, कस्य whose?

51_5.shloka: पुष्पिताः फलवन्तश्च पुण्यास्सुरभिगन्धिनः।।4.51.6।।इमे जाम्बूनदमयाः पादपाः कस्य तेजसा।काञ्चनानि च पद्मानि जातानि विमले जले।।4.51.7।।कथं मत्स्याश्च सौवर्णा दृश्यन्ते सह कच्छपैः।आत्मानमनुभावं च कस्य चैतत्तपोबलम्।।4.51.8।।अजानतां न स्सर्वेषां सर्वमाख्यातुमर्हसि।
51_5.translation: 'By whose prowess are these golden trees yielding sacred fragrant flowers and fruits?  How are these golden lotuses created in the clear water? How is it that here are golden fishes and tortoises? Whose fruit of penance is this? Is it by your power? We do not know. You should tell all of us everything'.
51_5.word_by_word: पुष्पिताः blossomed, फलवन्तश्च full of fruits, पुण्याः sacred, सुरभिगन्धिनः filled with fragrance, इमे these, जाम्बूनदमयाः full of gold, पादपाः trees, विमले in pure, जले in water, काञ्चनानि of gold, पद्मानि च and lotuses, कस्य whose, तेजसा by lustre, जातानि created, कच्छपैः सह along with tortoises, सौवर्णाः golden, मत्स्याश्च fishes too, कथम् how, आत्मानम् yourself, अनुभावाम् च your power, एतत् all this, तपोबलम् ascetic power, कस्य whose, च and, अजानताम्  do not know, नः us, सर्वेषाम् for all of us, सर्वम् everything, आख्यातुम् to tell, अर्हसि you ought to.

51_6.shloka: एवमुक्ता हनुमता तापसी धर्मचारिणी।।4.51.9।।प्रत्युवाच हनूमन्तं सर्वभूतहिते रता।
51_6.translation: The noble ascetic committed to the welfare of all beings replied to Hanuman's enquiry:
51_6.word_by_word: हनुमता Hanuman, एवम् in that way, उक्ता spoken, सर्वभूतहिते in the interest of all beings, रता committed, धर्मचारिणी noble woman, तापसी female ascetic, हनूमन्तम् to Hanuman, प्रत्युवाच replied.

51_7.shloka: मयो नाम महातेजा मायावी वानरर्षभः।।4.51.10।।तेनेदं निर्मितं सर्वं मायया काञ्चनं वनम्।
51_7.translation: 'O bull among monkeys this golden forest was created by the magical power of a deceitful demon called Maya.
51_7.word_by_word: वानरर्षभः O bull among monkeys, महातेजाः brilliant, मायावी a deceitful, मयो नाम called Maya, इदम् this, सर्वम् all, काञ्चनं वनम् golden forest, तेन by his, मायया magical power, निर्मितम् created.

51_8.shloka: पुरा दानवमुख्यानां विश्वकर्मा बभूव ह।।4.51.11।।येनेदं काञ्चनं दिव्यं निर्मितं भवनोत्तमम्।
51_8.translation: This best of wonderful mansions has been constructed earlier by Visvakarma, the chief (architect) of the demons.
51_8.word_by_word: येन by whomsoever, काञ्चनम् golden, दिव्यम् wonderful, इदम् this, भवनोत्तमम् best of mansions, निर्मितम् constructed, पुरा earlier, दानवमुख्यानाम्  chiefs of demons, विश्वकर्मा Visvakarma, बभूव existed.

51_9.shloka: स तु वर्षसहस्राणि तपस्तप्त्वा महावने।।4.51.12।।पितामहाद्वरं लेभे सर्वमौशनसं धनम्।
51_9.translation: 'He (Maya) performed rigorous penance in the dense forest for thousands of years seeking the favour of Brahma, the creator and obtained a boon that he should inherit all the wealth of Usanas (Shukra).
51_9.word_by_word: सः that, वने in the forest, वर्षसहस्राणि for thousands of years, महावने dense forest, तपः penance, तप्त्वा having performed, पितामहात् from the creator Brahma, वरम् boon, औशनसम् of Usanas, सर्वम् all, धनम् wealth, लेभे inherited.

51_10.shloka: वनं विधाय बलवान्सर्वकामेश्वरस्तदा।।4.51.13।।उवास सुखितः कालं कञ्चिदस्मिन्महावने।
51_10.translation: Then the mighty Maya who received the power of (executing) desires created this mansion and lived here happily for some time in this dense forest.
51_10.word_by_word: तदा then, बलवान् powerful one, सर्वकामेश्वरः master of all desires, सुखितः happily, अस्मिन् in this, महावने in this dense forest, कञ्चित्कालम् for some time, उवास lived, वनं the forest, विधाय after creating.

51_11.shloka: तमप्सरसि हेमायां सक्तं दानवपुङ्गवम्।।4.51.14।।विक्रम्यैवाशनिं गृह्य जघानेत्रः पुरन्दरः।
51_11.translation: 'Seeing this great demon in love with a heavenly apsara (nymph) called Hema, Lord Indra with all his might attacked him with his thunderbolt.
51_11.word_by_word: हेमायाम् Hema, अप्सरसि an apsarasa or angel, सक्तम् infatuated, तम् him, दानवपुङ्गवम् great demon, ईशः lord, पुरन्दरः Indra, अशनिम् thunderbolt, गृह्य after taking, विक्रम्यैव with all his might, जघान attacked.

51_12.shloka: इदं च ब्रह्मणा दत्तं हेमायै वनमुत्तमम्।।4.51.15।।शाश्वता: कामभोगश्च गृहं चेदं हिरण्मयम्।
51_12.translation: 'Thus this wonderful forest and the golden house with all luxury were given away permanently to Hema by the creator Brahma.
51_12.word_by_word: इदम् thus, उत्तमम् wonderful, वनम् forest, शाश्वता: permanently, कामभोगश्च luxurious life, हिरण्मयम् golden, इदम् this, गृहम् house, ब्रह्मणा creator Brahma, हेमायै to Hema, दत्तम् was given.

51_13.shloka: दुहिता मेरुसावर्णेरहं तस्यास्स्वयंप्रभा।।4.51.16।।इदं रक्षामि भवनं हेमाया वानरोत्तम।
51_13.translation: 'O best of monkeys daughter of Meru Sauvarni, I am Svayamprabha (selfilluminator), caretaker of this house of Hema. (Meru Sauvarni is the eleventh  Manu).
51_13.word_by_word: वानरोत्तम best of monkeys, मेरुसावर्णेः of Meru Sauvarni, दुहिता daughter, स्वयंप्रभा Svayamprabha, अहम् me, तस्याः her, हेमायाः Hema's, इदम् this, भवनम् house, रक्षामिI protect.

51_14.shloka: मम प्रियसखी हेमा नृत्तगीतविशारदा।।4.51.17।।तया दत्तवरा चास्मि रक्षामि भवनोत्तमम्।
51_14.translation: 'Hema, wellversed in dance and music is a fast friend to me. She granted a boon (that none can resist me) and gave this house of which I am the caretaker.
51_14.word_by_word: नृत्तगीतविशारदा wellversed in dance and music, हेमा Hema, मम to me, प्रियसखी dear friend, तया as such, दत्तवरा granted a boon, अस्मि I am, उत्तमम् supreme, भवनम् house, रक्षामि I watch this house.

51_15.shloka: किं कार्यं कस्य वा हेतोः कान्ताराणि प्रपश्यथ।।4.51.18।।कथं चेदं वनं दुर्गं युष्माभिरुपलक्षितम्।
51_15.translation: 'What is your mission? For what purpose have you come to this inaccessible forest? What are you looking for?How did you find this?
51_15.word_by_word: कार्यम् mission, किम् what, कस्य वा for what, हेतोः for purpose, कान्ताराणि these forests, प्रपश्यथ you are looking for, दुर्गम् inaccessible, इदम् वनम् this forest, युष्माभिः by all of you, कथम् how, उपलक्षितम् was found?

51_16.shloka: इमान्यभ्यवहार्याणि मूलानि च फलानि च।।4.51.19।।भुक्त्वा पीत्वा च पानीयं सर्वं मे वक्तुमर्हथ।
51_16.translation: 'Eat these wonderful roots and fruits and have these drinks and then tell me all about you.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकपञ्चशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends of the fiftyfirst sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
51_16.word_by_word: इमान् these, अभ्यवहार्याणि wonderful eatables, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits, भुक्त्वा after eating, पानीयम् drink, पीत्वा च taking, मे to me, सर्वम् every thing, वक्तुम् you may tell, अर्हथ you may do so.

52_1.shloka: [Hanuman narrates to Svayamprabha the purpose of the monkey mission and the reasons for entering the cave.]अथ तानब्रवीत्सर्वान्विश्रान्तान्हरियूथपान्।इदं वचनमेकाग्रा तापसी धर्मचारिणी।।4.52.1।।
52_1.translation: After the monkey leaders had taken rest, the noble ascetic with undiverted attention said these words:
52_1.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, धर्मचारिणी righteous woman, एकाग्रा with concentration, तापसी ascetic woman, विश्रान्तान्  had rested, तान् those, सर्वान् all, हरियूथपान् monkey leaders, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

52_2.shloka: वानरा यदि वः खेदः प्रनष्टः फलभक्षणात्।यदि चैतन्मया श्राव्यं श्रोतुमिच्छामि कथ्यताम्।।4.52.2।।
52_2.translation: 'O monkeys if you have been relieved of your fatigue after eating fruits, now tell me about yourself, if you think it can be told. I want to hear.
52_2.word_by_word: वानराः O monkey, फलभक्षणात् by eating fruits, वः your, खेदः sorrow, प्रनष्टः यदि is relieved, एतत् thus, मया by me, श्राव्यं च यदि if it can be heard, कथ्यताम् it may be narrated, श्रोतुम् to hear, इच्छामि I wish.

52_3.translation: When Hanuman, son of the Windgod, heard her, he started narrating frankly and truthfully.
52_3.word_by_word: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनूमान् Hanuman, तस्याः her, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, आर्जवेन frankly, यथातत्त्वम् faithfully, आख्यातुम् to narrate, उपचक्रमे started.

52_4.shloka: राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः।रामो दाशरथिश्शीमान्प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम्।।4.52.4।।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या चापि भार्यया।तस्य भार्या जनस्थानाद्रावणेन हृता बलात्।।4.52.5।।
52_4.translation: 'Rama, son of Dasaratha, a prosperous king of all the worlds, comparable to Indra and Varuna came to the Dandaka forest along with his brother Laksmana and wife Vaidehi. Ravana abducted his wife from Janasthana.
52_4.word_by_word: सर्वस्य for the entire, लोकस्य world's, राजा king, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः comparable to Indra and Varuna, दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, श्रीमान् prosperous, रामः Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, भार्यया with his wife, वैदेह्या सह with Vaidehi, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्टः entered, तस्य his, भार्या wife, रावणेन by Ravana, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, बलात् forcibly, हृता she was abducted.

52_5.shloka: वीरस्तस्य सखा राज्ञस्सुग्रीवो नाम वानरः।राजा वानरमुख्यानां येन प्रस्थापिता वयम्।।4.52.6।।
52_5.word_by_word: वीरः hero, वानरमुख्यानाम् lord of monkeys, राजा king, सुग्रीवो नाम called Sugriva, वानरः monkey, तस्य his, राज्ञः the king's, सखा friend, येन by whom, वयम् we, प्रस्थापिताः are sent.

52_6.shloka: अगस्त्यचरितामाशां दक्षिणां यमरक्षिताम्।सहैभिर्वानरैर्घोरैरङ्गदप्रमुखैर्वयम्।।4.52.7।।रावणं सहितास्सर्वे राक्षसं कामरूपिणम्।सीतया सह वैदेह्या मार्गध्वमिति चोदिताः।।4.52.8।।
52_6.translation: 'We along with the dreadful monkeys are sent with Angada as our chief to the southern direction, guarded by Yama and inhabited by sage Agasti. We are commanded to search Sita, princess of Videha and also the abode of the demon Ravana who assumes any form at his free will.
52_6.word_by_word: सर्वे all, सहिताः together, वैदेह्या Videha, सीतया सह with Sita, कामरूपिणम् he who changes his form at his will, राक्षसम् demon, रावणम् Ravana, मार्गध्वम् direction, इति thus, वयम् we, अङ्गदप्रमुखैः with Angada as chief, एभिः these also, मुख्यैः with leaders, वानरैः सह along with the monkeys, अगस्त्यचरिताम् where sage Agasthya lived, यमरक्षिताम् protected by Yama, दक्षिणाम् southern direction, आशाम् intent on, चोदिताः to search.

52_7.shloka: विचित्य तु वयं सर्वे समग्रां दक्षिणां दिशम्।परित्रान्ता बुभुक्षिता वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रिताः।।4.52.9।।
52_7.word_by_word: वयम् we, सर्वे all, सर्वम् all over, समग्रां entirely, वयं we, परिश्रान्ता exhausted, दक्षिणां दिशम् on the southern direction, विचित्य after searching, बुभुक्षिताः feeling hungry, वृक्षमूलम् under a tree, उपाश्रिताः  sheltered.

52_8.translation: 'We were all exhausted, lost in thought and worried, unable to cross this deep ocean of sorrow. We did not know how to proceed.
52_8.word_by_word: सर्वे all of us, विवर्णवदनाः palefaced, सर्वे all, ध्यानपरायणाः lost in thought, चिन्तामहार्णवे in the deep ocean of worry, मग्नाः immersed, पारम् the shore, नाधिगच्छामहे we were unable to find.

52_9.translation: 'Then while we were looking around we saw this cave concealed by trees and vines, with darkness spread all over.
52_9.word_by_word: ततः then, चक्षुः eyes, चारयन्तः while we were looking around, लतापादपसञ्च्छन्नम् concealed by vines and trees, तिमिरेण with darkness, समावृतम् spread all over, वयम् we, बिलम् cave, दृष्टवन्तः we saw.

52_10.translation: 'Drenched in water the swans, kuraras, and sarasas were seen emerging with water dripping from thier wings.
52_10.word_by_word: अस्मात् this, सलिलविस्रवैः by those with water dripping, पक्षैः with wings, जलक्लिन्नाः drenched in water, हंसाः swans, कुरराः kuraras, सारसाश्चैव sarasas also, पतत्रिणः birds, निष्पतन्ति flying out.

52_11.shloka: साध्वत्र प्रविशामेति मया तूक्ताः प्लवङ्गमाः।तेषामपि हि सर्वेषामनुमानमुपागतम्।।4.52.13।।
52_11.translation: 'I suggested to the fellowmonkeys to enter this cave, inferring that there would be water and all of them came to the same conclusion.
52_11.word_by_word: अत्र here, साधु it is proper, प्रविशाम let us enter, इति thus, मया by me, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, उक्ताः have been told, तेषाम् for them, सर्वेषामपि for all of them, अनुमानम् inferring, उपागतम् came in.

52_12.shloka: गच्छाम प्रविशामेति भर्तृकार्यत्वरान्विताः।ततो गाढं निपतिता गृह्य हस्तौ परस्परम्।।4.52.14।।
52_12.translation: 'We said, 'let us enter', since we were in a hurry to carry out our king's orders.Then we jumped in, holding one another's hand.
52_12.word_by_word: भर्तृकार्यत्वरान्विताः in haste to carry out the orders of our king, प्रविशामः let us enter, गच्छाम let us go, निपतिताः we jumped in, ततः then, परस्परम् each one holding the other, हस्तौ by hands, गाढम् firmly, गृह्य holding.

52_13.shloka: इदं प्रविष्टास्सहसा बिलं तिमिरसंवृतम्।एतन्नः कार्यमेतेन कृत्येन वयमागताः।।4.52.15।।त्वां चैवोपगतास्सर्वे परिद्यूना बुभुक्षिताः।
52_13.translation: 'Vexed and starved, we entered this grotto shrouded in darkness.This is our task and we reached here (in the process).
52_13.word_by_word: तिमिरसंवृतम् shrouded in darkness, इदं बिलम् this grotto, सहसा at once, प्रविष्टाः we entered, एतत् this, नः our, कार्यम् task, एतेन by this, कृत्येन by the task, वयम् we, आगताः we came, बुभुक्षिताः hungry ones, परिद्यूनाः vexed, सर्वे all of us, त्वाम् your, उपगताश्चैव we reached.

52_14.shloka: आतिथ्यधर्मदत्तानि मूलानि च फलानि च।।4.52.16।।अस्माभिरुपभुक्तानि बुभुक्षापरिपीडितैः।
52_14.translation: 'You have given us roots and fruits out of hospitality and we have been taken them driven by hunger and thirst.
52_14.word_by_word: बुभुक्षापरिपीडितैः tormented by hunger and thirst, अस्माभिः us, आतिथ्यधर्मदत्तानि  given out of hospitality, मूलानि च roots and, फलानि च and fruits, उपभुक्तानि have eaten.

52_15.shloka: यत्त्वया रक्षितास्सर्वे म्रियमाणा बुभुक्षया।।4.52.17।।ब्रूहि प्रत्युपकारार्थं किं ते कुर्वन्तु वानराः।
52_15.translation: 'We were dying from hunger when you saved us. Tell us what the monkeys can do to repay your debt?'.
52_15.word_by_word: बुभुक्षया by starvation, म्रियमाणाः dying, सर्वे all, यत् as such, त्वया by you, रक्षिताः saved, वानराः monkeys, ते to you, प्रत्युपकारार्थम् to repay you in turn, किं कुर्वन्तु what can they do, ब्रूहि  tell.

52_16.translation: To the leaders among the monkeys, knowers of dharma, who said this Svayamprabha replied:
52_16.word_by_word: तैः वानरैः by the monkeys, एवम् thus, उक्ताः addressed, धर्मज्ञौः by the knowers of dharma, स्वयंप्रभा Svayamprapbha, ततः then, सर्वान् all, वानरपुङ्गवान् leaders among the monkeys, इदम्  this, प्रत्युवाच replied.

52_17.shloka: सर्वेषां परितुष्टाऽस्मि वानराणां तरस्विनाम्।।4.52.19।।चरन्त्या मम धर्मेण न कार्यमिह केनचित्।
52_17.translation: 'I am very much pleased with all of you, smart monkeys. As I am engaged in the practice of righteousness, I do not need your services.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
52_17.word_by_word: तरस्विनाम् of those quick and energetic ones, सर्वेषाम् about all of you, वानराणाम् of  monkeys, परितुष्टा pleased, अस्मि I am, धर्मेण in rghteousness, चरन्त्याः while practising, मम to me, इह now, केनचित् any, कार्यम् service,  न no need.

53_1.shloka: [Svayamprabha helps the monkeys to reach out of the cave -- Angada regrets for exceeding the time limit -- proposes fasting unto death fearing punishment -- the monkeys decide to end their life rather than return without Sita.]एवमुक्तश्शुभं वाक्यं तापस्या धर्मसंहितम्।उवाच हनुमान्वाक्यं तामनिन्दितचेष्टिताम्।।4.53.1।।
53_1.translation: To the auspicious words of the righteous, blameless hermitess Hanuman replied:
53_1.word_by_word: तापस्या by the hermitess, एवम् that way, धर्मसंहितम् coupled with righteousness, शुभम् auspicious, वाक्यम् words, उक्तः expressed, हनुमान् Hanuman, अनिन्दितचेष्टिताम् blameless in actions, ताम् her, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.

53_2.shloka: शरणं त्वां प्रपन्ना स्म सर्वे वै धर्मचारिणीं।यः कृतस्समयोऽस्माकं सुग्रीवेण महात्मना।।4.53.2।।स च कालो ह्यतिक्रान्तो बिले च परिवर्तताम्।
53_2.translation: 'You are a righteous lady. You have given us refuge. Now in moving about the cave we have exceeded the time limit given by Sugriva.'
53_2.word_by_word: धर्मचारिणीम् to the righteous lady, त्वाम् you, सर्वे all, शरणं प्रसन्नाः स्मः have taken refuge, महात्मना by the great self, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, अस्माकं to us, यः such, समयः condition, कृतः having given, सः that, बिले in the cave, परिवर्तताम् while we were moving about, ह्यतिक्रान्तः exceeded.

53_3.word_by_word: सा such lady, त्वम् you, तस्मात् therefore, सुग्रीववचनात् Sugriva's words, अतिक्रान्तान् those who exceeded, गतायुषः lost our lives, घोरात् from the dreadful, अस्मात् from this, बिलात्  from this cave, उत्तारयितुम् to help us go out, अर्हसि should.

53_4.shloka: त्रातुमर्हसि नस्सर्वान्सुग्रीवभयकर्शितान्।।4.53.4।।महच्चकार्यमस्माभिः कर्तव्यं धर्मचारिणि।तच्चापि न कृतं कार्यमस्माभिरिह वासिभिः।।4.53.5।।
53_4.translation: 'O righteous lady we have a great task waiting. We are afraid of Sugriva as we could not accomplish our objective by staying here. Save us.'
53_4.word_by_word: धर्मचारिणि a woman of righteous practices, सुग्रीवभयकर्शितान् who are afraid of Sugriva, नः us, सर्वान् all, त्रातुम् to save, अर्हसि should, अस्माभिः by us, महत् great, कार्यं च task also, कर्तव्यम् should be done, इह now, वासिभिः staying here, अस्माभिः by us, तत् that, कार्यं चापि the objective, न कृतम् not accomplished.

53_5.shloka: एवमुक्ता हनुमता तापसी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।जीवता दुष्करं मन्ये प्रविष्टेन निवर्तितुम्।।4.53.6।।
53_5.translation: To the words of Hanuman the ascetic replied, 'I consider it difficult for any one who enters here to go back alive.'
53_5.word_by_word: हनुमता by Hanuman, एवम् in that manner, उक्ता being told, तापसी ascetic, वाक्यम्  these words, अब्रवीत् said, प्रविष्टेन by one who entered, जीवता with life, निवर्तितुम् to go back, दुष्करम् it is difficult, मन्ये I think.

53_6.shloka: तपसस्तु प्रभावेन नियमोपार्जितेन च।सर्वानेव बिलादस्मादुद्धरिष्यामि वानरान्।।4.53.7।।
53_6.translation: 'I will help all monkeys out of this cave by virtue of my power of asceticism duly practised.
53_6.word_by_word: नियमोपार्जितेन earned by practising, तपसः by asceticism, तु प्रभावेन by virtue of it, सर्वानेव all of you, वानरान् monkeys, अस्मात् बिलात् from this cave, उद्धरियिष्यामि I will help you out.

53_7.shloka: निमीलयत चक्षूंषि सर्वे वानरपुङ्गवाः।न हि निष्क्रमितुं शक्यमनिमीलितलोचनैः।।4.53.8।।
53_7.word_by_word: सर्वे all, वानरपुङ्गवाः great monkeys, चक्षूंषि eyes, निमीलयतः keep them closed, अनिमीलितलोचनैः if you do not close your eyes, निष्क्रमितुम् to get out, नशक्यं हि is not possible.

53_8.translation: Happy at the prospect of getting out (of the cave) they all not only closed their eyes but also covered them with their delicate fingers.
53_8.word_by_word: ततः then, गमनकाङ्क्षया with a desire to get out, हृष्टाः joyful ones, सर्वे all, सम्मीलिताः closed their eye lids, सहसा at once, सुकुमाराङ्गुलैः with delicate fingers, करैः with hands, दृष्टिम् eyes, पिदधुः closed.

53_9.translation: Then the great monkeys, faces covered with their hands, emerged from the cave in a moment.
53_9.word_by_word: तदा then, हस्तरुद्धमुखाः faces covered with hands, महात्मानः great souls, वानराः monkeys, तया with her help, निमेषान्तरमात्रेण in a moment, बिलात् from the cave, उत्तारिताः came out.

53_10.translation: The righteous hermitess released all the monkeys out of that difficult situation and said these words of consolation:
53_10.word_by_word: धर्मचारिणी righteous, तापसी ascetic, तत्र there, तान् सर्वान् all of them, विषमात् from the difficult situation, तस्मात् from that, निस्सृतान् those who were released, समाश्वास्य after consoling them all, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

53_11.shloka: एष विन्ध्यो गिरिश्श्रीमान्नानाद्रुमलताकुलः।एष प्रस्रवणश्शैलस्सागरोऽयं महोदधिः।।4.53.12।।स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु गमिष्यामि भवनं वानरर्षभाः।इत्युक्त्वा तद्बिलं श्रीमत्प्रविवेश स्वयम्प्रभा।।4.53.13।।
53_11.translation: 'This Vindhya mountain has a rich collection of trees and bushes. This is Prasravana hill and this is the great ocean.O monkeys. Good luck to you. (Now) I am going back home'. Having said so, Svayamprabha entered the splendid cave.
53_11.word_by_word: एषः this, श्रीमान् rich, नानाद्रुमलताकुलः filled with different kinds of trees and vines, विन्ध्यः Vindhya, गिरिः mountain, एषः this, प्रस्रवणः Prasravana, शैलः hill, अयम् this, सागरः sea, महोदधिः great ocean, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys वः you, स्वस्ति be happy, अस्तु so be it, भवनम् to my house, गमिष्यामि I will go, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, स्वयम्प्रभा Svayamprabha, श्रीमत् splendid, तत् बिलम् that cave, प्रविवेश entered.

53_12.translation: Then the monkeys saw the boundless, dreary ocean roaring wild with its terrific waves spread all over.
53_12.word_by_word: ततः then, ते they, घोरम् dreadful, वरुणालयम् abode of Varuna, अपारम् endless, अभिगर्जन्तम्  roaring wildly, घोरै: with terrific, ऊर्मिभिः with waves, आवृतम् spread over, सागरम् ocean, ददृशुः saw.

53_13.shloka: मयस्य मायाविहितं गिरिदुर्गं विचिन्वताम्।तेषां मासो व्यतिक्रान्तो यो राज्ञा समयः कृतः।।4.53.15।।
53_13.translation: While they were ransacking the impassable mountain created with the magical powers of Maya, the time limit of one month set by the king was over.
53_13.word_by_word: तेषाम् for them, मयस्य Maya's, मायाविहितम् created by his Maya, गिरिदुर्गम् impassable mountain, विचिन्वताम् while searching, यः such, राज्ञा by the king, समयः time set, कृतः was fixed, मासः month, व्यतिक्रान्तः exceeded.

53_14.shloka: विन्ध्यस्य तु गिरेः पादे सम्प्रपुष्पितपादपे।उपविश्य महाभागाश्चिन्तामापेदिरे तदा।।4.53.16।।
53_14.translation: Then the highsoul monkeys reached the hill adjacent to Vindhya mountain on which trees were in full bloom.They sat there, lost in thought.
53_14.word_by_word: तदा then, महाभागा: great souls, सम्प्रपुष्पितपादपे in a location where trees are in full bloom, विन्ध्यस्य तु of Vindhya, गिरेः of that mountain, पादे adjacent, उपविश्य sat, चिन्ताम् thinking, आपेदिरे did.

53_15.translation: Alarmed at the thought (of transgression of time limit), the monkeys kept looking at the tree tops entwined with a hundred oreepers heavily loaded with the flowers of spring.
53_15.word_by_word: ततः then, पुष्पातिभाराग्रान्  heavily loaded with flowers on top, लताशतसमावृतान् entwined by hundreds of creepers, वासन्तिकान् spring, द्रुमान् trees, दृष्ट्वा saw, भयशङ्किताः frightened, बभूवुः became.

53_16.translation: Having realised (looking at the flowers) that spring has set in and they have exceeded the time limit, they all fell down on the ground.
53_16.word_by_word: ते they, वसन्तम् spring, अनुप्राप्तम् set in, परस्परम् with one onather, प्रतिबुद्ध्वा after realising, नष्टसन्देशकालार्थाः having exceeded the time set, धरणीतले on the ground, निपेतुः fell down.

53_17.shloka: ततस्तान्कपिवृद्धांस्तु शिष्टांश्चैव वनौकसः।वाचा मधुरयाऽभाष्य यथावदनुमान्य च।।4.53.19।।स तु सिंहवृषस्कन्धः पीनायतभुजः कपिः।युवराजो महाप्राज्ञः अङ्गदो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।4.53.20।।
53_17.translation: Coming to a conclusion after due deliberation Angada, heir apparent, profoundly wise, endowed with sturdy and broad shoulders like those of a lion or a bull, spoke in a sweet voice to the elderly, respectable monkeys, dwellers of the forest:
53_17.word_by_word: ततः then, सिंहवृषस्कन्धः one who has shoulders like a lion or bull, पीनायतभुजः of sturdy and long arms, युवराजः heir apparent, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, कपिः monkey, अङ्गदः Angada, तान् them, कपिवृद्धांस्तु to the elderly monkeys, शिष्टान् respectable, वनैकसश्चैव forestdwellers (monkeys), मधुरया with a sweet, वाचा tone, आभाष्य spoke, यथावत् properly, अनुमान्य च after coming to a decision, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

53_18.shloka: शासनात्कपिराजस्य वयं सर्वे विनिर्गताः।मासः पूर्णो बिलस्थानां हरयः किं न बुद्ध्यते।।4.53.21।।
53_18.translation: 'O monkeys don't you realize that all of us have come here at the command of the monkey king, and while we were in the cave a whole month has gone by?
53_18.word_by_word: हरयः O monkeys, वयं सर्वे all of us, कपिराजस्य monkey king's, शासनात् by his command,  विनिर्गताः came here, बिलस्थानाम् for us staying in the cave, मासः a month, पूर्णः is completed, किम् what, न बुद्ध्यते do you not know?

53_19.shloka: वयमाश्वयुजे मासि कालसङ्ख्याव्यवस्थिताः।प्रस्थितास्सोऽपि चातीतः किमतः कार्यमुत्तरम्।।4.53.22।।
53_19.translation: 'We started our journey in the month of Ashvayuja with a certain time limit. That has exceeded. What is the future course of action?
53_19.word_by_word: वयम् we, कालसङ्ख्याव्यवस्थिताः with time limit, आश्वयुजे मासि the month of Ashvayuja, प्रस्थिताः we started our journey, सोऽपि even that has, अतीतः exceeded, अतः therefore, उत्तरं later, कार्यम् task, किम् what?

53_20.word_by_word: भवन्तः all of you, प्रत्ययम् trusted, प्राप्ताः you have got, नीतिमार्गविशारदाः experts in morals, भर्तुः king's, हितेषु  wellwishers, अभिरताः dedicated, सर्वकर्मसु in all tasks, निसृष्टाः sent with specific instructions.

53_21.shloka: कर्मस्वप्रतिमास्सर्वे दिक्षु विश्रुतपौरुषाः।मां पुरस्कृत्य निर्याताः पिङ्गाक्षप्रतिचोदिताः।।4.53.24।।
53_21.translation: 'You are all celebrated for bravery and incomparable in your activities. You have followed me in obedience to the orders of the tawnyeyed Sugriva.
53_21.word_by_word: सर्वे all, कर्मसु in actions, अप्रतिमाः incomparable, दिक्षु in all quarters, विश्रुतपौरुषाः very famous for bravery, पिङ्गाक्षप्रतिचोदिताः sent by tawnyeyed Sugriva, माम् me, पुरस्कृत्य obeying the orders, निर्याताः you have followed me.

53_22.shloka: इदानीमकृतार्थानां मर्तव्यं नात्र संशयः।हरिराजस्य सन्देशमकृत्वा कस्सुखी भवेत्।।4.53.25।।
53_22.translation: 'We should be killed since we have failed to achieve the objective (of finding Sita). There is no doubt about it. Who can live in peace without executing the orders of the king?
53_22.word_by_word: इदानीम् at this time, अकृतार्थानाम् not having achieved the objective (of finding Sita), मर्तव्यम् we should die, अत्र here, संशयः doubt, न not, हरिराजस्य the king's, सन्देशम् orders, अकृत्वा not executing, कः who, सुखी happy, भवेत् will be

53_23.shloka: तस्मिन्नतीते काले तु सुग्रीवेण कृते स्वयम्।प्रायोपवेशनं युक्तं सर्वेषां च वनौकसाम्।।4.53.26।।
53_23.translation: 'Now that the time limit fixed by Sugriva has expired, the right thing to do for the monkeys is to fast unto death.
53_23.word_by_word: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, कृते fixed, तस्मिन् काले at this time, अतीते when exceeded, सर्वेषाम् for all of us,वनौकसाम् for the forest dwellers (monkeys) स्वयम् personally, प्रायोपवेशनम् fasting unto death, युक्तम् is right.

53_24.shloka: तीक्ष्णः प्रकृत्या सुग्रीवस्स्वामिभावे व्यवस्थितः।न क्षमिष्यति नस्सर्वानपराधकृतो गतान्।।4.53.27।।
53_24.translation: 'By nature Sugriva is harsh, and being a king now, he will not forgive us who are real offenders and have not done the task assigned.
53_24.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रकृत्या by nature, तीक्ष्णः harsh, स्वामिभावे as a king, व्यवस्थितः consecrated, गतान् when we reach, अपराधकृतः  us who are real offenders, नः not, सर्वान् to all, न क्षमिष्यति will not forgive us.

53_25.shloka: अप्रवृत्तौ च सीतायाः पापमेव करिष्यति।तस्मात् क्षममिहाद्यैव गन्तुं प्रायोपवेशनम् हि नः।।4.53.28।।त्यक्त्वा पुत्रांश्च दारांश्च धनानि च गृहाणि च।
53_25.word_by_word: सीतायाः Sita, अप्रवृत्तौ for not bringing any clue, पापमेव sin, करिष्यति he will do, तस्मात् therefore, पुत्रांश्च sons, दारांश्च wives, धनानि च and wealth, गृहाणि च and houses, त्यक्त्या  bid farewell to, इह here, अद्यैव today itself, प्रायोपवेशनम् death, गन्तुम् take recourse, क्षमम् proper.

53_26.shloka: धृवं नो हिंसिता राजा सर्वान्प्रतिगतानितः।।4.53.29।।वधेनाप्रतिरूपेण श्रेयान्मृत्युरिहैव नः।
53_26.translation: 'Surely the king will torture us by awarding death sentence in a singular manner when we go back. It is better for us to meet death here itself.
53_26.word_by_word: राजा king, इतः here, प्रतिगतान् when we return, नः us, सर्वान् all, अप्रतिरूपेण in an incomparable manner, वधेन with death sentence, ध्रुवम् surely, हिंसिता will torture us, नः us, इहैव here itself, मृत्यु: death, श्रेयान् it is better.

53_27.translation: 'I was not installed as heir apparent by Sugriva. I was made crowned prince by king Rama, the king of the people who never hurts others.
53_27.word_by_word: अहम् I, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, यौवराज्येन as heir apparent, न अभिषेचितः not installed, अक्लिष्टकर्मणा who never harms others, नरेन्द्रेण by the king of the people, रामेण by Rama, अभिषिक्तः crowned prince, अस्मि I was.

53_28.shloka: स पूर्वं बद्धवैरो मां राजा दृष्ट्वा व्यतिक्रमम्।।4.53.31।।घातयिष्यति दण्डेन तीक्ष्णेन कृतनिश्चयः।
53_28.translation: 'The Monkeyking nursed bitter enmity against me even earlier. Now seeing my lapse, he will decidedly inflict severe punishment on me.
53_28.word_by_word: पूर्वम् earlier, बद्धवैरः nursed bitter enmity, सः राजा that king, व्यतिक्रमम् lapse, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, कृतनिश्चयः decidedly, माम् me, तीक्ष्णेन with a severe, दण्डेन with punishment, घातयिष्यति he will inflict.

53_29.shloka: किं मे सुहृदभिर्व्यसनं पश्यद्भिर्जीवितान्तरे।।4.53.32।।इहैव प्रायमासिष्ये पुण्ये सागररोधसि।
53_29.translation: 'I do not want my friends to see my calamity, my death. I shall sit here on the sacred shores of this ocean and await my death'.
53_29.word_by_word: जीवितान्तरे at the end of life, मे व्यसनम् my calamity, पश्यद्भिः by seeing, सुहृदभि: by my friends, किम् what, इहैव here itself, पुण्ये in a sacred, सागररोधसि on the shores of the ocean, प्रायमासिष्ये I shall sit down and await my death.

53_30.shloka: एतच्छ्रुत्वा कुमारेण युवराजेन भाषितम्।।4.53.33।।सर्वे ते वानरश्रेष्ठाः करुणं वाक्यमब्रुवन्।
53_30.translation: Hearing the young heir apparent thus speaking, the best of the monkeys kindly responded:
53_30.word_by_word: युवराजेन by heir apparent, कुमारेण by the young prince, भाषितम् talk, एतत् this, श्रुत्वा heard, सर्वे all, ते they, वानरश्रेष्ठाः  best of the monkeys करुणम् kindly, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रुवन् said.

53_31.shloka: तीक्ष्णः प्रकृत्या सुग्रीवः प्रियासक्तश्च राघवः।।4.53.34।।अदृष्टायां तु वैदेह्यां दृष्ट्वाऽस्मांश्त समागतान्।राघवप्रियकामार्थं घातयिष्यत्यसंशयम्।।4.53.35।।
53_31.translation: 'By nature Sugriva is harsh. Rama is devoted to his wife. Therefore, if Sugriva sees that we have not found Vaidehi and have returned (without fulfilling the mission) he will award death sentence to us in order to please Rama.There is no doubt.
53_31.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रकृत्या by nature, तीक्ष्णः harsh, राघव: Rama, प्रियासक्तः devoted to his wife, वैदेह्याम् princess of Videha, अदृष्टायाम् when she is not found, अस्मान् us, तु indeed, समागतान् reaching, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, राघवप्रियकामार्थम् in order to please Rama, असंशयम् without any doubt, घातयिष्यति he will punish us to death.

53_32.shloka: न क्षमं चापराद्धानां गमनं स्वामिपार्श्वतः।इहैव सीतामन्विष्य प्रवृत्तिमुपलभ्य वा।।4.53.36।।नो चेद्गच्छाम तं वीरं गमिष्यामो यमक्षयम्।
53_32.translation: 'Those who have failed in their mission, being offenders should not go to meet the king. Offenders are not forgiven. Here itself we will search for Sita and if we are able to know her whereabouts we will go back. Or else we will go to the abode of Yama'.
53_32.word_by_word: अपराद्धानाम् for offenders, स्वामिपार्श्वतः to the king's presence, गमनम् going, नक्षमम् is not proper, इहैव here itself, सीताम् Sita, अन्विष्य after searching, प्रवृत्तिम् whereabouts, उपलभ्य वा or after finding out, तं वीरम् to that hero, नो गच्छाम चेत् if we cannot go, यमक्षयम् to the abode of Yama, गमिष्यामः we will go.

53_33.shloka: प्लवङ्गमानां तु भयार्दितानांश्रुत्वा वचस्तार इदं बभाषे।अलं विषादेन बिलं प्रविश्यवसाम सर्वे यदि रोचते वः।।4.53.37।।
53_33.translation: 'On hearing the words of the frightened monkeys, Tara said, 'Enough of this sorrow. If it pleases you, we will all go to the cave and reside there' ''
53_33.word_by_word: तारः Tara, भयार्दितानाम् those shaken with fear, प्लवङ्गमानाम् of the monkeys, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, इदम् this, बभाषे he spoke, विषादेन with sorrow, अलम् enough, वः to you, रोचते यदि if it pleases you, सर्वे all of us, बिलम् cave, प्रविश्य after entering, वसाम let us reside.

53_34.shloka: इदं हि मायाविहितं सुदुर्गमंप्रभूतवृक्षोदकभोज्यपेयकम्।इहास्ति नो नैव भयं पुरन्दरान्न राघवाद्वानरराजतोऽपि वा।।4.53.38।।
53_34.translation: 'This cave built by magic is inaccessible. It has a number of trees, water, eatables and drinks. (If we live here) we need not be afraid of even Indra, the breaker of enemy citadels or even of Rama or also of the king of monkeys'.
53_34.word_by_word: मायाविहितम् built by magic, प्रभूतवृक्षोदकभोज्यपेयकम् with many trees, water, food and drinks, इदम् this, सुदुर्गमं हि inaccessible, इह here, नः for us, पुरन्दरात् from Indra, the breaker of enemy citadel, भयम् fear, नैव not there, राघवात् of Rama even, वानरराजतोऽपि वा also of king of monkeys, न not.

53_35.shloka: श्रुत्वाऽङ्गदस्यापि वचोऽनुकूलमूचुश्च सर्वे हरयः प्रतीताः।यथा न हिंस्येम तथा विधानमसक्तमद्यैव विधीयतां नः।।4.53.39।।
53_35.translation: All the monkeys agreed to the favourable suggestion of Tara which was acceptable to Angada. 'A plan may be made in such a way by which we will not be killed by the king. Our strategy should be delinked from the conditions laid down by the king. Let us not face punishment' said the monkeys.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftythird sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
53_35.word_by_word: अङ्गदस्य Angada's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सर्वे all, हरयः monkeys, प्रतीताः became agreeable, अनुकूलम् favourable, ऊचुः spoke, यथा as, न हिंस्येम we will not be punished, तथा that way, नः for us, अद्यैव now itself, विधानम् strategy, असक्तम् not conditional, विदीयताम्  be planned.

54_1.shloka: [Hanuman's startegy to  change Angada.]तथा ब्रुवति तारे तु ताराधिपतिवर्चसि।अथ मेने हृतं राज्यं हनूमानङ्गदेन तत्।।4.54.1।।
54_1.translation: Hanuman listened to the proposal of Tara, whose face was like the Moon, lord of the stars. (After listening to Tara) he thought Angada might take over the kingdom from Sugriva.
54_1.word_by_word: ताराधिपतिवर्चसि face like the moon, lord of stars, तारे when Tara, तथा thus, ब्रुवति spoke, अथ then, हनूमान् Hanuman, अङ्गदेन by Angada, तत् that, राज्यम् kingdom, हृतम् taken over, मेने thought.

54_2.shloka: बुद्ध्या ह्यष्टाङ्गया युक्तं चतुर्बलसमन्वितम्।चतुर्दशगुणं मेने हनूमान्वालिनस्सुतम्।।4.54.2।।
54_2.translation: Hanuman thought Vali's son possessed in addition to his intellect, eight kinds of limbs, four kinds of strength and fourteen qualities (required of a king):
54_2.word_by_word: हनूमान् Hanuman, वालिनः Vali's, सुतम् son, अष्टाङ्गया with eight limbs, बुद्ध्या with intellect, युक्तम् endowed, चतुर्बलसमन्वितम् possessed of four kinds of strength, चतुर्दशगुणम् having fourteen qualities, मेने thought.

54_3.shloka: आपूर्यमाणं शश्वच्च तेजोबलपराक्रमैः।शशिनं शुक्लपक्षादौ वर्धमानमिव श्रिया।।4.54.3।।बृहस्पतिसमं बुद्ध्या विक्रमे सदृशं पितुः।शुश्रूषमाणं तारस्य शक्रस्येव पुरन्दरम्।।4.54.4।।भर्तुरर्थे परिश्रान्तं सर्वशास्त्रविदांवरम्।अभिसन्धातुमारेभे हनूमानङ्गदं ततः।।4.54.5।।
54_3.translation: Hanuman proceeded to win over Angada, who was ever shining in strength and valour, who was growing in majesty constantly like the Moon in the bright fornight, whose intellectual prowess was equal to that of Brhaspati, who was equal to his father in valour and who was wellversed in all sastras. Angada was listening toTara like Indra listened to Sukra (preceptor of the demons).
54_3.word_by_word: शश्वत् eternally, तेजोबलपराक्रमैः with brilliance, strength and valour, आपूर्यमाणम् being filled, शुक्लपक्षादौ  at the beginning of the bright fortnight, शशिनमिव like the Moon, श्रिया with majesty, वर्धमानम् constantly growing, बुद्ध्या in intellect, बृहस्पतिसमम् equal to Brhaspati, विक्रमे in valour, पितुः of his father, सदृशम् like to, शुक्रस्य Sukra's, पुरन्दरम् इव like Indra, the breaker of citadel, तारस्य Tara's, शुश्रूषमाणम् serving, भर्तुः the king, अर्थे for the sake of, परिश्रान्तम् tired, अङ्गदम् Angada, सर्वशाश्त्रविदांवरम् versed in all sastras, हनुमान् Hanuman, ततः then, अभिसन्धातुम् to consult deliberately, आरेभे started.

54_4.translation: Resorting to the third strategy out of the four ways of achieving an objective Hanuman created differences among the monkeys with skilful arguments. (Sama, Dana, Bheda and Danda are the four means. Hanuman adopted Bheda as a means of winning over an enemy).
54_4.word_by_word: सः that, चतुर्णाम् of the four, उपायानाम् of means, तृतीयम् third one, उपवर्णयन् while describing, तान्सर्वान् all of them, वानरान् monkeys, वाक्यसम्पदा with wealth of arguments, भेदयामास created differences.

54_5.translation: When there were differences among the monkeys over the issue, Hanuman intimidated Angada with frightening words expressing his anger, using skilful arguments:
54_5.word_by_word: तेषु of them, सर्वेषु  all, भिन्नेषु of the differences, ततः then, कोपोपायसमन्वितैः strategy to cause both anger and expediency, भीषणैः with frightening, बहुभि: by many, वाक्यैः with arguments, अङ्गदम् to Angada, अभीषयत् frightened.

54_6.shloka: त्वं समर्थतरः पित्रा युद्धे तारेय वै धुरम्।दृढं धारयितुं शक्तः कपिराज्यं यथा पिता।।4.54.8।।
54_6.translation: 'O Son of Tara you are, indeed, very efficient like your father in combat. You can hold firmly the responsibilty of the vanara kingdom like your father.
54_6.word_by_word: तारेय O son of Tara, त्वम् you, युद्धे in combat, पित्रा compared to your father, समर्थतरः you are very efficient, वै indeed, धुरम् yoke (responsibility of running the kingdom), पिता यथा like your father, कपिराज्यम् kingdom of the monkeys, दृढम् firmly, धारयितुम् to hold, शक्तः capable.

54_7.shloka: नित्यमस्थिरचित्ता हि कपयो हरिपुङ्गव।नाज्ञाप्यं विषहिष्यन्ति पुत्रदारान्विना त्वया।।4.54.9।।
54_7.translation: 'O leader among  monkeys Vanaras are always fickleminded. Being away from their sons and wives they will not always carry out your command and stay here forever.
54_7.word_by_word: हरिपुङ्गव O leader of monkeys, कपयः vanaras, नित्यम् always, अस्थिरचित्ताः हि they are fickle minded, पुत्रदारान् sons and wives, विना without, त्वया with you, आज्ञाप्यम् command, न विषहिष्यन्ति will never tolerate.

54_8.shloka: त्वां नैतेह्यनुयुञ्जेयु: प्रत्यक्षं प्रवदामि ते।यथायं जाम्बवान्नीलस्सुहोत्रश्च महाकपिः।।4.54.10।।न ह्यहं ते इमे सर्वे सामदानादिभिर्गुणैः।दण्डेन वा त्वया शक्यास्सुग्रीवादपकर्षितम्।।4.54.11।।
54_8.translation: 'This  I am telling you openly and frankly. These monkeys are not going to be obedient to you. Neither Jambavan, nor Nila nor the great monkey Suhotra nor even myself would subscribe to this opinion (of staying in the cave) and follow you. It is not possible for you to keep us or these monkeys from Sugriva through the policy of appeasement like Sama, Dana, Bheda or even Danda (persuasion, giving gifts, creating differences or imposing punishment).
54_8.word_by_word: प्रत्यक्षम् directly, ते to you, यथा as, प्रवदामि I am speaking, अयम् this, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, नीलः Nila, महाकपिः great monkey, सुहोत्रश्च Suhotra also, एते  them, त्वाम् you, नानुयुञ्जेयुः हि will not following you, अहम् I am, न हि not, ते you, इमे these, सर्वे all, सामदानादिभिः through the policy of appeasement, गुणैः by merit, दण्डेन by punishment, त्वया by you, सुग्रीवात् from Sugriva, अपकर्षितुम् to avert, न शक्याः not possible.

54_9.translation: 'It is said that when a strong man fights a weak one, the weak opponent should adopt the strategy of asana (watching) for selfprotection. The weak should not enter into combat with the strong.
54_9.word_by_word: बलीयस: with a strong man, दुर्बलेन by a weak one, विगृह्य waging war, आसनम् अपि remaining quiet, watching (a kind of war strategy), आहुः it is said, तस्मात् therefore, आत्मरक्षाकरः for selfprotection, दुर्बलः a weak one, न विगृह्णीत should not wage.

54_10.shloka: यां चेमां मन्यसे धात्रीमेतद्बिलमिति श्रुतम्।एतल्लक्ष्मणबाणानामीषत्कार्यं विदारणे।।4.54.13।।
54_10.translation: 'You may think it safe to stay here in this opening of the earth. It is a petty task for the arrows of Lakshmana to break open this socalled cave.
54_10.word_by_word: याम् whichever, इमाम् this, धात्रीम् earth, मन्यसे you may be thinking, एतत् this, बिलम् cave, इति in this way, श्रुतम् is known, लक्ष्मणबाणानाम् for the arrows of Lakshmana, एतत् this, विदारणम् breaking, ईषत्कार्यम् is a very small task.

54_11.shloka: स्वल्पं हि कृतमिन्द्रेण क्षिपता ह्यशनिं पुरा।लक्ष्मणो निशितैर्बाणैर्भिन्ध्यात्पत्रपुटं यथा।।4.54.14।।
54_11.translation: 'In the past Indra had done a small damage (to the cave) with his thunderbolt. But with his sharp arrows Lakshmana will shatter the cave easily as though it is a leaf cup.
54_11.word_by_word: पुरा earlier, अशनिम् a thunderbolt, क्षिपता by throwing, इन्द्रेण by Indra, स्वल्पम् a little, कृतं हि has done, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, निशितै: with sharp ones, बाणैः with arrows, पत्रपुटम् यथा like tearing a leaf cup, भिन्द्यात् he can shatter.

54_12.shloka: लक्ष्मणस्य च नाराचा बहवस्सन्ति तद्विधाः।वज्राशनिसमस्पर्शा गिरीणामपि दारणाः।।4.54.15।।
54_12.translation: 'Lakshmna has many such iron arrows that are equal to the thunderbolt. They can even split the mountains.
54_12.word_by_word: वज्राशनिसमस्पर्शाः whose touch has the effect of a thunderbolt, गिरीणामपि even of the mountains, दारणाः breakers, तद्विधाः similarly, बहवः many, लक्ष्मणस्य with Lakshmana, नाराचाः iron arrows, सन्ति there are, च and.

54_13.shloka: अवस्थाने यदैव त्वमासिष्यसि परन्तप।तदैव हरयस्सर्वे त्यक्ष्यन्ति कृतनिश्चयाः।4.54.16।।
54_13.translation: 'O scorcher of enemies the moment you decide to establish yourself here, all thesemonkeys will surely desert you.
54_13.word_by_word: परन्तप O scorcher of enemies, त्वम् you, यदैव whenever, अवस्थाने to stay here, आसिष्यसि  decide, तदैव at that moment, सर्वे all these, हरयः monkeys, कृतनिश्चयाः decidedly,  त्यक्ष्यन्ति desert

54_14.shloka: स्मरन्तः पुत्रदाराणां नित्योद्विग्ना बुभुक्षिताः।खेदिता दुःखशय्याभिस्त्वां करिष्यन्ति पृष्ठतः।।4.54.17।।
54_14.translation: 'The memory of their sons and wives will haunt these hungry monkeys. The inconvenient bed will make them so depressed that they will leave you behind.
54_14.word_by_word: पुत्रदाराणाम् about their sons and wives, स्मरन्तः while they are remembering, नित्योद्विग्नाः always anxious, बुभुक्षिताः hungry ones, दुःखशय्याभिः with inconvenient beds, खेदिताः  depressed, त्वाम् you, पृष्ठतः करिष्यन्ति will leave you behind.

54_15.translation: 'Left out of your friends and relatives,who are your wellwishers, you will be very frightened even by the trembling of a blade of grass.
54_15.word_by_word: सुहृद्भिश्च even with friends also, हितकामैः by the wellwishers, बन्धुभिश्च even with your relatives, हीनः left out, सः त्वम् such a person, स्पन्दमानात् trembling, तृणादपि from a blade of grass, भृशोद्विग्नः you will be very much frightened, भविष्यसि you will be.

54_16.shloka: न च जातु न हिंस्युस्त्वां घोरा लक्ष्मणसायकाः ।अपवृत्तं जिघांसन्तो महावेगा दुरासदाः ।। 4.54.19 ।।

54_17.shloka: न च जातु न हिंस्युस्त्वा घोरा लक्ष्मणसायकाः।अपावृत्तं जिघांसन्तो महावेगा दुरासदाः।।4.54.20।।
54_17.translation: 'It is not that Lakshmana's dreadful arrows flying at great speed will not torture you. It will be difficult for you to avert them as they are eager to kill an escaping enemy.
54_17.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणसायकाः Lakshmana's arrows, त्वा (म्) you, न च जातु न हिंस्यु: it is not that they do not torture you, घोराः dreadful, अपावृत्तम् an escaping enemy, जिघांसन्तः while desiring to kill, महावेगाः of great speed, दुरासदाः  difficult to challenge.

54_18.shloka: अस्माभिस्तु गतं सार्धं विनीतवदुपस्थितम्।आनुपूर्व्यात्तु सुग्रीवो राज्ये त्वां स्थापयिष्यति।।4.54.21।।
54_18.translation: 'If along with us you approach Sugriva in a humble manner he will make you his successor to the kingdom.
54_18.word_by_word: अस्माभिः सार्धम् along with us, गतम् when you go, विनीतवत् humbly, उपस्थितम् approached, त्वाम् you, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राज्ये in the kingdom, आनुपूर्व्यात् following the law of succession, स्थापयिष्यति he will make you king, तु indeed.

54_19.shloka: धर्मकामः पितृव्यस्ते प्रीतिकामो दृढव्रतः।शुचिस्सत्यप्रतिज्ञश्च न त्वां जातु जिघांसति।।4.54.22।।
54_19.translation: 'Your father's brother is virtuous, wellintentioned, loving, steadfast in action, and true to his promise. He will not kill you.
54_19.word_by_word: ते your, पितृव्यः father's brother, धर्मकामः a goodintentioned, प्रीतिकामः  pleasureloving, दृढव्रतः steadfast, शुचिः virtuous one, सत्यप्रतिज्ञश्च one who is true to his promise, त्वाम् you also, जातु go with, न जिघांसति will not punish you.

54_20.shloka: प्रियकामश्च ते मातुस्तदर्थं चास्य जीवितम्।तस्यापत्यं च नास्त्यन्यत्तस्मादङ्गद गम्यताम्।।4.54.23।।
54_20.translation: 'Your mother is his life and he would love to please her. He has no offspring other than you. Therefore, go back.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुष्पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
54_20.word_by_word: ते your, मातुः mother's, प्रियकामश्च he would like to please her, अस्य जीवितम् his life, तदर्थं च for that purpose, तस्य her, अन्यत् another one, अपत्यं च offspring, नास्ति is not, अङ्गद Angada, तस्मात् therefore, गम्यताम् go back.

55_1.shloka: [ Angada resolves not to return -- monkeys decide to fast unto death]श्रुत्वा हनुमतो वाक्यं प्रश्रितं धर्मसंहितम्।स्वामिसत्कारसंयुक्तमङ्गदो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।4.55.1।।
55_1.translation: On hearing Hanuman's humble words (of advice) consistent with righteousness and full of devotion to his master, the king, Angada said:
55_1.word_by_word: हनुमतः Hanuman's, प्रश्रितम् humble, धर्मसंहितम् consistent with righteousness, स्वामिसत्कारसंयुक्तम् full of devotion to his master, the king, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अङ्गदः Angada, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

55_2.translation: 'Sugriva has no steadfastness, purity of body and mind, compassion, rectitude, valour and patience.
55_2.word_by_word: स्थैर्यम् steadfastness, आत्ममनश्शौचम् purity of body and mind, आनृशंस्यम् compassion, अथ and, आर्जवम् rectitude, विक्रमश्चैव valour, धैर्यं च as well as patience, सुग्रीवे in Sugriva, नोपपद्यते not found.

55_3.shloka: भ्रातुर्ज्येष्ठस्य यो भार्यां जीवतो महिषीं प्रियाम्।धर्मेण मातरं यस्तु स्वीकरोति जुगुप्सितः।।4.55.3।।कथं स धर्मं जानीते येन भ्रात्रा महात्मना।युद्धायाभिनियुक्तेन बिलस्य पिहितं मुखम्।।4.55.4।।
55_3.translation: 'He usurped his elder brother's queen, while he was still alive. It is morally abominable since an elder brother's wife is like a mother. How can a person who blocks the entrance of a cave while his noble brother is engaged in fighting inside be treated as righteous?
55_3.word_by_word: जुगुप्सितः despicable person, यः who, ज्येष्ठस्य of elder's, भ्रातुः brother's, जीवतः while he was alive, धर्मेण from the point of view of morality, मातरं motherlike, भार्याम् wife, प्रियाम् loved, महिषीम् queen, स्वीकरोति he took over (used her as his wife), महात्मना by the great, भ्रात्रा by the brother, युद्धाय for combat, अभिनियुक्तेन engaged, येन by whom, बिलस्य cave's, मुखम् entrance, पिहितम् blocked, सः he, धर्मम् morals, कथम् how, जानीते will he know?

55_4.shloka: सत्यात्पाणिगृहीतश्च कृतकर्मा महायशाः।विस्मृतो राघवो येन स कस्य तु कृतं स्मरेत्।।4.55.5।।
55_4.translation: 'Illustrious Rama, who faithfully held his hand was forgotten after he received his help. Indeed whose help would he remember?
55_4.word_by_word: सत्यात् truly, पाणिगृहीतश्च held his hand, कृतकर्मा accepted, महायशाः an illustrious man, राघवः Rama, येन whom, विस्मृतः forgotten, सः he, कस्य whose, तु indeed, कृतम् help, स्मरेत् will he remember?

55_5.shloka: लक्ष्मणस्य भयाद्येन नाधर्मभयभीरुणा।आदिष्टा मार्गितुं सीतां धर्ममस्मिन्कथं भवेत्।।4.55.6।।
55_5.translation: 'Sugriva ordered search for Sita out of fear of Lakshmana and not out of fear of unrighteousness. How can such a man be pious?
55_5.word_by_word: येन by whom, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, भयात् out of fear, सीताम् Sita, मार्गितुम् to search, आदिष्टाः ordered, अधर्मभयभीरुणा out of fear of unrighteousness, न not, अस्मिन् in this, धर्मम् righteousness, कथम् how, भवेत् will be?

55_6.shloka: तस्मिन्पापे कृतघ्ने तु स्मृतिहीने चलात्मनि।आर्यः को विश्वसेज्जातु तत्कुलीनो जिजीविषुः।।4.55.7।।
55_6.translation: 'He is a sinner and an ungrateful person as he does not remember others' help. He is fickleminded. Which respectable person will believe him? Which member of his family will wish to live?
55_6.word_by_word: पापे in a sinner, कृतघ्ने in an ungrateful one, स्मृतिहीने in one devoid of memory, चलात्मनि in a fickleminded self, तस्मिन् in him, जातु indeed, आर्यः a respectable one, कः who, विश्वसेत् have confidence, जिजीविषुः who wishes to live, तत् कुलीनः born in that family.

55_7.shloka: राज्ये पुत्रः प्रतिष्ठाप्यस्सगुणो विगुणोऽपि वा।कथं शत्रुकुलीनं मां सुग्रीवो जीवयिष्यति।।4.55.8।।
55_7.translation: 'If I am the king's son, virtuous or otherwise, I will be installed in the kingdom (as successor). How can Sugriva suffer me to live when I am his enemy's descendant?
55_7.word_by_word: सुगुणः virtuous, विगुणोऽपि or not virtuous also, पुत्रः a son, राज्ये in the kingdom, प्रतिष्ठाप्यः should be installed, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, शत्रुकुलीनम् enemy's descendant, माम् me, कथम् how, जीवयिष्यति will allow me to live.

55_8.shloka: भिन्नमन्त्रोऽपराद्धश्च हीनशक्तिः कथं ह्यहम्।किष्किन्धां प्राप्य जीवेयमनाथ इव दुर्बलः।।4.55.9।।
55_8.translation: 'My alternate strategy has failed. I have already made a mistake (by announcing my plan). My advisors are holding different views. I am powerless. How can a weakling, an orphan like me live in Kishkinda?
55_8.word_by_word: भिन्नमन्त्रः my effort failed (my counsels are divided), अपराद्धश्च a crime too, हीनशक्तिः powerless, अहम् I am, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, प्राप्य after reaching, दुर्बलः a weak person, अनाथ इव like an orphan, कथम् how, जीवेयम् will I live.

55_9.shloka: पांशुदण्डेन हि मां बन्धने नोपपादयेत्।शठः क्रूरो नृशंसश्च सुग्रीवो राज्यकारणात्।।4.55.10।।
55_9.translation: 'Sugriva is deceitful, cruel and treacherous. He will inflict secret punishment on me by way of imprisonment for the sake of the kingdom.
55_9.word_by_word: शठः deceitful person, क्रूरः cruel one, नृशंसः treacherous person, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राज्यकारणात् for the sake of kingdom, माम् me, उपांशुदण्डेन with secret punishment, बन्धनेन imprisonment, उपपादयेत् inflict.

55_10.shloka: बन्धनाद्वाऽवसादान्मे श्रेयः प्रायोपवेशनम्।अनुजानीत मां सर्वे गृहं गच्छन्तु वानराः।।4.55.11।।
55_10.translation: 'It is better for me to fast unto death rather than suffer imprisonment. Permit me to do so. You may all go back.
55_10.word_by_word: बन्धनाद्वा with imprisonment or, अवसादात् with pain, मे me, प्रायोपवेशनम् by fasting unto death, श्रेयः is better, सर्वे all, वानराः monkeys माम् me, अनुजानीत you may permit, गृहम् home, गच्छन्तु may go.

55_11.shloka: अहं वः प्रतिजानामि नागमिष्याम्यहं पुरीम्।इहैव प्रायमासिष्ये श्रेयो मरणमेव मे।।4.55.12।।
55_11.translation: 'I swear I will not return to the city. I will fast unto death here only. Death for me is desirable.
55_11.word_by_word: अहम् I am, वः to you, प्रतिजानामि I pledge, अहम् I am, पुरीम् to city, न आगमिष्यामि I will not come, इहैव here only, प्रायम् आसिष्ये I seek death by fasting, मे to me, मरणमेव death alone, श्रेयः better.

55_12.shloka: अभिवादनपूर्वं हि राघवौ बलशालिनौ।अभिवादनपूर्वं तु राजा कुशलमेव च।।4.55.13।।वाच्यस्तातो यवीयान्मे सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः।
55_12.translation: 'Convey my greetings with due courtesy to Rama and Lakshmana on my behalf and my respects to my father's younger brother, king of monkeys, Sugriva and wish him well.
55_12.word_by_word: बलशालिनौ two powerful ones, राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, अभिवादनपूर्वम् greet them with due courtesy on my behalf, वानरेश्वरः king of monkeys, मे to me, यवीयान् तातः father's younger brother, राजा king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अभिवादनपूर्वम् by conveying my respects, कुशलम् wellbeing, वाच्यः greet.

55_13.shloka: आरोग्यपूर्वं कुशलं वाच्या माता रुमा च मे।।4.55.14।।मातरं चैव मे तारामाश्वासयितुमर्हथ।
55_13.translation: 'You should convey my mother as well as Ruma my good wishes for their health and wellbeing. You should console my mother Tara also.
55_13.word_by_word: मे my, माता mother, रुमा च also Ruma, आरोग्यपूर्वम् enquire about their health, कुशलम् wellbeing, वाच्या by words, मे my, मातरम् mother, ताराम् Tara, आश्वासयितुं चैव to console, अर्हथ you should.

55_14.shloka: प्रकृत्या प्रियपुत्रा सा सानुक्रोशा तपस्विनी।।4.55.15।।विनष्टमिह मां श्रुत्वा व्यक्तं हास्यति जीवितम्।
55_14.translation: 'By nature my mother, is compassionate. She is fond of me. (But) she is helpless. On hearing about my death, she will certainly give up her life'.
55_14.word_by_word: प्रकृत्या by nature, सानुक्रोशा a compassionate woman, प्रियपुत्रा fond of her son, तपस्विनी a helpless lady, सा she, इह here, माम् me, विनष्टम् dead, श्रुत्वा on hearing, व्यक्तम् certainly, जीवितम् life, हास्यति she will give up.

55_15.shloka: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं वृद्धांस्तानभिवाद्य च।।4.55.16।।विवेश चाङ्गदो भूमौ रुदन्दर्भेषु दुर्मनाः।
55_15.translation: Having expresed so much of his feelings, disheartened Angada saluted the elderly monkeys and started crying. Then he spread the darbha grass and lay down on the ground.
55_15.word_by_word: एतावत् so much, वचनम् word, उक्त्वा having expressed, तान् them, वृद्धान् old, अभिवाद्य saluted, च and, अङ्गदः Angada, रुदन् started crying, दुर्मना: a disheartened one, भूमौ on the ground, दर्भेषु on darbha (Kusa) grass, विवेश lay down.

55_16.shloka: तस्य संविशतस्तत्र रुदन्तो वानरर्षभाः।।4.55.17।।नयनेभ्यः प्रमुमुचुरुष्णं वै वारि दुःखिताः।
55_16.translation: Seeing him lie down the bulls among the monkeys became sad and shed hot tears from their eyes.
55_16.word_by_word: तस्य his, तत्र there, संविशतः when he sat down, वानरर्षभाः bulls among the monkeys, दुःखिताः said, रुदन्तः cried, नयनेभ्यः from the eyes, उष्णम् hot, वारि tears, प्रमुमुचुः shed.

55_17.shloka: सुग्रीवं चैव निन्दन्तः प्रशंसन्तश्च वालिनम्।।4.55.18।।परिवार्याङ्गदं सर्वे व्यवसन्प्रायमासितुम्।
55_17.translation: Blaming Sugriva and praising Vali, all the companions of Angada sat there surrounding him after having decided to fast unto death .
55_17.word_by_word: सर्वे all , सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, निन्दन्तः while they were blaming, वालिनम् Vali, प्रशंसन्तश्च while praising, अङ्गदम् Angada, परिवार्य after surrounding, प्रायम् आसितुम् to seek fast unto death, व्यवसन् while he decided

55_18.shloka: मतं तद्वालिपुत्रस्य विज्ञाय प्लवगर्षभाः।।4.55.19।।उपस्पृश्योदकं तत्र प्राङ्मुखास्समुपाविशन्।दक्षिणाग्रेषु दर्भेषु उदक्तीरं समाश्रिताः।।4.55.20।।मुमूर्षवो हरिश्रेष्ठा एतत् क्षममिति स्म ह।
55_18.translation: With the opinion of Vali's son ascertained, all the great monkeys thought it proper to die. They sipped water and assembled on the northern shore of the sea facing the east with the darbha grass spread on the ground, their edges pointing southward.
55_18.word_by_word: वालिपुत्रस्य of Vali's son, तत् मतम्  his opinion, विज्ञाय after knowing, प्लवगर्षभाः bulls among monkeys, तत्र there, हरिश्रेष्ठाः best of monkeys, एतत् this, क्षमम् is fitting, इति in this way, मुमूर्षवः they were willing to die, उदकम् water, उपश्पृश्य having sipped, उदक्तीरम् on the (northern) shore of the sea, समाश्रिताः assembled, प्राङ्मुखाः facing the east, दक्षिणाग्रेषु pointing to the south, दर्भेषु darbha grass, समुपाविशन् sat down together.

55_19.shloka: रामस्य वनवासं च क्षयं दशरथस्य च।।4.55.21।।जनस्थानवधं चैव वधं चैव जटायुषः।हरणं चैव वैदेह्या वालिनश्च वधं रणे।।4.55.22।।रामकोपं च वदतां हरीणां भयमागतम्।
55_19.translation: Overtaken by the fear of death, the monkeys kept talking about Rama's exile into the forest, Dasaratha's death, destruction of demons in Janasthana, the death of Jatayu, abduction of Sita, Vali's death and Rama's anger.
55_19.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, वनवासं च exile in the forest, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, क्षयं च death, जनस्थानवधं चैव destruction of demons in Janasthana, जटायुषः Jatayu's, वधं चैव death, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, हरणं चैव and the abduction, रणे in war, वालिनः Vali's, वधं च death, रामकोपं च  and Rama's anger, वदताम् while they talked about, हरीणाम् for the monkeys, भयम् fear, आगतम् overtook.

55_20.translation: While the numerous monkeys, resembling peaks of high mountains were roaring, it resounded through the mountain caves. It was like the sound of the  stormy thunderclouds.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
55_20.word_by_word: संविशद्भि: preparing to lay down, महाद्रिकूटप्रतिमैः  as huge as mountain peaks, बहुभिः by many, प्लवङ्गमैः by monkeys, भृशम् greatly, सन्नादितनिर्दरान्तरः the sound that came from inside the cave, सः that, महीधरः mountain, नदद्भि: by the thundering, जलदैः with clouds,  इव like, उल्बणैः stormy clouds, बभूव appeared.

56_1.shloka: [Sampati sees Angada and other monkeys -- hears about the death of his brother Jatayu.]उपविष्टास्तु ते सर्वे यस्मिन्प्रायं गिरिस्थले।हरयो गृध्रराजश्च तं देशमुपचक्रमे।।4.56.1।।सम्पातिर्नाम नाम्ना तु चिरञ्जीवी विहङ्गमः।भ्राता जटायुषः श्रीमान्विख्यातबलपौरुषः।।4.56.2।।
56_1.translation: While the monkeys were preparing to fast unto death on the plateau of the mountain, Sampati, the prosperous king of vultures, the longlived elder brother of Jatayu widely known for his strength, appeared there.
56_1.word_by_word: ते they, सर्वे all, हरयः monkeys, यस्मिन् that, गिरिस्थले on the plateau of the mountain, प्रायम् उपविष्टाः seated preparing to die by fasting unto death, तं देशम् that location, गृध्रराजः king of vultures, नाम्ना by name, सम्पातिर्नाम as Sampati, चिरञ्जीवी longlived, जटायुष: Jatayu, भ्राता brother, श्रीमान् prosperous, विख्यातबलपौरुषः widely known for his strength, विहङ्गमः a vulture, उपचक्रमे came there.

56_2.shloka: कन्दरादभिनिष्क्रम्य स विन्ध्यस्य महागिरेः।उपविष्टान्हरीन्दृष्ट्वा हृष्टात्मा गिरमब्रवीत्।।4.56.3।।
56_2.translation: Coming out of the cave of the great mount Vindhya, Sampati was glad to see the monkeys seated there and said to himself:
56_2.word_by_word: सः he, महागिरेः of the great mountain, विन्ध्यस्य Vindhya's, कन्दरात् from the cave, अभिनिष्क्रम्य emerging, उपविष्टान् seated, हरीन् monkeys, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, हृष्टात्मा delighted, गिरम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.

56_3.shloka: विधिः किल नरं लोके विधानेनानुवर्तते।यथाऽयं विहितो भक्ष्यश्चिरान्मह्यमुपागतः।।4.56.4।।
56_3.translation: 'Destiny rules the world of men in accordance with a divine arrangement. Or else, it would not have brought me food after a long time (of fasting)'. (The monkeys are food for Sampati)'
56_3.word_by_word: लोके in this world, विधिः destiny, विधानेन in accordance with, नरम् अनुवर्तते किल said to follow, यथा as, चिरात् for long, मह्यम् for me, विहितः fixed, अयम् this, भक्ष्यः eatable, उपागतः has come.

56_4.shloka: परम्पराणां भक्षिष्ये वानराणां मृतं मृतम्।उवाचेदं वचः पक्षी तान्निरीक्ष्य प्लवङ्गमान्।।4.56.5।।
56_4.translation: Looking at them, the vulture continued, 'I will eat these monkeys one after the other as and when they die'.
56_4.word_by_word: वानराणाम् of monkeys, परम्पराणाम् one after the other, मृतं मृतम् as and when they die, भक्षिष्ये I will eat, तान् them, प्लवङ्गमान् monkeys, निरीक्ष्य looking at them, पक्षी the vulture, इदं these, वचः words, उवाच spoke.

56_5.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा भक्ष्यलुब्धस्य पक्षिणः।अङ्गदः परमायस्तो हनूमन्तमथाब्रवीत्।।4.56.6।।
56_5.translation: Hearing the words of the vulture greedily waiting for food, deeply dejected Angada spoke to Hanuman:
56_5.word_by_word: भक्ष्यलुब्धस्य of the greedy for food, तस्य पक्षिणः of the vulture, तत् वचनम् that words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अथ then, अङ्गदः Angada, परमायस्तः highly dejected, हनूमन्तम् to Hanumanta, अब्रवीत् said.

56_6.shloka: पश्य सीतापदेशेन साक्षाद्वैवस्वतो यमः।इमं देशमनुप्राप्तो वानराणां विपत्तये।।4.56.7।।
56_6.translation: 'See, Yama, son of Vaivasvata, has arrived here in person  to destroy the monkeys in the name of Sita. (Sita became the direct agent for causing the destruction of monkeys).
56_6.word_by_word: सीतापदेशेन in the name of Sita, वैवस्वतः Vaivasvata, यमः Yama, साक्षात् himself in person, वानराणाम् to monkeys, विपत्तये to kill, इमं देशम् this place, अनुप्राप्तः has come, पश्य see.

56_7.shloka: रामस्य न कृतं कार्यं राज्ञो न च वचः कृतम्।हरीणामियमज्ञाता विपत्तिस्सहसागता।।4.56.8।।
56_7.translation: 'Rama's task has not been performed. Sugriva's order has not been excuted. And (now) suddenly this calamity has overtaken the monkeys unawares.
56_7.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, कार्यम् task, न कृतम् not carried out, राज्ञ: the king's, वचः words, न च कृतम् not carried out, हरीणाम् for the monkeys, इयम् this, अज्ञाता unknown, विपत्ति: calamity, सहसा suddenly, आगता has set in.

56_8.shloka: वैदेह्याः प्रियकामेन कृतं कर्म जटायुषा।गृध्राराजेन यत्तत्र श्रुतं वस्तदशेषतः।।4.56.9।।
56_8.translation: 'We have heard in detail about the task accomplished by Jatayu, the king of vultures, in order to please Sita, the princess of Videha.
56_8.word_by_word: वैदेह्याः the princess of Videha, प्रियकामेन in order to please her, गृध्रराजेन by the king of vultures, जटायुषा by Jatayu, तत्र there, यत् कर्म whatever task, कृतम् has been accomplished, तत् that, अशेषतः fully, वः for you, श्रुतम् heard.

56_9.shloka: तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि तिर्यग्योनिगतान्यपि।प्रियं कुर्वन्ति रामस्य त्यक्त्वा प्राणान्यथा वयम्।।4.56.10।।
56_9.word_by_word: तथा that way, तिर्यग्योनिगतान्यपि those born as animals even, सर्वाणि all, भूतानि creatures, प्राणान् life, त्यक्त्वा risking, वयं यथा like us, रामस्य for Rama, प्रियम् please, कुर्वन्ति you will.

56_10.translation: 'Bound by  friendship and compassion each one helps the other. In fact, Jatayu did this by giving up his life on his own, for the sake of Rama.
56_10.word_by_word: स्नेहकारुण्ययन्त्रिताः  bound by  friendship and compassion, अन्योन्यम् mutually, उपकुर्वन्ति  help, तेन by him, तस्य Rama's, उपकारार्थम् for wellbeing, आत्मानम् his life, आत्मना by himself, त्यजत by giving up.

56_11.shloka: प्रियं कृतं हि रामस्य धर्मज्ञेन जटायुषा।राघवार्थे परिश्रान्ता वयं सन्त्यक्तजीविताः।।4.56.12।।कान्ताराणि प्रपन्नाः स्म न च पश्याम मैथिलीम्।
56_11.translation: 'Jatayu, the knower of dharma, has laid down his life for the wellbeing of Rama. We are exhausted in the process of helping Rama. We have lost hope of our lives after entering these forests. Yet we have failed to find the princess from Mithila.
56_11.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञेन by the righteous, जटायुषा by Jatayu, रामस्य Rama's, प्रियम् wellbeing, कृतं हि is done, वयम् we, राघवार्थे for Rama's sake, परिश्रान्ताः exhausted, सन्त्यक्तजीविताः all of us are giving up life, कान्ताराणि forests, प्रपन्नाः ventured, स्म we, मैथिलीम् Maithili, न च पश्याम we have not seen.

56_12.shloka: स सुखी गृध्रराजस्तु रावणेन हतो रणे।।4.56.13।।मुक्तश्च सुग्रीवभयाद्गतश्च परमां गतिम्।
56_12.translation: 'The king of vultures was slain by Ravana in a combat. He attained supreme status. He had no fear for Sugriva (as we have).
56_12.word_by_word: रणे in combat, रावणेन by Ravana, हतः was slain, सः he, गृध्रराजस्तु king of vultures, सुखी is happy, सुग्रीवभयात् fear of Sugriva, मुक्तश्च relieved, परमाम् supreme, गतिम् status, गतश्च attained.

56_13.shloka: जटायुषो विनाशेन राज्ञो दशरथस्य च।।4.56.14।।हरणेन च वैदेह्या स्संशयं हरयो गताः।
56_13.translation: 'The survival of monkeys has become doubtful due to the death of Jatayu, death of  king Dasaratha and the abduction of the princess from Videha.
56_13.word_by_word: जटायुषः Jatayu's, विनाशेन by the death, राज्ञः king's, दशरथस्य च and Dasaratha's, वैदेह्याः princess from Videha, हरणेन च by abducting, हरयः monkeys, संशयं गताः are caught in doubtful situation.

56_14.shloka: रामलक्ष्मणयोर्वासश्च अरण्ये सह सीतया।।4.56.15।।राघवस्य च बाणेन वालिनश्च तथा वधः।रामकोपादशेषाणां रक्षसानां तथा वधः।।4.56.16।।कैकेय्या वरदानेन इदं च विकृतं कृतम्।
56_14.translation: 'The exile of Rama and Lakshmana into the forest along with Sita, so also the death of Vali and of the demons in the hands of Rama due to his anger are all evilconsequences of a boon granted to Kaikeyi.'
56_14.word_by_word: कैकेय्याः to Kaikeyi, वरदानेन the granting of boons, सीतया सह along with Sita, अरण्ये in the forest, रामलक्ष्मणयोः of Rama and Lakshmana, वासः residence, तथा so also, राघवस्य Rama's, बाणेन with arrow, वालिनः Vali's, वधश्च death, तथा so also, रामकोपात् due to Rama's anger, अशेषाणाम् of the entire lot, रक्षसानाम् demons, वधश्च death, इदम् this, विकृतं च unwanted consequence, कृतम् was done.

56_15.shloka: तदसुखमनुकीर्तितं वचोभुवि पतितांश्च समीक्ष्य वानरान्।भृशचलितमतिर्महामतिःकृपणमुदाहृतवान् स गृध्रराट्।।4.56.17।।
56_15.translation: The wise king of vultures was shaken up mentally on seeing the monkeys lying on the ground and hearing the unhappy narration of Angada.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आतिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षटपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the  fiftysixth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
56_15.word_by_word: अनुकीर्तितम् which was described, असुखम् unhappy , तत् that, वचः words, भुवि on the earth, पतितान् fallen, वानरान् monkeys, समीक्ष्य observing, महामतिः wise, सः he, गृध्राराट् the king of vultures, भृशचलितमतिः shaken up mentally, कृपणम् wretched, उदाहृतवान् narrated.

57_1.shloka: [ Angada relates the story of Jatayu's combat with Ravana to Sampati]तत्तु श्रुत्वा तथा वाक्यमङ्गदस्य मुखोद्गतम्।अब्रवीद्वचनं गृध्रस्तीक्ष्णतुण्डो महास्वनः।।4.57.1।।
57_1.translation: On hearing the words that came from Angada's mouth, the sharpbeaked, loudvoiced vulture (Sampati) said:
57_1.word_by_word: तीक्ष्णतुण्डः sharpbeaked, महास्वनः loudvoiced, गृध्रः vulture, तथा like that, अङ्गदस्य of Angada, मुखोद्गतम् came from the mouth, तत् वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

57_2.shloka: कोऽयं गिरा घोषयति प्राणैः प्रियतमस्य मे।जटायुषो वधं भ्रातुः कम्पयन्निव मे मनः।।4.57.2।।
57_2.translation: 'Who is it that was Pronouncing loudly the death of my dearest brother Jatayu? This news has shaken my mind.
57_2.word_by_word: मे my, प्राणैः with life, प्रियतमस्य dearest, भ्रातुः brother's, जटायुषः Jatayu's, वधम् death, मे my, मनः mind, कम्पयन्निव shaking, गिरा with a word, घोषयति loudly proclaims, अयम् this, कः who is that?

57_3.shloka: कथमासीज्जनस्थाने युद्धं राक्षसगृध्रयोः।नामधेयमिदं भ्रातुश्चिरस्याद्य मया श्रुतम्।।4.57.3।।
57_3.translation: 'I heard my brother's name today after a long time.I wish to know how the demon and the vulture fought at Janasthana.
57_3.word_by_word: जनस्थाने at Janasthana, राक्षसगृध्रयोः between the demon and the vulture, युद्धम् fight, कथम् how, आसीत् took place, भ्रातुः brother's, इदं नामधेयम् this name, मया by me, अद्य today, चिरस्य श्रुतम् heard after a long time.

57_4.shloka: इच्छेयं गिरिदुर्गाच्च भवद्भिरवतारितुम्।यवीयसो गुणज्ञस्य श्लाघनीयस्य विक्रमैः।।4.57.4।।अतिदीर्घस्य कालस्य परितुष्टोऽस्मि परिकीर्तनात्।
