64_9.shloka: न विषादे मनः कार्यं विषादो दोषवत्तमः।विषादो हन्ति पुरुषं बालं क्रुद्ध इवोरगः।।4.64.11।।
64_9.translation: 'Do not be despondent. It is the biggest flaw. It destroys a person like an angry serpent killing a young child.
64_9.word_by_word: वषादे in despondency, मनः mind, न कार्यम् does not work, विषादः despair, दोषवत्तमाः biggest flaw, क्रुद्धः angry, उरगः serpent, बालम् इव like a child, पुरुषम् man, विषादः despondency, हन्ति destroys.

64_10.shloka: यो विषादं प्रसहते विक्रमे पर्युपस्थिते।तेजसा तस्य हीनस्य पुरुषार्थो न सिध्यति।।4.64.12।।
64_10.translation: 'If one succumbs to despondency while he has to exhibit his valour, his brilliance gets diminished and he does not succeed in his manly pursuits'.
64_10.word_by_word: विक्रमे when valiance, समुपस्थिते needs to be exhibited, यः whoever, विषादम् despondency, प्रसहते will succumb, तेजसा with brilliant, हीनस्य of a deprived one, तस्य his, पुरुषार्थः manly pursuit, न सिध्यति will not achieve.

64_11.translation: With the night over, Angada joined the older monkeys again and sought their counsel.
64_11.word_by_word: तस्याम् when that, रात्रौ night, व्यतीतायाम् having ended, अङ्गदः Angada, हरिवृद्धैः with old monkeys, वानरैस्सह along with fellowmonkeys, समागम्य joined together, पुनः again, मन्त्रम् counsel, अमन्त्रयत् sought.

64_12.shloka: सा वानराणां ध्वजिनी परिवार्याङ्गदं बभौ।वासवं परिवार्येव मरुतां वाहिनी स्थिता।।4.64.14।।
64_12.translation: The army of monkeys encircled Angada like the army of Maruts surrounding Indra.
64_12.word_by_word: वानराणाम् of the monkeys, सा that, ध्वजिनी army, अङ्गदम् Angada, परिवार्य surrounding, स्थिता stood, वासवम् Indra, परिवार्य surrounding, मरुताम् of Maruts, वाहिनी इव like the army, बभौ appeared.

64_13.shloka: कोऽन्यस्तां वानरीं सेनां शक्त:स्तम्भयितुं भवेत्।अन्यत्र वालितनयादन्यत्र च हनूमतः।।4.64.15।।
64_13.translation: Who else other than the son of Vali and Hanuman can resist and pacify the monkeyarmy?
64_13.word_by_word: वालितनयात् अन्यत्र other than Vali's son, हनूमतः Hanumat, अन्यत्र other than, अन्यः another person, कः who, ताम् that, वानरीम् monkey सेनाम् army, स्तम्भयितुम् to suspend, शक्तः can do, भवेत् will be.

64_14.translation: Then the illustrious Angada, subduer of foes took the counsel of elderly monkeys and  the army into confidence and thus addressed them all in meaningful words:
64_14.word_by_word: ततः then, अरिन्दमः subduer of foes, श्रीमान् illustrious, अङ्गदः Angada, तान् those, हरिवृद्धान् elderly monkeys, तत् that, सैन्यं च and the army also, अनुमान्य taking them into confidence, अर्थवत् meaningful, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् expressed.

64_15.shloka: क इदानीं महातेजा लङ्घयिष्यति सागरम्।कः करिष्यति सुग्रीवं सत्यसन्धमरिन्दमम्।।4.64.17।।
64_15.translation: 'Now which mighty monkey will cross the ocean? Who will prove Sugriva, subduer of enemies, true to his promise?
64_15.word_by_word: इदानीम् now, महातेजाः brilliant, कः who, सागरम् ocean, लङ्घयिष्यति will cross, कः who, अरिंदमम् subduer of foes, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, सत्यसन्धम् true to his promise, करिष्यति will render.

64_16.shloka: को वीरो योजनशतं लङ्घयेत प्लवङ्गमाः।इमांश्च यूथपान् सर्वान्मोक्षयेत्को महाभयात्।।4.64.18।।
64_16.translation: 'O monkeys which one can leap a hundred yojanas and liberate the monkey leaders from the great fear of Sugriva?
64_16.word_by_word: वीरः hero, कः who, प्लवङ्गमा: O monkeys, योजनशतम् a hundred yojanas, लङ्घयेत can leap, इमान् these, यूथपान् leaders, सर्वान् all, महाभयात् from great fear, मोक्षयेत liberate them.

64_17.shloka: कस्य प्रभावाद्धारांश्च पुत्रांश्चैव गृहाणि च।इतो निवृत्ताः पश्येम सिद्धार्थास्सुखिनो वयम्।।4.64.19।।
64_17.translation: 'By whose effort can we be successful and return home happily from here to meet wives and sons?
64_17.word_by_word: वयम् we,कस्य whose, प्रभावात् effort,सिद्धार्थाः emerge successful,सुखिनः happy,इतः from here, निवृत्ताः return,दारांश्च wives,पुत्रांश्चैव and sons, गृहाणि च and homes,पश्येम we will see.

64_18.shloka: कस्य प्रसादाद्रामं च लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।अभिगच्छेम संहृष्टास्सुग्रीवं च वनौकसम्।।4.64.20।।
64_18.translation: 'By whose grace shall we approach Rama and Lakshmana and even the monkey king Sugriva happily?
64_18.word_by_word: कस्य whose, प्रसादात् grace, संहृष्टा: happily, रामं च Rama and, महाबलम् mighty, लक्ष्मणं च Lakshmana also, वनौकसम् forester, सुग्रीवं च even Sugriva, अभिगच्छेम can we approach.

64_19.shloka: यदि कश्चित्समर्थो वस्सागरप्लवने हरिः।स ददा त्विह न शशीघ्रं पुण्यामभयदक्षिणाम्।।4.64.21।।
64_19.translation: 'If there is any one among you who is capable of leaping  across the ocean he will be giving all of us the sacred gift of life quickly?'
64_19.word_by_word: वः among you, कश्चित् any one, हरिः vanara, सागरप्लवने in leaping the ocean, समर्थः यदि if he is capable, सः he, इह here, नः to us, शीघ्रम् quickly, पुण्याम् sacred, अभयदक्षिणाम् a gift of assurance, ददातु can he give?

64_20.shloka: अङ्गदस्य वच श्शृत्वा न कश्चित् किञ्चिदब्रवीत्।स्तिमिते वा भवत्सर्वा सा तत्र हरिवाहिनी।।4.64.22।।
64_20.translation: After hearing Angada, no one spoke a word. The entire army of monkeys became still and motionless.
64_20.word_by_word: अङ्गदस्य Angada's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, कश्चित् any one, किञ्चित् even a little, न अब्रवीत् did not speak, तत्र there, सर्वा the entire, सा that, हरिवाहिनी army of monkeys स्तिमिते motionless, अभवत् became.

64_21.shloka: पुनरेवाङ्गदः प्राह तान्हरीन्हरिसत्तमः।सर्वे बलवतां श्रेष्ठा भवन्तो दृढविक्रमाः।।4.64.23।।व्यपदेश्य कुले जाताः पूजिताश्चाप्यभीक्ष्णशः।
64_21.translation: Angada, the best of the monkeys again addressed them saying, 'you are all mighty, eminent and courageous, born in renowned families and have been honoured again and again(for your actions).
64_21.word_by_word: हरिसत्तमः best of monkeys, अङ्गदः Angada, तान् हरीन् those monkeys, पुनरेव once again, प्राह addressed, भवन्तः you are, सर्वे all, बलवताम् among strong, श्रेष्ठाः eminent, दृढविक्रमाः mighty, व्यपदेशकुले in a renowned family, जाताः born, अभीक्ष्णशः again and again, पूजिताश्च honoured.

64_22.shloka: न हि वो गमने सङ्गः कदाचित्कस्यचित्क्वचित्।ब्रुवध्वं यस्य या शक्तिः प्लवने प्लवगर्षभाः।।4.64.24।।
64_22.translation: 'None of you at any time have faced any obstruction in doing your deeds. You are efficient  in leaping. O bulls among monkeys now speak out, who among you can fly and how far?इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुष्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
64_22.word_by_word: वः to you, कस्यचित् any one of you, कदाचित् at any time, गमने fly, सङ्गः no obstruction, क्वचित् हि to carry out, प्लवगर्षभाः bulls among monkeys, प्लवने in leaping, यस्य whose, या such, शक्तिः capacity, ब्रुवध्वम्  speak .

65_1.shloka: [Each of the monkey leaders declares the distance they can fly -- Jambavan resolves not to send Angada but send Hanuman instead to cross.]अथाङ्गदवचश्श्रुत्वा ते सर्वे वानरर्षभाः।स्वं स्वं गतौ समुत्साहमूचुस्तत्र यथाक्रमम्।।4.65.1।।गजो गवाक्षो गवयश्शरभो गन्धमादनः।मैन्दश्च द्विविदश्चैव सुषेणो जाम्बवां स्तथा।।4.65.2।।
65_1.translation: Thereafter, on hearing Angada, all the leaders among the monkeys, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda, Dvivida, Sushena and Jambavan as well expressed one after  the other their capability for leaping.
65_1.word_by_word: अथ and then, अङ्गदवचः Angada's words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, गजः Gaja, गवाक्षः Gavaksha, गवयः Gavaya, शरभः Sarabha, गन्धमादनः Gandhamadana, मैन्दश्च Mainda, द्विविदश्चैव even Dvivida, सुषेणः Sushena, तथा so also, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, सर्वे all, ते them, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys, यथाक्रमम् following an order, तत्र there, गतौ in turn the scope for, स्वं स्वम् on their own, समुत्साहम् capability (to leap), ऊचुः expressed.

65_2.shloka: आबभाषे गजस्तत्र प्लवेयं दशयोजनम्।गवाक्षो योजननान्याह गमिष्यामीति विंशतिम्।।4.65.3।।
65_2.translation: Gaja said he can leap ten yojanas and Gavaksha said he can go upto twenty yojanas.
65_2.word_by_word: तत्र after that, गजः Gaja, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, प्लवेयम् I can leap, आबभाषे said, गवाक्षः Gavaksha, विंशतिम् twenty, योजनानि yojanas, गमिष्यामि I can go, इति thus, आह said.

65_3.shloka: गवयो वानरस्तत्र वानरां स्तानुवाच ह।त्रिंशतं तु गमिष्यामि योजनानां प्लवङ्गमाः।।4.65.4।।शरभस्तानुवाचाथ वानरान् वानरर्षभः।चत्वारिंशद्गमिष्यामि योजनानां प्लवङ्गमाः।।4.65.5।।वानरस्तु महातेजा अब्रवीद्गन्धमादनः।योजनानां गमिष्यामि पञ्चाशत्तु न संशयः।।4.65.6।।मैन्दस्तु वानरस्तत्र वानरांस्तानुवाच ह।योजनानां परं षष्टिमहं प्लवितुमुत्सहे।।4.65.7।।ततस्तत्र महातेजा द्विविदः प्रत्यभाषत।गमिष्यामि न सन्देहस्सप्ततिं योजनान्यहम्।।4.65.8।।सुषेणस्तु महातेजा:प्रोक्तवान्हरिसत्तमान्।अशीतिं योजनानां तु प्लवेयं प्लवगेश्वराः।।4.65.9।।
65_3.translation: Then Gavaya said to the monkeys 'I can leap thirty yojanas Sarabha said 'I can leap forty yojanas' bright Ghandhamadana said 'I can leap as far as fifty yojanas withoutany doubt' Mainda said 'I can leap more than sixty yojanas' highly brilliant Dvivida said in turn, 'I can no doubt leap seventy yojanas ' brilliant and best of the monkeys Sushena declared 'I can leap across eighty yojanas'.
65_3.word_by_word: तत्र there, गवयो Gava, वानरः monkeys, तान् वानरान् the monkeys, उवाच ह said like that, प्लवङ्गमाः O leaping monkeys, योजनानाम्  yojanas, त्रिंशतम् thirty, गमिष्यामि I can reach, तत्र there, शरभः Sarabha, वानरर्षभ great monkey, तान् वानरान् those monkeys, उवाच ह said, योजनानाम् yojanas, चत्वारिंशत् forty, गमिष्यामि can reach, संशयः doubt, न without, महातेजाः bright, गन्धमादनः Ghandamadana, वानरान् monkeys, अब्रवीत् said, योजनानाम् yojanas, पञ्चाशत् fifty, गमिष्यामि I can go, संशयः doubt, न no, तत्र there, मैन्दः Mainda, वानरस्तु to the monkeys, तान् वानरान् those monkeys, उवाच ह said, अहम् I, योजनानाम् of yojanas, षष्टिं परम् more than sixty, प्लवितुम् to leap, उत्सहे I am enthusiastic, ततः then, महातेजाः highly brilliant, द्विविदः Dvivida, तत्र there, प्रत्यभाषत in turn spoke, अहम् I, सप्तति: seventy, योजनानि yojanas, गमिष्यामि I can go, सन्देहः doubt, न not, महातेजाः brilliant, सत्त्ववान् strong, सुषेणः Sushena, कपिसत्तमः best among the monkeys, अहम् I, पराक्रमे capability, योजनानाम् of yojanas, अशीतिम् eighty, प्लवेयं I can leap.

65_4.shloka: तेषां कथयतां तत्र सर्वांस्ताननुमान्य च।ततो वृद्धतमस्तेषां जाम्बवान्प्रत्यभाषत।।4.65.10।।
65_4.translation: When the monkeys were talking (of their individual capacity) in that manner about their speed, Jambavan the oldest of the monkeys inferred (their capacity) and said:
65_4.word_by_word: ततः then, तेषाम् among them, वृद्धतमः oldest, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, तेषाम् they, तत्र there, कथयताम् (when they were) saying, तान् सर्वान् all the, अनुमान्य inferred, प्रत्यभाषत replied.

65_5.translation: 'Earlier I was also very courageous, but now I have become old and reached the fag end of life.
65_5.word_by_word: पूर्वम् earlier, अस्माकमपि even I also, कश्चित् some, गतिपराक्रमः very courageous, आसीत् had , ते वयम् for me, साम्प्रतम् attained, वयसः (old) age, पारम् fag end of life, अनुप्राप्ताः स्म have reached.

65_6.shloka: किन्तु नैवं गते शक्यमिदं कार्यमुपेक्षितुम्।यदर्थं कपिराजश्च रामश्च कृतनिश्चयौ।।4.65.12।।
65_6.translation: 'However  in this situation, it is not possible for us to neglect (our task) as it is the order of the monkeyking and Rama who are determined to achieve the objective.
65_6.word_by_word: किं तु however, एवं गते in this situation, यदर्थम् order, कपिराजश्च monkey king's, रामश्च and Rama's, कृतनिश्चयौ are determined, इदम् this, कार्यम् task, उपेक्षितुम् to neglect, न शक्यम् not possible.

65_7.shloka: साम्प्रतं कालभेदेन या गतिस्तां निबोधत।नवतिं योजनानां तु गमिष्यामि न संशयः।।4.65.13।।
65_7.word_by_word: साम्प्रतम् at this age, कालभेदेन due to advancement of age, या that, गतिः movement, ताम् that, निबोधत you know, योजनानाम् of yojanas, नवतिम् ninety,गमिष्यामि I can leap, संशयः doubt, न not.

65_8.translation: Jambavan, the distinguished among the monkeys again said, 'My strength to leap into the sky was not only that much (I was stronger in my youth and could cover longer distances)'
65_8.word_by_word: सर्वान् all, तान् of the monkeys, हरिश्रेष्ठान् distinguished among the monkeys, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said, मे my, गमने in leaping, पराक्रमः valour, एतावदेव only that much, न आसीत् खलु was not.

65_9.shloka: मया महाबलेश्चैव यज्ञे विष्णुस्सनातनः।प्रदक्षिणीकृतः पूर्वं क्रममाणस्त्रिविक्रमम्।।4.65.15।।
65_9.translation: 'In the past, at the time of the wellknown yagna (of king Bali) I was very strong. I circumambulated the eternal Vishnu while he was taking three strides (in his incarnation of Trivikrama Vamana.)
65_9.word_by_word: मया by myself, पूर्वम् earlier, महाबलेश्चैव of Mahabali, यज्ञे in yagna, क्रममाणः the advancing Lord, विष्णुः Visnu, सनातनः eternal, त्रिविक्रमः Visnu of three strides, प्रदक्षिणीकृतः circumambulated.

65_10.shloka: स इदानीमहं वृद्धः प्लवने मन्दविक्रमः।यौवने च तदाऽसीन्मे बलमप्रतिमं परैः।।4.65.16।।
65_10.translation: 'Having grown old I do not have the same courage. In my youth my prowess was incomparable and none could excel me.
65_10.word_by_word: इदानीम् now, वृद्धः old, सः अहम् that I am, प्लवने to leap, मन्दविक्रमः my strength is denuded, तदा then, यौवने in youth, मे बलम् my prowess, अप्रतिमम् incomparable, परैः by others, आसीत् it was.

65_11.shloka: सम्प्रत्येतावतीं शक्तिं गमने तर्कयाम्यहम्।नैतावता हि संसिद्धिः कार्यस्यास्य भविष्यति।।4.65.17।।
65_11.translation: 'I guess that at this time I do not have the capacity to fly to that extent. Achieving the objective is out of question with this much of energy.
65_11.word_by_word: सम्प्रति at this time, अहम् I have, शक्तिं capacity, गमने to fly, तर्कयामि I guess, एतावतीं that much, शक्यम् possible, एतावता to this extent, अस्य of this, कार्यस्य of the objective, संसिद्धिः success, न भविष्यति will not be.

65_12.translation: 'Then the wise Angada said to great Jambavan, in a gentle manner about his  own strength.
65_12.word_by_word: अथ and now, तदा then, प्राज्ञः wise, अङ्गदः Angada, महाकपिम् great monkey, जाम्बवन्तम् Jambavan, अनुमान्य doubting, उदारार्थम् in a gentle manner, उत्तरम् reply, तदा then, अब्रवीत् said.

65_13.shloka: अहमेतद्गमिष्यामि योजनानां शतं महत्।निवर्तने तु मे शक्तिस्स्यान्न वेति न निश्चितम्।।4.65.19।।
65_13.translation: 'I can  certainly go to a distance of a hundred yojanas. However, I cannot say whether I will have enough capacity to return?
65_13.word_by_word: अहम् I, महत् great, एतत् this, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतम् hundred, गमिष्यामि I can go, निवर्तने to return, मे my, शक्तिः capacity, स्यात् may be, न वा or not, इति thus, निश्चितम् certainly, न not known.

65_14.shloka: तमुवाच हरिश्रेष्ठं जाम्बवान्वाक्यकोविदः।ज्ञायते गमने शक्तिस्तव हर्यृक्षसत्तम।।4.65.20।।
65_14.translation: Jambavan who was skilful in speech spoke to that great Angada, 'O leader among monkeys and bears your energy to cover this distance is wellknown to us'.
65_14.word_by_word: वाक्यकोविदः skilful at speech, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, तम् him, हरिश्रेष्ठम् best of monkeys, उवाच said, हर्यृक्षसत्तम best among bears and monkeys, गमने I am going to fly, तव your, शक्तिः energy, ज्ञायते is known.

65_15.shloka: कामं शतं सहस्रं वा न ह्येष विधिरुच्यते।योजनानां भवान् शक्तो गन्तुं प्रतिनिवर्तितुम्।।4.65.21।।
65_15.translation: 'You can go upto even a hundred thousand yojanas and have the required energy to return also. But it is not proper to send you (because you are the heir apparent).
65_15.word_by_word: भवान् you, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतं सहस्रं वा even a hundred or a thousand, गन्तुम् to go, प्रतिनिवर्तितुम् but to return, शक्तः कामम् you have the required energy, एषः this, विधिः duty, उच्यते हि not proper.

65_16.shloka: न हि प्रेषयिता तात स्वामी प्रेष्यः कथञ्चन।भवताऽयं जनस्सर्वः प्रेष्यः प्लवगसत्तम।।4.65.22।।
65_16.word_by_word: तात dear , प्रेषयिता who orders, स्वामी lord, कथञ्चन in any way, प्रेष्यः a servant who is sent, न हि indeed, प्लवगसत्तम best of monkeys, सर्वः all, अयं जनः this group, भवता by you, प्रेष्यः to be sent.

65_17.shloka: भवान्कळत्रमस्माकं स्वामिभावे व्यवस्थितः।स्वामी कळत्रं सैन्यस्य गतिरेषा परन्तप।।4.65.23।।
65_17.translation: 'O scorcher of enemies, you are established as the commander of the army and it is proper for us to protect you as we protect our wives.
65_17.word_by_word: परन्तप O scorcher of enemies, स्वामिभावे in a state of commander, व्यवस्थितः you are established, भवान् you, अस्माकम् for us, कलत्रम् wife, स्वामी lord, सैन्यस्य army's, कलत्रम् wife, एषा so that, गतिः proper.

65_18.shloka: अपि चैतस्य कार्यस्य भवान्मूलमरिन्दम।तस्मात्कळत्रवत्तात प्रतिपाल्यस्सदा भवान्।।4.65.24।।
65_18.translation: 'O subduer of enemies in acomplishing this task you are the root. O dear therefore you should always be taken care of by us just like the wife looked after.
65_18.word_by_word: तात O dear, अरिन्दम O subduer of enemies, एतस्य of this, कार्यस्य of the task, भवान् you, मूलम् the root, अपि वै and also, तस्मात् therefore, भवान् you, कलत्रवत् like the wife, सदा always, प्रतिपाल्यः should be taken care of.

65_19.shloka: मूलमर्थस्य संरक्ष्यमेष कार्यविदां नयः।मूले सति हि सिद्ध्यन्ति गुणा फलो पुष्पोदयाः।।4.65.25।।
65_19.translation: 'The root of any objective should be protected well. This is the basis of an accomplisher. Only when the roots are intact, the trees have the ability to yield flowers and fruits.
65_19.word_by_word: अर्थस्य the objective, मूलम् root, संरक्ष्यम् should be protected, एषः this कार्यविदाम् of the accomplishers, नयः policy, मूले when root, सति when it is intact, फलो पुष्पोदयाः bearing flowers and fruits, गुणाः qualities, सिद्ध्यन्ति हि will result.

65_20.shloka: तद्भवानस्य कार्यस्य साधने सत्यविक्रम।बुद्धिविक्रमसम्पन्नो हेतुरत्र परन्तप।।4.65.26।।
65_20.translation: 'O warrior of proven valour O subduer of enemies in achieving this objective you are the source, being endowed with valour and wisdom.
65_20.word_by_word: सत्यविक्रम truely courageous one, तत् that, भवान् you, अस्य कार्यस्य of this task, साधने in achieving, परन्तप O subduer of enemies, अत्र there, बुद्धिविक्रमसम्पन्नः endowed with wisdom and valour, हेतुः you are the cause.

65_21.shloka: गुरुश्च गुरुपुत्रश्च त्वं हि नः कपिसत्तम।भवन्तमाश्रित्य वयं समर्था ह्यर्थसाधने।।4.65.27।।
65_21.translation: 'O best of monkeys you are the son of my guide (Vali) and respectable. We will be capable of accomplishing the goal only under your protection and guidance.
65_21.word_by_word: कपिसत्तम O best of monkeys, नः for us, गुरुपुत्रः son of our teacher, त्वम् you are, गुरुश्च and also a respectable guide, वयम् we, भवन्तम् you, आश्रित्य under your care, अर्थसाधने in accomplishing our objective, समर्थाः हि are capable also.

65_22.shloka: उक्तवाक्यं महाप्राज्ञं जाम्बवन्तं महाकपिः।प्रत्युवाचोत्तरं वाक्यं वालिसूनुरथाङ्गदः।।4.65.28।।
65_22.translation: Jambavan, the wise monkey having said that, Angada, the great son of Vali, replied:
65_22.word_by_word: अथ now, महाकपिः great monkey, वालिसूनुः Vali's son, अङ्गदः Angada, उक्तवाक्यम् havingsaid that, महाप्राज्ञम् very wise, जाम्बवन्तम् Jambavan, उत्तरं वाक्यम् in reply, प्रत्युवाच said.

65_23.shloka: यदि नाहं गमिष्यामि नान्यो वानरपुङ्गवः।पुनः खल्विदमस्माभिः कार्यं प्रायोपवेशनम्।।4.65.29।।
65_23.translation: 'If I do not go and no other monkey leader goes, then we have to resort to fasting unto death once again.
65_23.word_by_word: अहम् I am, न गमिष्यामि यदि if I will not go, अन्यः other, वानरपुङ्गवः monkey leader, न not, अस्माभिः by us, पुनः again, इदम् this, प्रायोपवेशनम् fasting to death, कार्यं खलु have to do.

65_24.shloka: न ह्यकृत्वा हरिपतेस्सन्देशं तस्य धीमतः।तत्रापि गत्वा प्राणानां पश्यामि परिरक्षणम्।।4.65.30।।
65_24.translation: 'If I do not fulfil the objective of the wise king of monkeys I cannot save my life even after returning there (Kishkinda).
65_24.word_by_word: धीमतः of the wise, तस्य हरिपतेः of the lord of monkeys, सन्देशम् message, अकृत्वा by not fulfilling, तत्र there, गत्वापि even after going, प्राणानाम् of life, परिरक्षणम् protection, न पश्यामि I do not see.

65_25.shloka: स हि प्रसादे चात्यर्थं कोपे च हरिरीश्वरः।अतीत्य तस्य सन्देशं विनाशो गमने भवेत्।।4.65.31।।
65_25.translation: 'The monkey king has the authority to shower grace or give vent to his anger. If we go without fulfilling the task we will face destruction.
65_25.word_by_word: सः he, हरिः monkey king, प्रसादे च in showering grace, कोपे च and vent anger, अत्यर्थम् highly, ईश्वरः all powerful, तस्य his, सन्देशम् instruction, अतीत्य in not fulfilling the task, गमने in going, विनाशः total destruction, भवेत् will be.

65_26.shloka: तद्यथा ह्यस्य कार्यस्य न भवत्यन्यथा गतिः।तद्भवानेव दृष्टार्थस्सञ्चिन्तयितु मर्हति।।4.65.32।।
65_26.translation: 'Therefore, think over well so that we do not fail ultimately. You have a vision.You should suggest means by which this mission does not misfire.'
65_26.word_by_word: तत् तथाहि therefore, अस्य of this, कार्यस्य of the task, गतिः advancement, अन्यथा  otherwise, न भवति will not be, तत् that, दृष्टार्थः well aware, भवानेव you alone, सञ्चिन्तयितुम् to think over well, अर्हति you should.

65_27.shloka: सोऽङ्गदेन तदा वीरः प्रत्युक्तः प्लवगर्षभः।जाम्बवानुत्तरं वाक्यं प्रोवाचेदं ततोऽङ्गदम्।।4.65.33।।
65_27.translation: On listening to Angada's words, Jambavan, the  bull among monkeys, replied this way:
65_27.word_by_word: अङ्गदेन by Angada, तदा then, प्रत्युक्तः having been addressed, वीरः hero, प्लवगर्षभः bull among monkeys, सः जाम्बवान् that Jambavan, ततः then, अङ्गदम् to Angada, उत्तरम् reply, इदं वाक्यम् in these words, प्रोवाच said.

65_28.shloka: अस्य ते वीर कार्यस्य न किञ्चित्परिहीयते।एष सञ्चोदयाम्येनं यः कार्यं साधयिष्यति।।4.65.34।।
65_28.translation: 'O hero this work will not be balked. I will now inspire one who can achieve this task.'
65_28.word_by_word: वीर O hero, ते your, तस्य कार्यस्य of this task, किञ्चित् even a little, न परिहीयते nothing is balked, एषः here I am, कार्यम् task, यः who, साधयिष्यति who can achieve, सञ्चोदयामि एनम् I will inspire him.

65_29.translation: Then Jambavan the most eminent among the monkeys went to Hanuman, the  celebrated one among the monkey leaders and a renowned one, who was sitting alone quietly at some distance Jambavan motivated him.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चष्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfifth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first poem, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
65_29.word_by_word: तत: then, हरिप्रवीरः most eminent among monkeys, प्रतीतं renowned, प्लवतां among monkeys, वरिष्ठम् eminent one, एकान्तम् alone, आश्रित्य went to him, सुखेपविष्ठम् comfortably seated, हरिप्रवीरं best among the monkey leaders, हनुमन्तमेव Hanumanta alone, सञ्चोदयामास motivated.

66_1.shloka: [Description of Hanuman's glory]अनेकशतसाहस्रीं विषण्णां हरिवाहिनीम्।जाम्बवान्समुदीक्ष्यैवं हनूमन्तमथाब्रवीत्।।4.66.1।।
66_1.translation: Then Jambavan observed the worries of several hundred thousands of the monkey army and said to Hanuman:
66_1.word_by_word: जाम्बवान् Jambavan, विषण्णाम् worried, अनेकशतसाहस्रीम् several hundred thousands, हरिवाहिनीम् army of monkeys, समुदीक्ष्य observed, अथ then, हनूमन्तम् to Hanuman, एवम् this way, अब्रवीत् said.

66_2.shloka: वीर वानरलोकस्य सर्वशास्त्रविदां वर।तूष्णीमेकान्तमाश्रित्य हनूमन्किं न जल्पसि।।4.66.2।।
66_2.translation: 'O Hanuman you are the choicest one among many scholars wellversed in all sastras. Why do you sit alone? Why do you not speak?
66_2.word_by_word: वानरलोकस्य in the world of monkeys, वीर hero, सर्वशास्त्रविदाम् among the knowledgeable in all sastras, वर choicest one, हनूमान् Hanuman, तूष्णीम् quietly, एकान्तम् solitude, आश्रित्य remaining, किम् why, न जल्पसि you are not speaking.

66_3.shloka: हनूमन्हरिराजस्य सुग्रीवस्य समो ह्यसि।रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चापि तेजसा च बलेन च।।4.66.3।।
66_3.translation: 'Hanuman you are equal to the king of monkeys and also Rama and Lakshmana in brilliance and strength.
66_3.word_by_word: हनूमन् Hanuman, तेजसा च with brilliance, बलेन च and in strength, हरिराजस्य monkey king's, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चापि with Rama and Lakshmana also, समः equal, असि हि you are.

66_4.shloka: अरिष्टनेमिनः पुत्रो वैनतेयो महाबलः।गरुत्मानिति विख्यात उत्तमस्सर्वपक्षिणाम्।।4.66.4।।
66_4.translation: 'You are the son of Arishtanemi (sage Kasyapa) and Vinata, and your gurulike (elder brother) is Garuda, the greatest among birds. He is powerful and and famous.
66_4.word_by_word: अरिष्टनेमिनः Arishtanemi's, पुत्रः son, सर्वपक्षिणाम् among all birds, उत्तमः greatest, वैनतेयः Vainateya's, महाबलः very powerful, गरुत्मान् इति Garuthman as such, विख्यातः very famous.

66_5.shloka: बहुशो हि मया दृष्टः सागरे स महाबलः।भुजङ्गानुद्धरन्पक्षी महावेगो महायशाः।।4.66.5।।
66_5.translation: 'Garuda is very powerful, swift, and famous. I have seen him snatching serpents from the ocean many times.
66_5.word_by_word: महाबलः very powerful, महावेगः very swift, महायशाः very famous, सः that, पक्षी bird, सागरे ocean, भुजङ्गान् serpents, उद्धरन् while snatching, मया by me, बहुशः many times, दृष्टः हि is seen.

66_6.shloka: पक्षयोर्यद्बलं तस्य तावद्भुजबलं तव।विक्रमश्चापि वेगश्च न ते तेनावहीयते।।4.66.6।।
66_6.translation: 'The strength of your shoulders is equal to that of his (Garuda's) wings. Your speed and valour are no less.
66_6.word_by_word: तस्य his, पक्षयोः of the wings, यत् such, बलम् strength, तव your, भुजबलम् the strength of your shoulders, तावत् so much, ते your, विक्रमश्चापि also courage, वेगश्च speed, तेन with him, न अपहीयते no less.

66_7.shloka: बलं बुद्धिश्च तेजश्च सत्त्वं च हरिपुङ्गव।विशिष्टं सर्वभूतेषु किमात्मानं न बुध्यसे।।4.66.7।।
66_7.translation: 'O leader of the monkeys you are superior in strength, wisdom, brilliance and valour to all beings. Why do you not realise your own strength?
66_7.word_by_word: हरिपुङ्गव leader of the monkeys, बलम् strength, बुद्धिश्च wisdom, तेजश्च brilliance, सत्त्वम् valour, सर्वभूतेषु of all beings, विशिष्टम् superior, आत्मानम् your self, किम् why, न बुध्यसे do you not know that.

66_8.shloka: अप्सराप्सरसां श्रेष्ठा विख्याता पुञ्जिकस्थला।अञ्जनेति परिख्याता पत्नी केसरिणो हरेः।।4.66.8।।
66_8.word_by_word: पुञ्जिकस्थला Punjikasthala, अप्सरसाम् among apsarasas, श्रेष्ठा eminent, विख्याता famous, अञ्जनेति by name Anjana, परिख्याता wellknown as, अप्सरा: apsara, हरेः monkeys, केसरिणः Kesari, पत्नी wife.

66_9.shloka: विख्याता त्रिषु लोकेषु रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि।अभिशापादभूत्तात वानरी कामरूपिणी।।4.66.9।।
66_9.translation: 'O dear she was famous in the three worlds, peerless in beauty and could change form at her free will. She was born of a monkey on this land by dint of a curse.
66_9.word_by_word: तात dear, रूपेण in appearance, अप्रतिमा peerless, त्रिषु among three, लोकेषु in worlds, विख्याता famous, अभिशापात् by a curse, भुवि on the land, कामरूपिणी lovely one, who can change form at her will, वानरी monkey, अभूत् she was.

66_10.shloka: दुहिता वानरेन्द्रस्य कुञ्जरस्य महात्मनः।मानुषं विग्रहं कृत्वा रूपयौवनशालिनी।।4.66.10।।विचित्रमाल्याभरणा महार्हक्षौमवासिनी।अचरत्पर्वतस्याग्रे प्रावृडम्बुदसन्निभे।।4.66.11।।
66_10.translation: 'She was the daughter of a great king of monkeys called Kunjara. That young and beautiful lady had assumed a lustrous human form decked with wonderful garlands, ornaments and silk clothes and was roving on top of the mountain which appeared like a proud raincloud.
66_10.word_by_word: वानरेन्द्रस्य of the king of monkeys, महात्मनः of the great, कुञ्जरस्य Kunjara's, दुहिता  daughter, रूपयौवनशालिनी young and beautiful, मानुषम् human, विग्रहम् form, कृत्वा took, विचित्रमाल्याभरणा decked in wonderful garlands and ornaments, महार्हक्षौमवासिनी wearing rich silk clothes, प्रावृडम्बुदसन्निभे looking like the proud raincloud, पर्वतस्य अग्रे on top of the mountain, अचरत् she was wandering.

66_11.shloka: तस्या वस्त्रं विशालाक्ष्याः पीतं रक्तदशं शुभम्।स्थितायाः पर्वतस्याग्रे मारुतोऽपहरच्छनैः।।4.66.12।।
66_11.translation: 'While the largeeyed lady was stationed on the mountain top, the Windgod gently let her auspicious yellow garment with red border fly away.
66_11.word_by_word: पर्वतस्य mountain's, अग्रे on top, स्थितायाः stationed, विशालाक्ष्याः of largeeyed lady, तस्याः her, पीतं रक्तदशम् yellow with red border, शुभम् auspicious, वस्त्रम् garment, मारुतः Windgod, शनैः gently, अपाहरत् let it fly away.

66_12.shloka: स ददर्श ततस्तस्या वृत्तावूरू सुसंहतौ।स्तनौ च पीनौ सहितौ सुजातं चारु चाननम्।।4.66.13।।
66_12.translation: 'Then he (Windgod) saw her curved, wellset thighs, her beautiful plump breasts and her lovely pleasing face.
66_12.word_by_word: ततः then, सः he, तस्याः her, वृत्तौ curved, सुसंहतौ both wellset, ऊरू both thighs, पीनौ plump, सहितौ together, स्तनौ च two breasts, सुजातम् very beautiful, चारु pleasing, आननं च face, ददर्श saw.

66_13.shloka: तां विशालायतश्रोणीं तनुमध्यां यशस्विनीम्।दृष्टवैव शुभसर्वाङ्गीं पवनः काममोहितः।।4.66.14।।
66_13.translation: 'On seeing the broad hips, slender waist and beautiful limbs of that famous lady the Windgod was infatuated.
66_13.word_by_word: विशालायतश्रोणीम् a lady of broad hips, तनुमध्याम् slender waist, यशस्विनीम् famed one, शुभसर्वाङ्गीम् a lady of beautiful limbs, ताम् her, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing, पवनः Windgod, काममोहितः was infatuated.

66_14.shloka: स तां भुजाभ्यां दीर्घाभ्यां पर्यष्वजत मारुतः।मन्मथाविष्टसर्वाङ्गो गतात्मा तामनिन्दिताम्।।4.66.15।।
66_14.translation: 'The Windgod lost his control over himself. His whole being was overpowered by love for her beautiful, flawless body. He embraced her with his long arms.
66_14.word_by_word: अनिन्दिताम् blameless lady, ताम् her, गतात्मा lost his self, सः मारुतः that wind god, मन्मथाविष्टसर्वाङ्गः his whole body overpowered by love, दीर्घाभ्याम् with long ones, भुजाभ्याम् with shoulders, ताम् her, पर्यष्वजत embraced her.

66_15.shloka: सा तु तत्रैव सम्भ्रान्ता सुव्रता वाक्यमब्रवीत्।एकपत्नीव्रतमिदं को नाशयितुमिच्छति।।4.66.16।।
66_15.translation: 'She was bewildered by this and being chaste and strict observer of chastiny she said,'Who is it that has destroyed my monoandry?
66_15.word_by_word: तत्रैव on that spot itself, सम्भ्रान्ता bewildered lady, सुव्रता a chaste woman, सा तु she was, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, इदम् this, एकपत्नीव्रतम् observing strict monoandry, कः who, नाशयितुम् to destroy, इच्छति is wishing?

66_16.shloka: अञ्जनाया वच्शुत्वा मारुतः प्रत्यभाषत।न त्वां हिंसामि सुश्रोणि मा भूत्ते सुभगे भयम्।।4.66.17।।
66_16.translation: 'On hearing Anjana's words, the Windgod replied, ' O auspicious lady, I do you no harm, O lady of beautiful hips. I reached (enjoyed) you in mind, not body. You need not fear.'
66_16.word_by_word: अञ्जनायाः Anjana's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, मारुतः Windgod, प्रत्यभाषत replied, सुश्रोणि O woman of beautiful hips, त्वाम् you, न हिंसामि I do no harm, ते your, मनसः mind's, भयम् fear, मा भूत् do not entertain, सुभगे O auspicious lady

66_17.shloka: मनसाऽस्मि गतो यत्त्वां परिष्वज्य यशस्विनीम्।वीर्यवान्बुद्धिसम्पन्न: पुत्रस्तव भविष्यति।।4.66.18।।
66_17.translation: 'O renowned lady I have embraced you and united with you mentally (enjoyed you without physical contact).You will bring forth a son endowed with great wisdom and courage.
66_17.word_by_word: यशस्विनि O renowned woman, यत् such as, त्वाम् you, परिष्वज्य after embracing, मनसा mentally, गतः अस्मि I united with you, तव your, वीर्यवान् courageous, बुद्धिसम्पन्नः endowed with wisdom, पुत्रः son, भविष्यति will be born.

66_18.shloka: महासत्त्वो महातेजा महाबलपराक्रमः।लङ्घने प्लवने चैव भविष्यति हि मत्समः।।4.66.19।।
66_18.translation: 'He will be very powerful, illustrious and will be of great valour and strength. He will bemy equal in leaping and flying'.
66_18.word_by_word: महासत्त्वः very powerful, महातेजाः highly lustrous one, महाबलपराक्रमः of great valour and strength, लङ्घने in jumping, प्लवने चैव even in leaping, हि मत्समः similar to me, भविष्यति he will be.

66_19.shloka: एवमुक्ता ततस्तुष्टा जननी ते महाकपे।गुहायां त्वां महाबाहो प्रजज्ञे प्लवगर्षभम्।।4.66.20।।
66_19.translation: 'O great monkey O strongshouldered one having been assured that way, your mother was pleased and delivered you, a bull among monkeys, in a cave.
66_19.word_by_word: महाबाहो one of strong shoulders, महाकपे O great monkey, एवम् that way, उक्ता having been told, ते जननी your mother, तुष्टा pleased, ततः then, प्लवगर्षभम् bull among monkeys, त्वाम् you, गुहायाम् in the cave, प्रजज्ञे delivered you.

66_20.shloka: अभ्युत्थितं ततस्सूर्यं बालो दृष्ट्वा महावने।फलं चेति जिघृक्षुस्त्वमुत्प्लुत्याभ्युद्गतो दिवम्।।4.66.21।।
66_20.translation: 'On seeing the rising Sun in the deep forest, mistaking him to be a fruit, you wanted to seize it, when you were young.You suddenly flew into the sky and went flying towards the Sun.
66_20.word_by_word: ततः then, बालः a boy, त्वम् you, महावने in the deep forest, अभ्युत्थितम् rising, सूर्यम् Sun, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, फलं चेति treating it to be, जिघृक्षुः wished to seize, उत्प्लुत्य having jumped, दिवम् to sky, अभ्युद्गतः went flying.

66_21.shloka: शतानि त्रीणि गत्वाऽथ योजनानां महाकपे।तेजसा तस्य निर्धूतो न विषादं ततोगतः।।4.66.22।।
66_21.translation: 'O great monkey you went three hundred yojanas and were pushed back by the  Sun's radiance. Yet it did not leave you depressed.
66_21.word_by_word: महाकपे O great monkey, अथ then, योजनानाम् of yojanas, त्रीणि three, शतानि गत्वा after covering a distance of three hundred, तस्य his, तेजसा in brilliance, निर्धूतः you were pushed back, ततः then, विषादम् dull, न not, गतः attained.

66_22.shloka: तावदापपत स्तूर्णमन्तरिक्षं महाकपे।क्षिप्तमिन्द्रेण ते वज्रं कोपाविष्टेन धीमता।।4.66.23।।
66_22.translation: 'O great monkey while falling fast in space, wise Indra hurled his thunderbolt quickly at you, in anger.
66_22.word_by_word: महाकपे great monkey, तूर्णम् swiftly, अन्तरिक्षम् into space, कोपाविष्टेन in anger, धीमता by the wise, इन्द्रेण by Indra's, वज्रम् thunderbolt, ते at you, क्षिप्तम् hurled, तावत् so much, आपतत: while falling.

66_23.shloka: तदा शैलाग्रशिखरे वामो हनुरभज्यत।ततो हि नामधेयं ते हनुमानिति कीर्त्यते।।4.66.24।।
66_23.translation: 'You fell on the edge of the mountain peak and your left chin  got broken. Since then you are widely known as Hanuman (one who has a wounded chin).
66_23.word_by_word: तदा then, शैलाग्रशिखरे on the edge of the mountain peak, वामः left, हनुः chin, अभज्यत was broken, ततः then, ते your, नामधेयम् named, हनुमानिति Hanuman, कीर्त्यते wellknown.

66_24.shloka: तस्त्वावि निहतं दृष्ट्वा वायुर्गन्धवहस्स्वयम्।त्रैलोक्ये भृशसङ्कृद्धो न ववौ वै प्रभञ्जनः।।4.66.25।।
66_24.translation: The Windgod who is a carrier of fragrance and breaker of trees became very angry on seeing (the injury on) you and stopped blowing in the three worlds.
66_24.word_by_word: ततः then, गन्धवहः carrier of fragrance (Windgod), प्रभञ्जनः one who breaks (trees), वायुः wind, त्वाम् you, निहतम् hit दृष्ट्वा seeing, स्वयम् himself, भृशसङ्कृद्धुः became very angry, त्रैलोक्यम् in the three worlds, न ववौवै (windgod) did not blow wind.

66_25.shloka: सम्भ्रान्ताश्च सूरास्सर्वे त्रैलोक्ये क्षुभिते सति।प्रसादयन्ति संक्रुद्धं मारुतं भुवनेश्वराः।।4.66.26।।
66_25.word_by_word: त्रैलोक्ये in all the three worlds, क्षुभिते सति  disturbed, भुवनेश्वराः all lords of the world, सर्वे all, सुराः Gods, संभ्रान्ताः became uneasy, संक्रुद्धम् angry, मारुतम् Maruta, प्रसादयन्ति propitiated.

66_26.shloka: प्रसादिते च पवने ब्रह्मा तुभ्यं वरं ददौ।अशस्त्रवध्यतां तात समरे सत्यविक्रम।।4.66.27।।
66_26.translation: 'O dear when the Windgod was pleased, Brahma gave a boon to you, to appease his anger. The boon made you truly valiant so that you cannot be struck by any weapon and killed.
66_26.word_by_word: समरे in war, सत्यविक्रम O truly valiant, तात o dear, पवने when the Windgod, प्रसादिते propitiated, ब्रह्मा Brahma, तुभ्यम् to you, अशस्त्रवध्यताम् cannot be killed by a weapon, वरम् boon, ददौ he gave.

66_27.shloka: वज्रस्य च निपातेन विरुजं त्वां समीक्ष्य च।सहस्रनेत्रः प्रीतात्मा ददौ ते वरमुत्तमम्।।4.66.28।।स्वच्छन्दतश्च मरणं तेभूयादिति वै प्रभो।
66_27.translation: 'O lord observing that you are not hurt even when struck by the thunderbolt, Indra offered, one of the best boons to you, to choose to die only when you wish.
66_27.word_by_word: प्रभो O lord, सहस्रनेत्रः the thousandeyed, वज्रस्य thunderbolt's, निपातेन by striking, त्वाम् you, विरुजम् not hurt, समीक्ष्य च on observing that, प्रीतात्मा a pleased self, तव your, स्वच्छन्दतः at your wish, मरणम् death, ते you, भूयात् will be, इति thus, उत्तमम् best, वरम् boon, ददौ gave.

66_28.shloka: स त्वं केसरिणः पुत्रः क्षेत्रजो भीमविक्रमः।।4.66.29।।मारुतस्यौरसः पुत्रस्तेजसा चापि तत्समः।त्वं हि वायुसुतो वत्स प्लवने चापि तत्समः।।4.66.30।।
66_28.translation: 'You are a son of Kesari endowed with terrific strength and a lawful son of Maruta also. You are, therefore, equal to the very Windgod in flying and in brilliance.
66_28.word_by_word: भीमविक्रमः of terrific strength, सः त्वम् that you are, केसरिणः Kesari's, क्षेत्रजः the offspring (one of twelve sons according to Hindu scriptures), पुत्रः son, मारुतस्य Marutha's, औरसः पुत्रः lawful son, तेजसा with brilliance, तत्समश्च also equal to him, वत्स dear, वायुसुतः son of the Windgod, त्वम् you, प्लवने in flying, च अपि also, तत्समः हि equal to.

66_29.shloka: वयमद्य गतप्राणा भवान्नस्त्रातु साम्प्रतम्।दाक्ष्यविक्रमसम्पन्नः कपिराज इवापरः।।4.66.31।।
66_29.translation: 'Now we have almost lost our life.You are our saviour like another monkeyking (like Garuda, king of birds).You are fully endowed with valour and courage.
66_29.word_by_word: अद्य now, वयम् we, गतप्राणाः almost lost our life, भवान् you, साम्प्रतम् at present, त्रातु you may save us, दाक्ष्यविक्रमसम्पन्नः fully endowed with valour and courage, अपरः another, कपिराजः monkey king, इव like.

66_30.shloka: त्रिविक्रमे मया तात सशैलवनकानना।त्रिस्सप्तकृत्वः पृथिवी परिक्रान्ता प्रदक्षिणम्।।4.66.32।।
66_30.translation: 'O dear when Visnu (Vamana incarnate) took three strides I circumambulated the whole earth including its mountains and trees twentyone times.
66_30.word_by_word: तात dear, त्रिविक्रमे when Visnu took three strides, सशैलवनकानना with its mountains, trees and forests, पृथिवी the whole earth, मया by me, त्रिस्सप्तकृत्वः twenty one times, प्रदक्षिणम् परिक्रान्ता circumambulated.

66_31.translation: 'Then on receiving orders from the gods, we collected medicinal herbs and nectar which gave us great strength.
66_31.word_by_word: तदा then, देवशासनात् by the command of the gods, याभिः by those, अमृतम् nectar, निष्पन्नम् produced, ओषधयः herbs, अस्माभिः by us, सञ्चिताः are collected, तदानीम्  then, नः for us, बलम् strength, महत् great.

66_32.shloka: स इदानीमहं वृद्धः परिहीनपराक्रमः।साम्प्रतं कालमस्माकं भवान्सर्वगुणान्वितः।।4.66.34।।
66_32.translation: 'I have become old and my valour is depleted. At this time you are the sole resort for us. You have all the necessary qualities.
66_32.word_by_word: इदानीम् as such, वृद्धः old, सः अहम् I being, परिहीनपराक्रमः my valour is depleted, साम्प्रतं कालम् at this time, भवान् you have, अस्माकम् for us, सर्वगुणान्वितः endowed with all qualities.

66_33.shloka: तद्विजृम्भस्व विक्रान्त: प्लवतामुत्तमो ह्यसि।त्वद्वीर्यं द्रष्टुकामा हि सर्वा वानरवाहिनी।।4.66.35।।
66_33.translation: 'Cheer up and advance.You are the best among the creatures that can leap.The entire army of monkeys want to see your valour.
66_33.word_by_word: विक्रान्तः cheer up, तत् that, विजृम्भस्व expand yourself, प्लवताम् among the leaping ones, उत्तमः the best, असि हि you are, सर्वा entire, वानरवाहिनी monkey army, त्वद्वीर्यम् your valour, द्रष्टुकामा हि desiring to see.

66_34.shloka: उत्तिष्ठ हरिशार्दूल लङ्घयस्व महार्णवम्।परा हि सर्वभूतानां हनुमन्या गतिस्तव।।4.66.36।।
66_34.translation: 'O Hanuman, tiger among monkeys, rise up and cross this great ocean.You have that supreme capacity among all beings.
66_34.word_by_word: हरिशार्दूल O tiger among monkeys, हनुमन् O Hanuman, उत्तिष्ठ rise up, महार्णवम् great ocean, लङ्घयस्व cross, तव your, या such, गतिः capacity, सर्वभूतानाम् among all beings, परा हि indeed supreme.

66_35.translation: 'O Hanuman All the monkeys look dejected. Why do you delay? O warrior, act quick with your rapid speed like Trivikrama who took three strides that covered the entire universe'.
66_35.word_by_word: हनुमन् O Hanuman, सर्वे all, हरयः monkeys, विषण्णाः are dejected, किम् why, उपेक्षसे do you delay, महावेग O warrior of great speed, विष्णुः Visnu, त्रीन् three, विक्रमानिव like Trivikrama, विक्रमस्व you move fast.

66_36.shloka: ततस्तु वै जाम्बवता प्रचोदितःप्रतीतवेगः पवनात्मजः कपिः।प्रहर्षयंस्तां हरिवीरवाहिनींचकार रूपं महदात्मनस्तदा।।4.66.38।।
66_36.translation: Then Hanuman, son of the Windgod, inspired by Jambavan, enlarged his body, ready to leap. The army of heroic monkeys were pleased (to see him).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
66_36.word_by_word: ततः then, जाम्बवता by Jambavan, प्रचोदितः inspired, प्रतीतवेगः realising his speed, पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, कपिः monkey, ताम् that, हरिवीरवाहिनीम् army of heroic monkeys, प्रहर्षयन् by pleasing, तदा then, आत्मनः his own, रूपम् form, महत् चकार enlarged.

67_1.shloka: [Hanuman displays his immeasurable might and proceeds to mount Mahendra]तं दृष्ट्वा जृम्भमाणं ते क्रमितुं शतयोजनम्।वीर्येणापूर्यमाणं च सहसा वानरोत्तमम्।।4.67.1।।सहसा शोकमुत्सृज्य प्रहर्षेण समन्विताः।विनेदुस्तुष्टुवुश्चापि हनूमन्तं महाबलम्।।4.67.2।।
67_1.translation: 'In order to cross a hundred yojanas, Hanuman, the best of monkeys expanded his  might and strength. Seeing him, a warrior of great strength, all the monkeys, filled with enthusiasm at once gave up grief and collected together.They rejoiced and propitiated him screaming aloud.
67_1.word_by_word: शतयोजनम् hundred yojanas, क्रमितुम् to cross, जृम्भमाणम् enlarging, सहसा at once, वीर्येण in strength, आपूर्यमाणं च and being filled, वानरोत्तमम् best of monkeys, महाबलम् a warrior of great strength, तं हनूमन्तम् he, Hanuman, दृष्ट्वा seeing, ते those monkeys, सहसा all at once, शोकम् grief, उत्सृज्य gave up, प्रहर्षेण with joy, समन्विताः endowed, विनेदुः screamed aloud, तुष्टुवुश्चापि also propitiated him.

67_2.shloka: प्रहृष्टा विस्मिताश्चैव वीक्षन्ते स्म समन्ततः।त्रिविक्रमकृतोत्साहं नारायणमिव प्रजाः।।4.67.3।।
67_2.translation: The monkeys collected together happily, gazing at Hanuman.They were wonderstruck to see Hanuman in that huge form, just as all beings were when they saw Lord Narayana in his incarnation of Vamana.
67_2.word_by_word: समन्ततः collected together, प्रहृष्टाः happily, विस्मिताश्चैव wonderstruck, प्रजाः people,  त्रिविक्रमकृतोत्साहम् Lord Visnu's enthusiasm in taking three strides, नारायणमिव like Lord Narayana, वीक्षन्ते स्म they observed.

67_3.shloka: संस्तूयमानो हनुमान्व्यवर्धत महाबलः।समाविध्य च लाङ्गूलं हर्षाद्बलमुपेयिवान्।।4.67.4।।
67_3.translation: The monkeys praised the mighty Hanuman as he grew in size whirling his tail around joyfully.
67_3.word_by_word: महाबलः mighty, हनुमान् Hanuman, संस्तूयमानः being praised, हर्षात् joyfully, बलम् strength, उपेयिवान् assumed, लाङ्गूलम् tail, समाविध्य whirling, व्यवर्धत grew.

67_4.translation: As Hanuman was being praised by the monkey leaders, his body filled with lustre. It looked excellent.
67_4.word_by_word: सर्वैः by all, वानरपुङ्गवैः by monkey leaders, संस्तूयमानस्य of him being praised, तेजसा with lustre, पूर्यमाणस्य who was filled, तस्य his, रूपम् body, अनुत्तमम् excellent, आसीत् became.

67_5.shloka: यथा विजृम्भते सिंहो विवृद्धो गिरिगह्वरे।मारुतस्यौरसः पुत्रस्तथा सम्प्रति जृम्भते।।4.67.6।।
67_5.translation: Just as a lion grown in a mountain cave stretches its body, the Windgod's son stretched  (his limbs) at that time.
67_5.word_by_word: विवृद्धः grown, गिरिगह्वरे in a mountain cave, सिंहः lion, यथा as, विजृम्भते he stretches himself, मारुतस्य Windgod's, औरसः पुत्रः lawful son, सम्प्रति at that time, तथा like that, जृम्भते grew.

67_6.shloka: अशोभत मुखं तस्य जृम्भमाणस्य धीमतः।अम्बरीषमिवाऽदीप्तं विधूम इव पावकः।।4.67.7।।
67_6.translation: On expansion, wise Hanuman's face was bright, glowing like a burning oven and  shining like smokeless fire.
67_6.word_by_word: जृम्भमाणस्य on expansion, धीमतः of the wise person, तस्य his, मुखम् face, आदीप्तम्  glowing, अम्बरीषमिव like a burning oven, विधूमः smokeless, पावकः इव firelike, अशोभत was shining.

67_7.translation: Hanuman risen from the midst of the monkeys with his hair bristling on the body (due to expansion of body), saluted reverentially to the elderly monkey Jambavan and said :
67_7.word_by_word: हरीणाम् from the monkeys, मध्यात् from the midst, उत्थितः he rose, सम्प्रहृष्टतनूरुहः with the hair bristling on the body, हनुमान् Hanuman, वृद्धान् elderly, हरीन् monkeys (Jambavan), अभिवाद्य saluted reverentially, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् said.

67_8.translation: 'The Windgod is a friend of fire who is a powerful consumer of oblations. His strength is immeasurable. He wanders in the sky and shatters the mountain tops.
67_8.word_by_word: हुताशनसखः friend of fire, हुताशन the consumer of oblations, बलवान् powerful one, अप्रमेयः च and immesurable, आकाशगोचरः one who wanders in the sky, अनिलः fire, वायुः wind, सर्वताग्राणि mountain tops, अरुजत् shattered.

67_9.shloka: तस्याहं शीघ्रवेगस्य शीघ्रगस्य महात्मनः।मारुतस्यौरसः पुत्रः प्लवनेनास्मि तत्समः।।4.67.10।।
67_9.translation: 'I am the lawfulson of the swiftmoving Windgod, Maruta, comparable to him in leaping.
67_9.word_by_word: शीघ्रवेगस्य swiftmoving god's, शीघ्रगस्य of a swift one, महात्मनः of a great one, तस्य his,मारुतस्य Windgod's, औरसः पुत्रः lawfulson, अहम् I am, प्लवनेन in leaping, तत्समः equal to him, अस्मि I am.

67_10.shloka: उत्सहेयं हि विस्तीर्णमालिखन्तमिवाम्बरम्।मेरुं गिरिमसङ्गेन परिगन्तुं सहस्रशः।।4.67.11।।
67_10.translation: 'I can with all enthusiasm go round the vast mount Meru a thousand times without resting on it which is as though scratching the sky.
67_10.word_by_word: विस्तीर्णम् vast, expansive, अम्बरम् sky, अलिखन्तमिव as if rubbing , मेरुं गिरिम् Meru mount, असंगेन without touching, सहस्रशः thousand times, परिगन्तुम् can go round, उत्सहेयं हि I wish with all enthusiasm.

67_11.translation: 'I can submerge this world including its mountains rivers and lakes. I can push back the sea waters quickly with my arms.
67_11.word_by_word: अहम् I, बाहुवेगप्रणुन्नेन can drive away with my arms with high speed, सागरेण the ocean, सपर्वतनदीह्रदम् with mountains, rivers and lakes, लोकम् world, प्लावयितुम् to submerge, उत्सहे eager.

67_12.translation: 'Thrust by my thighs,the ocean will rise up, carrying with it the shanks and  mighty crocodiles stunned by the force.
67_12.word_by_word: वरुणालयः  abode of Varuna,ocean समुद्रः ocean, मम my, ऊरुजङ्घावेगेन with the thrust of my thighs and calf muscles, समुत्थितः will rise up, सम्मूर्च्छितमहाग्राहः the mighty sea crocodiles stunned by the force, भविष्यति it will be.

67_13.shloka: पन्नगाशनमाकाशे पतन्तं पक्षिसेविते।वैनतेयमहं शक्तः परिगन्तुं सहस्रशः।।4.67.14।।
67_13.translation: 'I am capable of circumambulating a thousand times the great Garuda who consumes snakes and flies in the sky, the abode of birds.
67_13.word_by_word: पन्नगाशनम् a consumer of snakes, the Garuda, पक्षिसेविते occupied by birds, आकाशे in the sky, पतन्तम् flying, वैनतेयम् to son of Vinata (Garuda), सहस्रशः a thousand times, परिगन्तुम् to go round, अहम् I, शक्तः able.

67_14.shloka: उदयात्प्रस्थितं वापि ज्वलन्तं रश्मिमालिनम्।अनस्तमितमादित्यमभिगन्तुं समुत्सहे।।4.67.15।।ततो भूमिमसंस्पृश्य पुनरागन्तुमुत्सहे।प्रवेगेनैव महता भीमेन प्लवगर्षभाः।।4.67.16।।
67_14.translation: 'O bull among monkeys when the Sun rises from behind the eastern mountain it is possible for me to start with him and go to the western horizon and return before the blazing Sun with its beams of light sets. It is also possible for me to descend to  the earth with the same speed and return to the Sun without touching the earth.
67_14.word_by_word: प्लवगर्षभाः O bull among monkeys, उदयात् from the mountain behind which the sun rises, प्रस्थितम् starts, ज्वलन्तम् blazing, रश्मिमालिनम् with rays, आदित्यम् the Sun, अनस्तमितम् before he sets, अभिगन्तुम् to approach, अहम् I, उत्सहे rise, ततः then, भूमिम् earth, अस्पृष्ट्वा without touching, भीमेन with a terrific, महता with great, प्रवेगेनैव with the same high speed, पुनः again, आगन्तुम् to return, उत्सहे I desire.

67_15.translation: 'If I rise up, I can overtake all those creatures flying in the sky and from there I can stir up the ocean and tear up the earth easily.
67_15.word_by_word: आकाशगोचरान् those that fly in the sky, सर्वान् all, अतिक्रान्तुम् to overtake, उत्सहेयम् easily, सागरं ocean, क्षोभयिष्यामि I will stir up, मेदिनीम् earth, दारयिष्यामि I will tear up.

67_16.translation: 'O monkeys when I leap, I can crush the mountains into powder and pull the vast ocean with me with the force of my thighs.
67_16.word_by_word: प्लवङ्गमाः O monkeys, प्लवमानः while I leap, पर्वतान् mountains, चूर्णयिष्यामि can crush them to powder, प्लवमानः when I leap, ऊरुवेगेन with the force of my thighs, महार्णवम् vast ocean, हरिष्यामि can pull with me.

67_17.shloka: लतानां विविधं पुष्पं पादपानां च सर्वशः।अनुयास्यन्ति मामद्य प्लवमानं विहायसा।।4.67.19।।
67_17.translation: And then as I leap through the sky flowers of many kinds of creepers and trees will follow me.
67_17.word_by_word: अद्य now, विहायसा through the sky, प्लवमानम् as I leap, माम् me, लतानाम् of creepers, पादपानां च and of trees, विविधम् many, पुष्पम् flower, सर्वशः all over, अनुयास्यन्ति will follow me.

67_18.shloka: भविष्यति हि मे पन्थास्स्वातेः पन्था इवाम्बरे।चरन्तं घोरमाकाशमुत्पतिष्यन्तमेव वा।।4.67.20।।द्रक्ष्यन्ति निपतिष्यन्तं च सर्वभूतानि वानराः।
67_18.translation: 'O monkey when I fly upward in the dreadful sky or descend down, all creatures will see me, for my path will be the path of the constellation of Swati (a group of stars).
67_18.word_by_word: वानराः monkeys अम्बरे in the sky, मे I, पन्थाः path, स्वातेः of the constellation of Swati, पन्थाः इव like the path, भविष्यति will be, घोरम् terrific, आकाशम् sky, उत्पतिष्यन्तमेव च as I am flying upward, चरन्तम् while I am moving, निपतिष्यन्तम् while I am descending, सर्वभूतानि all creatures, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will see me.

67_19.shloka: महामेरुप्रतीकाशं मां द्रक्ष्यथ वानराः।।4.67.21।।दिवमावृत्य गच्छन्तं ग्रसमानमिवाम्बरम्।
67_19.translation: 'O monkeys when I fly in the sky like the great mount Meru, you will see me as if I am swallowing the sky because I will be enveloping it with my strides.
67_19.word_by_word: वानरा: O monkeys, महामेरुप्रतीकाशम् like the great mount Meru, दिवम् sky, आवृत्य after enveloping, गच्छन्तम् while I go, अम्बरम् the sky, ग्रसमानम् इव like the one swallowing the sky, माम् me, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

67_20.word_by_word: समाहितः a composed self, प्लवमानः while I am leaping, जीमतान् clouds, विधमिष्यामि I scatter them up,पर्वतान् all mountains, कम्पयिष्यामि I will shake up, सागरम् ocean, शोषयिष्यामि I will agitate

67_21.shloka: वैनतेयस्य या शक्तिर्मम सा मारुतस्य वा।।4.67.23।।ऋते सुपर्णराजानं मारुतं वा महाजवम्।न तद्भूतं प्रपश्यामि यन्मां प्लुतमनुव्रजेत्।।4.67.24।।
67_21.translation: 'Only Garuda and Maruta have the capacity to fly like me. No one other than the king of vultures and the Windgod have the speed to fly like me.
67_21.word_by_word: वैनतेयस्य Garuda's, मारुतस्य वा Maruta's, या such, शक्तिः capacity, सा that, मम my, प्लुतम् flying, माम् me, यत् such, भूतम् a creature, अनुव्रजेत् that can follow, तत् that, सुपर्णराजानम् king of vultures, महाजवम् speedy, मारुतं वा ऋते or excepting the wind, न प्रपश्यामि I do not see.

67_22.translation: 'Just as the lightning generated by the clouds lands at once flying in the sky without any support I can also land in less than a moment.
67_22.word_by_word: घनात् from the, उत्थिता generated, विद्युदिव like the lightning, निमेषान्तरमात्रेण in less than a  moment, सहसा at once, निरालम्बनम् that which has no support, अम्बरम् sky, निपतिष्यामि I will land.

67_23.shloka: भविष्यति हि मे रूपं प्लवमानस्य सागरे।विष्णोर्विक्रममाणस्य पुरा त्रीन्विक्रमानिव।।4.67.26।।
67_23.word_by_word: सागरे in the ocean, प्लवमानस्य while I am leaping over, मे my, रूपम् form, पुरा earlier, त्रीन् three, विक्रमान् strides, प्रक्रममाणस्य who advanced, विष्णोः इव like Visnu, भविष्यति will be

67_24.shloka: बुद्ध्या चाहं प्रपश्यामि मनश्चेष्टा च मे तथा।अहं द्रक्ष्यामि वैदेहीं प्रमोदध्वं प्लवङ्गमाः।।4.67.27।।
67_24.translation: 'O monkeys I have a feeling in my mind that I will see Vaidehi. Be happy.
67_24.word_by_word: प्लवङ्गमाः O monkeys, अहम् I, बुद्ध्या with my intellect, प्रपश्यामि I can visualise, मे my, मनश्चेष्टा च my feeling in mind, तथा so also, अहम् I am, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, द्रक्ष्यामि I will see, प्रमोदध्वम् be happy.

67_25.shloka: मारुतस्य समो वेगे गरुडस्य समो जवे।अयुतं योजनानां तु गमिष्यामीति मे मतिः।।4.67.28।।
67_25.translation: 'I am equal to Maruta and Garuda in speed. I feel I can cover ten thousand yojanas (at a stretch).
67_25.word_by_word: वेगे in speed, मारुतस्य Maruta's, समः equal, जवे in rapidity, गरुडस्य Garuda's, समः equal, योजनानाम् of yojanas, अयुतम् ten thousand, गमिष्यामीति I will go, मे my, मतिः feeling.

67_26.shloka: वासवस्य सवज्रस्य ब्रह्मणो वा स्वयम्भुवः।विक्रम्य सहसा हस्तादमृतं तदिहानये।।4.67.29।।लङ्कां वापि समुत्क्षिप्य गच्छेयमिति मे मतिः।
67_26.translation: 'I think I can encounter Indra, wielder of the thunderbolt and obtain nectar from his hands. I can even confront Brahma, the selfborn creator courageously. I can even uproot Lanka and carry it.'
67_26.word_by_word: विक्रम्य after advancing, सवज्रस्य of that Indra the wielder of thunderbolt, वासवस्य Vasava's, स्वयम्भुवः of the self born, ब्रह्मणो वा of the ceator Brahma even, हस्तात् from his hand, सहसा at once, अमृतम् nectar, इह here, आनये I will get, लङ्काम् Lanka, समुत्क्षिप्य वापि uprooting, गच्छेयम् I can go, इति this way, मे my, मतिः feel in mind.

67_27.shloka: तमेवं वानरश्रेष्ठं गर्जन्तममितौजसम्।।4.67.30।।प्रहृष्टा हरयस्तत्र समुदैक्षन्त विस्मिताः।
67_27.translation: The monkeys looked at him and were amazed, happy to see him roaring and shining in brilliance.
67_27.word_by_word: तत्र there, एवम् in that way, गर्जन्तम् roaring aloud, अमितौजसम् shining brilliantly, तम् him, वानरश्रेष्ठम् best of monkeys, हरयः monkeys, प्रहृष्टाः joyful, विस्मिताः amazed, समुदैक्षन्त all looked at him.

67_28.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा ज्ञातीनां शोकनाशनम्।।4.67.31।।उवाच परिसंहृष्टो जाम्बवान्हरिसत्तमः।
67_28.translation: Jambavan, the finest of the monkeys, felt very glad on hearing his words which put an end to the sorrow of the kith and kin and said:
67_28.word_by_word: तस्य his, तत् that, ज्ञातीनाम् of the kith and kin, शोकनाशनम् remover of  grief, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, हरिसत्तम: finest of monkeys, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, परिसम्हृष्टः very glad, उवाच said.

67_29.shloka: वीर केसरिणः पुत्र हनुमान्मारुतात्मज।।4.67.32।।ज्ञातीनां विपुलश्शोकस्त्वया तात प्रणाशितः।
67_29.translation: 'O son of Kesari O son of Maruta O hero you have removed the great grief of your race, dear
67_29.word_by_word: वीर O hero, केसरिणः Kesari's, पुत्र son, मारुतात्मज O son of Marutha, तात O dear, त्वया by you, ज्ञातीनाम् of the kith and kin, विपुलः profound, शोकः grief, प्रणाशितः has been removed.

67_30.shloka: तव कल्याणरुचयः कपिमुख्यास्समागताः।।4.67.33।।मङ्गलं कार्यसिद्ध्यर्थं करिष्यन्ति समाहिताः।
67_30.word_by_word: तव your, कल्याणरुचयः well wishers, समागताः collected, कपिमुख्याः chiefs of monkeys, समाहिताः collected together, कार्य(अर्थ)सिद्ध्यर्थम् to achieve your objective, मङ्गलांauspicious prayers, करिष्यन्ति they will offer.

67_31.shloka: ऋषीणां च प्रसादेन कपिवृद्धमतेन च।।4.67.34।।गुरूणां च प्रसादेन प्लवस्व त्वं महार्णवम्।
67_31.translation: 'By the blessings of the sages and by the grace of the elderly monkeys may you cross over the vast ocean.
67_31.word_by_word: ऋषीणाम् of sages, प्रसादेन by the grace, कपिवृद्धमतेन च elderly monkeys', गुरूणाम् of elderlies, प्रसादेन by grace, च and, त्वम् you, महार्णवम् vast ocean, प्लवस्य cross.

67_32.shloka: स्थास्यामश्चैकपादेन यावदागमनं तव।।4.67.35।।त्वद्गतानि च सर्वेषां जीवनानि वनौकसाम्।
67_32.word_by_word: तव your, आगमनं यावत् awaiting your arrival, एकपादेन on one foot, स्थास्यामः we will stand, सर्वेषाम् of all of us, वनौकसाम् of forestdwellers, जीवनानि lives, त्वद्गतानि will depend upon you.

67_33.shloka: ततस्तु हरिशार्दूलस्तानुवाच वनौकसः।।4.67.36।।नेयं मम मही वेगं लङ्घने धारयिष्यति।
67_33.translation: Then the tiger among monkeys, Hanuman said to those forestdwellers (monkeys), 'The earth cannot bear the thrust of my leaping.
67_33.word_by_word: ततः then, हरिशार्दूलः tiger among monkeys, तान् to those, वनौकसः monkeys, उवाच said, इयं this, मही earth, मम my, वेगम् speed, लङ्घने while crossing, न धारयिष्यति it cannot sustain.

67_34.shloka: एतानीह नगस्यास्य शिलासङ्कटशालिनः।।4.67.37।।शिखराणि महेन्द्रस्य स्थिराणि सुमहान्ति च।
67_34.translation: 'The rocks on the peaks of the ranges of mount Mahendra cannot with stand it, although they are huge and firm.
67_34.word_by_word: शिलासङ्कटशालिनः the rocks of the mountain ranges, अस्य of this, महेन्द्रस्य नगरस्य Mahendra mountain's, एतानि these, शिखराणि peaks, स्थिराणि stable, सुमहान्ति च are very  huge.

67_35.translation: 'I will pick up speed on the peaks of mount Mahendra filled with different kinds of trees and minerals.
67_35.word_by_word: नानाद्रुमविकीर्णेषु  scattered with different kinds of trees, धातुनिष्यन्दशोभिषु shining with different kinds of minerals, एष: here I am, महेन्द्रशिखरेषु peaks of mountain Mahendra, अहम् I, वेगम् speed, करिष्यामि I will do.

67_36.shloka: एतानि मम निष्पेषं पादयोः प्लवतां वराः।।4.67.39।।प्लवतो धारयिष्यन्ति योजनानामितश्शतम्।
67_36.translation: 'O great monkeys these mountain peaks can withstand the crushing force of my feet as I leap over a hundred yojanas.
67_36.word_by_word: इतः from here, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतम् one hundred, प्लवतः for me as I leap, मम to me, निष्पेषं crushing force of, पादयोः of both feet, प्लवतां वरा: best among those who leap, धारयिष्यन्ति will withstand.

67_37.shloka: ततस्तं मारुतप्रख्यस्सहरिर्मारुतात्मजः।।4.67.40।।आरुरोह नगश्रेष्ठं महेन्द्रमरिमर्दनः।वृतं नानाविधैः वृक्षैर्मृगसेवितशाद्वलम्।।4.67.41।।लताकुसुमसम्बाधं नित्यपुष्पफलद्रुमम्।सिंहशार्दूलचरितं मत्तमातङ्गसेवितम्।।4.67.42।।मत्तद्विजगणोद्घुष्टं सलिलोत्पीडसङ्कुलम्।
67_37.translation: The son of Maruta, who was as eminent as the Windgod, the crusher of enemies ascended the great mountain Mahendra, full of grassland inhabited by deer, thickly grown with various trees and creepers full of fragrant flowers and fruits, where roam lions and tigers and proud elephants, a place that echoes with sounds of intoxicated birds and waterfalls.
67_37.word_by_word: ततः then, मारुतप्रख्यः as eminent as the Windgod, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, अरिमर्दनः crusher of enemies, सः हरिः that monkey, नानाविधैः with several, वृक्षैः  trees, वृतम् covered, मृगसेवितशाद्वलम् grassy land inhabited by deer, लताकुसुमसम्बाधम् filled with creepers and fragrant flowers, नित्यपुष्पफलद्रुमम् ever with trees full of flowers and fruits, सिंहशार्दूलचरितं where lions and tigers move, मत्तमातङ्गसेवितम् inhabited by proud elephants, मत्तद्विजगणोद्घुष्टम् filled with flocks of intoxicated birds, सलिलोत्पीडसङ्कुलम् full of water falls, नगश्रेष्ठम् great mountain, महेन्द्रम् Mahendra, आरुरोह ascended.

67_38.shloka: महद्भिरुच्छ्रितं शृङ्गैर्महेन्द्रं स महाबलः।।4.67.43।।विचचार हरिश्रेष्ठो महेन्द्रसमविक्रमः।
67_38.translation: The mighty, preeminent monkey who was equal to Indra in valour took a leap from the high peaks of the tall mountain, Mahendra৷৷
67_38.word_by_word: महेन्द्रसमविक्रमः equal to Indra in valour, महाबलः mighty, हरिश्रेष्ठः best of the monkeys, महद्भि: great, शृङ्गैः with peaks, उच्छ्रितम् high, तम् him, महेन्द्रम् Mahendra, विचचार strode.

67_39.shloka: पादाभ्यां पीडितस्तेन महाशैलो महात्मना।।4.67.44।।रराज सिंहाभिहतो महान्मत्त इव द्विपः।
67_39.translation: Crushed by the feet of the great self, Hanuman, the huge mountain looked like a proud elephant struck by a lion.
67_39.word_by_word: महात्मना by great self, तेन by him, बाहुभ्याम् with both his shoulders, पीडितः crushed, महाशैलः mighty mountain, सिंहाभिहतः struck by a lion, मत्तः proud, महान् great, द्विपः इव like an elephant, रराज looked.

67_40.translation: The rocks of the mountain got scattered by the force. The deer and elephants were terrified. The trees were shaken up violently and streams of water gushed forth.
67_40.word_by_word: विप्रकीर्णशिलोच्चयः scattered rocks, वित्रस्तमृगमातङ्गः terrified deer and elephants, प्रकम्पितमहाद्रुमः violently shaken up trees, सलिलोत्पीडान् poured out gushing streams of water, मुमोच released.

67_41.translation: Shaken by the rude shock, couples of intoxicated gandharvas left in a huff the vast slopes of the great mountain. Flocks of birds and groups of vidyadharas flew away. The serpents went into hiding. Rocks fell off the shaken mountain.
67_41.word_by_word: तदा then, सः महागिरिः that great mountain, पानसंसर्गकर्कशैः by those whose behaviour was rough in a drunken state, नानागन्धर्वमिथुनैः by different groups of copulating gandharvas, उत्पतद्भि: by those flying, विहगैश्च by birds in the sky, विद्याधरगणैरपि hosts of vidyadharas, त्यज्यमानमहासानुः abandoned by the vast mountain slopes, सन्निलीनमहोरगः with serpents resting, चलशृङ्गशिलोद्घातः the rocks shaken up on mountain tops, अभूत् appeared.

67_42.shloka: निश्श्वसद्भिस्तदाऽर्तैस्तु भुजङ्गैरर्धनि:सृतैः।।4.67.48।।सपताक इवाभाति स तदा धरणीधरः।
67_42.translation: The serpents with their bodies half protruded out of the rocks and hissing looked like flags planted on the mountain.
67_42.word_by_word: तदा then, सः that, धरणीधरः holder of the earth, mountain, निश्वसद्भि: hissing out of the rocks, अर्धनि:सृतैः protruding half of their body, भुजगैः serpents, सपताकः इव like the flags, आभाति appeared.

67_43.translation: The alarmed and agitated sages abandonned the mountain peaks.The mountain appeared like a lone traveller separated from the caravan in the great forest.
67_43.word_by_word: त्राससम्भ्रान्तै: by those alarmed and agitated, ऋषिभिः by sages, त्यज्यमानः being abandoned, शिलोच्चयः the mountain, सार्थहीनः berefit of a caravan, महति in a great, कान्तारे in the forest, सीदन् while worrying, अध्वगः इव like the traveller.

67_44.shloka: सवेगवान् वेगसमाहितात्माहरिप्रवीरः परवीरहन्ता।मनस्समाधाय महानुभावोजगाम लङ्कां मनसा मनस्वी।।4.67.50।।
67_44.translation: Magnanimous, wise and heroic Hanuman, destroyer of enemy warriors, fixed his attention on speed, betook himself mentally to Lanka (ere he reached it physically).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामाणये वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
67_44.word_by_word: वेगवान् speeds, वेगसमाहितात्मा fixing his attention on speed, परवीरहन्ता destroyer of enemywarriors, मनस्वी sensitive , महानुभावः noble, सः that, हरिप्रवीरः heroic monkey मनः in mind, समाधाय composed, मनसा mentally, लङ्काम् Lanka, जगाम reached.
